original: @1b # // ji skad du spangs pa ni yongs su shes pa'i ming 'thob po zhes bshad pa de yang /
analyzed: @1b # // ji skad du spangs pa ni yongs su shes pa'i ming 'thob po zhes bshad pa de yang /
translated: Abandonment obtains the name of complete knowledge.🔽Abandonment of afflictions

original: bden pa mthong dang bsgom pa las //🔽nyon mongs spangs pa zhes bshad pa //
analyzed: bden pa mthong dang bsgom pa las // nyon mongs spangs pa zhes bshad pa //
translated: through seeing and meditation

original: nyon mongs pa rnams mthong bas spang bar bya ba dang / bsgom pas spang bar bya ba yin no zhes rgyas par bshad pa /🔽da ni mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam de dag ci zag pa med pa'am /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnams mthong bas spang bar bya ba dang / bsgom pas spang bar bya ba yin no zhes rgyas par bshad pa / da ni mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam de dag ci zag pa med pa'am /
translated: It is explained in detail that afflictions are abandoned through seeing and meditation.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa zhes brjod par bya zhe na /
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa zhes brjod par bya zhe na /
translated: Now, should these paths of seeing and meditation be called uncontaminated or contaminated?

original: de'i phyir 'di dag brjod de /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di dag brjod de /
translated: Therefore, this is said:

original: bsgom pa'i lam ni rnam gnyis te //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam ni rnam gnyis te //
translated: The path of meditation is twofold:

original: mthong ba zhes bya zag pa med //
analyzed: mthong ba zhes bya zag pa med //
translated: The path of seeing is uncontaminated.

original: bsgom pa'i lam ni rnam gnyis te //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam ni rnam gnyis te //
translated: The path of meditation is twofold:

original: 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'o //
translated: mundane and transcendent.

original: mthong ba'i lam ni khams gsum pa'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir dang / mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnam pa dgu cig car du sprang ba'i phyir 'jig rten las 'das pa kho na yin te ;
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam ni khams gsum pa'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir dang / mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnam pa dgu cig car du sprang ba'i phyir 'jig rten las 'das pa kho na yin te ;
translated: The path of insight is supramundane, because it is the antidote to the three realms of existence, and because it simultaneously eliminates the nine categories of defilements to be eliminated by insight.

original: 'jig rten pa la ni de 'dra ba'i mthu med do //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa la ni de 'dra ba'i mthu med do //
translated: The mundane path does not have such power.

original: bden pa mthong ba las zhes bshad pa /
analyzed: bden pa mthong ba las zhes bshad pa /
translated: It is said that one is detached through seeing the truths.

original: bden pa de dag kyang gang zhig tu /
analyzed: bden pa de dag kyang gang zhig tu /
translated: What are these truths?

original: bden pa dag ni bzhir bshad do //
analyzed: bden pa dag ni bzhir bshad do //
translated: The truths are explained as four.

original: gang du bshad ce na /🔽chos @2a * //
analyzed: gang du bshad ce na / chos @2a * //
translated: Where are they explained?🔽In the teaching on the truths of the Dharma with and without impurity, the truth of the path is taught by its own name:

original: zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa bstan par zag med lam gyi bden pa dang zhes lam gyi bden ba rang gi ming gis bstan to //🔽so sor brtags pas 'gog pa gang //
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa bstan par zag med lam gyi bden pa dang zhes lam gyi bden ba rang gi ming gis bstan to // so sor brtags pas 'gog pa gang //
translated: “The truth of the path is the pure path.”🔽What is the truth of cessation?

original: bral ba'o zhes 'gog pa'i bden ba bstan to //
analyzed: bral ba'o zhes 'gog pa'i bden ba bstan to //
translated: “Cessation is the elimination of the defilements.”🔽In the teaching on the world, the truths of suffering and origin are taught:

original: sdug bsngal kun 'byung 'jig rten dang // zhes bya ba der sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung gi bden bdag bstan to //
analyzed: sdug bsngal kun 'byung 'jig rten dang // zhes bya ba der sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung gi bden bdag bstan to //
translated: “The world is the truth of suffering and the truth of origin.”

original: ci 'di dag gi rim pa 'di kho na yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: ci 'di dag gi rim pa 'di kho na yin nam zhe na /
translated: Are the truths taught in this very order in which they are realized?

original: smras pa / ma yin no //
analyzed: smras pa / ma yin no //
translated: No, they are not.

original: 'o na ji lta bu yin zhe na /🔽sdug bsngal kun 'byung de bzhin du //
analyzed: 'o na ji lta bu yin zhe na / sdug bsngal kun 'byung de bzhin du //
translated: In what order, then, are they taught?

original: 'gog dang lam ste de ltar na //
analyzed: 'gog dang lam ste de ltar na //
translated: The origin of suffering, the cessation of suffering, and the path leading to that cessation.

original: de dag gi rim ba ni 'di yin no //
analyzed: de dag gi rim ba ni 'di yin no //
translated: The order of the truths is thus.

original: de bzhin zhes bya ba'i sgra ni rang gi ngo bo ni sngar ji skad bshad ba de kho na bzhin no zhes rab tu bstan par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin zhes bya ba'i sgra ni rang gi ngo bo ni sngar ji skad bshad ba de kho na bzhin no zhes rab tu bstan par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The word “thus” is used to indicate that the intrinsic nature of the truths is just as it was previously explained.

original: de ni / de dag ji ltar mngon rtogs rim //
analyzed: de ni / de dag ji ltar mngon rtogs rim //
translated: The order in which they are realized is the order in which they are taught.

original: bden pa gang zhig sngar mngon par rtogs pa de sngar bstan to //
analyzed: bden pa gang zhig sngar mngon par rtogs pa de sngar bstan to //
translated: The truth that is realized first is taught first.

original: de lta ma yin na rgyu ni sngar bstan la 'bras bu ni phyis bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na rgyu ni sngar bstan la 'bras bu ni phyis bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, the cause would be taught first and the result would be taught later.

original: kha cig ni skye ba dang mthun pa bstan te /
analyzed: kha cig ni skye ba dang mthun pa bstan te /
translated: Some are taught in the order in which they arise.

original: dper na dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang ; bsam gtan la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang ; bsam gtan la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the foundations of mindfulness, the meditative absorptions, and so on.

original: kha cig ni rab tu brtag pa dang mthun par bstan te /
analyzed: kha cig ni rab tu brtag pa dang mthun par bstan te /
translated: Some are taught in the order in which they are investigated.

original: dper na yang dag par spong ba rnams lta bu ste /
analyzed: dper na yang dag par spong ba rnams lta bu ste /
translated: For example, the four right efforts.

original: gang sngar ni skyes pa rnams spang bar bya ba'i phyir 'dun pa skyed la /
analyzed: gang sngar ni skyes pa rnams spang bar bya ba'i phyir 'dun pa skyed la /
translated: One generates enthusiasm for the abandonment of those that have already arisen,

original: phyis ni ma skyes pa rnams @2b mi skye bar bya ba'i phyir 'dun bskyed pa'i nges pa 'di ni med do //
analyzed: phyis ni ma skyes pa rnams @2b mi skye bar bya ba'i phyir 'dun bskyed pa'i nges pa 'di ni med do //
translated: but there is no such restriction that one generates enthusiasm for the non-arising of those that have not yet arisen.

original: bden pa rnams ni mngon bar rtogs pa dang mthun par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: bden pa rnams ni mngon bar rtogs pa dang mthun par bstan pa yin no //
translated: The truths are taught in accordance with the order in which they are realized.

original: ci'i phyir bden pa rnams de ltar mngon par rtogs she na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir bden pa rnams de ltar mngon par rtogs she na /
translated: Why are the truths realized in that order?

original: gang la chags pa dang / gang gis gnod pa byed pa dang / gang las thar pa don du gnyer ba'i sdug bsngal gyi bden bde nyid la dang por rnam par dpyod pa'i gnas skabs na yongs su rtog la /
analyzed: gang la chags pa dang / gang gis gnod pa byed pa dang / gang las thar pa don du gnyer ba'i sdug bsngal gyi bden bde nyid la dang por rnam par dpyod pa'i gnas skabs na yongs su rtog la /
translated: When one first investigates the truth of suffering, one investigates the truth of suffering in terms of the object to which one is attached, the means by which one is harmed, and the liberation from which one seeks.

original: phyis 'di'i rgyu ni gang zhig yin zhes kun 'byung gi bden pa la yongs su rtog go //
analyzed: phyis 'di'i rgyu ni gang zhig yin zhes kun 'byung gi bden pa la yongs su rtog go //
translated: Later, one investigates the truth of origination, asking, “What is the cause of this?”

original: 'di'i 'gog pa ni gang zhig yin zhes 'gog pa'i bden ba la yongs su rtog go //
analyzed: 'di'i 'gog pa ni gang zhig yin zhes 'gog pa'i bden ba la yongs su rtog go //
translated: One investigates the truth of cessation, asking, “What is the cessation of this?”

original: 'di'i lam ni gang zhig yin zhes lam gyi bden pa la yongs su rtog ste /
analyzed: 'di'i lam ni gang zhig yin zhes lam gyi bden pa la yongs su rtog ste /
translated: One investigates the truth of the path, asking, “What is the path?”

original: nad mthong bas de'i gzhi dang zad pa dang sman tshol ba bzhin no //
analyzed: nad mthong bas de'i gzhi dang zad pa dang sman tshol ba bzhin no //
translated: Just as, having seen a disease, one seeks its cause, its destruction, and its medicine.

original: bden pa rnams kyi dpe 'di ni mdo las kyang bshad do //
analyzed: bden pa rnams kyi dpe 'di ni mdo las kyang bshad do //
translated: This example of the truths is also explained in the sutras.

original: mdo gang las she na /
analyzed: mdo gang las she na /
translated: In which sutra?

original: yan lag bzhi dang ldan pa'i sman pas zug rdu 'byin pa zhes gsungs pa de las bstan to //
analyzed: yan lag bzhi dang ldan pa'i sman pas zug rdu 'byin pa zhes gsungs pa de las bstan to //
translated: In the one that says, “The physician who has the four attributes extracts the dart.”

original: sngar 'phangs pa'i phyir ji ltar rnam par dpyod pa'i gnas skabs na bden ba la yongs su rtog pa de kho na bzhin du mngon par rtogs pa'i gnas skabs na yang bden pa mngon par rtogs te /
analyzed: sngar 'phangs pa'i phyir ji ltar rnam par dpyod pa'i gnas skabs na bden ba la yongs su rtog pa de kho na bzhin du mngon par rtogs pa'i gnas skabs na yang bden pa mngon par rtogs te /
translated: Just as one investigates the truths in the stage of investigation, so too one realizes the truths in the stage of realization, because the latter is projected by the former.

original: dkyus sa bstan pa'i rta thags thogs med par rgyug pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dkyus sa bstan pa'i rta thags thogs med par rgyug pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like a horse running without obstruction on familiar ground.

original: mngon bar rtogs pa zhes bya ba'i don ni ci zhe na /
analyzed: mngon bar rtogs pa zhes bya ba'i don ni ci zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of the term abhisamaya, realization?

original: mngon par yang dag par rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par yang dag par rtogs pa'o //
translated: It is the clear realization of the truths.

original: ci'i phyir zag ba med pa kho na yin gyi zag pa dang bcas pa ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zag ba med pa kho na yin gyi zag pa dang bcas pa ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why is it only uncontaminated?

original: de ni mya ngan las 'das pa la mngon du phyogs par yang dag par rtog pa ste /
analyzed: de ni mya ngan las 'das pa la mngon du phyogs par yang dag par rtog pa ste /
translated: It is the correct view that is directed toward nirvana.

original: yang dag pa zhes bya ba ni de kho na nyid du'o //🔽de la nye bar len pa'i phung po 'bras bur gyur pa rnams ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa yin no//🔽rgyur gyur pa rnams ni kun 'byung gi bden ba yin te /
analyzed: yang dag pa zhes bya ba ni de kho na nyid du'o // de la nye bar len pa'i phung po 'bras bur gyur pa rnams ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa yin no// rgyur gyur pa rnams ni kun 'byung gi bden ba yin te /
translated: Correct means in reality.🔽The effect aggregates that are appropriated are the truth of suffering.

original: 'di las kun 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di las kun 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The cause aggregates that are appropriated are the truth of origin because suffering originates from them.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'di gnyis ni rgyu dang 'bras bur gyur pas ming gi sgo nas bye brag yod kyi rdzas su ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'di gnyis ni rgyu dang 'bras bur gyur pas ming gi sgo nas bye brag yod kyi rdzas su ni ma yin no //
translated: For this reason, these two truths are distinguished only by name, not by substance, since they are cause and effect.

original: 'gog pa dang lam ni rdzas su yang bye brag yod do //
analyzed: 'gog pa dang lam ni rdzas su yang bye brag yod do //
translated: But cessation and the path are distinguished both by name and by substance.

original: mdo las 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams zhes 'byung ba de'i don ci zhe na /
analyzed: mdo las 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams zhes 'byung ba de'i don ci zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of the expression “noble truths”?

original: 'di dag ni 'phags pa rnams la bden pas /
analyzed: 'di dag ni 'phags pa rnams la bden pas /
translated: They are truths for the noble ones,🔽but not for others.

original: de lta bas na mdo kho na las /
analyzed: de lta bas na mdo kho na las /
translated: Therefore, the sutra itself explains:

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams zhes bshad do //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams zhes bshad do //
translated: They are called the noble truths.

original: ci 'di dag gzhan rnams la brdzun nam zhe na /
analyzed: ci 'di dag gzhan rnams la brdzun nam zhe na /
translated: Are they false for others?🔽They are true for all, since they are not erroneous.

original: 'di dag ni phyin ci ma log pa'i phyir thams cad la bden na 'phags pa rnams kyis ni 'di dag ji lta bde kho na bzhin du @3a * //
analyzed: 'di dag ni phyin ci ma log pa'i phyir thams cad la bden na 'phags pa rnams kyis ni 'di dag ji lta bde kho na bzhin du @3a * //
translated: The noble ones see them as they are, but others do not.🔽Therefore they are called the noble truths.

original: gzigs kyi gzhan dag gis ni ma yin pas de'i phyir 'di dag ni 'phags pa rnams kyi bden pa zhes bya ba'i phyin ci log tu mthong ba'i phyir 'phags pa ma yin pa rnams kyi ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gzigs kyi gzhan dag gis ni ma yin pas de'i phyir 'di dag ni 'phags pa rnams kyi bden pa zhes bya ba'i phyin ci log tu mthong ba'i phyir 'phags pa ma yin pa rnams kyi ni ma yin te /
translated: They are not the truths of those who are not noble ones, because they see them in a distorted way.

original: tshigs su bcad pa las /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa las /
translated: A verse says:

original: 'phags pas bde bar gang gsungs pa //
analyzed: 'phags pas bde bar gang gsungs pa //
translated: What the noble ones call pleasure,🔽others recognize as pain.

original: de ni gzhan gyis sdug bsngal rig / gzhan gyis bde bar gang smras pa //
analyzed: de ni gzhan gyis sdug bsngal rig / gzhan gyis bde bar gang smras pa //
translated: What others call pleasure,

original: de ni 'phags pas sdug bsngal rig / ces 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de ni 'phags pas sdug bsngal rig / ces 'byung ngo //
translated: the noble ones recognize as pain.

original: gzhan dag na re gnyis ni 'phags pa rnams kyi bden pa yin la /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re gnyis ni 'phags pa rnams kyi bden pa yin la /
translated: Others say: Two are the truths of the noble ones.

original: gnyis ni 'phags pa yang yin 'phags pa rnams kyi bden pa yang yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gnyis ni 'phags pa yang yin 'phags pa rnams kyi bden pa yang yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: The noble ones are the noble truths.

original: gang gi tshe tshor ba'i phyogs gcig sdug bsngal gyi rang bzhin yin pa de'i tshe ji ltar na 'du byed zag pa dang bcas pa thams cad sdug bsngal zhes brjod ce na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe tshor ba'i phyogs gcig sdug bsngal gyi rang bzhin yin pa de'i tshe ji ltar na 'du byed zag pa dang bcas pa thams cad sdug bsngal zhes brjod ce na /
translated: If one part of feeling is suffering by nature, how can it be said that all contaminated action is suffering?

original: yid 'ong yid du mi 'ong dang // de las gzhan zag bcas rnams nyid //
analyzed: yid 'ong yid du mi 'ong dang // de las gzhan zag bcas rnams nyid //
translated: The pleasant, the unpleasant, and that which is different from the pleasant and the unpleasant are contaminated.

original: sdug bsngal nyid gsum ldan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: sdug bsngal nyid gsum ldan pa'i phyir //
translated: They are suffering because they possess the three kinds of suffering.

original: ci rigs ma lus sdug bsngal lo //
analyzed: ci rigs ma lus sdug bsngal lo //
translated: All of them are suffering without exception, as the case may be.

original: sdug bsngal nyid ni gsum ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal nyid ni gsum ste /
translated: There are three kinds of suffering:

original: sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal nyid dang / 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid dang / 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal nyid do //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal nyid dang / 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid dang / 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal nyid do //
translated: the suffering of suffering, the suffering of the conditioned, and the suffering of change.

original: de dag gis ci rigs par 'du byed zag pa dang bcas pa thams cad ma lus par sdug bsngal ba yin te /
analyzed: de dag gis ci rigs par 'du byed zag pa dang bcas pa thams cad ma lus par sdug bsngal ba yin te /
translated: All contaminated action is suffering without exception, as the case may be, because of these three.

original: de la yid du 'ong ba rnams ni 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal gyis sdug bsngal ba nyid do //
analyzed: de la yid du 'ong ba rnams ni 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal gyis sdug bsngal ba nyid do //
translated: The pleasant is suffering because of the suffering of change.

original: yid du mi 'ong ba rnams ni sdug bsngal gyis sdug bsngal ba nyid do //
analyzed: yid du mi 'ong ba rnams ni sdug bsngal gyis sdug bsngal ba nyid do //
translated: The unpleasant are suffering by suffering itself.

original: de dag las gzhan pa rnams ni 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal gyis sdug bsngal ba nyid do //
analyzed: de dag las gzhan pa rnams ni 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal gyis sdug bsngal ba nyid do //
translated: The rest are suffering through being conditioned.

original: yid du 'ong ba ni gang dag yin /🔽yid du mi 'ong ba ni gang dag yin /
analyzed: yid du 'ong ba ni gang dag yin / yid du mi 'ong ba ni gang dag yin /
translated: What are the pleasant?🔽What are the unpleasant?

original: gnyi ga ma yin pa ni gang dag yin zhe na /
analyzed: gnyi ga ma yin pa ni gang dag yin zhe na /
translated: What are neither?

original: tshor ba gsum dang go rims bzhin te /
analyzed: tshor ba gsum dang go rims bzhin te /
translated: They are, respectively, the three feelings.

original: de'i dbang gis bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba la sogs pa'i 'du byed rnams kyang yid du 'ong ba la sogs pa'i ming 'thob po //
analyzed: de'i dbang gis bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba la sogs pa'i 'du byed rnams kyang yid du 'ong ba la sogs pa'i ming 'thob po //
translated: The formations that are the basis for the experience of pleasant feeling, etc. are called pleasant, etc.

original: bde ba'i tshor ba ni 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal nyid de /
analyzed: bde ba'i tshor ba ni 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal nyid de /
translated: Pleasant feeling is suffering through change.🔽A sutra states:

original: mdo las / bde ba'i tshor ba ni skye ba na yang bde /
analyzed: mdo las / bde ba'i tshor ba ni skye ba na yang bde /
translated: Pleasant feeling is pleasant when it arises,

original: gnas pa na yang bde la /
analyzed: gnas pa na yang bde la /
translated: pleasant while it persists,

original: 'gyur ba na sdug bsngal lo zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'gyur ba na sdug bsngal lo zhes gsungs so //
translated: and painful when it changes.

original: sdug bsngal ni sdug bsngal gyi rang gi ngo bo kho nas sdug bsngal ba nyid de /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ni sdug bsngal gyi rang gi ngo bo kho nas sdug bsngal ba nyid de /
translated: Painful feeling is suffering by its very nature.

original: mdo las / sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba ni skye ba na yang sdug bsngal la /
analyzed: mdo las / sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba ni skye ba na yang sdug bsngal la /
translated: When a painful feeling arises, it is painful;

original: gnas pa na yang sdug bsngal lo zhes gsungs so //🔽bde ba yang ma @3b yin ;
analyzed: gnas pa na yang sdug bsngal lo zhes gsungs so // bde ba yang ma @3b yin ;
translated: when it persists, it is painful.

original: sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin ba'i tshor ba ni rkyen gyis mngon par 'du byed pa'i phyir 'du byed kho nas sdug bsngal ba nyid de /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin ba'i tshor ba ni rkyen gyis mngon par 'du byed pa'i phyir 'du byed kho nas sdug bsngal ba nyid de /
translated: A neither pleasant nor painful feeling is only suffering due to the formative forces because it is conditioned by the formative forces.

original: gang mi rtag pa de ni sdug bsngal ba yin no zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gang mi rtag pa de ni sdug bsngal ba yin no zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: For it is said: Whatever is impermanent is suffering.

original: de myong bar 'gyur ba'i 'du byed rnams kyang tshor ba dang 'dra bar brjod do //🔽gzhan dag na re sdug bsngal nyid sdug bsngal nyid yin pas sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal nyid yin la /
analyzed: de myong bar 'gyur ba'i 'du byed rnams kyang tshor ba dang 'dra bar brjod do // gzhan dag na re sdug bsngal nyid sdug bsngal nyid yin pas sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal nyid yin la /
translated: The formative forces that are conducive to the experience of that are also described as being similar to feeling.

original: 'du byed nyid sdug bsngal yin pa'i bar du yang de dang 'dra'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: 'du byed nyid sdug bsngal yin pa'i bar du yang de dang 'dra'o zhes zer ro //
translated: Others believe that the suffering of pain is suffering by reason of its intrinsic nature, and that the other two are suffering by reason of the suffering of the formative forces and the suffering of change respectively.🔽The formative forces are suffering because they are conditioned by the formative forces.

original: 'gyur ba yang sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal dag ni yid du 'ong ba dang yid du mi 'ong ba rnams kyi thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir bshad do //
analyzed: 'gyur ba yang sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal dag ni yid du 'ong ba dang yid du mi 'ong ba rnams kyi thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir bshad do //
translated: The suffering of change is explained as suffering because it is the suffering of what is pleasant and unpleasant, which is not shared in common.

original: 'du byed thams cad ni 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid kyis sdug bsngal ba nyid la de dag kyang 'phags pa rnams kho nas gzigs so //
analyzed: 'du byed thams cad ni 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid kyis sdug bsngal ba nyid la de dag kyang 'phags pa rnams kho nas gzigs so //
translated: All formations are suffering because of the suffering of the formations themselves, and only the noble ones see this.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here it is said:

original: lag mthil sbu nyag gcig 'dug pa //
analyzed: lag mthil sbu nyag gcig 'dug pa //
translated: The single hair on the palm of the hand

original: mi rnams kyis ni mi rtogs la //
analyzed: mi rnams kyis ni mi rtogs la //
translated: is not perceived by humans.

original: de nyid mig tu song na ni //
analyzed: de nyid mig tu song na ni //
translated: But when it enters the eye,

original: mi bde ba dang gnod skyed ltar //
analyzed: mi bde ba dang gnod skyed ltar //
translated: it causes discomfort and harm.

original: byis pa lag mthil 'dab yis ;
analyzed: byis pa lag mthil 'dab yis ;
translated: The childish, with palms like the soles of feet,

original: /'du byed sdug bsngal spu mi rtogs //
analyzed: /'du byed sdug bsngal spu mi rtogs //
translated: do not perceive the hair of the suffering of formations.

original: 'phags pa mig dang 'dra ba ni //
analyzed: 'phags pa mig dang 'dra ba ni //
translated: The noble ones, like the eyes,

original: de yis shin tu yid kyang 'byung //
analyzed: de yis shin tu yid kyang 'byung //
translated: are greatly distressed by that.

original: ji ltar 'phags pa rnams srid pa'i rtse mo pa dag la yang sdug bsngal gyi blo 'jug pa ltar byis pa rnams ni mnar med pa'i phung po rnams la yang de ltar sdug bsngal gyi blo mi 'jug go //
analyzed: ji ltar 'phags pa rnams srid pa'i rtse mo pa dag la yang sdug bsngal gyi blo 'jug pa ltar byis pa rnams ni mnar med pa'i phung po rnams la yang de ltar sdug bsngal gyi blo mi 'jug go //
translated: Just as the noble ones have the idea of suffering with regard to the peak of cyclic existence, so the foolish do not have the idea of suffering with regard to the aggregates of the Avici hells.

original: de lta na 'o na ni lam yang 'dus byas yin pa'i phyir 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na 'o na ni lam yang 'dus byas yin pa'i phyir 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then it follows that the path is also the suffering of conditioned states because it is conditioned.

original: sdug bsngal zhes bya ba'i mtshan nyid ni mi mthun pa yin pa'i phyir lam ni sdug bsngal ba ma yin te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal zhes bya ba'i mtshan nyid ni mi mthun pa yin pa'i phyir lam ni sdug bsngal ba ma yin te /
translated: The path is not suffering because the definition of suffering is incompatible with it.

original: de skye ba ni sdug bsngal thams cad zad pa 'dren pa'i 'phags pa rnams dang mi mthun pa med do//🔽gang gi tshe de dag mya ngan las 'das pa la zhi bar lta ba de'i tshe yang /
analyzed: de skye ba ni sdug bsngal thams cad zad pa 'dren pa'i 'phags pa rnams dang mi mthun pa med do// gang gi tshe de dag mya ngan las 'das pa la zhi bar lta ba de'i tshe yang /
translated: The arising of the path does not lead to the exhaustion of all suffering, and it is not incompatible with the noble ones.🔽When they view nirvana as peace,

original: sdug bsngal du mthong ba gang yin pa de kho na'i 'gog pa la zhi bar lta'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal du mthong ba gang yin pa de kho na'i 'gog pa la zhi bar lta'o //
translated: they view the cessation of just that which they have seen as suffering as peace.

original: gang gi tshe 'di dag la bde ba yang yod pa de'i tshe ci'i phyir sdug bsngal kho na 'phags pa'i bden pa zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'di dag la bde ba yang yod pa de'i tshe ci'i phyir sdug bsngal kho na 'phags pa'i bden pa zhes bya zhe na /
translated: If pleasure exists, why is only pain an ārya truth?

original: kha cig na re bde ba myong ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: kha cig na re bde ba myong ba'i phyir te /
translated: Some say: Because pleasure is experienced.

original: mon sran sde'u la sogs pa yod bzhin du mon sran gre'u'i phung bo zhes ston pa bzhin te /
analyzed: mon sran sde'u la sogs pa yod bzhin du mon sran gre'u'i phung bo zhes ston pa bzhin te /
translated: For example, when mung beans and so on exist, they are taught to be a heap of black beans.

original: mkhas pa su zhig chus btab pa'i bde ba chung dus 'bras bu bde ba yin no snyam du sems par 'gyur /
analyzed: mkhas pa su zhig chus btab pa'i bde ba chung dus 'bras bu bde ba yin no snyam du sems par 'gyur /
translated: What wise person would think that the small pleasure of being sprinkled with water is a result?

original: yang smras pa /
analyzed: yang smras pa /
translated: Again, it is said:🔽Because it is the cause of pain,

original: sdug bsngal gyi ni rgyu phyir dang // sdug bsngal mang pos bskyed phyir dang / sdug bsngal @4a * //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi ni rgyu phyir dang // sdug bsngal mang pos bskyed phyir dang / sdug bsngal @4a * //
translated: because it is generated by much pain,

original: yod na bde 'dod phyir //
analyzed: yod na bde 'dod phyir //
translated: because pleasure is desired when pain exists,

original: bde ba sdug bsngal zhes rtog go //
analyzed: bde ba sdug bsngal zhes rtog go //
translated: pleasure is conceived to be pain.

original: srid pa thams cad ni bde ba dang bcas te 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal du ro gcig ba'i 'phags ba rnams kyis sdug bsngal du gzigs te /
analyzed: srid pa thams cad ni bde ba dang bcas te 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal du ro gcig ba'i 'phags ba rnams kyis sdug bsngal du gzigs te /
translated: Āryas see all existence as pain, since it is of the same taste as the suffering of contaminated formations.

original: de'i phyir sdug bsngal kho na 'phags pa'i bden bar rnam par gzhag gi bden ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir sdug bsngal kho na 'phags pa'i bden bar rnam par gzhag gi bden ba ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, only suffering is established as a noble truth, not happiness.

original: da ni ji ltar bde ba'i rang bzhin gyi tshor ba rnams la sdug bsngal du lta zhe na /
analyzed: da ni ji ltar bde ba'i rang bzhin gyi tshor ba rnams la sdug bsngal du lta zhe na /
translated: Now, how can one regard the pleasant feelings as suffering?

original: mi rtag pa'i mtshan nyid kyis mi mthun pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: mi rtag pa'i mtshan nyid kyis mi mthun pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because they are incompatible with the characteristic of impermanence.

original: dper na gzugs dang 'du shes la sogs pa la yang sdug bsngal du lta mod kyi /
analyzed: dper na gzugs dang 'du shes la sogs pa la yang sdug bsngal du lta mod kyi /
translated: For example, one regards form, ideation, etc. as suffering,

original: de dag ji ltar sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba bzhin du sdug bsngal ba ni ma yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: de dag ji ltar sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba bzhin du sdug bsngal ba ni ma yin pa bzhin no //
translated: but they are not suffering in the same way as painful feeling.

original: gang zhig sdug bsngal gyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro snyam du sems pa de'i de ni kun 'byung gi rnam pa yin gyi sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig sdug bsngal gyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro snyam du sems pa de'i de ni kun 'byung gi rnam pa yin gyi sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa ni ma yin no //
translated: If one thinks that they are suffering because they are the cause of suffering, then that is the aspect of origination, not the aspect of suffering.

original: gzugs dang gzugs med par skyes pa dag gis 'phags pa rnams la yang ji ltar sdug bsngal gyi 'du shes 'jug par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med par skyes pa dag gis 'phags pa rnams la yang ji ltar sdug bsngal gyi 'du shes 'jug par 'gyur te /
translated: How can the noble ones have the notion of suffering with regard to the pleasant feelings, since they are born in the form and formless realms?

original: de dag gi phung po rnams ni sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba'i rgyu ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag gi phung po rnams ni sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba'i rgyu ma yin no //
translated: The aggregates of these sentient beings are not the cause of the sensation of suffering.

original: mdo las 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid kyang ci'i phyir gsungs par gyur /
analyzed: mdo las 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid kyang ci'i phyir gsungs par gyur /
translated: Why did the Buddha declare the truth of the unsatisfactoriness of conditioned states?

original: gal te mi rtag pa'i phyir sdug bsngal nyid du lta na 'o na mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa dag la khyad par ci zhig yod /
analyzed: gal te mi rtag pa'i phyir sdug bsngal nyid du lta na 'o na mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa dag la khyad par ci zhig yod /
translated: If you consider the impermanent to be unsatisfactory because of its impermanence, then what is the difference between the aspects of impermanence and unsatisfactoriness?

original: skye zhing 'jig pa'i chos can yin pa'i phyir mi rtag par lta la /🔽mi mthun pa yin pa'i phyir sdug bsngal du lta ste /
analyzed: skye zhing 'jig pa'i chos can yin pa'i phyir mi rtag par lta la / mi mthun pa yin pa'i phyir sdug bsngal du lta ste /
translated: You should consider the impermanent to be unsatisfactory because it is the basis of that which is undesirable.🔽You should consider the impermanent to be unsatisfactory because it is the basis of that which is undesirable.

original: mi rtag par mthong na mi mthun par 'gyur bas mi rtag pa'i rnam pas sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa 'dren par byed do //
analyzed: mi rtag par mthong na mi mthun par 'gyur bas mi rtag pa'i rnam pas sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa 'dren par byed do //
translated: When one sees that which is impermanent, one does not desire it.

original: kha cig na re bde ba'i tshor ba zhes bya ba ni med pa nyid de /
analyzed: kha cig na re bde ba'i tshor ba zhes bya ba ni med pa nyid de /
translated: Some say: There is no sensation that is pleasant.

original: thams cad sdug bsngal kho na yin no //
analyzed: thams cad sdug bsngal kho na yin no //
translated: All is only suffering.

original: 'di ji ltar khong du chud ce na /
analyzed: 'di ji ltar khong du chud ce na /
translated: How do you understand this?

original: mdo dang / rigs pa las te /
analyzed: mdo dang / rigs pa las te /
translated: From the scriptures and from logical reasoning.

original: re zhig mdo las ji lta bu zhe na bcom ldan 'das kyis gang ci tshor yang rung de ni 'dir sdug bsngal lo zhes bya ba dang / bde ba'i tshor ba ni sdug bsngal du blta bar bya'o zhes bya ba dang / sdug bsngal la bde ba'o snyam du 'du shes phyin ci log go zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: re zhig mdo las ji lta bu zhe na bcom ldan 'das kyis gang ci tshor yang rung de ni 'dir sdug bsngal lo zhes bya ba dang / bde ba'i tshor ba ni sdug bsngal du blta bar bya'o zhes bya ba dang / sdug bsngal la bde ba'o snyam du 'du shes phyin ci log go zhes gsungs te /
translated: And, “With regard to suffering, there is the error of the ideation of pleasure.”

original: re zhig mdo las ni de lta bu'o //
analyzed: re zhig mdo las ni de lta bu'o //
translated: This is the meaning of the sutra.

original: rigs pa las ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: rigs pa las ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of reasoning?

original: bde ba'i rgyu rnam par mi gnas pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: bde ba'i rgyu rnam par mi gnas pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because the cause of pleasure is not fixed.

original: kha cig bde ba'i rgyu btung ba dang bza' ba dang grang ba dang dro ba la sogs par 'dod pa gang dag yin pa de dag kho na ha cang spyad pa dang / dus ma yin par spyad pa rnams kyang sdug bsngal gyi rgyu dag tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kha cig bde ba'i rgyu btung ba dang bza' ba dang grang ba dang dro ba la sogs par 'dod pa gang dag yin pa de dag kho na ha cang spyad pa dang / dus ma yin par spyad pa rnams kyang sdug bsngal gyi rgyu dag tu 'gyur ro //
translated: Some maintain that the cause of pleasure is drink, food, cold, warmth, etc. But those very things, when used excessively or at the wrong time, become the cause of suffering.

original: @4b bde ba'i rgyu 'phel ba'am mnyam pas ni dus gzhan na sdug bsngal skyed par rigs pa ma yin pas de dag ni dang po kho na nas sdug bsngal gyi rgyu dag yin zhing bde ba'i rgyu ni ma yin la /
analyzed: @4b bde ba'i rgyu 'phel ba'am mnyam pas ni dus gzhan na sdug bsngal skyed par rigs pa ma yin pas de dag ni dang po kho na nas sdug bsngal gyi rgyu dag yin zhing bde ba'i rgyu ni ma yin la /
translated: It is not reasonable that a cause of pleasure, whether increased or the same, would generate pain at another time. Therefore, from the very beginning, they are causes of pain and not causes of pleasure.

original: mjug tu ni sdug bsngal de 'phel bar 'gyur bas bsal bar 'gyur bar zad de /
analyzed: mjug tu ni sdug bsngal de 'phel bar 'gyur bas bsal bar 'gyur bar zad de /
translated: In the end, that pain increases and becomes manifest.

original: spyod lam gyi bye brag la yang de bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: spyod lam gyi bye brag la yang de bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
translated: The same should be said of the various postures.

original: sdug bsngal gyi gnyen po dang sdug bsngal gyi bye brag la bde ba'i blo skye ba'i yang phyir te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi gnyen po dang sdug bsngal gyi bye brag la bde ba'i blo skye ba'i yang phyir te /
translated: Also, because the idea of pleasure arises in relation to the antidote to pain and in relation to the distinction between two pains.

original: ji srid du bkres pa dang skom pa dang grang ba dang tsha ba dang ngal ba dang 'dod pa'i 'dod chags las skyes pa'i sdug bsngal gzhan gyis gtses par ma gyur ba de srid du bde ba'o snyam du tshor ba cung zad kyang med do //
analyzed: ji srid du bkres pa dang skom pa dang grang ba dang tsha ba dang ngal ba dang 'dod pa'i 'dod chags las skyes pa'i sdug bsngal gzhan gyis gtses par ma gyur ba de srid du bde ba'o snyam du tshor ba cung zad kyang med do //
translated: As long as one is not afflicted by the pain born of hunger, thirst, cold, heat, fatigue, or sexual desire, one does not experience the slightest pleasure.

original: de lta bas na mi mkhas pa rnams ni gnyen po kho na la bde ba'i blo 'jug gi bde ba la ni ma yin no /
analyzed: de lta bas na mi mkhas pa rnams ni gnyen po kho na la bde ba'i blo 'jug gi bde ba la ni ma yin no /
translated: Thus, the unwise have the idea of pleasure only with regard to the remedy, not with regard to pleasure itself.

original: byis pa rnams ni sdug bsngal gyi bye brag la yang bde ba'i blo skyed par byed de /
analyzed: byis pa rnams ni sdug bsngal gyi bye brag la yang bde ba'i blo skyed par byed de /
translated: The foolish generate the idea of pleasure with regard to a particular type of pain.

original: dper na phrag pa nas phrag par khur yod par byed pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na phrag pa nas phrag par khur yod par byed pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, they move the burden from one shoulder to the other.

original: de lta bas na bde ba ni med pa kho na'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de lta bas na bde ba ni med pa kho na'o zhes zer ro //
translated: Thus, pleasure does not exist at all.

original: chos mngon pa pa rnams na re /
analyzed: chos mngon pa pa rnams na re /
translated: The Ābhidharmikas say:

original: yod pa nyid do zhes zer te /
analyzed: yod pa nyid do zhes zer te /
translated: It does exist.

original: 'di nyid rigs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di nyid rigs pa yin no //
translated: This is the correct position.

original: ji ltar byas pas she na /
analyzed: ji ltar byas pas she na /
translated: How do we know?

original: re zhig bde ba la skur ba 'debs pa de la 'di dri bar bya ste /🔽sdug bsngal zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig yin /
analyzed: re zhig bde ba la skur ba 'debs pa de la 'di dri bar bya ste / sdug bsngal zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig yin /
translated: First, we ask the one who denies pleasure:🔽What is pain?

original: gal te gnod pa'i bdag nyid gang yin pa'o zhes zer na ni ji lta bu yin zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: gal te gnod pa'i bdag nyid gang yin pa'o zhes zer na ni ji lta bu yin zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: If he says that pain is that which has the nature of harming, we ask: What is that?

original: gal te gnod par byed pa yin no zhes zer na ni phan par byed pa bde ba yin no zhes bya bar grub po //
analyzed: gal te gnod par byed pa yin no zhes zer na ni phan par byed pa bde ba yin no zhes bya bar grub po //
translated: If you say that it is that which harms, then it is established that that which benefits is pleasure.

original: gal te mi 'dod pa yin no zhes zer na ni 'dod pa bde ba yin no zhes bya bar grub po //
analyzed: gal te mi 'dod pa yin no zhes zer na ni 'dod pa bde ba yin no zhes bya bar grub po //
translated: If you say that it is that which is not desired, then it is established that that which is desired is pleasure.

original: gal te 'dod pa de nyid 'phags pa rnams 'dod chags dang bral ba'i tshe mi bzhed pa yin te /
analyzed: gal te 'dod pa de nyid 'phags pa rnams 'dod chags dang bral ba'i tshe mi bzhed pa yin te /
translated: If you say that the desired itself is not desired when the noble ones are free from attachment,

original: de lta bas na 'dod pa nyid yongs su ma grub pa yin no zhes zer na ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta bas na 'dod pa nyid yongs su ma grub pa yin no zhes zer na ni ma yin te /
translated: then it is not established that the desired is not desired,

original: mi 'dod pa ni gzhan du yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi 'dod pa ni gzhan du yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that which is not desired is different.

original: tshor ba gang zhig rang gi mtshan nyid kyis 'dod pa de ni nam yang de kho nas mi 'dod par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: tshor ba gang zhig rang gi mtshan nyid kyis 'dod pa de ni nam yang de kho nas mi 'dod par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Whatever feeling is desired by its intrinsic nature is never not desired by that very intrinsic nature.

original: 'di ltar 'phags pa rnams ni 'di gang gis na mi bzhed par 'gyur ba rnam pa gzhan gyis rnam par sun 'byin par byed cing /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'phags pa rnams ni 'di gang gis na mi bzhed par 'gyur ba rnam pa gzhan gyis rnam par sun 'byin par byed cing /
translated: In this way, the noble ones are disgusted with it by another mode, by which it is not desired.

original: 'di la bag med pa'i gnas dang / mngon par 'du bya ba chen pos bsgrub par bya ba dang / rnam par 'gyur ba can dang / mi rtag par lta'i rang gi mtshan nyid kyi rnam pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di la bag med pa'i gnas dang / mngon par 'du bya ba chen pos bsgrub par bya ba dang / rnam par 'gyur ba can dang / mi rtag par lta'i rang gi mtshan nyid kyi rnam pas ni ma yin no //
translated: It is seen as a basis of heedlessness, as something to be accomplished through great effort, as something that changes, and as impermanent, but not as having the aspect of its own characteristic.

original: gal te 'di rang gi mtshan nyid kyis mi 'dod pa @5a * //
analyzed: gal te 'di rang gi mtshan nyid kyis mi 'dod pa @5a * //
translated: If it were unpleasant by its own nature,

original: zhig yin bar gyur na ni de la su yang 'dod chags skye bar mi 'gyur ba zhig na //
analyzed: zhig yin bar gyur na ni de la su yang 'dod chags skye bar mi 'gyur ba zhig na //
translated: then no one would develop desire for it.

original: gang gi phyir 'dod chags dang bral ba'i ched du rnam pa gzhan gyis kyang skyon can du lta bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'dod chags dang bral ba'i ched du rnam pa gzhan gyis kyang skyon can du lta bar 'gyur te /
translated: But because it is the object of desire, it is seen as having faults through another aspect, in order to become free from desire.

original: de lta bas na bde ba'i tshor ba ni rang gi mtshan nyid kyis yod pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na bde ba'i tshor ba ni rang gi mtshan nyid kyis yod pa kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, the pleasant feeling exists only by its own nature.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis gang ci tshor yang rung de ni 'dir sdug bsngal lo zhes gsungs pa gang yin pa de ni bcom ldan 'das kho nas kun dga' bo gang ci tshor yang rung de ni 'dir sdug bsngal lo zhes bya ba ni ngas 'du byed mi rtag
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis gang ci tshor yang rung de ni 'dir sdug bsngal lo zhes gsungs pa gang yin pa de ni bcom ldan 'das kho nas kun dga' bo gang ci tshor yang rung de ni 'dir sdug bsngal lo zhes bya ba ni ngas 'du byed mi rtag
translated: The Bhagavān said, “Whatever is felt is suffering here.”🔽The Bhagavān alone said, “Whatever is felt is suffering here.”🔽“ Ānanda, I said this because conditioned states are impermanent,🔽

original: pa nyid dang / 'du byed rnam par 'gyur ba nyid la dgongs nas gsungs so zhes don nges par mdzad pa yin no //
analyzed: pa nyid dang / 'du byed rnam par 'gyur ba nyid la dgongs nas gsungs so zhes don nges par mdzad pa yin no //
translated: The Bhagavān has said, “Whatever is felt is suffering in this context,” and the Bhagavān himself has ascertained the meaning of this statement: “Ānanda, whatever is felt is suffering in this context. I have stated this with the intention of conditioned states being impermanent, and conditioned states changing.”

original: de lta bas na 'di ni sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal nyid las dgongs te gsungs pa ma yin par grub pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'di ni sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal nyid las dgongs te gsungs pa ma yin par grub pa yin no //
translated: Therefore it is established that this statement was not made with the intention of the suffering of suffering.

original: gal te tshor ba thams cad rang bzhin gyis sdug bsngal ba zhig yin par gyur na ni ci'i phyir 'phags pa kun dga' bos bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bde ba yang ma lags sdug bsngal ba yang ma lags ba dang tshor ba 'di gsum yang gsungs la /🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis gang ci tshor yang rung de ni 'dir sdug bsngal lo zhes kyang gsungs na /
analyzed: gal te tshor ba thams cad rang bzhin gyis sdug bsngal ba zhig yin par gyur na ni ci'i phyir 'phags pa kun dga' bos bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bde ba yang ma lags sdug bsngal ba yang ma lags ba dang tshor ba 'di gsum yang gsungs la / bcom ldan 'das kyis gang ci tshor yang rung de ni 'dir sdug bsngal lo zhes kyang gsungs na /
translated: happy, unhappy, and neither happy nor unhappy.🔽Bhagavan, you have also said, ‘Whatever is felt is suffering in this world.’

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis ci las dgongs nas gang ci tshor yang rung de ni 'dir sdug bsngal lo zhes bka' stsal zhes zhus par gyur te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis ci las dgongs nas gang ci tshor yang rung de ni 'dir sdug bsngal lo zhes bka' stsal zhes zhus par gyur te /
translated: Bhagavan, what were you thinking when you said, ‘Whatever is felt is suffering in this world’?

original: des kyang 'di skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis ci las dgongs nas tshor ba gsum zhes bka' stsal zhes zhus par 'gyur la bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang 'di skad du tshor ba gsum zhes bya ba 'di ni ngas dgongs nas bshad pa yin no zhes lung bstan par
analyzed: des kyang 'di skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis ci las dgongs nas tshor ba gsum zhes bka' stsal zhes zhus par 'gyur la bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang 'di skad du tshor ba gsum zhes bya ba 'di ni ngas dgongs nas bshad pa yin no zhes lung bstan par
translated: He would ask, “What did the Bhagavān intend when he said, ‘There are three feelings’?” And the Bhagavān would answer, “I taught ‘There are three feelings’ with a specific intention.”

original: 'gyur ba zhig na de skad kyang bka' stsal te /
analyzed: 'gyur ba zhig na de skad kyang bka' stsal te /
translated: But he did not say that.

original: de lta bas na tshor ba gsum ni rang gi ngo bos yod la /🔽gang ci tshor yang rung de ni 'dir sdug bsngal lo zhes bya ba 'di ngas dgongs nas bshad pa yin no zhes tshig 'di ni dgongs pa can du ston par mdzad pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na tshor ba gsum ni rang gi ngo bos yod la / gang ci tshor yang rung de ni 'dir sdug bsngal lo zhes bya ba 'di ngas dgongs nas bshad pa yin no zhes tshig 'di ni dgongs pa can du ston par mdzad pa yin no //
translated: Therefore the three feelings exist by their own intrinsic reality.🔽And he would teach that the statement, “Whatever is felt is suffering in this world,” was taught with a specific intention.🔽And he would teach that the statement, “You should view pleasant feeling as suffering,” was taught with a specific intention.

original: gang yang bde ba'i tshor ba ni sdug bsngal du blta bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yang de la gnyi ga yod do //
analyzed: gang yang bde ba'i tshor ba ni sdug bsngal du blta bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yang de la gnyi ga yod do //
translated: And he would teach that the statement, “Pleasant feeling should be viewed as suffering,” was taught with a specific intention.

original: rang gi ngo bos yid du 'ong ba'i phyir ni bde ba nyid yin la rnam par 'gyur ba dang mi rtag pa'i chos can yin pa'i phyir rnam grangs kyis ni sdug bsngal nyid yin no //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bos yid du 'ong ba'i phyir ni bde ba nyid yin la rnam par 'gyur ba dang mi rtag pa'i chos can yin pa'i phyir rnam grangs kyis ni sdug bsngal nyid yin no //
translated: Because it is pleasant by its intrinsic nature, it is happiness; but because it is subject to transformation and impermanence, it is suffering, in the sense of pariyāya duḥkhatā.

original: de la @5b bde bar mthong na ni 'dod chags can rnams de'i ro myong bar byed pa'i phyir 'ching bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: de la @5b bde bar mthong na ni 'dod chags can rnams de'i ro myong bar byed pa'i phyir 'ching bar 'gyur la /
translated: When it is seen as happiness, those who are attached to it experience its taste and are bound;

original: sdug bsngal du mthong na ni de la 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir thar bar 'gyur bas bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di ji ltar mthong na thar bar 'gyur ba de kho na bzhin du blta bar bka' stsal pa yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal du mthong na ni de la 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir thar bar 'gyur bas bcom ldan 'das kyis 'di ji ltar mthong na thar bar 'gyur ba de kho na bzhin du blta bar bka' stsal pa yin no //
translated: when it is seen as suffering, they are liberated from attachment to it. Thus the Fortunate One teaches that it should be seen as suffering, in order that one may be liberated.

original: de rang gi ngo bos bde zhes bya ba 'di ji ltar khong du chud ce na /
analyzed: de rang gi ngo bos bde zhes bya ba 'di ji ltar khong du chud ce na /
translated: How do you know that it is happiness by its intrinsic nature?

original: 'di ltar / rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rab mkhyen gyis //🔽'du byed mi rtag nyid dang ni //
analyzed: 'di ltar / rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rab mkhyen gyis // 'du byed mi rtag nyid dang ni //
translated: Because the perfect Buddha,🔽knowing the impermanence of conditioned things

original: rnam par 'gyur ba nyid mkhyen nas //
analyzed: rnam par 'gyur ba nyid mkhyen nas //
translated: and their transformation,

original: tshor ba sdug bsngal bar gsungs so //
analyzed: tshor ba sdug bsngal bar gsungs so //
translated: has declared that sensation is suffering.

original: zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: This is the meaning of the verse.

original: gang yang sdug bsngal la bde ba'o snyam du 'du shes phyin ci log go zhes gsungs pa yang bstan ba 'di ni dgongs pa can yin te /
analyzed: gang yang sdug bsngal la bde ba'o snyam du 'du shes phyin ci log go zhes gsungs pa yang bstan ba 'di ni dgongs pa can yin te /
translated: The statement, “The notion that what is painful is pleasant is a mistaken notion” is a teaching that is interpretable in meaning.

original: 'jig rten ni tshor ba dang / 'dod pa'i yon tan rnams dang / skye ba la bde bar 'du shes so //
analyzed: 'jig rten ni tshor ba dang / 'dod pa'i yon tan rnams dang / skye ba la bde bar 'du shes so //
translated: The world is mistaken in thinking that feeling, the sensory pleasures, and birth are pleasant.

original: de la bde ba'i tshor ba la ni rnam grangs kyis sdug bsngal yang yod na gcig tu bde bar lta ba ni phyin ci log yin la /
analyzed: de la bde ba'i tshor ba la ni rnam grangs kyis sdug bsngal yang yod na gcig tu bde bar lta ba ni phyin ci log yin la /
translated: In the case of pleasant feeling, there is suffering in the sense of a transformation of what is pleasant, and so the view that it is exclusively pleasant is a mistake.

original: 'dod pa'i yon tan rnams la yang bde ba ni chung la sdug bsngal ni mang ba yin na gcig tu bde bar lta ba ni phyin ci log pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i yon tan rnams la yang bde ba ni chung la sdug bsngal ni mang ba yin na gcig tu bde bar lta ba ni phyin ci log pa yin te /
translated: In the case of the sensory pleasures, there is little pleasure and much suffering, and so the view that they are exclusively pleasant is a mistake.

original: skye ba la de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: skye ba la de dang 'dra'o //
translated: The same applies to birth.

original: de lta bas na bde ba'i tshor ba med par mi 'grub po //
analyzed: de lta bas na bde ba'i tshor ba med par mi 'grub po //
translated: Thus, the nonexistence of pleasant feeling is not established.

original: gal te tshor ba thams cad rang gi ngo bo kho nas sdug bsngal ba yin par 'gyur na tshor ba gsum zhes gsungs pa la yon tan ci zhig yod par 'gyur /
analyzed: gal te tshor ba thams cad rang gi ngo bo kho nas sdug bsngal ba yin par 'gyur na tshor ba gsum zhes gsungs pa la yon tan ci zhig yod par 'gyur /
translated: If all feelings were suffering by their intrinsic reality, what would be the benefit of stating three feelings?

original: gal te 'jig rten dang mthun par gsungs pa yin no zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te 'jig rten dang mthun par gsungs pa yin no zhe na ma yin te /
translated: If you say that it is stated in accordance with the world, that is not so.

original: tshor ba thams cad sdug bsngal ba nyid ni ngas dgongs nas gsungs so zhes bka' stsal pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshor ba thams cad sdug bsngal ba nyid ni ngas dgongs nas gsungs so zhes bka' stsal pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is said, “I taught that all feelings are suffering with a specific intention.”

original: yang dag par ji lta ba bzhin zhes gsungs pa'i yang phyir te /
analyzed: yang dag par ji lta ba bzhin zhes gsungs pa'i yang phyir te /
translated: And because it says, “In reality, as it is,”🔽and after stating, “The faculty of pleasure and the faculty of mental satisfaction should be viewed as the feeling of pleasure,”

original: bde ba'i dbang po gang yin pa dang / yid bde ba'i dbang po gang yin pa 'di ni bde ba'i tshor ba yin par blta bar bya'o zhes rgyas par gsungs nas gang gis dbang po lnga po 'di dag de ltar yang dag pa'i shes rab kyis yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin mthong zhing /
analyzed: bde ba'i dbang po gang yin pa dang / yid bde ba'i dbang po gang yin pa 'di ni bde ba'i tshor ba yin par blta bar bya'o zhes rgyas par gsungs nas gang gis dbang po lnga po 'di dag de ltar yang dag pa'i shes rab kyis yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin mthong zhing /
translated: and so on, it says, “Whoever sees these five faculties in this way with correct wisdom sees reality as it is.”

original: de'i kun du sbyor ba gsum yang sbangs pa yin zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa gsungs so //🔽'jig rten yang ji ltar na sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba la rnam pa gsum du rtog par 'gyur gal te chung ngu dang chen po dang 'bring dag la go rims bzhin du bde ba la sogs pa'i blo skye'o zhe na ni bde ba la yang rnam pa gsum
analyzed: de'i kun du sbyor ba gsum yang sbangs pa yin zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa gsungs so // 'jig rten yang ji ltar na sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba la rnam pa gsum du rtog par 'gyur gal te chung ngu dang chen po dang 'bring dag la go rims bzhin du bde ba la sogs pa'i blo skye'o zhe na ni bde ba la yang rnam pa gsum
translated: The three fetters of that person are also destroyed.🔽How could the world conceive of the three types of feeling in relation to the feeling of pain?

original: yod pas sdug bsngal chung ngu @6a * //
analyzed: yod pas sdug bsngal chung ngu @6a * //
translated: If the idea of pleasure arises in relation to a small amount of pain, a medium amount of pain, and a great amount of pain, respectively, then pleasure also has three types.

original: la sogs pa la bde ba chen po la sogs pa'i blo skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: la sogs pa la bde ba chen po la sogs pa'i blo skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the idea of pleasure would arise in relation to a small amount of pain, etc.

original: gang gi tshe dri dang ro dang reg bya'i khyad par las skyes pa'i bde ba sang ba de'i tshe gang la 'di bde ba'i blor 'gyur ba sdug bsngal chung ngur gyur pa yang gang zhig yin /
analyzed: gang gi tshe dri dang ro dang reg bya'i khyad par las skyes pa'i bde ba sang ba de'i tshe gang la 'di bde ba'i blor 'gyur ba sdug bsngal chung ngur gyur pa yang gang zhig yin /
translated: When pleasure arises from the special qualities of smell, taste, and tactility, then what is the small amount of pain in relation to which the idea of pleasure arises?

original: sdug bsngal chung ngu de ma skyes pa dang 'gags pa na sdug bsngal ma lus pa dang bral ba'i phyir bde ba'i blo shin tu ches skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal chung ngu de ma skyes pa dang 'gags pa na sdug bsngal ma lus pa dang bral ba'i phyir bde ba'i blo shin tu ches skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: When that small suffering has not yet arisen or has ceased, the idea of pleasure arises very strongly, because all suffering has been eliminated.

original: 'dod pa'i bde ba mngon sum du gyur pa la yang de bzhin du brjod par bya'o //🔽tshor ba chung du la ni nyams su myong ba shin tu gsal ba dang shas chen por 'dzin la /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i bde ba mngon sum du gyur pa la yang de bzhin du brjod par bya'o // tshor ba chung du la ni nyams su myong ba shin tu gsal ba dang shas chen por 'dzin la /
translated: The same should be said of the manifest pleasure of the desire realm.🔽How could it be correct to say that one grasps the experience of small feeling as very clear and strong,

original: 'bring la ni mi gsal bar 'dzin zhes bya ba gang yin ba 'di yang ji ltar rung /
analyzed: 'bring la ni mi gsal bar 'dzin zhes bya ba gang yin ba 'di yang ji ltar rung /
translated: and that one grasps the experience of medium feeling as unclear?

original: bsam gtan gsum na bde ba yod do zhes 'byung bas sdug bsngal chung dur yang 'gyur la /
analyzed: bsam gtan gsum na bde ba yod do zhes 'byung bas sdug bsngal chung dur yang 'gyur la /
translated: Since it is said that pleasure exists in the third absorption, it would follow that there is small suffering.

original: gang na bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa yod do zhes 'byung bas sdug bsngal 'bring du yang 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang na bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa yod do zhes 'byung bas sdug bsngal 'bring du yang 'gyur te /
translated: Since it is said that neither pleasure nor suffering exists in the fourth absorption, it would follow that there is medium suffering.

original: de lta bas na sdug bsngal chung ngu la sogs pa la bde ba la sogs pa'i tshor ba rnam par gzhag tu mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de lta bas na sdug bsngal chung ngu la sogs pa la bde ba la sogs pa'i tshor ba rnam par gzhag tu mi rung ngo //
translated: Therefore it is not correct to posit pleasure and so on in relation to small suffering and so on.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang ming chen gal te gzugs gcig tu sdug bsngal ba zhig yin par gyur na ni bde ba yang med /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang ming chen gal te gzugs gcig tu sdug bsngal ba zhig yin par gyur na ni bde ba yang med /
translated: If form were exclusively suffering, there would be no pleasure and no one would be attached to it.

original: bde ba dang rjes su 'brel pa yang med ces bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa gsungs pas de'i phyir yang bde ba cung zad cig yod de /
analyzed: bde ba dang rjes su 'brel pa yang med ces bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa gsungs pas de'i phyir yang bde ba cung zad cig yod de /
translated: Therefore, pleasure exists to some degree.

original: re zhig de lta na mdo las bde ba'i tshor ba med par mi 'grub bo //
analyzed: re zhig de lta na mdo las bde ba'i tshor ba med par mi 'grub bo //
translated: In this way, the nonexistence of the feeling of pleasure is not established by the sutra.

original: gang yang bde ba'i rgyu rnam par mi gnas pa'i phyir ro zhes smras pa /
analyzed: gang yang bde ba'i rgyu rnam par mi gnas pa'i phyir ro zhes smras pa /
translated: You also said that the cause of pleasure is not fixed.

original: de yang rgyu yongs su ma shes pa'i phyir smra bar zad de /🔽rten gyi khyad par la ltos pa'i yul bde ba'i rgyu 'am /
analyzed: de yang rgyu yongs su ma shes pa'i phyir smra bar zad de / rten gyi khyad par la ltos pa'i yul bde ba'i rgyu 'am /
translated: This is said because the cause is not fully understood.🔽The cause of pleasure or the cause of suffering depends on the specific basis,

original: sdug bsngal gyi rgyu yin gyi yul 'ba' zhig ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi rgyu yin gyi yul 'ba' zhig ni ma yin no //
translated: but the object alone is not the cause.

original: de lus kyi gnas skabs gang zhig dang phrad na bde ba'i rgyu yin pa de ni de dang phrad na ma yin pa ni nam yang ma yin pas bde ba'i rgyu rnam par gnas pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: de lus kyi gnas skabs gang zhig dang phrad na bde ba'i rgyu yin pa de ni de dang phrad na ma yin pa ni nam yang ma yin pas bde ba'i rgyu rnam par gnas pa kho na yin te /
translated: When it encounters a certain state of the body, it is a cause of pleasure. It is never not a cause of pleasure when it encounters that state. Therefore the cause of pleasure is definitely a cause of pleasure.

original: dper na btso bar bya ba'i 'byung ba'i khyad par la ltos pa'i me de nyid zhim par tshos pa'i rgyu yang yin zhing /
analyzed: dper na btso bar bya ba'i 'byung ba'i khyad par la ltos pa'i me de nyid zhim par tshos pa'i rgyu yang yin zhing /
translated: For example, fire, which depends on a particular element to be cooked, is a cause of delicious cooking.

original: de nyid mi zhim par tshos pa'i rgyu yang yin la btso bar bya ba'i 'byung ba'i gnas skabs gang dang phrad nas zhim par tshos pa'i rgyu yin pa de dang phrad nas rgyu ma yin pa ni ma yin pa bzhin te 'di ni dpe yin no //
analyzed: de nyid mi zhim par tshos pa'i rgyu yang yin la btso bar bya ba'i 'byung ba'i gnas skabs gang dang phrad nas zhim par tshos pa'i rgyu yin pa de dang phrad nas rgyu ma yin pa ni ma yin pa bzhin te 'di ni dpe yin no //
translated: It is also a cause of undelicious cooking. When it encounters a certain state of the element to be cooked, it is a cause of delicious cooking. It is never not a cause of delicious cooking when it encounters that state. This is an example.

original: bsam gtan dag na yang bde ba'i rgyu ji ltar rnam par mi gnas pa yin /
analyzed: bsam gtan dag na yang bde ba'i rgyu ji ltar rnam par mi gnas pa yin /
translated: How is the cause of pleasure in the absorptions not definitely a cause of pleasure?

original: gang yang @6b gnyen po la bde ba'i blo skye zhes smras pa de la yang gang gi tshe dril la sogs pa'i khyad par las skyes pa'i bde ba myong ba de'i tshe gang gis gnyen po la bde ba'i blor 'gyur /
analyzed: gang yang @6b gnyen po la bde ba'i blo skye zhes smras pa de la yang gang gi tshe dril la sogs pa'i khyad par las skyes pa'i bde ba myong ba de'i tshe gang gis gnyen po la bde ba'i blor 'gyur /
translated: And when you say that the idea of pleasure arises in regard to an antidote, then when you experience pleasure born of a special sound, etc., in regard to what is that idea of pleasure in regard to the antidote?

original: sdug bsngal de ma skyes pa dang 'gags nas bde ba'i blo shin tu ches skye bar yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal de ma skyes pa dang 'gags nas bde ba'i blo shin tu ches skye bar yang 'gyur ro //
translated: And when that suffering has not yet arisen or has already ceased, the idea of pleasure arises even more strongly.

original: bsam gtan las skyes pa'i bde ba la yang gang gi gnyen po yin zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa lan bshad zin to //
analyzed: bsam gtan las skyes pa'i bde ba la yang gang gi gnyen po yin zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa lan bshad zin to //
translated: And in regard to the pleasure born of the meditative absorptions, we have already explained the answer to the question, “In regard to what is that an antidote?”

original: khur sbed pa la yang ji srid du lus kyi gnas skabs de lta bu med par ma gyur gyi bar du gnas skabs gzhan las skyes pa'i bde ba khon skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khur sbed pa la yang ji srid du lus kyi gnas skabs de lta bu med par ma gyur gyi bar du gnas skabs gzhan las skyes pa'i bde ba khon skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: And in regard to the relief of fatigue, as long as the condition of the body has not changed, pleasure born of that other condition will continue to arise.

original: de lta ma yin na phyis bde ba'i blo rje mang du skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na phyis bde ba'i blo rje mang du skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: Otherwise, later on, the idea of pleasure would not arise frequently.

original: ngal ba'i spyod lam gyi rnam pa dag la yang de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: ngal ba'i spyod lam gyi rnam pa dag la yang de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: The same should be understood in regard to the various kinds of activity that cause fatigue.

original: gal te dang po nas rtsom pa zhig med na mjug tu sdug bsngal gyi blor ga la 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gal te dang po nas rtsom pa zhig med na mjug tu sdug bsngal gyi blor ga la 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If there is no beginning, how can there be a subsequent idea of suffering?

original: lus yongs su 'gyur pa'i khyad par las te /
analyzed: lus yongs su 'gyur pa'i khyad par las te /
translated: From the special transformation of the body.

original: chang la sogs pa mngar ba la mjug tu skyur por 'gyur ba bzhin no //
analyzed: chang la sogs pa mngar ba la mjug tu skyur por 'gyur ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, alcohol, which is sweet at the beginning, becomes sour at the end.

original: de lta bas na bde ba'i tshor ba yod pa kho na'o zhes bya ba yang grub la /
analyzed: de lta bas na bde ba'i tshor ba yod pa kho na'o zhes bya ba yang grub la /
translated: Thus, the existence of the sensation of pleasure is established.

original: sdug bsngal nyid gsum dang ldan pa'i phyir zag pa dang bcas pa thams cad sdug bsngal lo zhes bya ba yang grub pa yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal nyid gsum dang ldan pa'i phyir zag pa dang bcas pa thams cad sdug bsngal lo zhes bya ba yang grub pa yin no //
translated: And it is established that all that is contaminated is suffering because it possesses the three kinds of suffering.🔽The truth of origination is the same as the truth of suffering.

original: kun 'byung gi bden pa gang yin pa de nyid sdug bsngal gyi bden pa yin no zhes bya ba de ni mdo las thal ba yin te /🔽mdo las ni sred pa kho na yin par bshad do //
analyzed: kun 'byung gi bden pa gang yin pa de nyid sdug bsngal gyi bden pa yin no zhes bya ba de ni mdo las thal ba yin te / mdo las ni sred pa kho na yin par bshad do //
translated: This is a consequence of the sutra, for the sutra explains that craving alone is the truth of origination.🔽Craving is the principal factor, and so it is mentioned in the sutra.

original: de ni gtso bo yin pa'i phyir mdo las bshad kyi gzhan dag kyang kun 'byung ni yin no //
analyzed: de ni gtso bo yin pa'i phyir mdo las bshad kyi gzhan dag kyang kun 'byung ni yin no //
translated: But other factors are also the truth of origination.

original: 'di ji ltar khong du chud par bya zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ji ltar khong du chud par bya zhe na /
translated: How is this understood?

original: gzhan las gzhan yang yin par gsungs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gzhan las gzhan yang yin par gsungs pa'i phyir te /
translated: because it is said that it is also other than that.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis /
translated: The Bhagavān has said:

original: las dang srid pa dang ni ma rig pa //
analyzed: las dang srid pa dang ni ma rig pa //
translated: Karma, craving, and ignorance

original: phyi ma'i tshe la 'du byed rnams kyi rgyu //
analyzed: phyi ma'i tshe la 'du byed rnams kyi rgyu //
translated: are the causes of formations in the next life.🔽And it is said:

original: zhes gsungs la yang sa bon gyi rnam pa lnga zhes bya ba /
analyzed: zhes gsungs la yang sa bon gyi rnam pa lnga zhes bya ba /
translated: The five aspects of seeds

original: 'di ni nye bar len pa dang bcas pa'i rnam par shes pa'i tshig bla dags yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni nye bar len pa dang bcas pa'i rnam par shes pa'i tshig bla dags yin no //
translated: are synonyms for consciousness associated with appropriating.

original: sa'i khams zhes bya ba 'di ni rnam par shes pa gnas pa bzhi'i tshig bla dags yin no zhes kyang gsungs te /
analyzed: sa'i khams zhes bya ba 'di ni rnam par shes pa gnas pa bzhi'i tshig bla dags yin no zhes kyang gsungs te /
translated: The term “earth element” is a synonym for the four abodes of consciousness.

original: de lta bas na mdo las bstan pa ni dgongs pa can yin la /
analyzed: de lta bas na mdo las bstan pa ni dgongs pa can yin la /
translated: Therefore the teaching in the sutra is provisional,

original: chos mngon pa las bstan pa ni mtshan nyid pa yin no //
analyzed: chos mngon pa las bstan pa ni mtshan nyid pa yin no //
translated: but the teaching in the Abhidharma is definitive.

original: gzhan yang mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu bka' stsol pa na ni kun 'byung gi bden pa sred pa kho na yin par gsungs la /
analyzed: gzhan yang mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu bka' stsol pa na ni kun 'byung gi bden pa sred pa kho na yin par gsungs la /
translated: Moreover, when the Buddha taught the cause of manifest existence, he said that the truth of origin is craving alone.

original: skye ba dang mngon bar 'grub pa'i rgyu /
analyzed: skye ba dang mngon bar 'grub pa'i rgyu /
translated: When he taught the cause of birth and manifest existence, he said that the truth of origin is the five appropriated aggregates.

original: @7a * // rgyu dang bcas par bka' stsol pa ni tshigs su bcad pa las /
analyzed: @7a * // rgyu dang bcas par bka' stsol pa ni tshigs su bcad pa las /
translated: The Buddha declared the causes of birth and of becoming, in a verse:🔽Action, craving, and ignorance are the causes of birth.🔽A sūtra says: Action is the cause of birth.

original: las dang sred pa dang ma rig pa yin par gsungs te /
analyzed: las dang sred pa dang ma rig pa yin par gsungs te /
translated: Craving is the cause of actualization.🔽Or else, the order of the causes, conditions, and bases is in accordance with the order in which they are mentioned in the sūtras.🔽The Buddha declared the causes of birth and of becoming, in a verse:🔽Action, craving, and ignorance are the causes of birth.🔽A sūtra says: Action is the cause of birth.

original: mdo las / las ni skye ba'i rgyu yin la /🔽srid pa ni mngon bar 'grub pa'i rgyu yin no zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //🔽yang na mdo las rgyu dang bcas /
analyzed: mdo las / las ni skye ba'i rgyu yin la / srid pa ni mngon bar 'grub pa'i rgyu yin no zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro // yang na mdo las rgyu dang bcas /
translated: Craving is the cause of actualization.

original: rkyen dang bcas /
analyzed: rkyen dang bcas /
translated: Or else, the order of the causes, conditions, and bases is in accordance with the order in which they are mentioned in the sūtras.🔽The Buddha declared the causes of birth and of becoming, in a verse:🔽Action, craving, and ignorance are the causes of birth.🔽A sūtra says: Action is the cause of birth.

original: gzhi dang bcas zhes 'byung ba'i rim par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhi dang bcas zhes 'byung ba'i rim par bstan pa yin no //
translated: Craving is the cause of actualization.🔽Or else, the order of the causes, conditions, and bases is in accordance with the order in which they are mentioned in the sūtras.🔽The Buddha declared the causes of birth and of becoming, in a verse:🔽Action, craving, and ignorance are the causes of birth.

original: sa bon dang zhing gi dngos por ston par mdzad pas rnam par shes pa la sogs pa la yang gsungs so //
analyzed: sa bon dang zhing gi dngos por ston par mdzad pas rnam par shes pa la sogs pa la yang gsungs so //
translated: A sūtra says: Action is the cause of birth.🔽Craving is the cause of actualization.🔽Or else, the order of the causes, conditions, and bases is in accordance with the order in which they are mentioned in the sūtras.

original: skye ba ni gang yin /
analyzed: skye ba ni gang yin /
translated: The Buddha declared the causes of birth and of becoming, in a verse:🔽Action, craving, and ignorance are the causes of birth.🔽A sūtra says: Action is the cause of birth.

original: mngon par 'grub ba ni gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: mngon par 'grub ba ni gang yin zhe na /
translated: Craving is the cause of actualization.🔽Or else, the order of the causes, conditions, and bases is in accordance with the order in which they are mentioned in the sūtras.

original: khams dang 'gro ba dang skye gnas la sogs pa'i bye brag gis lus skye ba ni skye ba yin la /🔽bye brag med par yang srid par nyid mtshams sbyor ba ni mngon par 'grub pa yin no //
analyzed: khams dang 'gro ba dang skye gnas la sogs pa'i bye brag gis lus skye ba ni skye ba yin la /🔽bye brag med par yang srid par nyid mtshams sbyor ba ni mngon par 'grub pa yin no //
translated: The Buddha declared the causes of birth and of becoming, in a verse:🔽Action, craving

original: de gnyis kyi rgyu ni go rims bzhin du las dang sred pa yin te /
analyzed: de gnyis kyi rgyu ni go rims bzhin du las dang sred pa yin te /
translated: The causes of these two are, respectively, action and craving.

original: dper na sa bon s'a lu dang nas la sogs pa'i rigs kyi bye brag gis myu gu skye ba'i rgyu yin la /
analyzed: dper na sa bon s'a lu dang nas la sogs pa'i rigs kyi bye brag gis myu gu skye ba'i rgyu yin la /
translated: For example, a seed is the cause of the arising of a sprout, by virtue of the specific type of rice, barley, etc.

original: chu ni bye brag med par myu gu thams cad skye ba tsam gyi rgyu yin ba lta bu ste 'di ni dpe yin no //
analyzed: chu ni bye brag med par myu gu thams cad skye ba tsam gyi rgyu yin ba lta bu ste 'di ni dpe yin no //
translated: Water is the cause of the mere arising of any sprout, without any distinction.

original: mngon bar grub pa'i rgyu sred pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di la rigs pa ci zhig yod ce na /
analyzed: mngon bar grub pa'i rgyu sred pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di la rigs pa ci zhig yod ce na /
translated: What is the reasoning that craving is the cause of manifest action?

original: sred pa dang bral ba skye ba med pa'i phyir te /🔽sred pa dang bcas pa dang sred pa dang bral ba gnyi ga yang 'chi ba las sred pa dag kho na skye bar snang gi sred pa dang bral ba rnams ni ma yin pas sred pa med na skye ba med pa'i phyir sred pa mngon par 'grub par
analyzed: sred pa dang bral ba skye ba med pa'i phyir te / sred pa dang bcas pa dang sred pa dang bral ba gnyi ga yang 'chi ba las sred pa dag kho na skye bar snang gi sred pa dang bral ba rnams ni ma yin pas sred pa med na skye ba med pa'i phyir sred pa mngon par 'grub par
translated: Because there is no birth for one free from craving.

original: bya ba la sred pa rgyu yin par shes so //
analyzed: bya ba la sred pa rgyu yin par shes so //
translated: Both those who possess craving and those who are free from craving die, but only those who possess craving are seen to be reborn. Those who are free from craving are not. Therefore, since there is no birth without craving, craving is understood to be the cause of the establishment of manifest action.

original: rgyud gzhol ba'i yang phyir te /
analyzed: rgyud gzhol ba'i yang phyir te /
translated: Also, because the stream is directed.

original: gang la sred pa dang bcas pa der sems kyi rgyud yang dang yang du gzhol bar mthong bas /
analyzed: gang la sred pa dang bcas pa der sems kyi rgyud yang dang yang du gzhol bar mthong bas /
translated: We see that the mind is constantly drawn to that which is craved.

original: de lta bas na yang sred pa la yang de dang 'dra'o zhes bya bar shes so //
analyzed: de lta bas na yang sred pa la yang de dang 'dra'o zhes bya bar shes so //
translated: Thus, craving is also like that.

original: ji ltar sred pas 'dag pa'i chal sran chung gi phye ma'i lde gu bskams pas lus bzung ba bzhin du lus /
analyzed: ji ltar sred pas 'dag pa'i chal sran chung gi phye ma'i lde gu bskams pas lus bzung ba bzhin du lus /
translated: Craving is like the paste of jujube flour that holds the body together when it dries.

original: kun du bzung ba de ltar ni gang gis kyang lus kun du ma bzung ste /
analyzed: kun du bzung ba de ltar ni gang gis kyang lus kun du ma bzung ste /
translated: But the self is not like that, for nothing holds it together.

original: rgyu gzhan ni ji ltar bdag la chags pa de ltar rjes su 'brel ba ma yin te /
analyzed: rgyu gzhan ni ji ltar bdag la chags pa de ltar rjes su 'brel ba ma yin te /
translated: No other cause is related to the self in the way that attachment is.

original: 'di ni rigs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni rigs pa yin no //
translated: This is the correct explanation.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bden pa bzhi zhes kyang gsungs /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bden pa bzhi zhes kyang gsungs /
translated: The Blessed One has taught four noble truths.

original: kun rdzob kyi bden pa dang / don dam pa'i bden pa dang bden ba gnyis zhes kyang gsungs la /
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi bden pa dang / don dam pa'i bden pa dang bden ba gnyis zhes kyang gsungs la /
translated: He has also taught two truths, the conventional truth and the ultimate truth.

original: de gnyis kyi mtshan nyid ci zhe na //🔽gang la bcom dang blo yis gzhan //
analyzed: de gnyis kyi mtshan nyid ci zhe na // gang la bcom dang blo yis gzhan //
translated: What are their characteristics?🔽When something is destroyed or mentally dissected,

original: @7b bsal na de blo mi 'jug pa //
analyzed: @7b bsal na de blo mi 'jug pa //
translated: and the mind no longer apprehends it as such,

original: bum chu bzhin du kun rdzob tu //
analyzed: bum chu bzhin du kun rdzob tu //
translated: Like a pot and water, they exist superficially.

original: yod de don dam yod gzhan no //🔽gang la cha shas su bcom na de'i blo mi 'jug pa de ni kun rdzob tu yod pa ste /
analyzed: yod de don dam yod gzhan no // gang la cha shas su bcom na de'i blo mi 'jug pa de ni kun rdzob tu yod pa ste /
translated: The other is ultimate existence.

original: dper na bum pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na bum pa lta bu'o //
translated: That which, when broken down into parts, ceases to be perceived as such, exists superficially, like a pot.

original: de la ni gyo mor bcom na bum pa'i blo mi 'jug go //
analyzed: de la ni gyo mor bcom na bum pa'i blo mi 'jug go //
translated: When a pot is broken down into shards, the perception of a pot ceases.

original: gang la blos chos gzhan bsal na de'i blo mi 'jug pa de yang kun rdzob tu yod pa yin par khong du chud par bya ste /
analyzed: gang la blos chos gzhan bsal na de'i blo mi 'jug pa de yang kun rdzob tu yod pa yin par khong du chud par bya ste /
translated: One should understand that that which, when mentally dissected, ceases to be perceived as such, also exists superficially.

original: dper na chu lta bu'o //🔽de la ni blos gzugs la sogs pa'i chos bsal na /
analyzed: dper na chu lta bu'o // de la ni blos gzugs la sogs pa'i chos bsal na /
translated: Like water, for example.

original: chu'i blo mi 'jug go //
analyzed: chu'i blo mi 'jug go //
translated: When water is mentally dissected, the perception of water ceases.

original: de dag kho na la kun rdzob tu de'i ming du btags pa yin pas kun rdzob kyi dbang gis bum pa dang chu yod do zhes brjod pa ni bden pa kho na smras pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de dag kho na la kun rdzob tu de'i ming du btags pa yin pas kun rdzob kyi dbang gis bum pa dang chu yod do zhes brjod pa ni bden pa kho na smras pa yin gyi /
translated: Since the names of those are merely imputed superficially, it is said that “a pot and water exist by superficial power,” and this is the only truth.

original: brdzun pa ni ma yin pas de ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa yin no //
analyzed: brdzun pa ni ma yin pas de ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa yin no //
translated: It is not false, so this is superficial truth.

original: de las gzhan pa ni don dam pa'i bden pa ste /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa ni don dam pa'i bden pa ste /
translated: The other is ultimate truth.

original: gang la bcom yang de'i blo 'jug pa kho na yin la /
