analyzed: gang la bcom yang de'i blo 'jug pa kho na yin la /
translated: The cognition of that object continues to occur even when it is broken into parts.

original: blos chos gzhan bsal yang de'i blo 'jug pa de ni don dam par yod pa yin te /
analyzed: blos chos gzhan bsal yang de'i blo 'jug pa de ni don dam par yod pa yin te /
translated: The cognition of that object continues to occur even when other properties are removed from it by the mind.

original: dper na gzugs lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na gzugs lta bu'o //
translated: For example, a visible form.

original: de la rdul phra bar tu bcom yang rung /
analyzed: de la rdul phra bar tu bcom yang rung /
translated: Even when it is broken down into minute particles,

original: blos ro la sogs pa'i chos bsal kyang rung gzugs kyi rang bzhin gyi blo 'jug pa nyid de /
analyzed: blos ro la sogs pa'i chos bsal kyang rung gzugs kyi rang bzhin gyi blo 'jug pa nyid de /
translated: or when the properties of taste, etc. are removed from it by the mind, the cognition of the intrinsic nature of visible form continues to occur.

original: tshor ba la sogs pa yang de bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: tshor ba la sogs pa yang de bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
translated: The same should be understood with regard to feeling, etc.

original: de ni don dam par yod pa'i phyir don dam pa'i bden pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni don dam par yod pa'i phyir don dam pa'i bden pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Because it exists ultimately, it is called the ultimate truth.

original: sngon gyi slob dpon rnams na re /🔽ji ltar 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes pa'am /
analyzed: sngon gyi slob dpon rnams na re / ji ltar 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes pa'am /
translated: The former masters say:

original: de'i rjes la thob pa 'jig rten pas 'dzin pa de ltar ni don dam pa'i bden pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i rjes la thob pa 'jig rten pas 'dzin pa de ltar ni don dam pa'i bden pa yin no //
translated: That which is apprehended by supramundane cognition or by the cognition that is attained subsequently to it is the ultimate truth.

original: ji ltar gzhan gyis 'dzin pa de ltar ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: ji ltar gzhan gyis 'dzin pa de ltar ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: That which is apprehended by other cognitions is the conventional truth.

original: bden pa rnams bshad zin to //
analyzed: bden pa rnams bshad zin to //
translated: The Truths have been explained.

original: ji ltar na de dag mthong bar 'gyur ba brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: ji ltar na de dag mthong bar 'gyur ba brjod par bya ste /
translated: How does one see them?🔽We will explain this.

original: de'i phyir dang po 'jug pa las brtsams te brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir dang po 'jug pa las brtsams te brjod par bya'o //
translated: First, we will discuss the beginning of practice.

original: tshul gnas thos dang bsam gtan pa //
analyzed: tshul gnas thos dang bsam gtan pa //
translated: One who abides in morality, who listens and reflects,

original: bsgom pa la ni rab tu sbyor //
analyzed: bsgom pa la ni rab tu sbyor //
translated: is well prepared for meditation.

original: bden pa rnams mthong bar 'dod pa ni dang po kho nar tshul khrims srung bar byed do //🔽de'i 'og tu bden pa mthong ba dang mthun pa'i thos pa 'dzin pa'am /
analyzed: bden pa rnams mthong bar 'dod pa ni dang po kho nar tshul khrims srung bar byed do // de'i 'og tu bden pa mthong ba dang mthun pa'i thos pa 'dzin pa'am /
translated: One who desires to see the truths first of all guards morality.

original: don nyan par byed do //
analyzed: don nyan par byed do //
translated: After that, he listens to the meaning of the scriptures that are conducive to seeing the truths.

original: thos nas phyin ci ma log par sems par byed do //
analyzed: thos nas phyin ci ma log par sems par byed do //
translated: Having listened, he reflects without error.

original: bsams nas ting nge 'dzin sgom pa la rab tu sbyor bar byed do //
analyzed: bsams nas ting nge 'dzin sgom pa la rab tu sbyor bar byed do //
translated: Having reflected, he is well prepared for the cultivation of concentration.

original: de thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab la brten nas bsam pa las byung ba skye'o //🔽bsam pa las byung ba la @8a * //
analyzed: de thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab la brten nas bsam pa las byung ba skye'o // bsam pa las byung ba la @8a * //
translated: He generates the wisdom that arises from reflection in dependence on the wisdom that arises from listening.

original: brten nas bsgom pa las byung ba skye'o //
analyzed: brten nas bsgom pa las byung ba skye'o //
translated: He generates the wisdom that arises from meditation in dependence on the wisdom that arises from reflection.

original: shes rab 'di dag gi mtshan nyid ci zhe na /
analyzed: shes rab 'di dag gi mtshan nyid ci zhe na /
translated: What are the characteristics of these three wisdoms?

original: thos sogs las byung blo rnams ni //
analyzed: thos sogs las byung blo rnams ni //
translated: The wisdoms that arise from listening, reflection, and meditation are, respectively,

original: ming dang gnyi ga don yul tsan //
analyzed: ming dang gnyi ga don yul tsan //
translated: Both name and meaning are the objects of the wisdom arisen from meditation.

original: bye brag tu smra ba rnams na re thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab ni ming la dmigs pa yin la /
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba rnams na re thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab ni ming la dmigs pa yin la /
translated: Vaibhasikas say: The wisdom arisen from hearing focuses on name.

original: bsam pa las byung ba ni ming dang don la dmigs pa yin te /
analyzed: bsam pa las byung ba ni ming dang don la dmigs pa yin te /
translated: The wisdom arisen from contemplation focuses on both name and meaning.

original: res 'ga' ni yi ges don 'dren par byed do //
analyzed: res 'ga' ni yi ges don 'dren par byed do //
translated: Sometimes syllables lead to meaning.

original: bsgom pa las byung ba ni don la dmigs pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: bsgom pa las byung ba ni don la dmigs pa kho na yin te /
translated: The wisdom arisen from meditation focuses on meaning alone.

original: de ni yi ge la mi ltos par don la 'jug go //
analyzed: de ni yi ge la mi ltos par don la 'jug go //
translated: It engages meaning without relying on syllables.

original: dper na stong rkyal legs par ma lobs pa chu'i nang du 'ju bar bya ba mi gtong ba kho na yin la ;
analyzed: dper na stong rkyal legs par ma lobs pa chu'i nang du 'ju bar bya ba mi gtong ba kho na yin la ;
translated: For example, someone who has not fully learned to swim does not let go of the bank.

original: cung zad lo bas pa ni res 'ga' ni gtong res 'ga' ni 'ju bar byed do //
analyzed: cung zad lo bas pa ni res 'ga' ni gtong res 'ga' ni 'ju bar byed do //
translated: Someone who has learned a little sometimes lets go and sometimes holds on.

original: legs par lobs pa ni 'ju par bya ba la mi ltos bar rgal ba lta bu ste 'di ni dpe yin no zhes zer ro zhes grag go //
analyzed: legs par lobs pa ni 'ju par bya ba la mi ltos bar rgal ba lta bu ste 'di ni dpe yin no zhes zer ro zhes grag go //
translated: Someone who has fully learned does not need to hold on, but swims across. This is the example.

original: gzhan dag na re rtog pa 'di la ni ming la dmigs pa gang yin pa de ni thos pa las byung ba yin par 'gyur la /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re rtog pa 'di la ni ming la dmigs pa gang yin pa de ni thos pa las byung ba yin par 'gyur la /
translated: Others say: In this theory, if it focuses on the name, it is derived from hearing.

original: don la dmigs pa gang yin pa de ni bsgom pa las byung ba yin par 'gyur bas bsam pa las byung ba'i shes rab 'grub par mi 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: don la dmigs pa gang yin pa de ni bsgom pa las byung ba yin par 'gyur bas bsam pa las byung ba'i shes rab 'grub par mi 'gyur gyi /
translated: If it focuses on the object, it is derived from meditation. Therefore it is not established as wisdom derived from contemplation.

original: thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab ni yid ches pa'i lung tshad ma nyid las skyes pa'i nges pa yin no //
analyzed: thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab ni yid ches pa'i lung tshad ma nyid las skyes pa'i nges pa yin no //
translated: Wisdom derived from hearing is certainty born from the valid cognition of authoritative scripture.

original: bsam pa las byung ba ni rigs pas nges par brtags pa la skyes pa yin no //
analyzed: bsam pa las byung ba ni rigs pas nges par brtags pa la skyes pa yin no //
translated: Wisdom derived from contemplation is born from logical investigation.🔽Wisdom derived from meditation is born from concentration.

original: bsgom pa las byung ba'i ting nge 'dzin las skyes pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni 'di dag gi mtshan nyid kha na mtho ba med par snang ngo zhes zer ro //
analyzed: bsgom pa las byung ba'i ting nge 'dzin las skyes pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni 'di dag gi mtshan nyid kha na mtho ba med par snang ngo zhes zer ro //
translated: This is the unerring definition of these three.

original: de ltar bsgom pa la rab tu brtson pa de ji ltar na sgom pa rdzogs par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar bsgom pa la rab tu brtson pa de ji ltar na sgom pa rdzogs par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How does one who strives in meditation complete meditation?

original: bsrings gnyis ldan zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: bsrings gnyis ldan zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He possesses the two:

original: gal te 'du 'dzi dang mi dge ba'i rnam par rtog pa thag bsrings pa'i phyir lus dang sems dag gis bsrings pa yin na rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te 'du 'dzi dang mi dge ba'i rnam par rtog pa thag bsrings pa'i phyir lus dang sems dag gis bsrings pa yin na rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is extended by the body and the mind in order to avoid distraction and unwholesome thoughts, then it is complete.

original: 'o na bsrings pa de gnyis su la sla zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na bsrings pa de gnyis su la sla zhe na /
translated: But to whom is it easy to extend the body and the mind?

original: 'dod pa chung ba dang / chog shes pa la sla'i /
analyzed: 'dod pa chung ba dang / chog shes pa la sla'i /
translated: It is easy for one who has few desires and is content.

original: chog mi shes pa dang / 'dod chen can la ma yin no //
analyzed: chog mi shes pa dang / 'dod chen can la ma yin no //
translated: It is not easy for one who is discontented and has great desires.

original: chog mi shes pa 'di ni gang zhig yin no //
analyzed: chog mi shes pa 'di ni gang zhig yin no //
translated: What is discontent?

original: 'dod chen can ni gang zhig yin zhe na /🔽rnyed la yang sred chog mi shes //
analyzed: 'dod chen can ni gang zhig yin zhe na / rnyed la yang sred chog mi shes //
translated: What is having great desires?🔽Discontent is the desire for more than one has.

original: ma rnyed la 'dod 'dod chen can //
analyzed: ma rnyed la 'dod 'dod chen can //
translated: Having great desires is the desire for what one does not have.

original: chos mngon pa pa rnams na re chos gos la sogs pa gya nom pa rnyed pa la yang dang yang du 'dod pa ni chog mi shes pa @8b yin la /
analyzed: chos mngon pa pa rnams na re chos gos la sogs pa gya nom pa rnyed pa la yang dang yang du 'dod pa ni chog mi shes pa @8b yin la /
translated: The Abhidharmikas say: Discontent is the desire to have again and again the fine robes, etc. that one has obtained.

original: ma rnyed pa dag la de 'dod pa ni 'dod chen can yin no zhes zer ro zhes grag go //
analyzed: ma rnyed pa dag la de 'dod pa ni 'dod chen can yin no zhes zer ro zhes grag go //
translated: Having great desires is the desire for what one has not obtained.

original: yang dang yang du 'dod pa de yang ma rnyed pa kho na la yin gyi rnyed pa la ni ma yin pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: yang dang yang du 'dod pa de yang ma rnyed pa kho na la yin gyi rnyed pa la ni ma yin pa ma yin nam /
translated: Is it not the case that the desire for what one does not have is insatiable, but the desire for what one has is not insatiable?

original: 'di gnyis la khyad bar ci zhig yod de 'di ni brjod par bya dgos so //
analyzed: 'di gnyis la khyad bar ci zhig yod de 'di ni brjod par bya dgos so //
translated: What is the difference between these two? This must be explained.

original: 'di ltar ni rung ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar ni rung ste /
translated: This is the correct explanation:

original: gya nom pa ma yin pa dang / mang po ma yin pa rnyed pas yid mi bde ba ni chog mi shes pa yin no //
analyzed: gya nom pa ma yin pa dang / mang po ma yin pa rnyed pas yid mi bde ba ni chog mi shes pa yin no //
translated: Insatiability is the dissatisfaction that results from obtaining what is not excellent or what is not abundant.

original: gya nom pa dang mang po ma rnyed pas 'dod pa ni 'dod chen can yin no //
analyzed: gya nom pa dang mang po ma rnyed pas 'dod pa ni 'dod chen can yin no //
translated: Desire is the desire for what is excellent and abundant that one does not have.🔽The remedies for these two are their opposites.

original: bzlog pa de yi gnyen po dag / chog mi shes pa dang / 'dod chen can las bzlog pa ni de dag gi gnyen po chog shes pa dang / 'dod chen chung ba yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bzlog pa de yi gnyen po dag / chog mi shes pa dang / 'dod chen can las bzlog pa ni de dag gi gnyen po chog shes pa dang / 'dod chen chung ba yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The remedies for insatiability and desire are recognized to be their opposites, namely, satisfaction and fewness of wishes.

original: de gnyis khams gsum gtogs dri med //🔽de'i gnyen po zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: de gnyis khams gsum gtogs dri med // de'i gnyen po zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: These two are associated with the three realms and are also uncontaminated.🔽The remedies for these two are their opposites, namely, satisfaction and fewness of wishes.

original: khams gsum pa dag dang / mi ldan pa dag kyang yin no /
analyzed: khams gsum pa dag dang / mi ldan pa dag kyang yin no /
translated: These two are associated with the three realms and are also uncontaminated.

original: chog mi shes pa dang / 'dod chen can ni 'dod pa na spyod pa dag kho na yin no //
analyzed: chog mi shes pa dang / 'dod chen can ni 'dod pa na spyod pa dag kho na yin no //
translated: The first two are called the one who is not content and the one who has great desires.

original: 'dod chen chung ba dang chog shes pa 'di gnyis kyi rang bzhin ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'dod chen chung ba dang chog shes pa 'di gnyis kyi rang bzhin ci zhe na /
translated: What is the nature of the one who is content and the one who has few desires?

original: ma chags zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: ma chags zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: They are nonattachment.

original: 'di dag ni ma chags pa'i rang bzhin dag yin no //🔽'phags rigs ma chags pa zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: 'di dag ni ma chags pa'i rang bzhin dag yin no // 'phags rigs ma chags pa zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: They are by nature nonattachment.

original: 'di dag las 'phags pa rnams skye bas na 'phags pa'i rigs bzhi ste /
analyzed: 'di dag las 'phags pa rnams skye bas na 'phags pa'i rigs bzhi ste /
translated: The four types of noble persons arise from them.

original: de dag kyang ma chags pa'i rang bzhin no //🔽de dag las gsum ni chog shes bdag nyid do //
analyzed: de dag kyang ma chags pa'i rang bzhin no // de dag las gsum ni chog shes bdag nyid do //
translated: They are by nature nonattachment.🔽Three of them are by nature contentment.

original: dang po gsum po chos gos dang / bsod snyoms dang / mal cha dang stan gyis chog shes pa rnams ni chog shes pa'i rang bzhin dag yin no //
analyzed: dang po gsum po chos gos dang / bsod snyoms dang / mal cha dang stan gyis chog shes pa rnams ni chog shes pa'i rang bzhin dag yin no //
translated: The first three are by nature contentment.

original: 'phags pa'i rigs bzhi pa ni spong ba dang bsgom pa dag la dga' ba nyid yin no ;
analyzed: 'phags pa'i rigs bzhi pa ni spong ba dang bsgom pa dag la dga' ba nyid yin no ;
translated: The fourth is by nature delight in abandonment and meditation.

original: / ji ltar na ma chags pa'i rang bzhin yin zhe na /
analyzed: / ji ltar na ma chags pa'i rang bzhin yin zhe na /
translated: How are they by nature nonattachment?

original: srid pa dang 'dod pa'i 'dod chags la rgyab kyis phyogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: srid pa dang 'dod pa'i 'dod chags la rgyab kyis phyogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they turn their back on existence and attachment to the objects of desire.

original: yang bcom ldan 'das kyis 'phags pa'i rigs bzhis ci zhig bstan ce na /
analyzed: yang bcom ldan 'das kyis 'phags pa'i rigs bzhis ci zhig bstan ce na /
translated: What is the meaning of the four noble lineages?

original: gsum gyis tshul bstan thams cad las //
analyzed: gsum gyis tshul bstan thams cad las //
translated: Three are the noble lineages;🔽the fourth is the noble lineage and the path.

original: chos kyi rje bcom ldan 'das kyis /
analyzed: chos kyi rje bcom ldan 'das kyis /
translated: The Blessed One, the Master of the Teaching,

original: rang gi tshul dang las kyi mtha' yongs su spangs shing thar pa don du gnyer bar khas 'che ba'i slob ma rnams la tshul dang las gnyis bcas te /
analyzed: rang gi tshul dang las kyi mtha' yongs su spangs shing thar pa don du gnyer bar khas 'che ba'i slob ma rnams la tshul dang las gnyis bcas te /
translated: has prescribed two things for his disciples who have rejected the way of the world and have undertaken the quest for liberation:

original: 'phags pa'i rigs gsum gyis ni tshul bcas so //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i rigs gsum gyis ni tshul bcas so //
translated: three noble lineages for the observance of the rules,

original: bzhi pas ni las bcas te /🔽khyed tshul 'dis las 'di byed na ring por @9a * //
analyzed: bzhi pas ni las bcas te / khyed tshul 'dis las 'di byed na ring por @9a * //
translated: and one noble lineage for the performance of actions.

original: mi thogs par thar pa thob par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: mi thogs par thar pa thob par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
translated: He has said: “If you observe the rules and perform actions in this way, you will soon obtain liberation.”

original: ci'i phyir tshul 'di lta bu dang / las 'di lta bu bcas she na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir tshul 'di lta bu dang / las 'di lta bu bcas she na /
translated: Why has the Blessed One prescribed these rules and this action?

original: sred pa skye ba'i gnyen po'i phyir /
analyzed: sred pa skye ba'i gnyen po'i phyir /
translated: In order to counteract the arising of craving.

original: mdo las sred pa skye ba bzhi gsungs te /
analyzed: mdo las sred pa skye ba bzhi gsungs te /
translated: The Sūtra teaches that there are four types of craving that arise:

original: dge slong sred pa skye ba na chos gos kyi phyir dang / bsod snyoms kyi phyir dang ; mal cha dang stan gyi phyir skye'o //
analyzed: dge slong sred pa skye ba na chos gos kyi phyir dang / bsod snyoms kyi phyir dang ; mal cha dang stan gyi phyir skye'o //
translated: When a monk generates craving, he generates it for robes, for alms-food, for bedding and seats.

original: gnas pa na gnas so //
analyzed: gnas pa na gnas so //
translated: When he abides in them, he abides in them.

original: mngon par zhen pa na mngon par zhen to //
analyzed: mngon par zhen pa na mngon par zhen to //
translated: When he clings to them, he clings to them.

original: dge slong sred pa skye ba na 'byung ba dang 'jig pa de lta bu'i phyir skye'o zhes rgyas par gsungs te /
analyzed: dge slong sred pa skye ba na 'byung ba dang 'jig pa de lta bu'i phyir skye'o zhes rgyas par gsungs te /
translated: When a monk generates craving, he generates it for the arising and perishing of such things.

original: de dag gi gnyen por 'phags pa'i rigs bzhi bstan to //
analyzed: de dag gi gnyen por 'phags pa'i rigs bzhi bstan to //
translated: The four noble lineages are taught as their antidotes.

original: bdag gi bdag 'dzin dngos 'dod pa //🔽de yi dus dang gtan zhi phyir //
analyzed: bdag gi bdag 'dzin dngos 'dod pa // de yi dus dang gtan zhi phyir //
translated: The object of clinging to “mine” is🔽the object of clinging to “I.”

original: don de nyid rnam grangs kyis ston pa ste /
analyzed: don de nyid rnam grangs kyis ston pa ste /
translated: The same point is taught by way of synonyms:

original: bdag gir 'dzin pa'i dngos po ni chos gos la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bdag gir 'dzin pa'i dngos po ni chos gos la sogs pa'o //
translated: The object of clinging to “mine” is robes, etc.

original: bdag tu 'dzin pa'i dngos po ni lus so //
analyzed: bdag tu 'dzin pa'i dngos po ni lus so //
translated: The object of clinging to “I” is the body.

original: de dag la 'dod pa ni sred pa'o //
analyzed: de dag la 'dod pa ni sred pa'o //
translated: Craving is the desire for those.

original: de la 'phags pa'i rigs gsum ni bdag gir 'dzin pa'i dngos po 'dod pa de'i dus su zhi bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de la 'phags pa'i rigs gsum ni bdag gir 'dzin pa'i dngos po 'dod pa de'i dus su zhi bar byed pa yin no //
translated: The first three noble lineages are the pacification of the desire for the objects of clinging to “mine” at the time of their occurrence.

original: bzhi pa ni gnyi ga 'dod pa gtan du zhi bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: bzhi pa ni gnyi ga 'dod pa gtan du zhi bar byed pa yin no //
translated: The fourth is the calming of both for a long period of time.

original: ji lta bu'i bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba 'di ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: ji lta bu'i bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba 'di ni bshad zin to //
translated: We have explained how the cultivation of the applications of mindfulness is perfected.

original: de ltar snod du gyur pa de ji ltar na bsgom pa de la 'jug pa yin zhe na /🔽de la 'jug pa mi sdug dang // dbugs rngub 'byung ba dran pa yis //
analyzed: de ltar snod du gyur pa de ji ltar na bsgom pa de la 'jug pa yin zhe na / de la 'jug pa mi sdug dang // dbugs rngub 'byung ba dran pa yis //
translated: How does the person who is a fit vessel enter into the cultivation of the applications of mindfulness?

original: dran pa nyid dran pa yin no //
analyzed: dran pa nyid dran pa yin no //
translated: The person who is a fit vessel enters into the cultivation of the applications of mindfulness by means of the cultivation of the loathsome and the mindfulness of breathing.🔽The cultivation of the loathsome is the meditation on a skeleton, etc.🔽The mindfulness of breathing is the close attention to the in-and-out breathing.

original: gang dag ni mi sdug pas 'jug / gang dag ni dbugs rngub pa dang 'byung ba dran pas 'jug ce na /🔽go rims bzhin du /
analyzed: gang dag ni mi sdug pas 'jug / gang dag ni dbugs rngub pa dang 'byung ba dran pas 'jug ce na / go rims bzhin du /
translated: What is the difference between the two?

original: 'dod chags rnam rtog lhag rnams so //
analyzed: 'dod chags rnam rtog lhag rnams so //
translated: The first is the counter-agent to the first category of craving, craving for sense-pleasures.🔽The second is the counter-agent to the second category of craving, craving for the self to live on, and to the third category of craving, craving for things.🔽The first is the counter-agent to the craving that has as its object the visible forms, sounds, odors, tastes and tangibles.

original: 'di dag la 'dod chags dang rnam par rtog pa lhag pa yod pas /🔽'di dag ni 'dod chags dang rnam par rtog pa lhag pa dag ste /
analyzed: 'di dag la 'dod chags dang rnam par rtog pa lhag pa yod pas / 'di dag ni 'dod chags dang rnam par rtog pa lhag pa dag ste /
translated: The second is the counter-agent to the craving that has as its object the self and things pertaining to the self.🔽The first is the counter-agent to the craving that is active in the realm of desire.

original: gang zhig 'dod chags nye ba dang shin tu spyad pa de ni mi sdug pas 'jug go //
analyzed: gang zhig 'dod chags nye ba dang shin tu spyad pa de ni mi sdug pas 'jug go //
translated: The second is the counter-agent to the craving that is active in the realm of fine-materiality.

original: gang zhig rnam par rtog pa spyad pa de ni dbugs rngub pa dang 'byung ba dran pas 'jug go //
analyzed: gang zhig rnam par rtog pa spyad pa de ni dbugs rngub pa dang 'byung ba dran pas 'jug go //
translated: Those who are given to discursive thought enter into it through mindfulness of breathing.

original: kha cig na re 'di ni sna tshogs la mi dmigs pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa gcod par byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: kha cig na re 'di ni sna tshogs la mi dmigs pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa gcod par byed pa yin gyi /
translated: Some say: This meditation cuts off discursive thought because it does not focus on variety.

original: mi sdug pa ni kha dog dang dbyibs kyi bye brag la dmigs pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa 'dren par byed do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: mi sdug pa ni kha dog dang dbyibs kyi bye brag la dmigs pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa 'dren par byed do zhes zer ro //
translated: But the meditation on the loathsome leads to discursive thought because it focuses on the variety of colors and shapes.

original: gzhan dag na re kha phyir ma bltas pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re kha phyir ma bltas pa'i phyir te /
translated: Others say: Because it does not look outward.

original: mi sdug pa ni mig gi rnam @9b bar shes pa bzhin du kha phyir bltas pa yin te /
analyzed: mi sdug pa ni mig gi rnam @9b bar shes pa bzhin du kha phyir bltas pa yin te /
translated: The meditation on the loathsome looks outward, like visual consciousness,

original: de'i yul la nye bar rtog pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de'i yul la nye bar rtog pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
translated: because it focuses on the object-field of the eye.

original: de la 'dod chags ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: de la 'dod chags ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: There are four types of attachment:

original: kha dog gi 'dod chags dang / dbyibs kyi 'dod chags dang / reg ba'i 'dod chags dang / bsnyen bkur gyi 'dod chags so //
analyzed: kha dog gi 'dod chags dang / dbyibs kyi 'dod chags dang / reg ba'i 'dod chags dang / bsnyen bkur gyi 'dod chags so //
translated: attachment to color, attachment to shape, attachment to contact, attachment to veneration.

original: dang po'i gnyen por ni rnam par bsngos pa la sogs pa la dmigs pa'i mi sdug pa rjod par byed do //
analyzed: dang po'i gnyen por ni rnam par bsngos pa la sogs pa la dmigs pa'i mi sdug pa rjod par byed do //
translated: The antidote to the first is the meditation on the repulsive, focusing on the bloated corpse, etc.

original: gnyis pa'i ni rnam par zos pa dang / rnam par 'thor ba la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa'i ni rnam par zos pa dang / rnam par 'thor ba la dmigs pa'o //
translated: The antidote to the second is the meditation on the repulsive, focusing on the corpse being devoured and scattered.

original: gsum pa'i ni rnam par 'bus gzhigs pa dang / rgyus pas brang breng du sbrel ba'i keng rus la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: gsum pa'i ni rnam par 'bus gzhigs pa dang / rgyus pas brang breng du sbrel ba'i keng rus la dmigs pa'o //
translated: The antidote to the third is the meditation on the repulsive, focusing on the skeleton held together by tendons.

original: bzhi pa'i ni shi ba'i ro g-yo ba med pa la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: bzhi pa'i ni shi ba'i ro g-yo ba med pa la dmigs pa'o //
translated: The antidote to the fourth is the meditation on the repulsive, focusing on the motionless corpse.

original: bye brag med par ni /🔽keng rus chags bcas thams cad la //
analyzed: bye brag med par ni / keng rus chags bcas thams cad la //
translated: In general,🔽all those who are attached to skeletons

original: shis te / rus pa'i keng rus la ni chags pa'i gzhi rnam ba bzhi po 'di dag thams cad med do //
analyzed: shis te / rus pa'i keng rus la ni chags pa'i gzhi rnam ba bzhi po 'di dag thams cad med do //
translated: are not free from the four bases of attachment.

original: mos pa dang nyi tshe ba yid la byed pa yin pa'i phyir mi sdug pas nyon mongs pa spong ba ni ma yin gyi rnam par gnon pa ni yin no //
analyzed: mos pa dang nyi tshe ba yid la byed pa yin pa'i phyir mi sdug pas nyon mongs pa spong ba ni ma yin gyi rnam par gnon pa ni yin no //
translated: The meditation on the repulsive does not eliminate the defilements, but it does suppress them, because it is a limited and voluntary attention.

original: mi sdug ba bsgom pa'i rnal 'byor spyod pa de ni rnam pa gsum du brjod de /
analyzed: mi sdug ba bsgom pa'i rnal 'byor spyod pa de ni rnam pa gsum du brjod de /
translated: The practitioners of the meditation on the repulsive are of three types:

original: las dang po ba dang / yongs su sbyang ba byas pa dang / yid la byed pa rdzogs pa'o //🔽de la rus pa rgya mtsho'i bar du ni //
analyzed: las dang po ba dang / yongs su sbyang ba byas pa dang / yid la byed pa rdzogs pa'o // de la rus pa rgya mtsho'i bar du ni //
translated: 1. the beginner, 2. the one who has done the training, 3. the one who has completed the mental attention.

original: spro zhing sdud pa las dang po //
analyzed: spro zhing sdud pa las dang po //
translated: The beginner is the one who expands and contracts the skeleton up to the ocean.

original: mi sdug pa bsgom par 'dod pa'i rnal 'byor spyod pa ni dang po nyid du rang gi lus kyi yan lag rkang pa'i mthe bo'am /
analyzed: mi sdug pa bsgom par 'dod pa'i rnal 'byor spyod pa ni dang po nyid du rang gi lus kyi yan lag rkang pa'i mthe bo'am /
translated: The yogī who wishes to cultivate the meditation on the ugly, first of all, focuses his mind on a part of his own body, on the toe of the foot,

original: dpral ba'i dbyes sam /
analyzed: dpral ba'i dbyes sam /
translated: on the forehead,

original: yang na de gar dga' bar sems gtod par byed cing /
analyzed: yang na de gar dga' bar sems gtod par byed cing /
translated: or wherever he likes.

original: des der sha myags shing zag par mos pas rim gyis rus pa rnam par spyod bar byed ba na thams cad rus pa'i keng rus su lta zhing /
analyzed: des der sha myags shing zag par mos pas rim gyis rus pa rnam par spyod bar byed ba na thams cad rus pa'i keng rus su lta zhing /
translated: By his imagination of the decay and putrefaction of the flesh, he gradually expands the skeleton, and finally sees the whole body as a skeleton.

original: de bzhin du mos pa bskyed pa'i phyir gnyis ba la mos par byed pa nas gtsug lag khang dang / kun dga'i rab dang / grong dang / zhing dang rim gyis rgya mtsho'i mthas klas pa'i bar gyis gzhi rus pa'i keng rus kyis gang bar mos par byed do //🔽yang sdud pa na sems bsdu ba'i phyir bdag gcig pu kho na la rus pa'i keng rus su mos pa'i bar du sdud de /🔽'di tsam gyis na mi sdug pa yongs su rdzogs pa yin no zhes grag ste /🔽'di ni las dang po pa'i rnal 'byor spyod pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du mos pa bskyed pa'i phyir gnyis ba la mos par byed pa nas gtsug lag khang dang / kun dga'i rab dang / grong dang / zhing dang rim gyis rgya mtsho'i mthas klas pa'i bar gyis gzhi rus pa'i keng rus kyis gang bar mos par byed do // yang sdud pa na sems bsdu ba'i phyir bdag gcig pu kho na la rus pa'i keng rus su mos pa'i bar du sdud de / 'di tsam gyis na mi sdug pa yongs su rdzogs pa yin no zhes grag ste / 'di ni las dang po pa'i rnal 'byor spyod pa yin no //
translated: Likewise, in order to generate conviction, one should first imagine that the earth is filled with skeletons up to the ocean, and then gradually reduce the size of the area, until one imagines that only one's own body is filled with skeletons.🔽Again, in order to collect the mind, one should reduce the size of the area, until one imagines that only one's own body is filled with skeletons.🔽It is said that this much is the completion of the meditation on foulness.🔽This is the practice of a beginner.🔽🔽

original: rkang rus nas ni thod phyed par //🔽btang bas sbyang ba byas par bshad //🔽de @10a * //🔽sems bsdu ba khyad par can du bya ba'i phyir rus pa'i keng rus de las rkang pa'i rus ba rnams bor nas lhag ma yid la byed cing /
analyzed: rkang rus nas ni thod phyed par //🔽btang bas sbyang ba byas par bshad //🔽de @10a * //🔽sems bsdu ba khyad par can du bya ba'i phyir rus pa'i keng rus de las rkang pa'i rus ba rnams bor nas lhag ma yid la byed cing /
translated: Likewise, in order to generate interest, one visualizes the earth filled with skeletons up to the ocean, gradually increasing the visualization from the monastery, the village, the field, the house, the bed, the seat, the body, the head, the neck, the shoulders, the arms, the hands, the fingers, the chest, the belly, the back, the sides, the buttocks, the thighs, the calves, the feet, the bones, the marrow, the flesh, the skin, the hair, the nails, the teeth, the head, the skull, the brain, the eyes, the ears, the nose, the face, the neck, the shoulders, the arms, the hands, the fingers, the chest, the belly, the back, the sides, the buttocks, the thighs, the calves, the feet, the bones, the marrow, the flesh, the skin, the hair, the nails, the teeth, the head, the skull, the brain, the eyes, the ears, the nose, the face, the neck, the shoulders, the arms, the hands, the fingers, the chest, the belly, the back, the sides, the buttocks, the thighs, the calves, the feet, the bones, the marrow, the flesh, the skin, the hair, the nails, the teeth, the head, the skull, the brain, the eyes, the ears, the nose, the face, the neck, the shoulders, the arms, the hands, the fingers, the chest, the belly, the back, the sides, the buttocks, the thighs, the calves, the feet, the bones, the marrow, the flesh, the skin, the hair, the nails, the teeth, the head, the skull, the brain, the eyes, the ears, the nose, the face, the neck, the shoulders, the arms, the hands, the fingers, the chest, the belly, the back, the sides, the buttocks, the thighs, the calves, the feet, the bones, the marrow, the flesh, the skin, the hair, the nails, the teeth, the head, the skull, the brain, the eyes, the ears, the nose, the face, the neck, the shoulders, the arms, the hands, the fingers, the chest, the belly, the back, the sides, the buttocks, the thighs, the calves, the feet, the bones, the marrow, the flesh, the skin, the hair, the nails,

original: de bzhin du thod pa'i byed bor nas thod ba phyed kyi bar yid la byed ba 'di ni yongs su sbyang ba byas pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du thod pa'i byed bor nas thod ba phyed kyi bar yid la byed ba 'di ni yongs su sbyang ba byas pa yin no //
translated: Similarly, when one focuses the mind on the space between the eyebrows, having discarded the half skull, this is complete training.

original: smin ma'i bar du sems 'dzin pas /
analyzed: smin ma'i bar du sems 'dzin pas /
translated: When one focuses the mind on the space between the eyebrows,

original: yid la byed pa rdzogs pa yin /
analyzed: yid la byed pa rdzogs pa yin /
translated: this is complete attention.

original: de thod pa'i phyed kyang bor nas smin ma gnyis kyi bar du sems 'dzin par byed ba 'di ni mi sdug pa yid la byed pa rdzogs pa'i rnal 'byor spyod pa yin no zhes grag go //
analyzed: de thod pa'i phyed kyang bor nas smin ma gnyis kyi bar du sems 'dzin par byed ba 'di ni mi sdug pa yid la byed pa rdzogs pa'i rnal 'byor spyod pa yin no zhes grag go //
translated: When one focuses the mind on the space between the eyebrows, having discarded the half skull, this is the yoga of complete attention to repulsiveness.

original: dmigs pa chung bas chung la dbang chung bas ma yin pas yang mi sdug pa yang yod de zhes bya ba mu bzhi ste /
analyzed: dmigs pa chung bas chung la dbang chung bas ma yin pas yang mi sdug pa yang yod de zhes bya ba mu bzhi ste /
translated: There are four possibilities: There is repulsiveness that is small due to a small focal object, but not small due to a small domain.

original: yid la byed pa sbyang pa byas pa dang / sbyang ba ma byas pa dang / yid la byed pa sbyang ba ma byas pa dang / sbyang ba byas pa dag rang gi lus dang rgya mtsho'i mtha' klas pa la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yid la byed pa sbyang pa byas pa dang / sbyang ba ma byas pa dang / yid la byed pa sbyang ba ma byas pa dang / sbyang ba byas pa dag rang gi lus dang rgya mtsho'i mtha' klas pa la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because one who has trained attention focuses on one’s own body and the ocean shore, while one who has not trained attention focuses on the ocean shore and not one’s own body.

original: yang mi sdug pa 'di'i rang bzhin ci zhig yin /
analyzed: yang mi sdug pa 'di'i rang bzhin ci zhig yin /
translated: What is the intrinsic nature of this meditation on the loathsome?

original: sa ni du zhig yin /
analyzed: sa ni du zhig yin /
translated: On how many stages is it?

original: dmigs pa ni ci zhig yin /
analyzed: dmigs pa ni ci zhig yin /
translated: What is its object?

original: gang du skyed bar byed ce na /
analyzed: gang du skyed bar byed ce na /
translated: Where is it generated?

original: go rims bzhin du /
analyzed: go rims bzhin du /
translated: In order,

original: mi sdug ma chags sa bcu dang / dmigs ba 'dod snang mis skyed do //
analyzed: mi sdug ma chags sa bcu dang / dmigs ba 'dod snang mis skyed do //
translated: the loathsome is the absence of attachment, on ten stages, with the realm of desire as its object, and it is generated by humans.

original: rang bzhin ni ma chags pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin ni ma chags pa'o //
translated: Its intrinsic nature is the absence of attachment.

original: sa ni bcu pa ste /
analyzed: sa ni bcu pa ste /
translated: It exists on ten stages:

original: bsam gtan bzhi nyer bsdogs dang bsam gtan khyad par can dang bcas pa dang / 'dod pa'i khams na yod do //
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi nyer bsdogs dang bsam gtan khyad par can dang bcas pa dang / 'dod pa'i khams na yod do //
translated: the four meditations, the intermediate meditation, the special meditation, and the realm of desire.

original: dmigs pa ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i snang ba yin no //
analyzed: dmigs pa ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i snang ba yin no //
translated: Its object is the visible form of the realm of desire.

original: snang ba zhes bya ba ci zhe na /
analyzed: snang ba zhes bya ba ci zhe na /
translated: What is called visible form?

original: kha dog dang / dbyibs te /
analyzed: kha dog dang / dbyibs te /
translated: Color and shape.

original: de nyid kyi phyir don la dmigs pa zhes bya bar grub bo //🔽mi rnams kyi nang kho nar skyed kyi 'gro ba gzhan du yang ma yin na khams gzhan du lta smos kyang ci dgos /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir don la dmigs pa zhes bya bar grub bo // mi rnams kyi nang kho nar skyed kyi 'gro ba gzhan du yang ma yin na khams gzhan du lta smos kyang ci dgos /
translated: That is why it is established that it has an object.🔽It is generated only among humans, not among the other sentient beings of the other destinies, much less in the other realms.

original: der yang byang gi sgra mi snyan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: der yang byang gi sgra mi snyan du ni ma yin no //
translated: And even among humans, not among the Kurus.

original: mi nyid kyis mi sdug pa'i rnam ba zhes bya bar grub bo /🔽dus gang yin pa de'i dus la dmigs so //
analyzed: mi nyid kyis mi sdug pa'i rnam ba zhes bya bar grub bo / dus gang yin pa de'i dus la dmigs so //
translated: The object of the meditation on the loathsome is a human being, and the aspect is the color of a corpse in decomposition.🔽The meditation on the loathsome is of two types:

original: mi skye ba'i chos can gyi yul ni dus gsum yin no //
analyzed: mi skye ba'i chos can gyi yul ni dus gsum yin no //
translated: 1. the meditation on a part of the body,

original: mos pa yid la byed ba yin pa'i phyir zag ba dang bcas pa yin no //🔽'dris pa dang ma 'dris pa yin pa'i phyir 'dod chags dang bral bas thob ba dang sbyor ba las byung ba yin no //🔽mi sdug pa'i mtshan nyid rab tu dbye ba dang bcas te bshad zin to //
analyzed: mos pa yid la byed ba yin pa'i phyir zag ba dang bcas pa yin no // 'dris pa dang ma 'dris pa yin pa'i phyir 'dod chags dang bral bas thob ba dang sbyor ba las byung ba yin no // mi sdug pa'i mtshan nyid rab tu dbye ba dang bcas te bshad zin to //
translated: 2. the meditation on a whole body.

original: dbugs rngub dbugs 'byung dran pa ni //🔽shes rab sa lnga spyod yul rlung //
analyzed: dbugs rngub dbugs 'byung dran pa ni // shes rab sa lnga spyod yul rlung //
translated: The meditation on a part of the body is the meditation on one of the parts of the body, the head, etc.

original: 'dod rten / dbugs rngub pa ni dbugs rngub pa ste rlung @10b 'jug pa gang yin pa'o //🔽dbugs 'byung ba ni dbugs 'byin pa ste rlung 'byung ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod rten / dbugs rngub pa ni dbugs rngub pa ste rlung @10b 'jug pa gang yin pa'o // dbugs 'byung ba ni dbugs 'byin pa ste rlung 'byung ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: The meditation on a whole body is the meditation on a body similar to one’s own body, or on another body.🔽The meditation on a whole body is of two types:🔽1. the meditation on a real body,

original: de gnyis dran pa ni dbugs rngub pa dang dbugs 'byung ba dran pa ste /
analyzed: de gnyis dran pa ni dbugs rngub pa dang dbugs 'byung ba dran pa ste /
translated: 2. the meditation on an imaginary body.🔽The meditation on a real body is the meditation on a corpse that one sees at a distance or nearby, a corpse with skin, without skin, a complete corpse, an incomplete corpse.🔽The meditation on an imaginary body is the meditation on a corpse similar to the one seen, but which one imagines in a place free of corpses, or on a corpse of a different nature.

original: de ni shes rab kyi rang bzhin yin no //
analyzed: de ni shes rab kyi rang bzhin yin no //
translated: This is the nature of wisdom.

original: dran pa zhes smos pa ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: dran pa zhes smos pa ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi ste /
translated: The four foundations of mindfulness are mentioned,

original: de'i stobs bskyed pas 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i stobs bskyed pas 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the foundations of mindfulness are the roots of the wholesome which are the faculties and the powers.

original: sa lnga po nyer ba sngogs gsum dang / bsam gtan khyad par can dang / 'dod pa'i khams na yod do //
analyzed: sa lnga po nyer ba sngogs gsum dang / bsam gtan khyad par can dang / 'dod pa'i khams na yod do //
translated: They exist in the three preliminary stages of the five stages, in the special meditative absorption, and in the realm of desire.

original: btang snyoms dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: btang snyoms dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are associated with equanimity.

original: bde ba dang sdug bsngal dag ni rnam par rtog pa dang mthun pa'i phyir de'i gnyen po ni de dag dang mtshungs par mi ldan no ;
analyzed: bde ba dang sdug bsngal dag ni rnam par rtog pa dang mthun pa'i phyir de'i gnyen po ni de dag dang mtshungs par mi ldan no ;
translated: Because pleasure and pain are in harmony with discursive thought, their antidote is not associated with them.

original: / bde ba dang yid bde bdag kyang gtod pa la bar chad byed pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: / bde ba dang yid bde bdag kyang gtod pa la bar chad byed pa'i phyir la /
translated: Because pleasure and mental pleasure are obstacles to concentration,

original: de yang gtad pas bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro zhes grag go //
analyzed: de yang gtad pas bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro zhes grag go //
translated: and because concentration is to be accomplished by equanimity.

original: gang dag bsam gtan dngos gzhi dag na yang snyoms par zhugs pa la btang snyoms kyi dbang po yod par 'dod pa de dag gi ltar nas brgyad pa yin no //
analyzed: gang dag bsam gtan dngos gzhi dag na yang snyoms par zhugs pa la btang snyoms kyi dbang po yod par 'dod pa de dag gi ltar nas brgyad pa yin no //
translated: According to those who believe that the faculty of equanimity exists in the fundamental meditations, the fourth meditation is also the support of this mindfulness.

original: yan chad ni dbugs rngub pa dang dbugs 'byung ba'i sa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yan chad ni dbugs rngub pa dang dbugs 'byung ba'i sa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Above the fourth meditation, the stage of inhalation and exhalation is absent.

original: de'i dmigs pa ni rlung yin no //
analyzed: de'i dmigs pa ni rlung yin no //
translated: Its object is wind.

original: 'dod pa'i khams kyi rten can yin no //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams kyi rten can yin no //
translated: It has the realm of desire for its stage.

original: lha dang mi dag gi nang nas skyed do //
analyzed: lha dang mi dag gi nang nas skyed do //
translated: It is produced among humans and among the gods.🔽It is obtained either through preparatory effort or through detachment.🔽It is the application of mindfulness to factors.🔽It is the application of mindfulness to factors.🔽It is the application of mindfulness to factors.

original: sbyor ba las byung ba dang / 'dod chags dang bral bas thob pa yin no //🔽'di ni de kho na yid la byed pa yin no //
analyzed: sbyor ba las byung ba dang / 'dod chags dang bral bas thob pa yin no // 'di ni de kho na yid la byed pa yin no //
translated: It is the application of mindfulness to factors.🔽It is the application of mindfulness to factors.

original: chos 'di pa rnams kho na'i yin gyi /🔽phyi ba'i ma yin no //
analyzed: chos 'di pa rnams kho na'i yin gyi / phyi ba'i ma yin no //
