original: lung med pa'i phyir dang / bdag nyid kyis chos zab mo mngon par mi rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lung med pa'i phyir dang / bdag nyid kyis chos zab mo mngon par mi rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the application of mindfulness to

original: de yang bgrang ba la sogs pa rnam pa drug / de ni bgrang ba dang rjes su 'gro ba dang / 'jog pa dang / nye bar rtogs pa dang / bsgyur ba dang / yongs su dag pa ste /
analyzed: de yang bgrang ba la sogs pa rnam pa drug / de ni bgrang ba dang rjes su 'gro ba dang / 'jog pa dang / nye bar rtogs pa dang / bsgyur ba dang / yongs su dag pa ste /
translated: Counting, etc. are six in number.

original: rgyu drug dang ldan na yongs su rdzogs pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyu drug dang ldan na yongs su rdzogs pa yin no //
translated: It is said that the completion of the meditation on the exhalation and inhalation of the breath is due to six causes: counting, following, fixing, observing, transforming, and purifying.

original: de la bgrang ba zhes bya ba'i dbugs rngub pa dang dbugs 'byung ba dag la sems gtad nas mngon par 'du bya ba med par lus dang sems rnal du gzhag ste dran pa tsam gyis gcig dang gnyis nas bcu'i bar du bgrang bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: de la bgrang ba zhes bya ba'i dbugs rngub pa dang dbugs 'byung ba dag la sems gtad nas mngon par 'du bya ba med par lus dang sems rnal du gzhag ste dran pa tsam gyis gcig dang gnyis nas bcu'i bar du bgrang bar byed pa'o //
translated: Counting is the fixing of the mind on the inhalation and exhalation of the breath, and then, without any mental activity, the settling of the body and mind in their natural state, and the simple counting of the breaths from one to ten, by means of mindfulness.

original: sems mngon par sdud pa dang rnam par g-yeng bar dogs pas ha cang mang ba dang nyung ngur ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sems mngon par sdud pa dang rnam par g-yeng bar dogs pas ha cang mang ba dang nyung ngur ni ma yin no //
translated: One should not count too much or too little, for fear of mental depression or mental excitement.

original: de la skyon ni gsum yod de /
analyzed: de la skyon ni gsum yod de /
translated: There are three faults in counting:

original: gal te gnyis la gcig tu 'dzin nam tshang bar bgrang @11a * //
analyzed: gal te gnyis la gcig tu 'dzin nam tshang bar bgrang @11a * //
translated: if one counts two for one, or one for two, this is the fault of confusion;

original: ba'i skyon no //
analyzed: ba'i skyon no //
translated: if one loses count, this is the fault of distraction;🔽if one counts too much or too little, this is the fault of mental activity.

original: gal te gcig la gnyis su 'dzin na lhag par bgrang ba'i skyon no //🔽gal te dbugs rngub pa la dbugs 'byin par 'dzin tam /
analyzed: gal te gcig la gnyis su 'dzin na lhag par bgrang ba'i skyon no // gal te dbugs rngub pa la dbugs 'byin par 'dzin tam /
translated: If one counts two when there is one, there is the fault of excess.

original: dbugs 'byin pa la dbugs rngub par 'dzin na 'chol bar bgrang ba'i skyon no //
analyzed: dbugs 'byin pa la dbugs rngub par 'dzin na 'chol bar bgrang ba'i skyon no //
translated: If one counts exhalation when there is inhalation, or vice versa, there is the fault of confusion.

original: de las gzhan pa ni yang dag pa'i bgrang ba yin no //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa ni yang dag pa'i bgrang ba yin no //
translated: Counting other than that is correct counting.

original: bar skabs su sems rnam par g-yeng na yang mgo nas ji srid du ting nge 'dzin ma thob kyi bar du bgrang bar bya'o //🔽rjes su 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni 'di dag thag ni ji srid gcig tu 'byung zhing 'jug / ci 'di dag lus thams cad la khyab pa dag cig gam /
analyzed: bar skabs su sems rnam par g-yeng na yang mgo nas ji srid du ting nge 'dzin ma thob kyi bar du bgrang bar bya'o // rjes su 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni 'di dag thag ni ji srid gcig tu 'byung zhing 'jug / ci 'di dag lus thams cad la khyab pa dag cig gam /
translated: If the mind becomes distracted in the middle, one should begin again from the beginning and count until samādhi is attained.

original: phyogs 'ga' zhig na rgyu ba dag yin zhes mngon par 'du bya ba med par dbugs rngub pa dang dbugs 'byung ba'i 'gros kyis rjes su 'gro ba ste /
analyzed: phyogs 'ga' zhig na rgyu ba dag yin zhes mngon par 'du bya ba med par dbugs rngub pa dang dbugs 'byung ba'i 'gros kyis rjes su 'gro ba ste /
translated: Following means following the movement of the inhalation and exhalation of the breath without mental application, thinking, “How far do these go and come? Do they pervade the whole body or do they move in one place?”

original: de 'jug pa na lkog ma dang / snying ga dang / lte ba dang / rked pa dang / brla dang / byin par 'jug pa'i rim gyis rkang pa gnyis kyi bar du rjes su 'gro la /
analyzed: de 'jug pa na lkog ma dang / snying ga dang / lte ba dang / rked pa dang / brla dang / byin par 'jug pa'i rim gyis rkang pa gnyis kyi bar du rjes su 'gro la /
translated: When it enters, it enters through the mouth, heart, navel, waist, thighs, and calves, and it goes to the feet.

original: 'byung ba na mtho gang dang 'dom gang gi bar du 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'byung ba na mtho gang dang 'dom gang gi bar du 'byung ngo //
translated: When it comes out, it comes out from the same places, and it goes up to a distance of one hand-span or one fathom.

original: gzhan dag na re rlung gi dkyil 'khor dang rnam par 'thor byed kyi rlung gi bar du'o zhes zer te /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re rlung gi dkyil 'khor dang rnam par 'thor byed kyi rlung gi bar du'o zhes zer te /
translated: According to others, it goes as far as the wind-disk and the wind that scatters the clouds.

original: 'di ni kho na yid la byed pa yin pa'i phyir rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni kho na yid la byed pa yin pa'i phyir rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: This is not correct, because it is a mental attention that is not in conformity with the Sūtras.

original: 'jog pa zhes bya ba ni nor bu'i thag pa bzhin du sna'i rtse mo nas rkang pa'i mthe bong gi bar du gnas par lta zhing /🔽ci 'di dag phan 'dogs par byed pa zhig gam /🔽gnod par byed pa zhig gam /
analyzed: 'jog pa zhes bya ba ni nor bu'i thag pa bzhin du sna'i rtse mo nas rkang pa'i mthe bong gi bar du gnas par lta zhing / ci 'di dag phan 'dogs par byed pa zhig gam / gnod par byed pa zhig gam /
translated: Fixation is the attention that the wind remains from the tip of the nose to the toes, like a thread of crystal.

original: grang ngam / dro ba dag cig ces rtog pa'o //
analyzed: grang ngam / dro ba dag cig ces rtog pa'o //
translated: One asks oneself: Does this wind do good or harm? Is it cold or hot?

original: nye bar rtog pa ni 'di dag ni rlung 'ba' zhig ma yin gyi 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag dang 'byung ba dag las mngon par grub pa rgyur byas pa'i gzugs dang / de dag la brten pa sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyang yod do zhes phung po lnga la nye bar rtog par byed pa'o //
analyzed: nye bar rtog pa ni 'di dag ni rlung 'ba' zhig ma yin gyi 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag dang 'byung ba dag las mngon par grub pa rgyur byas pa'i gzugs dang / de dag la brten pa sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyang yod do zhes phung po lnga la nye bar rtog par byed pa'o //
translated: Investigation is the investigation of the five aggregates, thinking: “These are not just wind, but also the four great elements and the form derived from the great elements, and also the mind and mental factors that are based on them.”

original: bsgyur ba zhes bya ba ni rlung la dmigs pa'i blo bsgyur te chos kyi mchog gi bar du gong nas gong du dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams la yang dag par sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: bsgyur ba zhes bya ba ni rlung la dmigs pa'i blo bsgyur te chos kyi mchog gi bar du gong nas gong du dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams la yang dag par sbyor ba'o //
translated: Transformation is the transformation of the mind that observes the wind, and the correct application of the roots of virtue, higher and higher, up to the supreme mundane state.

original: yongs su dag pa ni mthong ba'i lam la sogs pa la 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su dag pa ni mthong ba'i lam la sogs pa la 'jug pa'o //
translated: Purification is the entry into the path of seeing and so on.

original: gzhan dag na re bsgyur ba ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa nas rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyi bar yin la /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re bsgyur ba ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa nas rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyi bar yin la /
translated: Others say: Transformation is from the applications of mindfulness up to the vajra-like samadhi.

original: rnam par dag pa ni zad pa shes pa la sogs pa yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: rnam par dag pa ni zad pa shes pa la sogs pa yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Purification is the knowledge of elimination and so on.

original: dbugs rngub dbugs 'byung dran pa ni//
analyzed: dbugs rngub dbugs 'byung dran pa ni//
translated: Mindfulness of inhalation and exhalation

original: @11b bgrang dang rjes 'gro 'jog pa dang // rtog pa dang ni bsgyur ba dang // yang dag rnam ba drug tu 'dod //
analyzed: @11b bgrang dang rjes 'gro 'jog pa dang // rtog pa dang ni bsgyur ba dang // yang dag rnam ba drug tu 'dod //
translated: Counting, following, fixing, observing, modifying, and purifying are the six aspects of mindfulness of breathing.

original: ces bya ba ni bsdu ba'i tshigs su bcad pa yin no //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni bsdu ba'i tshigs su bcad pa yin no //
translated: This is the summary verse.🔽In this regard:

original: de la / dbugs rngub dbugs 'byung gang las lus //
analyzed: de la / dbugs rngub dbugs 'byung gang las lus //
translated: Inhaling and exhaling are bodily

original: 'di gnyis ni lus kyi phyogs gcig yin pa'i phyir lus sa pa gang yin pa de'i sa pa dag yin par rig bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'di gnyis ni lus kyi phyogs gcig yin pa'i phyir lus sa pa gang yin pa de'i sa pa dag yin par rig bar bya'o //
translated: These two are bodily, because they are a part of the body. They should be understood as belonging to the stage of the body.

original: dbugs rngub pa dang dbugs 'byung ba ni gzugs med pa dang / nur nur po la sogs par gyur pa rnams dang / sems med pa dang / bsam gtan bzhi pa la snyoms par zhugs pa rnams la med pa'i phyir lus dang sems khyad par can la brten nas 'jug pa yin te /
analyzed: dbugs rngub pa dang dbugs 'byung ba ni gzugs med pa dang / nur nur po la sogs par gyur pa rnams dang / sems med pa dang / bsam gtan bzhi pa la snyoms par zhugs pa rnams la med pa'i phyir lus dang sems khyad par can la brten nas 'jug pa yin te /
translated: Inhaling and exhaling are based on a special body and mind, because they do not exist for those in the formless realm, for embryos such as kalala, for those without mind, and for those absorbed in the fourth meditation.

original: gal te lus kyang sbubs yod pa yin la dbugs rngub pa dang / dbugs 'byung pa'i sa pa'i sems kyang mngon sum du gyur na de lta na 'jug go //
analyzed: gal te lus kyang sbubs yod pa yin la dbugs rngub pa dang / dbugs 'byung pa'i sa pa'i sems kyang mngon sum du gyur na de lta na 'jug go //
translated: If the body has cavities and the mind of the stage of inhaling and exhaling is present, then they occur.

original: skye ba dang / bsam gtan bzhi pa las ldang ba la ni 'jug la /
analyzed: skye ba dang / bsam gtan bzhi pa las ldang ba la ni 'jug la /
translated: They are included in the realm of mental objects.🔽They are called “in and out” because they are in and out of the body.🔽They are called “breath” because they are the wind that moves in and out.🔽They are called “life” because they are the support of life.🔽They are called “vitality” because they are the support of life.

original: 'chi ba dang / bsam gtan bzhi pa la snyoms par 'jug pa la ni 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'chi ba dang / bsam gtan bzhi pa la snyoms par 'jug pa la ni 'byung ngo //
translated: They are called “in and out” because they are in and out of the body.🔽They are called “breath” because they are the wind that moves in and out.🔽They are called “life” because they are the support of life.🔽They are called “vitality” because they are the support of life.🔽They are called “in and out” because they are in and out of the body.

original: dbugs rngub pa dang dbugs 'byung ba 'di gnyis ni /
analyzed: dbugs rngub pa dang dbugs 'byung ba 'di gnyis ni /
translated: They are called “breath” because they are the wind that moves in and out.

original: sems can zhes bya /
analyzed: sems can zhes bya /
translated: They are called “life” because they are the support of life.

original: sems can du mi bgrang ba dag ni ma yin no //🔽ma zin pa'o //
analyzed: sems can du mi bgrang ba dag ni ma yin no // ma zin pa'o //
translated: They are called “vitality” because they are the support of life.🔽They are called “in and out” because they are in and out of the body.

original: dbang po dang tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang po dang tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are called “breath” because they are the wind that moves in and out.

original: rgyu mthun las byung /
analyzed: rgyu mthun las byung /
translated: They are called “life” because they are the support of life.🔽They are called “vitality” because they are the support of life.🔽They are called “in and out” because they are in and out of the body.🔽They are called “breath” because they are the wind that moves in and out.🔽They are called “life” because they are the support of life.🔽They are called “vitality” because they are the support of life.

original: lus rgyas pas 'grib par 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / chad nas yang nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i phyir rgyas pa las byung ba dang / rnam par smin pa las skyes pa ni ma yin te /🔽rnam par smin pa'i gzugs la ni de lta bu med do //
analyzed: lus rgyas pas 'grib par 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / chad nas yang nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i phyir rgyas pa las byung ba dang / rnam par smin pa las skyes pa ni ma yin te / rnam par smin pa'i gzugs la ni de lta bu med do //
translated: They are called “in and out” because they are in and out of the body.

original: 'og ma yi /
analyzed: 'og ma yi /
translated: They are called “breath” because they are the wind that moves in and out.

original: yid kyis de gnyis mi rtogs so //
analyzed: yid kyis de gnyis mi rtogs so //
translated: They are called “life” because they are the support of life.🔽They are called “vitality” because they are the support of life.🔽They are called “in and out” because they are in and out of the body.

original: de gnyis ni rang gi sa pa dang sa gong ma pa'i sems kyis rtogs kyi /
analyzed: de gnyis ni rang gi sa pa dang sa gong ma pa'i sems kyis rtogs kyi /
translated: They are called “breath” because they are the wind that moves in and out.🔽They are called “life” because they are the support of life.🔽They are called “vitality” because they are the support of life.🔽They are called “in and out” because they are in and out of the body.🔽They are called “breath”

original: 'og ma pa spyod lam pa dang sbrul pa'i sems kyis mi rtogs so //
analyzed: 'og ma pa spyod lam pa dang sbrul pa'i sems kyis mi rtogs so //
translated: The thought of emanation and the thought of deportment of a lower stage do not cognize it.

original: 'jug pa'i sgo gnyis bshad zin to //
analyzed: 'jug pa'i sgo gnyis bshad zin to //
translated: The two doors of entry have been explained.

original: de gnyis kyi ting nge 'dzin thob nas /
analyzed: de gnyis kyi ting nge 'dzin thob nas /
translated: Having obtained concentration through these two,

original: lhag mthong bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir //
analyzed: lhag mthong bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir //
translated: in order to accomplish insight,

original: zhi gnas grub par gyur pa yis //
analyzed: zhi gnas grub par gyur pa yis //
translated: one who has accomplished serenity

original: dran pa nyer gzhag bsgom par bya //
analyzed: dran pa nyer gzhag bsgom par bya //
translated: should cultivate the applications of mindfulness.

original: ji ltar bya zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar bya zhe na /
translated: How does one cultivate them?🔽With regard to the body,

original: lus tshor sems dang chos rnams la //
analyzed: lus tshor sems dang chos rnams la //
translated: feelings, thoughts, and dharmas,

original: mtshan nyid gnyis su yongs brtags pas //
analyzed: mtshan nyid gnyis su yongs brtags pas //
translated: one thoroughly investigates the two kinds of characteristics.

original: lus dang / tshor ba dang / sems dang chos rnams la rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid dag tu yongs su brtags pa ste /
analyzed: lus dang / tshor ba dang / sems dang chos rnams la rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid dag tu yongs su brtags pa ste /
translated: One thoroughly investigates the specific and general characteristics of the body, feelings, mind, and dharmas.

original: de dag gi rang gi mtshan nyid ni rang gi ngo bo'o //
analyzed: de dag gi rang gi mtshan nyid ni rang gi ngo bo'o //
translated: Their specific characteristics are their own natures.

original: spyi'i mtshan nyid ni 'dus byas @12a * //
analyzed: spyi'i mtshan nyid ni 'dus byas @12a * //
translated: The general characteristics are that all conditioned

original: rnams ni mi rtag pa nyid dang / zag pa dang bcas pa rnams sdug bsngal ba nyid dang / chos thams cad stong pa dang / bdag med pa nyid dag go //
analyzed: rnams ni mi rtag pa nyid dang / zag pa dang bcas pa rnams sdug bsngal ba nyid dang / chos thams cad stong pa dang / bdag med pa nyid dag go //
translated: phenomena are impermanent, that all contaminated phenomena are the suffering of contamination, and that all phenomena are empty and selfless.

original: lus kyi rang gi ngo bo ci zhe na /
analyzed: lus kyi rang gi ngo bo ci zhe na /
translated: What is the intrinsic nature of the body?

original: 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa nyid do //
translated: It is the primary elements and the derivative form that arises from them.

original: gsum las gzhan pa dag ni chos so //
analyzed: gsum las gzhan pa dag ni chos so //
translated: The other three are phenomena.

original: mnyam par gzhag pas lus la rdul phra rab dang skad cig mar mthong bas lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa grub pa yin no /
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag pas lus la rdul phra rab dang skad cig mar mthong bas lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa grub pa yin no /
translated: The close placement of mindfulness of the body is established by seeing the body as composed of subtle particles and as momentary through meditative equipoise.

original: zhes grag go //
analyzed: zhes grag go //
translated: This is what is widely accepted.

original: yang dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams kyi rang bzhin ci zhe na /
analyzed: yang dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams kyi rang bzhin ci zhe na /
translated: What is the intrinsic nature of the foundations of mindfulness?

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The foundations of mindfulness are threefold:

original: rang bzhin dang / 'brel pa dang / dmigs pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin dang / 'brel pa dang / dmigs pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'o //
translated: the foundation of mindfulness that is intrinsic nature, the foundation of mindfulness that is related, and the foundation of mindfulness that is the focal object.

original: de la rang bzhin gyi dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ni /
analyzed: de la rang bzhin gyi dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ni /
translated: The foundation of mindfulness that is intrinsic nature

original: shes rab bo //
analyzed: shes rab bo //
translated: is wisdom.

original: shes rab ji lta bu zhig ce na /
analyzed: shes rab ji lta bu zhig ce na /
translated: What kind of wisdom is it?

original: thos sogs las byung ba'o //
analyzed: thos sogs las byung ba'o //
translated: It arises from hearing and so on.

original: thos pa las byung ba dang / bsam pa las byung ba dang / bsgom pa las byung ba'o //
analyzed: thos pa las byung ba dang / bsam pa las byung ba dang / bsgom pa las byung ba'o //
translated: It arises from hearing, contemplation and meditation.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dag kyang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dag kyang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The foundations of mindfulness are also threefold:

original: thos pa dang / bsam pa dang / bsgom pa las byung ba dag go //
analyzed: thos pa dang / bsam pa dang / bsgom pa las byung ba dag go //
translated: The foundations of mindfulness are also threefold: arisen from listening, reflection, and cultivation.

original: gzhan ni 'brel dang dmigs pa las //
analyzed: gzhan ni 'brel dang dmigs pa las //
translated: The others are related to it and have it as their object.

original: gzhan de dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i chos rnams ni 'brel ba'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan de dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i chos rnams ni 'brel ba'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa yin no //
translated: The other factors that coexist with mindfulness are the foundation of mindfulness related to it.

original: de dag gi dmigs pa ni dmigs pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gi dmigs pa ni dmigs pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'o //
translated: The object of these factors is the foundation of mindfulness as object.

original: rang bzhin gyi dran pa nye bar gzhag pa shes rab yin no zhes bya ba 'di ga las she na /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi dran pa nye bar gzhag pa shes rab yin no zhes bya ba 'di ga las she na /
translated: How do you know that the foundation of mindfulness is discernment by nature?

original: lus la lus kyi rjes su lta ba ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'o zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus la lus kyi rjes su lta ba ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'o zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the Sūtra says, “The foundation of mindfulness consisting of contemplation of the body.

original: rjes su lta ba zhes bya ba ci zhe na /
analyzed: rjes su lta ba zhes bya ba ci zhe na /
translated: ” What is meant by “contemplation”?

original: shes rab ste /
analyzed: shes rab ste /
translated: Discernment.

original: des de dang ldan pa rjes su lta bar byed do //
analyzed: des de dang ldan pa rjes su lta bar byed do //
translated: The person who possesses it is said to “contemplate.

original: 'di ltar nang gi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas so zhes kyang gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di ltar nang gi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas so zhes kyang gsungs te /
translated: ” The Sūtra says, “He dwells contemplating the body in the body.

original: 'di la rjes su lta ba ste lta ba yod pas na rjes su lta ba'o //
analyzed: 'di la rjes su lta ba ste lta ba yod pas na rjes su lta ba'o //
translated: ” The person who possesses this contemplation is one who contemplates.

original: lus la rjes su lta ba ni lus kyi rjes su lta ba'o //
analyzed: lus la rjes su lta ba ni lus kyi rjes su lta ba'o //
translated: The contemplation of the body is the contemplation of the body.

original: ci'i phyir shes rab la dran pa nye bar gzhag pa zhes bshad ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir shes rab la dran pa nye bar gzhag pa zhes bshad ce na /
translated: Why is wisdom called the application of mindfulness?

original: bye brag tu smra ba rnams na re dran pa shas che ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba rnams na re dran pa shas che ba'i phyir te /
translated: The Vaibhāṣikas say: because mindfulness predominates in it.

original: shing gshegs pa'i khye'u dag gis 'dzin pa ltar dran pa'i stobs bskyed pas 'jug pa nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go zhes zer ro //
analyzed: shing gshegs pa'i khye'u dag gis 'dzin pa ltar dran pa'i stobs bskyed pas 'jug pa nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go zhes zer ro //
translated: It is called the application of mindfulness because it is engaged through the power of the generation of mindfulness, like a child who is carried by his nurses.

original: 'di ltar ni rung ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar ni rung ste /
translated: This is correct.

original: 'dis dran pa nye bar 'jog pas na dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ni shes rab yin te /
analyzed: 'dis dran pa nye bar 'jog pas na dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ni shes rab yin te /
translated: It is the application of mindfulness because it applies mindfulness through wisdom.

original: ji ltar mthong ba mngon par brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji ltar mthong ba mngon par brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the application of mindfulness because it expresses what is seen.

original: 'di ltar @12b tshe dang ldan pa ma 'gags pas kyang /
analyzed: 'di ltar @12b tshe dang ldan pa ma 'gags pas kyang /
translated: Thus the Venerable Aniruddha said:

original: lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa de'i lus la dmigs pa'i dran pa gnas pa yang dag par gnas zhes rgyas par bshad do //
analyzed: lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa de'i lus la dmigs pa'i dran pa gnas pa yang dag par gnas zhes rgyas par bshad do //
translated: “When one dwells contemplating the body as a body, the mindfulness that is directed to the body is established.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa de'i dran pa nye bar gnas shing kun tu mi rmongs pa yin zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa de'i dran pa nye bar gnas shing kun tu mi rmongs pa yin zhes gsungs so //
translated: The Fortunate One also said: “The monk who dwells observing the body as a body, his memory is well placed, well established.

original: gang las dge slong dag ji ltar na dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams kun 'byung ba dang / nub pa yin zhe na /🔽zas kun 'byung bas ni lus kun 'byung pa yin la /
analyzed: gang las dge slong dag ji ltar na dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams kun 'byung ba dang / nub pa yin zhe na / zas kun 'byung bas ni lus kun 'byung pa yin la /
translated: ” In the Sūtra, it is said: “How, O monks, does the origin and the disappearance of the foundations of mindfulness take place?🔽The origin and the disappearance of the body, etc.

original: zas 'gags pas ni lus nub pa yin no zhes gsungs pa de las ni dmigs pa khon dran pa nye bar gzhag par gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: zas 'gags pas ni lus nub pa yin no zhes gsungs pa de las ni dmigs pa khon dran pa nye bar gzhag par gsungs pa yin te /
translated: ” From this text, it results that the object is the foundation of mindfulness.

original: 'di la dran pa nye bar gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di la dran pa nye bar gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because memory is placed, is established with regard to it.

original: 'di dag gi ming ni dmigs pa ji lta ba bzhin no //
analyzed: 'di dag gi ming ni dmigs pa ji lta ba bzhin no //
translated: The names of the foundations of mindfulness are in accordance with their objects.

original: 'di dag rang dang gzhan dang gnyi ga'i rgyud la dmigs pa'i phyir re re zhing rnam pa gsum gsum yin no //
analyzed: 'di dag rang dang gzhan dang gnyi ga'i rgyud la dmigs pa'i phyir re re zhing rnam pa gsum gsum yin no //
translated: Each one of them is threefold, for they have for their domain the stream of another, one’s own stream, and both.

original: rim ni ji ltar skye ba bzhin ci'i phyir de ltar skye zhe na /
analyzed: rim ni ji ltar skye ba bzhin ci'i phyir de ltar skye zhe na /
translated: Why do they arise in this order? In the order in which they are discerned.

original: bye brag tu smra ba rnams na re /
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba rnams na re /
translated: The Vaibhāṣikas say:

original: sngar rags pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngar rags pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one first sees the gross.

original: yang na 'di ltar 'dod pa la 'dod chags pa'i rten ni lus yin la /
analyzed: yang na 'di ltar 'dod pa la 'dod chags pa'i rten ni lus yin la /
translated: Or else, the body is the basis of attachment to pleasure.

original: de yang tshor ba mngon par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang tshor ba mngon par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And that is because of the desire for sensation.

original: de yang sems ma zhi ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang sems ma zhi ba'i phyir ro //
translated: And that is because of the non-pacification of the mind.

original: de yang nyon mongs pa ma spangs pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro ;🔽/ phyin ci log gi gnyen por bzhi //
analyzed: de yang nyon mongs pa ma spangs pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro ; / phyin ci log gi gnyen por bzhi //
translated: And that is because of the non-abandoning of the defilements.🔽Four foundations of mindfulness are taught as the counter-agents to the four errors.

original: gtsang ba dang bde ba dang rtag pa dang bdag tu phyin ci log rnam pa bzhi'i gnyen por dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi go rims bzhin du bstan te mi mang mi nyung ngo //
analyzed: gtsang ba dang bde ba dang rtag pa dang bdag tu phyin ci log rnam pa bzhi'i gnyen por dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi go rims bzhin du bstan te mi mang mi nyung ngo //
translated: Four foundations of mindfulness are taught in order as the counter-agents to the four errors of purity, pleasure, permanence, and a real self.

original: de dag las gsum ni ma 'dres pa la dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag las gsum ni ma 'dres pa la dmigs pa yin no //
translated: Three of them have as their object the unmixed aggregates.

original: bzhi pa ni gnyi ga yin te /
analyzed: bzhi pa ni gnyi ga yin te /
translated: The fourth has both as its object.

original: gal te chos kho na la lta na ma 'dres pa la dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te chos kho na la lta na ma 'dres pa la dmigs pa yin no //
translated: If it has only the dharmas as its object, then it has the unmixed aggregates as its object.

original: 'on te lus la sogs pa gnyis sam gsum mam bzhi po spyi la lta na 'dres pa la dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on te lus la sogs pa gnyis sam gsum mam bzhi po spyi la lta na 'dres pa la dmigs pa yin no //
translated: If he considers two, three, or four, body, etc., together, then he has a mixed object.

original: de ltar lus la sogs pa la dmigs pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams goms par byas nas ;
analyzed: de ltar lus la sogs pa la dmigs pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams goms par byas nas ;
translated: Having thus practiced the applications of mindfulness with their objects consisting of body, etc.,

original: de ni chos dran nye gzhag pa //
analyzed: de ni chos dran nye gzhag pa //
translated: he then, in the application of mindfulness to the dharmas,

original: spyi la dmigs pa la gnas te //
analyzed: spyi la dmigs pa la gnas te //
translated: he abides in the mixed object.🔽He sees all of them as impermanent, painful,

original: de dag la ni mi rtag dang // sdug bsngal stong bdag med par lta //
analyzed: de dag la ni mi rtag dang // sdug bsngal stong bdag med par lta //
translated: empty, and insubstantial.

original: chos dran pa nye bar gzhag par 'dres pa la dmigs pa la gnas te /
analyzed: chos dran pa nye bar gzhag par 'dres pa la dmigs pa la gnas te /
translated: In the application of mindfulness to the dharmas, he abides in the mixed object.

original: lus la sogs pa de dag thams cad spyir bsdus te /
analyzed: lus la sogs pa de dag thams cad spyir bsdus te /
translated: He includes all of those, body, etc.,

original: mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal @13a * //
analyzed: mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal @13a * //
translated: and sees them as impermanent, painful,

original: ba dang / stong pa dang bdag med pa dang / rnam pa bzhir lta'o //
analyzed: ba dang / stong pa dang bdag med pa dang / rnam pa bzhir lta'o //
translated: empty, and insubstantial.

original: de las dro bar gyur pa 'byung //
analyzed: de las dro bar gyur pa 'byung //
translated: From that, the state of “heat” arises.

original: chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la de ltar goms pa las rim gyis dge ba'i rtsa ba do bar gyur ba zhes bya ba skye'o //
analyzed: chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la de ltar goms pa las rim gyis dge ba'i rtsa ba do bar gyur ba zhes bya ba skye'o //
translated: From the cultivation of the application of mindfulness to the dharmas in this way, the root of the wholesome called “heat” arises in sequence.

original: dro bar gyur pa dang 'dra bas na dro bar gyur pa ste /
analyzed: dro bar gyur pa dang 'dra bas na dro bar gyur pa ste /
translated: It is called heat because it is similar to heat.

original: nyon mongs pa'i bud shing sreg par byed pa 'phags pa'i lam gyi me'i snga ltas yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i bud shing sreg par byed pa 'phags pa'i lam gyi me'i snga ltas yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the sign of the fire of the noble path that burns the kindling of the defilements.

original: de ni bden bzhi spyod yul can //
analyzed: de ni bden bzhi spyod yul can //
translated: It has the four truths for its object.

original: dro bar gyur pa de ni rgyun chags pa yin pa'i phyir bden pa bzhi la dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: dro bar gyur pa de ni rgyun chags pa yin pa'i phyir bden pa bzhi la dmigs pa yin no //
translated: Since it is continuous, heat has the four truths for its object.🔽It has sixteen aspects or modes of activity.

original: rnam pa bcu drug / sdug bsngal la mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang / bdag med pa dang / rnam pa bzhir lta'o //
analyzed: rnam pa bcu drug / sdug bsngal la mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang / bdag med pa dang / rnam pa bzhir lta'o //
translated: It has sixteen aspects or modes of activity: it considers the truth of unsatisfactoriness under four aspects or modes of activity: impermanence, unsatisfactoriness, emptiness, nonself;

original: kun 'byung la rgyu dang / kun 'byung ba dang / rab tu skye ba dang / rkyen dang rnam pa bzhir lta'o //
analyzed: kun 'byung la rgyu dang / kun 'byung ba dang / rab tu skye ba dang / rkyen dang rnam pa bzhir lta'o //
translated: it considers the truth of the origin under four aspects or modes of activity: cause, origin, successive causation, condition;

original: 'gog pa la 'gog pa dang / zhi ba dang / gya nom pa dang / nges par 'byung ba dang rnam pa bzhir lta'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa la 'gog pa dang / zhi ba dang / gya nom pa dang / nges par 'byung ba dang rnam pa bzhir lta'o //
translated: it considers the truth of cessation under four aspects or modes of activity: cessation, calm, excellent, definitive release;🔽it considers the truth of the path under four aspects or modes of activity: path, correctness, achievement, definitive release.

original: lam la lam dang / rigs pa dang / sgrub pa dang / nges par 'byin pa dang rnam pa bzhir lta ste 'di dag gi bye brag ni /🔽'og nas bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: lam la lam dang / rigs pa dang / sgrub pa dang / nges par 'byin pa dang rnam pa bzhir lta ste 'di dag gi bye brag ni / 'og nas bshad par bya'o //
translated: The path is considered from four points of view: path, reason, practice, and definite release.

original: dro ba las /
analyzed: dro ba las /
translated: Their distinctions will be explained later.🔽The summit is like the stage of heat.

original: rtse mo // dro ba chung ngu dang 'phring dang chen po'i rim gyis mngon par 'phel ba las rtse mo dag kyang skye ste /
analyzed: rtse mo // dro ba chung ngu dang 'phring dang chen po'i rim gyis mngon par 'phel ba las rtse mo dag kyang skye ste /
translated: The summit is produced from the increase of the small, medium, and great heat.

original: de yang de dang 'dra /
analyzed: de yang de dang 'dra /
translated: It is like the stage of heat.🔽Just as the stage of heat has the four truths for its object and is of sixteen aspects,

original: ji ltar dro bar gyur pa rnams bden pa bzhi la dmigs pa dang / rnam pa bcu drug yin pa bzhin te /
analyzed: ji ltar dro bar gyur pa rnams bden pa bzhi la dmigs pa dang / rnam pa bcu drug yin pa bzhin te /
translated: so is the summit.

original: ches mchog tu gyur pa'i phyir na ming gzhan du btags so //
analyzed: ches mchog tu gyur pa'i phyir na ming gzhan du btags so //
translated: But it is superior to the stage of heat.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba g-yo ba'i rtse mo yin pa'i phyir rtse mo rnams te /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba g-yo ba'i rtse mo yin pa'i phyir rtse mo rnams te /
translated: The summit is so called because it is the summit of the unstable wholesome roots.

original: de dag las ltung ba'am 'da' bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //🔽gnyi ga chos kyi rnam pa gtod //
analyzed: de dag las ltung ba'am 'da' bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro // gnyi ga chos kyi rnam pa gtod //
translated: One can fall away from it, one can pass beyond it.🔽Both are turned toward the aspects of the truths.

original: dro bar gyur pa dang rtse mo gnyis ka chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pas rnam pa gtod par byed do //
analyzed: dro bar gyur pa dang rtse mo gnyis ka chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pas rnam pa gtod par byed do //
translated: Both the stage of heat and the stage of summit are turned toward the aspects of the truths by the close placement of mindfulness of the factors.

original: rnam pa gtod ces bya ba 'di ci zhe na /
analyzed: rnam pa gtod ces bya ba 'di ci zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of the expression “to set the aspects”?

original: dang po nyid du bden pa rnams la rnam pa dag 'god pa'o //🔽gzhan dag gis kyang 'phel bar byed /
analyzed: dang po nyid du bden pa rnams la rnam pa dag 'god pa'o // gzhan dag gis kyang 'phel bar byed /
translated: It is to set the aspects of the Truths in the first place.🔽The increase of the roots of good by means of the applications of mindfulness.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi char gyis kyang de dag 'phel bar byed do //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi char gyis kyang de dag 'phel bar byed do //
translated: The four applications of mindfulness cause the roots of good to increase.

original: rnam par 'phel bar byed pa na sngon thob pa rnams mngon sum du mi byed de /
analyzed: rnam par 'phel bar byed pa na sngon thob pa rnams mngon sum du mi byed de /
translated: When they increase, one does not actualize the previously acquired roots of good.

original: dga' ba chen po med pa'i phyir ro //🔽de las bzod pa yang skye ste /🔽de chung ngu dang 'breng dang chen po'i rim gyis mngon par 'phel ba dag las yang /

analyzed: gang gi tshe rnam par nyams pa dag gis yang thob pa de'i tshe so sor thar pa'i sdom pa bzhin du sngon med pa dag kho na 'thob kyi sngon btang ba dag ni ma yin te ma 'dris pa dang 'bad de bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'i phyir🔽ro // mtshams ston par byed pa zhig yod na ni gong ma skyed par byed do //

original: med na ni gzhi kho nas skyed par byed do //
analyzed: med na ni gzhi kho nas skyed par byed do //
translated: If not, it is the basis itself that produces the heat.

original: rnam par nyams pa dang yongs su nyams pa 'di dag gi rang bzhin ci zhe na /🔽nyams pa gnyis ni mi ldan pa //
analyzed: rnam par nyams pa dang yongs su nyams pa 'di dag gi rang bzhin ci zhe na / nyams pa gnyis ni mi ldan pa //
translated: What is the nature of the two losses and the two retrogressing?🔽Two losses are nonpossession.

original: nyams pa gnyi g-yang mi ldan pa'i rang bzhin yin la /
analyzed: nyams pa gnyi g-yang mi ldan pa'i rang bzhin yin la /
translated: The two losses are by nature nonpossession asambhava of the possession of the wholesome roots.🔽The retrogressing from the fruit is produced by a transgression; the retrogressing from the acquisition of the fruit is not produced by a transgression.

original: yongs su nyams pa ni nyes pas byas pa yin gyi rnam par nyams pa ni gdon mi za ba yin no //
analyzed: yongs su nyams pa ni nyes pas byas pa yin gyi rnam par nyams pa ni gdon mi za ba yin no //
translated: The retrogressing from the fruit is produced by a transgression; the retrogressing from the acquisition of the fruit is not produced by a transgression.

original: dro bar gyur pa thob pa ni yongs su nyams kyang nges par mya ngan las 'das pa'i chos can yin no //
analyzed: dro bar gyur pa thob pa ni yongs su nyams kyang nges par mya ngan las 'das pa'i chos can yin no //
translated: The person who has obtained heat will certainly obtain nirvāṇa, even if he retrogresses.

original: thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa dang khyad par ci yang ce na /
analyzed: thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa dang khyad par ci yang ce na /
translated: What is the difference between the person who is endowed with the condition for liberation and the person who is endowed with heat?

original: bar chad byed pa med na bden ba mthong ba la ches nye ba nyid yin no //🔽rtse mo thob pa rtsa mi 'chad //
analyzed: bar chad byed pa med na bden ba mthong ba la ches nye ba nyid yin no // rtse mo thob pa rtsa mi 'chad //
translated: The latter is very close to the seeing of the truths, if there is no obstacle.🔽The person who has obtained the summit does not cut off the wholesome roots, even if he retrogresses.🔽The person who has obtained the summit does not cut off the wholesome roots, even if he retrogresses.🔽The person who has obtained the summit does not cut off the wholesome roots, even if he retrogresses.

original: rtse mo thob pa ni yongs su nyams kyang dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams kun tu mi 'chad kyi ngan song du yang 'gro la mtshams med pa dag kyang byed do //
analyzed: rtse mo thob pa ni yongs su nyams kyang dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams kun tu mi 'chad kyi ngan song du yang 'gro la mtshams med pa dag kyang byed do //
translated: The person who has obtained the summit does not cut off the wholesome roots, even if he retrogresses.

original: bzod thob ngan song mi 'gro'o //
analyzed: bzod thob ngan song mi 'gro'o //
translated: One who has obtained patience never goes to the lower realms.

original: bzod pa las ni rnam par nyams kyang ngan song du mi 'gro ste /
analyzed: bzod pa las ni rnam par nyams kyang ngan song du mi 'gro ste /
translated: One who has obtained patience never goes to the lower realms,

original: der 'gro ba'i las dang nyon mongs pa thag bsrings pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: der 'gro ba'i las dang nyon mongs pa thag bsrings pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one has distanced oneself from the karma and afflictions that go there.

original: bzod pa thob pa kho nas 'gro ba dang / skye gnas dang / skye ba dang / lus dang / srid pa dang / nyon mongs pa rnams las kha cig gis mi skye ba'i chos nyid thob ste /
analyzed: bzod pa thob pa kho nas 'gro ba dang / skye gnas dang / skye ba dang / lus dang / srid pa dang / nyon mongs pa rnams las kha cig gis mi skye ba'i chos nyid thob ste /
translated: One who has obtained patience alone obtains the nonarising of certain realms, birth processes, births, bodies, existences, and afflictions.

original: ngan song gi 'gro ba rnams dang / sgo nga las skyes pa dang / drod gsher las skyes pa'i skye gnas dag dang / 'du shes med pa'i sems can dag dang / byang gi sgra mi snyan dang / tshangs pa chen por skye ba rnams dang /
analyzed: ngan song gi 'gro ba rnams dang / sgo nga las skyes pa dang / drod gsher las skyes pa'i skye gnas dag dang / 'du shes med pa'i sems can dag dang / byang gi sgra mi snyan dang / tshangs pa chen por skye ba rnams dang /
translated: Certain realms are the lower realms. Certain birth processes are birth from eggs and birth from heat and moisture. Certain births are birth in the state of nondiscernment and birth in Uttarakuru. Certain bodies are the bodies of Mahābrahma and existence. Certain afflictions are the afflictions of the higher realms.

original: zam dang / ma ning dang mtshan gnyis pa'i lus rnams dang brgyad pa la sogs pa'i srid pa rnams dang / mthong bas spang bar @15b bya ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyi mi skye ba'i chos nyid 'thob bo //
analyzed: zam dang / ma ning dang mtshan gnyis pa'i lus rnams dang brgyad pa la sogs pa'i srid pa rnams dang / mthong bas spang bar @15b bya ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyi mi skye ba'i chos nyid 'thob bo //
translated: the eight existences beginning with the intermediate existence, and the non-arising of the defilements to be abandoned by insight.

original: de dag ni ci rigs par te /
analyzed: de dag ni ci rigs par te /
translated: These are obtained in accordance with the case.

original: chung ngus ni ngan song gi 'gro ba rnams kyi mi skye ba 'thob la /
analyzed: chung ngus ni ngan song gi 'gro ba rnams kyi mi skye ba 'thob la /
translated: By the weak, one obtains the non-arising of the destinies of the unfortunate realms;

original: chen pos ni gzhan dag gi'o //
analyzed: chen pos ni gzhan dag gi'o //
translated: by the medium, the non-arising of the other destinies;🔽by the strong, the non-arising of all destinies.🔽The stages conducive to penetration are of three kinds, because of the difference of lineages of disciples, etc.

original: nyan thos la sogs pa'i rigs tha dad pa'i phyir nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa rnams rigs gsum yin te ;🔽de la / gnyis slob rigs las bzlog nas ni //
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa'i rigs tha dad pa'i phyir nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa rnams rigs gsum yin te ; de la / gnyis slob rigs las bzlog nas ni //
translated: In this regard,

original: sangs rgyas su 'gyur /
analyzed: sangs rgyas su 'gyur /
translated: one who is in training can turn away from the two lineages and become a Buddha.

original: dro bar gyur pa dang / rtse mor skyes pa nyan thos kyi rigs las bzlog nas yang sangs rgyas su 'gyur ba ni srid kyi bzod pa thob pa la ni de lta bu mi srid do //
analyzed: dro bar gyur pa dang / rtse mor skyes pa nyan thos kyi rigs las bzlog nas yang sangs rgyas su 'gyur ba ni srid kyi bzod pa thob pa la ni de lta bu mi srid do //
translated: One who has arisen in the heat and summits can turn away from the lineage of disciples and become a Buddha, but it is not possible for one who has attained the acceptance stage.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: ngan song bzlog pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: ngan song bzlog pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because the unfortunate realms have been turned away from.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni gzhan la phan 'dogs pa'i gzhan gyi dbang gis ngan song du yang 'gro'o zhes grag go //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni gzhan la phan 'dogs pa'i gzhan gyi dbang gis ngan song du yang 'gro'o zhes grag go //
translated: It is well known that bodhisattvas go to the lower rebirths through the power of others, that is, through the power of benefiting others.

original: rigs de nyid bzlog tu mi rung ba'i phyir mi srid do //
analyzed: rigs de nyid bzlog tu mi rung ba'i phyir mi srid do //
translated: But it is impossible that they would go to the lower rebirths through their own karma, because that lineage is irreversible.

original: gzhan gsum yang /
analyzed: gzhan gsum yang /
translated: The other three lineages

original: bzlog nas 'gyur zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: bzlog nas 'gyur zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: can be reversed.

original: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa gsum yang nyan thos kyi rigs las ldog nas sangs rgyas las gzhan par 'gyur te rang sangs rgyas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa gsum yang nyan thos kyi rigs las ldog nas sangs rgyas las gzhan par 'gyur te rang sangs rgyas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The three lineages conducive to penetrations can be reversed from the sravaka lineage and become buddhas, which is to say pratyekabuddhas.

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi rigs rnams ni bzlog par mi nus te /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi rigs rnams ni bzlog par mi nus te /
translated: But it is impossible to reverse the pratyekabuddha lineage.

original: 'di ltar / ston dang bse ru byang chub par //
analyzed: 'di ltar / ston dang bse ru byang chub par //
translated: The teacher and rhinoceroses🔽attain enlightenment in one life,

original: bsam gtan mtha' rten gcig la kun //
analyzed: bsam gtan mtha' rten gcig la kun //
translated: based on the final absorption.

original: ston pa ni sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: ston pa ni sangs rgyas so //
translated: The teacher is the Buddha.

original: bse ru lta bu ni rang sangs rgyas te /
analyzed: bse ru lta bu ni rang sangs rgyas te /
translated: The rhinoceros like pratyekabuddha is the other.

original: de gnyis ni ting nge 'dzin mi g-yo ba dang / gsal ba'i phyir bsam gtan bzhi ba kho na la kha rten te stan gcig kho na la nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa rnams nas bzung ste /
analyzed: de gnyis ni ting nge 'dzin mi g-yo ba dang / gsal ba'i phyir bsam gtan bzhi ba kho na la kha rten te stan gcig kho na la nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa rnams nas bzung ste /
translated: Since those two are unwavering and clear meditative stabilization, they are based on the fourth absorption alone.🔽

original: byang chub kyi bar du skyed par byed do //
analyzed: byang chub kyi bar du skyed par byed do //
translated: Since those two are unshakable concentration and clear concentration, they are based on the fourth absorption alone and generate the factors conducive to penetrative insight and so on up to enlightenment on a single seat.

original: byang chub ni zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa'i ye shes yin no zhes 'og nas bshad par bya'o ;🔽/ gzhan dag na re mi sdug pa nas bzung ste /
analyzed: byang chub ni zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa'i ye shes yin no zhes 'og nas bshad par bya'o ; / gzhan dag na re mi sdug pa nas bzung ste /
translated: Enlightenment is the transcendent wisdom of the knowledge of elimination and nonarising, which will be explained later.

original: byang chub kyi bar du'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: byang chub kyi bar du'o zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say: They generate the factors conducive to penetrative insight and so on up to enlightenment through repulsiveness.

original: gang dag bse ru lta bu las gzhan pa'i rang sangs rgyas yod par 'dod pa de'i rigs rnams ni bzlog par dgag pa med do //
analyzed: gang dag bse ru lta bu las gzhan pa'i rang sangs rgyas yod par 'dod pa de'i rigs rnams ni bzlog par dgag pa med do //
translated: There is no refutation of those who assert that pratyekabuddhas other than rhinoceroslike pratyekabuddhas exist.

original: ci tshe dang po kho na la sbyor ba byas te nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa rnams skyed par byed dam zhe na /
analyzed: ci tshe dang po kho na la sbyor ba byas te nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa rnams skyed par byed dam zhe na /
translated: Do they generate the factors conducive to penetrative insight and so on in their first lifetime alone through preparatory application?

original: de lta bu ni med kyi nges par de'i sngon du thar pa'i cha mthun bskyed par bya dgos so //🔽thams cad pas shin tu /
analyzed: de lta bu ni med kyi nges par de'i sngon du thar pa'i cha mthun bskyed par bya dgos so // thams cad pas shin tu /
translated: But this is not so. One must necessarily generate the root of the wholesome which is conducive to liberation before that.

original: myur ba'i srid pa gsum gyis thar //🔽sa bon 'debs pa dang / 'bru skye ba dang / 'bras bu chags pa bzhin du tshe gcig la ni thar pa'i cha dang @16a * //
analyzed: myur ba'i srid pa gsum gyis thar // sa bon 'debs pa dang / 'bru skye ba dang / 'bras bu chags pa bzhin du tshe gcig la ni thar pa'i cha dang @16a * //
translated: The most rapid is liberated in three existences.

original: mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba skyed par byed do //
analyzed: mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba skyed par byed do //
translated: Just as there is the planting of the seed, the growth of the sprout and the appearance of the fruit, in the same way, in one existence one plants the root of the wholesome which is conducive to liberation.

original: gnyis pa la ni nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa rnams skyed par byed do //
analyzed: gnyis pa la ni nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa rnams skyed par byed do //
translated: In the second, one produces the factors conducive to insight.

original: gsum pa la ni 'phags pa'i lam skyed par byed de /
analyzed: gsum pa la ni 'phags pa'i lam skyed par byed de /
translated: In the third, one produces the noble path.

original: chos nyid 'di la ni rgyud rim gyis 'jug pa dang / yongs su smin pa dang / rnam par grol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos nyid 'di la ni rgyud rim gyis 'jug pa dang / yongs su smin pa dang / rnam par grol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In this reality, the stream enters gradually, matures and is liberated.

original: thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa de yang thos bsam las byung ba yin par brjod de /
analyzed: thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa de yang thos bsam las byung ba yin par brjod de /
translated: This root of the wholesome which is conducive to liberation is said to be derived from hearing and reflection,

original: bsgom pa las byung ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bsgom pa las byung ba ni ma yin no //
translated: but not from meditative development.

original: las du dag cig ce na /
analyzed: las du dag cig ce na /
translated: How many actions are there?

original: las gsum mo //
analyzed: las gsum mo //
translated: There are three actions.

original: gtso bor ni yid kyi las yin no //
analyzed: gtso bor ni yid kyi las yin no //
translated: The mental action is the principal factor.

original: de'i smon lam gyis yongs su bzung ba'i phyir lus dang ngag gi las kyang thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i smon lam gyis yongs su bzung ba'i phyir lus dang ngag gi las kyang thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa yin te /
translated: But the bodily and vocal actions are also conducive to liberation, because they are embraced by the aspiration for liberation.

original: la la zhig gis zas 'ga' tsam byin nas sam bslab pa 'ga' tsam yang mnos nas thar pa 'dod pa'i stobs bskyed pas thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i 'phen par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: la la zhig gis zas 'ga' tsam byin nas sam bslab pa 'ga' tsam yang mnos nas thar pa 'dod pa'i stobs bskyed pas thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i 'phen par 'gyur ro //
translated: When someone gives a little food or observes a little morality, if he generates the power of the aspiration for liberation, he projects the conducive to liberation.

original: de yang / mi yi nang nas 'phen par byed //🔽mi rnams kyi nang kho na dang / gling gsum nas 'phen gyi gzhan nas ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang / mi yi nang nas 'phen par byed // mi rnams kyi nang kho na dang / gling gsum nas 'phen gyi gzhan nas ni ma yin te /
translated: It is projected among humans.

original: ci rigs par shes rab dang skyo ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ci rigs par shes rab dang skyo ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is projected among humans alone, and in the three continents, because there is no distinction of sex, and because there is no distinction of faculties.🔽It is projected in the three continents, because there is no distinction of sex, and because there is no distinction of faculties.

original: thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa zhar las 'ongs pa bshad zin to //
analyzed: thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa zhar las 'ongs pa bshad zin to //
translated: The discussion of the conducive to liberation has been concluded.

original: mngon par rtogs pa'i rim ba bshad par brtsams pa de la chos kyi mchog gi bar rnams ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa'i rim ba bshad par brtsams pa de la chos kyi mchog gi bar rnams ni bshad zin to //
translated: The stages of clear knowledge have been begun. The supreme factors have been explained.

original: lhag ma brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: lhag ma brjod par bya ste /
translated: The remaining factors will be explained.

original: de'i phyir / 'jig rten pa yi chos mchog las //
analyzed: de'i phyir / 'jig rten pa yi chos mchog las //
translated: from the supreme mundane state,

original: chos kyi bzod pa zag pa med //
analyzed: chos kyi bzod pa zag pa med //
translated: the receptivity to the cognition of the dharma is uncontaminated.

original: ces bya ba 'di smos te /
analyzed: ces bya ba 'di smos te /
translated: This is stated.

original: 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog gi mjug thogs su chos shes pa'i bzod pa zag pa med pa skye'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog gi mjug thogs su chos shes pa'i bzod pa zag pa med pa skye'o //
translated: Immediately after the supreme mundane state, the receptivity to the cognition of the dharma that is uncontaminated arises.

original: dmigs pa gang la zhe na /🔽'dod sdug bsngal la /
analyzed: dmigs pa gang la zhe na / 'dod sdug bsngal la /
translated: What is its object?🔽It is the suffering of the desire realm.

original: de'i dmigs pa ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sdug bsngal yin te /
analyzed: de'i dmigs pa ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sdug bsngal yin te /
translated: Its object is the suffering of the desire realm.

original: de ni sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the receptivity to the cognition of the dharma with regard to suffering.

original: zag pa med pa nyid yin par shes par bya ba'i phyir rgyu mthun pas bye brag tu byas te /
analyzed: zag pa med pa nyid yin par shes par bya ba'i phyir rgyu mthun pas bye brag tu byas te /
translated: In order to understand that it is uncontaminated, it is distinguished by its natural outcome.

original: chos shes pa'i phyir bzod pa ni chos shes pa'i bzod pa ste me tog dang 'bras bu'i shing bzhin no //
analyzed: chos shes pa'i phyir bzod pa ni chos shes pa'i bzod pa ste me tog dang 'bras bu'i shing bzhin no //
translated: The receptivity to the cognition of the dharma is the receptivity to the cognition of the dharma, like a tree with flowers and fruit.

original: de nyid nges par 'jug pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de nyid nges par 'jug pa zhes bya ste /
translated: That itself is called definite entry,

original: yang dag pa nyid du nges par zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dag pa nyid du nges par zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it definitely enters reality.

original: yang dag pa nyid ni mdo las mya ngan las 'das pa yin par bshad do //🔽der nges pa ni nges pa ste gcig tu gyur pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa nyid ni mdo las mya ngan las 'das pa yin par bshad do // der nges pa ni nges pa ste gcig tu gyur pa'o //
translated: Nirvāṇa is the truth of cessation, because it is the cessation of all unsatisfactoriness.🔽The truth of the path is the correct method, because it is the correct method for attaining nirvāṇa.🔽Nirvāṇa is the truth of cessation, because it is the cessation of all unsatisfactoriness.

original: der 'jug pa ni mngon @16b par 'gro ba ste /🔽de skyes na 'phags pa'i gang zag ces bya'o //
analyzed: der 'jug pa ni mngon @16b par 'gro ba ste / de skyes na 'phags pa'i gang zag ces bya'o //
translated: The truth of the path is the correct method, because it is the correct method for attaining nirvāṇa.

original: ma 'ongs pas ni so so'i skye bo nyid zlog par byed do //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pas ni so so'i skye bo nyid zlog par byed do //
translated: Nirvāṇa is the truth of cessation, because it is the cessation of all unsatisfactoriness.🔽The truth of the path is the correct method, because it is the correct method for attaining nirvāṇa.

original: ma 'ongs pa de'i bya ba ni de kho na yin par khas len gyi gzhan ni ma yin te /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa de'i bya ba ni de kho na yin par khas len gyi gzhan ni ma yin te /
translated: Nirvāṇa is the truth of cessation, because it is the cessation of all unsatisfactoriness.

original: mar me dang skye ba bzhin no //🔽gzhan dag na re 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog rnams kyis bzlog go zhes zer ro //
analyzed: mar me dang skye ba bzhin no // gzhan dag na re 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog rnams kyis bzlog go zhes zer ro //
translated: The truth of the path is the correct method, because it is the correct method for attaining nirvāṇa.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: Nirvāṇa is the truth of cessation, because it is the cessation of all unsatisfactoriness.

original: de'i chos yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i chos yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The truth of the path is the correct method, because it is the correct method for attaining nirvāṇa.

original: de dang 'gal ba yin pa'i phyir nyes pa med de /
analyzed: de dang 'gal ba yin pa'i phyir nyes pa med de /
translated: Nirvāṇa is the truth of cessation, because it is the cessation of all unsatisfactoriness.🔽The truth of the path is the correct method, because it is the correct method for attaining nirvāṇa.🔽Nirvāṇa is the truth of cessation, because it is the cessation of all unsatisfactoriness.🔽The truth of the path is the correct method, because it is the correct method for attaining nirvāṇa.🔽Nirvāṇa is the truth of cessation, because it is the cessation of all unsatisfactoriness.🔽The truth of the path is the correct method, because it is the correct method for attaining nirvāṇa.🔽Nirvāṇa is the truth of cessation, because it is the cessation of all unsatisfactoriness.

original: dgra bo'i phrag pa la zhon nas de la 'tshog pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dgra bo'i phrag pa la zhon nas de la 'tshog pa bzhin no //
translated: The truth of the path is the correct method, because it is the correct method for attaining nirvāṇa.

original: gzhan dag na re gnyi gas bzlog ste /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re gnyi gas bzlog ste /
translated: Nirvāṇa is the truth of cessation, because it is the cessation of all unsatisfactoriness.🔽The truth of the path is the correct method, because it is the correct method for attaining nirvāṇa.🔽Nirvāṇa is the truth of cessation, because it is the cessation of all unsatisfactoriness.🔽The truth of the path is the correct method, because

original: bar chad med pa dang rnam par grol ba'i lam dang chos mthun pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: bar chad med pa dang rnam par grol ba'i lam dang chos mthun pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
translated: Because they are similar to the uninterrupted and liberated paths.

original: de nas ni de nyid la chos she na /
analyzed: de nas ni de nyid la chos she na /
translated: Then, what is Dharma knowledge?

original: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'i mjug thogs su 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sdug bsngal ba de kho na la chos shes pa skye ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'i mjug thogs su 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sdug bsngal ba de kho na la chos shes pa skye ste /
translated: Subsequently, Dharma knowledge of the truth of suffering arises in relation to the suffering of the desire realm that was previously realized by perseverance for Dharma knowledge of the truth of suffering.

original: de ni sdug bsngal la chos shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni sdug bsngal la chos shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called Dharma knowledge of the truth of suffering.

original: thams cad du yang zag pa med pa'i gnas skabs yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: thams cad du yang zag pa med pa'i gnas skabs yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that all of these are states of uncontaminated states.

original: ji ltar 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang chos shes pa skye ba de bzhin du /🔽sdug bsngal lhag la rjes bzod shes //
analyzed: ji ltar 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang chos shes pa skye ba de bzhin du / sdug bsngal lhag la rjes bzod shes //
translated: Just as perseverance for Dharma knowledge of the truth of suffering and Dharma knowledge of the truth of suffering arise in relation to the suffering of the desire realm, so too:🔽Subsequently, perseverance for subsequent knowledge and subsequent knowledge arise in relation to the remaining truths.

original: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i mjug thogs su gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa spyi la dmigs pa skye ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i mjug thogs su gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa spyi la dmigs pa skye ste /
translated: Subsequently, perseverance for subsequent knowledge of the truth of suffering and subsequent knowledge of the truth of suffering arise in relation to the remaining two higher realms.

original: de ni sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called acquiescence in subsequent knowledge with regard to unsatisfactoriness.

original: de nas ni rjes su shes pa skye ste /
analyzed: de nas ni rjes su shes pa skye ste /
translated: Then subsequent knowledge arises.

original: de ni sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called subsequent knowledge with regard to unsatisfactoriness.

original: dang po nyid du chos kyi de kho na nyid shes pa'i phyir chos shes pa yin no //
analyzed: dang po nyid du chos kyi de kho na nyid shes pa'i phyir chos shes pa yin no //
translated: It is knowledge of the doctrine because it is the first knowledge of the suchness of the doctrine.

original: de'i rgyu las byung ba'i phyir gong ma'i sdug bsngal la sogs pa la dmigs pa ni rjes su shes pa ste /
analyzed: de'i rgyu las byung ba'i phyir gong ma'i sdug bsngal la sogs pa la dmigs pa ni rjes su shes pa ste /
translated: Subsequent knowledge is that which has unsatisfactoriness, etc., of the higher realms as its object, because it arises from the cause of that knowledge of the doctrine.

original: de bzhin du rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is subsequent knowledge because it is knowledge that is similar to that.

original: ji ltar sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la bzod pa dang shes pa bzhi po de dag skye ba ltar /
analyzed: ji ltar sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la bzod pa dang shes pa bzhi po de dag skye ba ltar /
translated: Just as these four, acquiescence and knowledge, arise with regard to the truth of unsatisfactoriness,

original: bden pa gsum la de bzhin no //
analyzed: bden pa gsum la de bzhin no //
translated: so too with regard to the other three truths.

original: sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa'i mjug thogs su 'dod pa ni spyod pa'i kun 'byung la chos shes pa'i bzod pa skye zhing /
analyzed: sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa'i mjug thogs su 'dod pa ni spyod pa'i kun 'byung la chos shes pa'i bzod pa skye zhing /
translated: Immediately after subsequent knowledge of the truth of unsatisfactoriness, acquiescence in the knowledge of the doctrine with regard to the origin of the desire realm arises.

original: de nas kun 'byung la chos shes pa skye la /
analyzed: de nas kun 'byung la chos shes pa skye la /
translated: Then the knowledge of the doctrine with regard to the origin arises.

original: de bzhin du mjug thogs su skye ba'i rim gyis kun 'byung lhag ma la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa dang / kun 'byung la rjes su shes pa skye'o //🔽'dod pa @17a * //🔽na spyod pa'i sdug bsngal 'gog pa la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang / 'gog pa la chos shes pa skye'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du mjug thogs su skye ba'i rim gyis kun 'byung lhag ma la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa dang / kun 'byung la rjes su shes pa skye'o // 'dod pa @17a * // na spyod pa'i sdug bsngal 'gog pa la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang / 'gog pa la chos shes pa skye'o //
translated: In the same way, the subsequent moments arise in the order of the truths: subsequent patience with regard to the truth of origin, knowledge of the truth of origin,

original: 'gog pa lhag ma rnams la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa dang / 'gog pa la rjes su shes pa skye'o //🔽'dod pa na spyod pa'i sdug bsngal gyi gnyen po lam la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang / lam la chos shes pa skye'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa lhag ma rnams la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa dang / 'gog pa la rjes su shes pa skye'o // 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sdug bsngal gyi gnyen po lam la chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang / lam la chos shes pa skye'o //
translated: subsequent patience with regard to the truth of cessation, knowledge of the truth of cessation,

original: lam lhag ma rnams la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa dang / lam la rjes su shes pa skye ste /
analyzed: lam lhag ma rnams la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa dang / lam la rjes su shes pa skye ste /
translated: subsequent patience with regard to the truth of the path, knowledge of the truth of the path.

original: de ltar bden pa mngon rtogs 'di //
analyzed: de ltar bden pa mngon rtogs 'di //
translated: Thus, the clear knowledge of the truths

original: sems bcu drug go //
analyzed: sems bcu drug go //
translated: is sixteen thought-moments.

original: de ltar na rim pa 'dis na bden pa mngon par rtogs pa 'di ni sems bcu drug yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na rim pa 'dis na bden pa mngon par rtogs pa 'di ni sems bcu drug yin no //
translated: In this way, the clear knowledge of the truths is sixteen thought-moments.

original: sde ba gzhan gang dag bden pa rnams mngon par rtogs pa 'di ni gcig go zhes brjod pa de dag gi bsam pa ltar bya ste /
analyzed: sde ba gzhan gang dag bden pa rnams mngon par rtogs pa 'di ni gcig go zhes brjod pa de dag gi bsam pa ltar bya ste /
translated: The other schools say that the realization of the truths is one.

original: bye brag med par ni mngon par rtogs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bye brag med par ni mngon par rtogs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: But it should be understood according to the Vaibhāṣika system.

original: de ni rnam gsum ste /
analyzed: de ni rnam gsum ste /
translated: It is threefold:

original: mthong dmigs bya ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mthong dmigs bya ba zhes bya'o //
translated: seeing, object, and action.

original: mthong ba'i mngon par rtogs pa ni zag pa med pa'i shes rab kyi bden pa rnams mngon par rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: mthong ba'i mngon par rtogs pa ni zag pa med pa'i shes rab kyi bden pa rnams mngon par rtogs pa'o //
translated: The realization of seeing is the realization of the truths by uncontaminated wisdom.

original: dmigs pa'i mngon par rtogs pa ni de dang mtshungs par ldan pa rnams kyis kyang mngon par rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i mngon par rtogs pa ni de dang mtshungs par ldan pa rnams kyis kyang mngon par rtogs pa'o //
translated: The realization of the object is the realization of the truths by those concomitant with that wisdom.

original: bya ba'i mngon par rtogs pa ni ldan pa ma yin pa tshul khrims dang skye ba la sogs pas kyang mngon par rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: bya ba'i mngon par rtogs pa ni ldan pa ma yin pa tshul khrims dang skye ba la sogs pas kyang mngon par rtogs pa'o //
translated: The realization of action is the realization of the truths by those not concomitant with that wisdom, such as ethics, birth and so on.

original: sdug bsngal mthong na de'i mngon par rtogs pa ni gsum mo //
analyzed: sdug bsngal mthong na de'i mngon par rtogs pa ni gsum mo //
translated: When suffering is seen, there are three realizations.

original: kun 'byung la sogs pa ni bya ba'i mngon par rtogs pa yin te /
analyzed: kun 'byung la sogs pa ni bya ba'i mngon par rtogs pa yin te /
translated: The realizations of origin and so on are the realization of action.

original: spong ba dang mngon gsum du byed pa dang sgom pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spong ba dang mngon gsum du byed pa dang sgom pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one abandons, manifests and cultivates them.

original: de lta bas na gal te bden pa rnams mthong ba'i mngon par rtogs pa'i mngon par rtogs pa gcig go zhes smra ni rnam pa tha dad pa'i phyir mi rigs par smra ba yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na gal te bden pa rnams mthong ba'i mngon par rtogs pa'i mngon par rtogs pa gcig go zhes smra ni rnam pa tha dad pa'i phyir mi rigs par smra ba yin no //
translated: Thus, if one maintains that the realization of the truths is a single realization, that is illogical, because the aspects are different.

original: 'on te thams cad bdag med pa'i rnam par mthong ngo zhes zer na ni /
analyzed: 'on te thams cad bdag med pa'i rnam par mthong ngo zhes zer na ni /
translated: But if one maintains that one sees all the truths in the aspect of selflessness,

original: 'o na ni bden pa rnams la sdug bsngal la sogs par mthong bar mi 'gyur bas de lta bas na /
analyzed: 'o na ni bden pa rnams la sdug bsngal la sogs par mthong bar mi 'gyur bas de lta bas na /
translated: then one would not see the truths as suffering and so on.🔽Therefore, it contradicts the sutra that states:

original: 'phags pa nyan thos sdug bsngal la sdug bsngal du yid la byed pa'am /
analyzed: 'phags pa nyan thos sdug bsngal la sdug bsngal du yid la byed pa'am /
translated: The noble disciple attends to suffering as suffering,

original: kun 'byung la kun 'byung du yid la byed pa'am /
analyzed: kun 'byung la kun 'byung du yid la byed pa'am /
translated: attends to the origin as the origin,

original: lam la lam gyi bar du yid la byed pa'i zag pa med pa'i yid la byed pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i chos rnams rnam par 'byed pa gang yin pa @17b zhes gsungs pa'i mdo dang 'gal lo //
analyzed: lam la lam gyi bar du yid la byed pa'i zag pa med pa'i yid la byed pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i chos rnams rnam par 'byed pa gang yin pa @17b zhes gsungs pa'i mdo dang 'gal lo //
translated: attends to the path as the path, and discerns those dharmas associated with uncontaminated attention.

original: gal te de lta bu ni bsgom pa'i lam ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de lta bu ni bsgom pa'i lam ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that this is not the path of cultivation,

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: then it is not so,

original: ji ltar mthong ba bzhin bsgom pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji ltar mthong ba bzhin bsgom pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one cultivates in accordance with what one has seen.

original: 'on te gcig mthong bas lhag ma rnams lnga dbang thob pa'i phyir mngon par rtogs pa gcig kho na zhes zer na ni nyes pa med de bar skabs su ldan pa yod dam med ces dpyad par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'on te gcig mthong bas lhag ma rnams lnga dbang thob pa'i phyir mngon par rtogs pa gcig kho na zhes zer na ni nyes pa med de bar skabs su ldan pa yod dam med ces dpyad par bya ba yin no //
translated: But if you say that there is only one clear realization because one obtains mastery over the rest of the truths by seeing one of them, there is no fault, because it must be investigated whether or not one possesses the others in the interim.

original: 'on te sdug bsngal kho na yongs su shes na kun 'byung yang spongs la 'gog pa yang mngon sum du byed cing lam yang sgom par byed pas de'i phyir mngon par rtogs pa gcig go zhes zer na de lta na yang nyes pa med de ;
analyzed: 'on te sdug bsngal kho na yongs su shes na kun 'byung yang spongs la 'gog pa yang mngon sum du byed cing lam yang sgom par byed pas de'i phyir mngon par rtogs pa gcig go zhes zer na de lta na yang nyes pa med de ;
translated: But if you say that there is only one clear realization because when one fully understands just suffering, one abandons origination, manifests cessation, and cultivates the path, then there is no fault,

original: gcig mthong na lhag ma rnams kyang bya ba'i mngon par rtogs pa yin no zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig mthong na lhag ma rnams kyang bya ba'i mngon par rtogs pa yin no zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is said that when one sees one truth, one has the clear realization of the others.

original: mdo las mthong ba'i mngon par rtogs pa'i phyir bden pa rnams rim gyis mngon par rtogs par gsungs par mngon te /
analyzed: mdo las mthong ba'i mngon par rtogs pa'i phyir bden pa rnams rim gyis mngon par rtogs par gsungs par mngon te /
translated: The truths are realized serially because they are realized through insight.

original: khyim bdag bden pa rnams mngon par rtogs pa gcig pa ni med pa nyid de /
analyzed: khyim bdag bden pa rnams mngon par rtogs pa gcig pa ni med pa nyid de /
translated: The householder, there is no single realization of the truths.🔽However, they are realized serially.

original: 'on kyang mthar gyis mngon par rtogs so zhes rgyas par gsungs pa dpe dang bcas pa'i mdo gsum khungs su yod do //
analyzed: 'on kyang mthar gyis mngon par rtogs so zhes rgyas par gsungs pa dpe dang bcas pa'i mdo gsum khungs su yod do //
translated: This is stated extensively with an example.

original: gal te mdo las /
analyzed: gal te mdo las /
translated: If you say that the sutra that states:🔽One who is without doubt and uncertainty with regard to suffering is also without doubt and uncertainty with regard to the Buddha,

original: gang zhig sdug bsngal la ne ma nur med cing the tshom med pa de ni sangs rgyas la yang zhes gsungs pas mngon bar rtogs pa gcig go zhes zer na /
analyzed: gang zhig sdug bsngal la ne ma nur med cing the tshom med pa de ni sangs rgyas la yang zhes gsungs pas mngon bar rtogs pa gcig go zhes zer na /
translated: proves that there is a single realization,

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: that is not so,

original: kun du mi 'byung ba dang / gdon mi za bar spong ba las dgongs te gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun du mi 'byung ba dang / gdon mi za bar spong ba las dgongs te gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is stated from the perspective of not being active and definitely abandoning doubt.

original: mngon par rtogs pa sems bcu drug par bshad pa gang yin pa de ni chos mchog dang sa gcig / chos kyi mchog sa gang yin ba sems bcu drug po 'di dag kyang de'i sa pa ste /
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa sems bcu drug par bshad pa gang yin pa de ni chos mchog dang sa gcig / chos kyi mchog sa gang yin ba sems bcu drug po 'di dag kyang de'i sa pa ste /
translated: The supreme mundane state and these sixteen thoughts are of the same level.

original: de dag ni sa drug pa'o zhes sngar bshad zin to //
analyzed: de dag ni sa drug pa'o zhes sngar bshad zin to //
translated: They are of six levels, as previously explained.

original: ci'i phyir gdon mi za bar bzod pa dag dang / shes pa dag yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir gdon mi za bar bzod pa dag dang / shes pa dag yin zhe na /
translated: Why are they definitely acceptances and knowledges?🔽Acceptances and knowledges

original: bzod dang shes pa go rims bzhin //
analyzed: bzod dang shes pa go rims bzhin //
translated: are, respectively,

original: bar chad med dang rnam grol lam //
analyzed: bar chad med dang rnam grol lam //
translated: the uninterrupted and liberated paths.

original: bzod pa rnams ni nyon mongs pa'i thob pa rnam par gcod pa la bar chad bya bar mi nus pa'i phyir bar chad med pa'i lam dag yin no //
analyzed: bzod pa rnams ni nyon mongs pa'i thob pa rnam par gcod pa la bar chad bya bar mi nus pa'i phyir bar chad med pa'i lam dag yin no //
translated: Acceptances are uninterrupted paths because they cannot be obstructed from eliminating the obtainment of affliction.

original: shes pa rnams ni nyon mongs pa'i thob pa las rnam par grol ba rnams la bral ba'i thob pa dang lhan cig skye ba'i phyir rnam par grol ba'i lam dag yin te /
analyzed: shes pa rnams ni nyon mongs pa'i thob pa las rnam par grol ba rnams la bral ba'i thob pa dang lhan cig skye ba'i phyir rnam par grol ba'i lam dag yin te /
translated: Knowledges are liberated paths because they are generated together with the obtainment of separation from the obtainment of affliction.

original: de'i phyir gnyi ga yang @18a * //🔽yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gnyi ga yang @18a * //🔽yin par 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore they are both.

original: gnyis kyis rkun po 'byin pa dang sbo gcod pa bzhin no //
analyzed: gnyis kyis rkun po 'byin pa dang sbo gcod pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like two people, one who expels a thief and one who closes the door.

original: gal te bar chad med pa'i lam gnyis pa kho na bral ba'i thob ba dang lhan cig skye bar gyur na ni dmigs pa de kho na la the tshom spangs ba'i shes pa skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te bar chad med pa'i lam gnyis pa kho na bral ba'i thob ba dang lhan cig skye bar gyur na ni dmigs pa de kho na la the tshom spangs ba'i shes pa skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If the second uninterrupted path alone were to arise simultaneously with the obtainment of freedom, then knowledge abandoning doubt would not arise with regard to that focal object.

original: gal te brjod pa rnams kyis nyon mongs pa spangs pa'i phyir bstan bcos las kun du sbyor ba'i ris dgu zhes 'byung ba dang 'gal lo zhe na /
analyzed: gal te brjod pa rnams kyis nyon mongs pa spangs pa'i phyir bstan bcos las kun du sbyor ba'i ris dgu zhes 'byung ba dang 'gal lo zhe na /
