translated: If you say that it contradicts the treatise that declares nine types of fetters when it says that afflictions are abandoned by the formless realm,

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: then that is not so.

original: bzod pa rnams ni shes pa'i 'khor yin pa'i phyir rgyal bo'i 'khor gyis byas pa las rgyal pos byas so zhes tha snyad 'dogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: bzod pa rnams ni shes pa'i 'khor yin pa'i phyir rgyal bo'i 'khor gyis byas pa las rgyal pos byas so zhes tha snyad 'dogs pa bzhin no //
translated: Because the acceptances are the retinue of knowledge, it is like the convention that what is done by the king’s retinue is done by the king.

original: ci sems bcu drug po thams cad bden pa ma mthong ba mthong ba'i phyir mthong ba'i lam yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: ci sems bcu drug po thams cad bden pa ma mthong ba mthong ba'i phyir mthong ba'i lam yin nam zhe na /
translated: Do all sixteen moments of mind see the four truths that were not previously seen?

original: smras pa / ma yin no //
analyzed: smras pa / ma yin no //
translated: They reply: No.

original: 'o na ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: If not, then what?

original: de las skad cig bco lnga ni //
analyzed: de las skad cig bco lnga ni //
translated: Fifteen moments are learners.

original: ma mthong mthong phyir mthong ba'i lam //
analyzed: ma mthong mthong phyir mthong ba'i lam //
translated: The path of insight is so called because one sees what has not been seen.

original: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa nas bzung ste lam la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa'i bar gyi skad cig ma bco lnga po de dag ni mthong ba'i lam yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa nas bzung ste lam la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa'i bar gyi skad cig ma bco lnga po de dag ni mthong ba'i lam yin no //
translated: The fifteen moments of the path of insight are the fifteen moments beginning with the receptivity to the cognition of the factors with regard to suffering and ending with the receptivity to the subsequent cognition with regard to the path.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it so?

original: bden pa ma mthong ba mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bden pa ma mthong ba mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one sees what has not been seen, namely, the truths.

original: bcu drug pa la ni sngon ma mthong ba blta bar bya ba med kyi ji ltar mthong ba ni goms par byed pa'i phyir bsgom pa'i lam kho na yin no //
analyzed: bcu drug pa la ni sngon ma mthong ba blta bar bya ba med kyi ji ltar mthong ba ni goms par byed pa'i phyir bsgom pa'i lam kho na yin no //
translated: The sixteenth moment, the subsequent cognition with regard to the path, is not the path of insight, for one does not see what has not been seen in it. It is the path of cultivation.

original: des kyang lam la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa ma mthong ba mthong ba ma yin nam zhe na /🔽bden pa'i phyir bsam gtan gyi skad cig ma la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: des kyang lam la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa ma mthong ba mthong ba ma yin nam zhe na / bden pa'i phyir bsam gtan gyi skad cig ma la ni ma yin no //
translated: But, one would say, in the receptivity to the subsequent cognition with regard to the path, one does not see what has not been seen, namely, the truth of the path.🔽This receptivity is not the path of insight, because it is not a moment of the contemplation of a truth, as is the case for the receptivity to the cognition of the factors with regard to the path.

original: skad cig ma gcig ma mthong bas ni bden ba ma mthong ba ma yin te /
analyzed: skad cig ma gcig ma mthong bas ni bden ba ma mthong ba ma yin te /
translated: One does not see a truth because one does not see a moment of the truth.

original: dper na nyag ma gcig ma brngas pas zhing ma brngas pa ma yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na nyag ma gcig ma brngas pas zhing ma brngas pa ma yin pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, one does not say that a field is not ploughed because one has left a certain number of furrows unploughed.

original: 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir dang / shes pa brgyad dang rnam pa bcu drug thob pa'i phyir dang / lam snga ma rnam par nyams pa'i phyir dang / rgyun chags pa yin pa'i phyir lam la rjes su shes pa ni bsgom pa'i lam yin no //🔽yongs su ma nyams pa ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i spangs pa yang dag par 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir dang / shes pa brgyad dang rnam pa bcu drug thob pa'i phyir dang / lam snga ma rnam par nyams pa'i phyir dang / rgyun chags pa yin pa'i phyir lam la rjes su shes pa ni bsgom pa'i lam yin no // yongs su ma nyams pa ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i spangs pa yang dag par 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the result of the path of insight; because it is the acquisition of the eight cognitions and the sixteen aspects; because it is the continuation of the path of insight; because it is the path of cultivation.🔽The path of cultivation is the path of cultivation because it is the repetition of the path of insight, because it is the repetition of the abandonment of the defilements abandoned by means of the path of insight, because it is the repetition of the possession of the possession of the abandonment of the defilements abandoned by means of the path of insight.

original: gal te de nyid kyi phyir mthong ba'i lam yin zhe na /🔽ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te de nyid kyi phyir mthong ba'i lam yin zhe na / ma yin te /
translated: If you consider that the path of cultivation is the path of insight because it is the repetition of the path of insight, then the path of insight would be the path of cultivation.

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: No, because it would be absurd to maintain that it is the repetition of itself.

original: ci'i phyir shes pa bdun mthong ba'i lam yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir shes pa bdun mthong ba'i lam yin zhe na /
translated: Why are the seven cognitions the path of insight?

original: mthong ba ma rdzogs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: mthong ba ma rdzogs pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because the seeing of the truths is not complete.

original: bden pa mthong ba thams cad ma rdzogs pas de'i bar mar gyur @18b pa'i phyir de dag kyang mthong ba'i lam yin no //
analyzed: bden pa mthong ba thams cad ma rdzogs pas de'i bar mar gyur @18b pa'i phyir de dag kyang mthong ba'i lam yin no //
translated: The seeing of the truths is not complete, because the seeing of the origin and of the cessation is not complete.

original: mthong ba'i lam dang bsgom pa'i lam ji ltar skye ba bshad zin to //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam dang bsgom pa'i lam ji ltar skye ba bshad zin to //
translated: We have explained how the path of insight and the path of cultivation arise.

original: da ni ji ltar na 'phags pa'i lam skyes pa'i gang zag rnams rnam par gzhag pa de bzhin du bshad par bya ste /🔽mthong ba'i lam gyi rang bzhin gyi skad cig ma bco lngar bshad pa gang dag yin pa /
analyzed: da ni ji ltar na 'phags pa'i lam skyes pa'i gang zag rnams rnam par gzhag pa de bzhin du bshad par bya ste / mthong ba'i lam gyi rang bzhin gyi skad cig ma bco lngar bshad pa gang dag yin pa /
translated: Now, we will explain how the persons who have generated the noble path are classified.🔽The fifteen moments of the nature of the path of seeing that were explained

original: dbang po rno rtul de dag tu //
analyzed: dbang po rno rtul de dag tu //
translated: are the path of seeing for those of sharp and dull faculties.

original: dad dang chos kyis rjes 'brang ba //
analyzed: dad dang chos kyis rjes 'brang ba //
translated: Those who are followers of faith and followers of reality

original: yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: should be understood as being in those fifteen moments.

original: dbang po rtul po de dag la gnas pa ni dad pas rjes su 'brang ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dbang po rtul po de dag la gnas pa ni dad pas rjes su 'brang ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Those who are abiding in dull faculties are called “followers of faith.”

original: dbang po rnon po ni chos kyis rjes su 'brang ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dbang po rnon po ni chos kyis rjes su 'brang ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Those who are abiding in sharp faculties are called “followers of reality.”

original: dad bas rjes su 'brang bas na dad pas rjes su 'brang ba'o //🔽de 'di la yod pas sam /
analyzed: dad bas rjes su 'brang bas na dad pas rjes su 'brang ba'o // de 'di la yod pas sam /
translated: They are followers of faith because they follow the meaning through faith.🔽They are followers of faith because they have faith,

original: 'di dad pas rjes su 'brang ba'i dang tshul can yin pas na dad pas rjes su 'brang ba ste /
analyzed: 'di dad pas rjes su 'brang ba'i dang tshul can yin pas na dad pas rjes su 'brang ba ste /
translated: or because they have the nature of being followers of faith,

original: sngon gzhan gyi dring gis don gyi rjes su 'brang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngon gzhan gyi dring gis don gyi rjes su 'brang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because previously they followed the meaning through the faith of others.

original: chos kyis rjes su 'brang ba yang de dang 'dra ste ;
analyzed: chos kyis rjes su 'brang ba yang de dang 'dra ste ;
translated: The same applies to the one who follows the teachings.

original: sngon bdag nyid kho nas mdo la sogs pa'i chos kyi don gyi rjes su 'brang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngon bdag nyid kho nas mdo la sogs pa'i chos kyi don gyi rjes su 'brang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: For previously, he himself followed the meaning of the teachings, such as the sutras.

original: de gnyis ni /
analyzed: de gnyis ni /
translated: These two

original: bsgom pas spang bya ma spangs na //
analyzed: bsgom pas spang bya ma spangs na //
translated: have not abandoned that which is to be abandoned by the path of cultivation.

original: 'bras bu dang po la zhugs pa //
analyzed: 'bras bu dang po la zhugs pa //
translated: They enter the first fruit.

original: 'bras bu rnams kyi dang po ni 'bras bu dang po ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu rnams kyi dang po ni 'bras bu dang po ste /
translated: The first of the fruits is the first fruit.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: It is the fruit of stream-entry.

original: de ni 'bras bu thob par bya ba thams cad kyi dang po yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni 'bras bu thob par bya ba thams cad kyi dang po yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the first of all the fruits to be attained.

original: dad pa dang chos kyis rjes su 'brang ba de dag nyid gal te sngon 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis bsgom pas spang bar bya ba ma spangs pa 'ching ba mtha' dag dang ldan pa zhig yin na ni de gnyis rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la zhugs pa
analyzed: dad pa dang chos kyis rjes su 'brang ba de dag nyid gal te sngon 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis bsgom pas spang bar bya ba ma spangs pa 'ching ba mtha' dag dang ldan pa zhig yin na ni de gnyis rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la zhugs pa
translated: If those who follow faith and those who follow the teachings have not previously abandoned that which is to be abandoned by the path of cultivation of the mundane path, and possess all the bonds, they are called “those who enter the fruit of stream-entry.”

original: zhes bya'o // rnam lnga'i bar bcom /
analyzed: zhes bya'o // rnam lnga'i bar bcom /
translated: They have destroyed up to five types.

original: gal te sngon 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis bsgoms te spang bar bya ba 'dod pa na spyod pa rnams las rnam pa lnga'i bar du spangs pa zhig yin na yang de kho na bzhin du dang po'i 'bras bul zhugs pa dag ces bya'o //
analyzed: gal te sngon 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis bsgoms te spang bar bya ba 'dod pa na spyod pa rnams las rnam pa lnga'i bar du spangs pa zhig yin na yang de kho na bzhin du dang po'i 'bras bul zhugs pa dag ces bya'o //
translated: If they previously abandoned five types of objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation in the desire realm by the mundane path, they are called those who enter the result of stream entry.

original: gnyis pa la /
analyzed: gnyis pa la /
translated: Those who enter the second

original: dgu pa tshun chad zad pa yin //
analyzed: dgu pa tshun chad zad pa yin //
translated: exhaust nine stages.

original: gnyis pa la zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa'i phyir te /🔽gal te de gnyis kyis de yan chad rnam pa drug gam /
analyzed: gnyis pa la zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa'i phyir te / gal te de gnyis kyis de yan chad rnam pa drug gam /
translated: Those who enter the second means those who enter the second result.

original: bdun nam brgyad dag cig sngon spangs ba yin na ni de gnyis 'bras bu gnyis pa la zhugs pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: bdun nam brgyad dag cig sngon spangs ba yin na ni de gnyis 'bras bu gnyis pa la zhugs pa zhes bya ste /
translated: If they previously abandoned six, seven, or eight types of objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation in the desire realm, they are called those who enter the second result.

original: gnyis pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: gnyis pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the second result?

original: lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'o//
analyzed: lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'o//
translated: It is the result of once returning.🔽Those who enter the third

original: @19a * // 'dod pa'am yang na gong ma las //🔽chags bral gsum pa la zhugs pa //
analyzed: @19a * // 'dod pa'am yang na gong ma las // chags bral gsum pa la zhugs pa //
translated: are free from attachment to the desire or higher realms.

original: gal te rnam pa dgu ba yang spangs pa'i phyir 'dod pa'i khams las 'dod chags dang bral ba zhig yin nam /
analyzed: gal te rnam pa dgu ba yang spangs pa'i phyir 'dod pa'i khams las 'dod chags dang bral ba zhig yin nam /
translated: If they are free from attachment to the desire realm by abandoning the ninth stage of the desire realm, they are called those who enter the third result.🔽What is the third result?

original: gong ma ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi bar las 'dod chags dang bral ba zhig yin na de gnyis 'bras bu gsum pa la zhugs pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gong ma ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi bar las 'dod chags dang bral ba zhig yin na de gnyis 'bras bu gsum pa la zhugs pa zhes bya ste /
translated: If they are free from attachment to the base of infinite space and below, they are called “those who enter the third result.”

original: gsum gang zhe na /
analyzed: gsum gang zhe na /
translated: What are the three results?

original: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: The result of nonreturn.

original: gang zhig gang la zhugs pa ni //
analyzed: gang zhig gang la zhugs pa ni //
translated: Those who enter

original: bcu drug pa la de 'bras gnas //
analyzed: bcu drug pa la de 'bras gnas //
translated: abide in the sixteenth moment.

original: sems bcu drug pa skyes na de gnyis dad pa dang chos kyis rjes su 'brang ba zhes kyang mi bya la /
analyzed: sems bcu drug pa skyes na de gnyis dad pa dang chos kyis rjes su 'brang ba zhes kyang mi bya la /
translated: When the sixteenth moment arises, they are not called those who follow faith or those who follow the dharma.

original: zhugs pa zhes kyang ni bya'o //
analyzed: zhugs pa zhes kyang ni bya'o //
translated: They are called “those who enter.”

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What are they?

original: 'bras bu la gnas pa dag yin te /
analyzed: 'bras bu la gnas pa dag yin te /
translated: They abide in the result.

original: gang zhig rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu 'am /
analyzed: gang zhig rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu 'am /
translated: Those who enter the result of stream entry,

original: lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu 'am /
analyzed: lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu 'am /
translated: the result of once-returner,

original: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu yang rung 'bras bu gang la zhugs par gyur ba de ni de'i tshe 'bras bu de la gnas pa yin no//
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu yang rung 'bras bu gang la zhugs par gyur ba de ni de'i tshe 'bras bu de la gnas pa yin no//
translated: or the result of nonreturner abide in that result at that time.

original: dgra bcom pa nyid ni dang po nyid du thob par mi nus te /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa nyid ni dang po nyid du thob par mi nus te /
translated: The state of an arhat cannot be attained for the first time.

original: mthong ba'i lam gyis bsgom pas spang bar bya ba mi spong ba'i phyir dang / sngar yang srid pa'i rtse mo las 'dod chags dang bral ba mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam gyis bsgom pas spang bar bya ba mi spong ba'i phyir dang / sngar yang srid pa'i rtse mo las 'dod chags dang bral ba mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the path of seeing does not abandon that which is to be abandoned by the path of cultivation, and because it is impossible that one previously detached from the summit of existence would again enter the path of seeing.

original: de'i tshe dbang po rno rtul dag / dad bas mos dang mthong bas thob //
analyzed: de'i tshe dbang po rno rtul dag / dad bas mos dang mthong bas thob //
translated: At that time, those of sharp and dull faculties are resolute in faith and obtainment by insight.

original: de'i tshe dbang po rtul bo sngon dad pas rjes su 'brang ba gang yin pa de ni dad pas mos ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe dbang po rtul bo sngon dad pas rjes su 'brang ba gang yin pa de ni dad pas mos ba zhes bya'o //
translated: At that time, those of dull faculties who were previously followers through faith are called resolute in faith.

original: dbang po rnon po sngon chos kyis rjes su 'brang ba gang yin ba de ni mthong bas thob pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: dbang po rnon po sngon chos kyis rjes su 'brang ba gang yin ba de ni mthong bas thob pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Those of sharp faculties who were previously followers through Dharma are called obtainment by insight.

original: dad pa dang shes rab lhag bas mos pa dang mthong bas rab tu phye ba'i phyir ro //🔽ci'i phyir rnam pa lnga spangs kyang sems bcu drug pa la rgyun du zhugs pa kho na zhes bya la /
analyzed: dad pa dang shes rab lhag bas mos pa dang mthong bas rab tu phye ba'i phyir ro // ci'i phyir rnam pa lnga spangs kyang sems bcu drug pa la rgyun du zhugs pa kho na zhes bya la /
translated: They are distinguished by faith and insight, respectively.

original: lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la zhugs pa zhes mi bya zhe na /
analyzed: lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la zhugs pa zhes mi bya zhe na /
translated: Why is one called a stream enterer when one abandons five types but not one who has entered the result of once returning?

original: gang gi phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir /
translated: Because,

original: 'bras thob 'bras bu'i khyad par gyis //
analyzed: 'bras thob 'bras bu'i khyad par gyis //
translated: The difference in the fruits is due to the difference in the paths.

original: lam thob med pas de yi phyir //
analyzed: lam thob med pas de yi phyir //
translated: But there is no difference in the paths that have been obtained.🔽Therefore, one who does not strive for the distinction of the fruits

original: 'bras gnas khyad par bya ba'i phyir //🔽mi brtson pa ni zhugs ma yin //
analyzed: 'bras gnas khyad par bya ba'i phyir // mi brtson pa ni zhugs ma yin //
translated: is not a candidate for the distinction of the fruits.

original: 'bras bu thob na 'bras bu khyad par can gyi lam mi 'thob po zhes bya ba 'di ni nges so //
analyzed: 'bras bu thob na 'bras bu khyad par can gyi lam mi 'thob po zhes bya ba 'di ni nges so //
translated: It is certain that when one has obtained a fruit, one does not obtain the path of a higher fruit.

original: de lta bas na 'bras bu la gnas pa ji srid du khyad par du bya ba'i phyir 'bras bu gzhan thob par bya pa la mi brtson pa de srid du zhugs pa zhes mi bya ste /
analyzed: de lta bas na 'bras bu la gnas pa ji srid du khyad par du bya ba'i phyir 'bras bu gzhan thob par bya pa la mi brtson pa de srid du zhugs pa zhes mi bya ste /
translated: Therefore, as long as one who is established in a fruit does not strive to obtain another fruit in order to distinguish it, he is not called a candidate for the distinction of that fruit.

original: de bzhin du 'bras @19b bu gzhan la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'bras @19b bu gzhan la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The same should be applied to the other fruits.

original: gang zhig bsam gtan gsum ba las 'dod chags dang bral la /
analyzed: gang zhig bsam gtan gsum ba las 'dod chags dang bral la /
translated: One who is free from attachment to the third absorption

original: sa 'og ma la brten te nges par 'jug pa de ni gdon mi za bar 'bras bu khyad par can gyi lam mngon du byed do //
analyzed: sa 'og ma la brten te nges par 'jug pa de ni gdon mi za bar 'bras bu khyad par can gyi lam mngon du byed do //
translated: and enters the certainty of perfection in dependence on a lower stage, without doubt manifests the path of a higher fruit.

original: de lta ma yin na de'i gong du skyes pa de bde ba'i dpang po dang mi ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na de'i gong du skyes pa de bde ba'i dpang po dang mi ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, one born in a higher stage would not possess the faculty of pleasure.

original: re zhig phal cher las dang 'dod pa las 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams kyis nges par 'jug pa'i gang zag rnam par gzhag pa ni de lta bu yin no //
analyzed: re zhig phal cher las dang 'dod pa las 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams kyis nges par 'jug pa'i gang zag rnam par gzhag pa ni de lta bu yin no //
translated: This is how the persons who definitely enter the stages are established, for the most part, by those who are detached from the realm of desire and from the stages.

original: mthar gyis 'jug ba brjod par bya ste /🔽de'i phyir re zhig 'di rnam par gzhag par bya'o //🔽ji ltar 'dod pa'i khams kyi nyon mongs pa rnam pa dgu po de dag bstan pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: mthar gyis 'jug ba brjod par bya ste / de'i phyir re zhig 'di rnam par gzhag par bya'o // ji ltar 'dod pa'i khams kyi nyon mongs pa rnam pa dgu po de dag bstan pa de bzhin du /
translated: We must now explain the gradual entry into the stages.🔽The nine categories of defilements of the realm of desire are taught as above.

original: sa dang sa na nyes rnam dgu //
analyzed: sa dang sa na nyes rnam dgu //
translated: In the same way, in each stage, there are nine categories of faults.

original: srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar du'o //
analyzed: srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar du'o //
translated: up to the summit of cyclic existence.

original: nyes pa rnams ji lta bde bzhin du yang yon tan rnams sa dang sa na de'i gnyen bo bar chad med pa'i lam dang rnam par grol ba'i lam zhes bya ba yon tan yang rnam pa dgu dgu kho na yod do //
analyzed: nyes pa rnams ji lta bde bzhin du yang yon tan rnams sa dang sa na de'i gnyen bo bar chad med pa'i lam dang rnam par grol ba'i lam zhes bya ba yon tan yang rnam pa dgu dgu kho na yod do //
translated: As there are faults, so there are virtues, for each stage, there are also nine categories of virtues, which are the uninterrupted paths and the paths of liberation that are the counteractives of the faults.

original: ji ltar byas pas she na /
analyzed: ji ltar byas pas she na /
translated: How is this?

original: chung dang 'bring dang che rnams kyi //
analyzed: chung dang 'bring dang che rnams kyi //
translated: The small, medium, great,

original: chung ngu la sogs tha dad phyir //
analyzed: chung ngu la sogs tha dad phyir //
translated: are divided into small, etc.

original: rtsa ba'i rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: rtsa ba'i rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The fundamental categories are three:

original: chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po'o //
analyzed: chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po'o //
translated: weak, middling, strong.

original: de dag re re zhing yang chung du dang 'bring dang chen po nyid kyis rnam pa gsum yin pa'i phyir dgur rnam par gzhag ste /🔽chung ngu'i chung ngu'i rnam pa dang / chung ngu'i 'bring dang / chung ngu'i chen po dang / 'bring gi chung ngu dang / 'bring gi 'bring dang / 'bring gi chen po dang / chen po'i chung ngu dang / chen po'i 'bring dang / chen po'i chen po'o //🔽de la lam chung ngu'i chung dus ni nyon mongs pa chen po'i chen po sbong la /🔽de bzhin du ma chen po'i chen pos ni nyon mongs pa chung ngu'i chung ngu'i bar du spong ste /
analyzed: de dag re re zhing yang chung du dang 'bring dang chen po nyid kyis rnam pa gsum yin pa'i phyir dgur rnam par gzhag ste / chung ngu'i chung ngu'i rnam pa dang / chung ngu'i 'bring dang / chung ngu'i chen po dang / 'bring gi chung ngu dang / 'bring gi 'bring dang / 'bring gi chen po dang / chen po'i chung ngu dang / chen po'i 'bring dang / chen po'i chen po'o // de la lam chung ngu'i chung dus ni nyon mongs pa chen po'i chen po sbong la / de bzhin du ma chen po'i chen pos ni nyon mongs pa chung ngu'i chung ngu'i bar du spong ste /
translated: Each of these is threefold, weak-weak, etc., thus making nine types.🔽The weak-weak path eliminates the strong-strong defilement, and so on up to the strong-strong path which eliminates the weak-weak defilement.

original: dang po kho nar lam chen po mi srid pa'i phyir dang / lam chen bo skyes pa la nyon mongs ba chen po mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dang po kho nar lam chen po mi srid pa'i phyir dang / lam chen bo skyes pa la nyon mongs ba chen po mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For it is impossible that a strong path would arise when a weak path is sufficient, and it is impossible that a weak defilement would arise when a strong path is present.

original: gos la dri ma che long ni sngar 'khrul phra mo ni phyis 'khru ba dang / mun pa che long ni snang ba chung ngus 'joms la phra mo ni chen pos sel zhes bya ba 'di ni dpe'i rnam pa yin no //
analyzed: gos la dri ma che long ni sngar 'khrul phra mo ni phyis 'khru ba dang / mun pa che long ni snang ba chung ngus 'joms la phra mo ni chen pos sel zhes bya ba 'di ni dpe'i rnam pa yin no //
translated: The coarse stains of a garment are washed first, the subtle stains later; the coarse darkness is destroyed by a small light, the subtle darkness is removed by a great light.

original: 'phags pa'i lam skad cig ma chung ngus kyang 'khor ba thog ma med pa nas brgyud pas spel ba'i nyon mongs pa chen po rnams @20a * //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam skad cig ma chung ngus kyang 'khor ba thog ma med pa nas brgyud pas spel ba'i nyon mongs pa chen po rnams @20a * //
translated: Even a small moment of the noble path can eradicate the great afflictions that have been increased through the continuum of cyclic existence since beginningless time.

original: rtsa ba nas med par byed pa'i phyir chos dkar po rnams ni stobs dang ldan pa yin la /
analyzed: rtsa ba nas med par byed pa'i phyir chos dkar po rnams ni stobs dang ldan pa yin la /
translated: Therefore, the virtuous factors are powerful,

original: nag po rnams ni stobs chung ba yin te /
analyzed: nag po rnams ni stobs chung ba yin te /
translated: and the nonvirtuous factors are weak.

original: yun ring po nas bsags pa'i skyon rnams sman tri byid thun gcig gis 'byin pa lta bu dang / mar me skad cig ma chung ngus mun pa chen po 'joms pa bzhin no //
analyzed: yun ring po nas bsags pa'i skyon rnams sman tri byid thun gcig gis 'byin pa lta bu dang / mar me skad cig ma chung ngus mun pa chen po 'joms pa bzhin no //
translated: This is like the faults that have accumulated over a long time being removed by a single dose of medicine, and like a small moment of light destroying great darkness.

original: de ltar nyon mongs pa rnams pa dgu po de dag thams cad du /
analyzed: de ltar nyon mongs pa rnams pa dgu po de dag thams cad du /
translated: Thus, in all the nine levels of the three realms,

original: 'bras gnas bsgom spang bya ma zad //
analyzed: 'bras gnas bsgom spang bya ma zad //
translated: those abiding in the result do not abandon objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation.

original: re ltar thogs na lan bdun pa //🔽'bras bu la gnas pa gang zhig gis /
analyzed: re ltar thogs na lan bdun pa // 'bras bu la gnas pa gang zhig gis /
translated: If he is the one who is obstructed, he is the one who attains nirvana after seven rebirths.

original: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa gcig kyang ma spangs pa de ni rgyun du zhugs pa yin la /
analyzed: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa gcig kyang ma spangs pa de ni rgyun du zhugs pa yin la /
translated: One who abides in the result who has not abandoned even one affliction to be abandoned by the path of meditation is a stream enterer.

original: tshe bdun gyi bar du skye bas na re ltar thogs na lan bdun pa'o //
analyzed: tshe bdun gyi bar du skye bas na re ltar thogs na lan bdun pa'o //
translated: If he is the one who is obstructed, he is the one who attains nirvana after seven rebirths because he takes birth for seven existences.

original: thams cad du ni lan bdun pa ma yin pas re ltar thogs na zhes bya ba ni thams cad kyi tha shal ba'o //
analyzed: thams cad du ni lan bdun pa ma yin pas re ltar thogs na zhes bya ba ni thams cad kyi tha shal ba'o //
translated: He is not one who attains nirvana in all seven existences, so if he is the one who is obstructed, he is the worst of all.🔽A sutra states:

original: mdo las / mchog tu thogs na lan bdun pa zhes 'byung ba ni de mchog tu thogs na skye ba lan bdun pa zhes bya pa'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: mdo las / mchog tu thogs na lan bdun pa zhes 'byung ba ni de mchog tu thogs na skye ba lan bdun pa zhes bya pa'i tha tshig ste /
translated: The one who attains nirvana after seven rebirths at the most is called the one who attains nirvana after seven existences at the most.

original: mchog ces bya ba'i sgra ni rab tu'o //
analyzed: mchog ces bya ba'i sgra ni rab tu'o //
translated: The term most means best.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i rgyun ni lam ste /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i rgyun ni lam ste /
translated: The path is the stream of nirvana.

original: des na der 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des na der 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one goes there through it,

original: 'di ni der zhugs shing phyin la son pas na rgyun du zhugs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni der zhugs shing phyin la son pas na rgyun du zhugs pa yin no //
translated: one who has entered it, gone there, and reached it is a stream enterer.

original: ji ltar na zhugs pa yin /
analyzed: ji ltar na zhugs pa yin /
translated: How does one enter it?

original: gal te lam dang pho thob pa'i phyir ro zhe na ni brgyad pa yang yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te lam dang pho thob pa'i phyir ro zhe na ni brgyad pa yang yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is because he obtains the path and the male sex, then the eighth stage would also be a person.

original: gal te 'bras bu dang po thob ba'i phyir ro zhe na ni phal tshor las 'dod chags dang bral pa yang yin par 'gyur la /
analyzed: gal te 'bras bu dang po thob ba'i phyir ro zhe na ni phal tshor las 'dod chags dang bral pa yang yin par 'gyur la /
translated: If it is because he obtains the first fruit, then one freed from the passions of the realm of desire would be a person.

original: 'dod pa las 'dod chags dang bral ba yang yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa las 'dod chags dang bral ba yang yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: And one freed from the passions of the realm of desire would be a person.

original: 'bras bu thams cad thob pa'i dbang du byas nas 'bras bu dang po thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu thams cad thob pa'i dbang du byas nas 'bras bu dang po thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But it is in the sense of obtaining all the fruits that he obtains the first fruit.

original: ci'i phyir de kho na yin la brgyad pa ni ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de kho na yin la brgyad pa ni ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why is it only that stage and not the eighth stage?

original: lam la rjes su shes pa la ni zhugs pa dang 'bras bu'i lam thob ba'i phyir dang / mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam thob pa'i phyir dang / rgyun thams cad mngon par rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lam la rjes su shes pa la ni zhugs pa dang 'bras bu'i lam thob ba'i phyir dang / mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam thob pa'i phyir dang / rgyun thams cad mngon par rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because in the path of insight into the truths, one obtains the path of insight and the path of cultivation, and because one realizes all the stages.

original: bye brag tu smra ba rnams na re de ni de las gzhan ba skye ba'i srid pa bdun dang srid pa bar ma bdun du mi rnams kyi nang du nyid mtshams sbyor bar byed la de bo zhin du lha dag gi nang du yang nying mtshams sbyor bar
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba rnams na re de ni de las gzhan ba skye ba'i srid pa bdun dang srid pa bar ma bdun du mi rnams kyi nang du nyid mtshams sbyor bar byed la de bo zhin du lha dag gi nang du yang nying mtshams sbyor bar
translated: Vaibhasikas say: He links with human rebirth seven times in a different realm from the previous one, then seven times in the intermediate state, then seven times in the divine realm.

original: byed do // de ltar na srid pa nyi shu @20b rtsa brgyad kyi bar du nying mtshams sbyor bar byed do //
analyzed: byed do // de ltar na srid pa nyi shu @20b rtsa brgyad kyi bar du nying mtshams sbyor bar byed do //
translated: In this way he links with rebirth for twenty-eight existences.

original: srid pa bdun tshan du 'dra ba'i phyir mchog tu thogs na lan bdun pa zhes bshad de /
analyzed: srid pa bdun tshan du 'dra ba'i phyir mchog tu thogs na lan bdun pa zhes bshad de /
translated: He is called one obstructed for seven existences parimoksa because he is similar to one obstructed for seven sets of existences.

original: gnas bdun la mkhas pa zhes bya ba dang / 'dab ma bdun ba zhes bya ba bzhin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gnas bdun la mkhas pa zhes bya ba dang / 'dab ma bdun ba zhes bya ba bzhin no zhes zer ro //
translated: This is like the expression skilled in the seven abodes and like the expression seven leaves.

original: 'o na gang mdo las /
analyzed: 'o na gang mdo las /
translated: If that is so, how do you interpret the sutra that states:

original: gang zag lta ba phun sum tshogs pa srid pa brgyad pa mngon par 'grub pa gang yin pa de ni gnas ma yin zhing go skabs med de 'di ni gnas med do zhes gsungs pa ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: gang zag lta ba phun sum tshogs pa srid pa brgyad pa mngon par 'grub pa gang yin pa de ni gnas ma yin zhing go skabs med de 'di ni gnas med do zhes gsungs pa ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: It is impossible and inconceivable that a person who has perfected view would establish an eighth existence.

original: 'gro ba gcig tu dgongs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'gro ba gcig tu dgongs pa yin no //
translated: The meaning is that they are born in one realm.

original: 'on te sgra ji bzhin du brtags na ni srid pa bar ma yang yod par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on te sgra ji bzhin du brtags na ni srid pa bar ma yang yod par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If one analyzes the meaning of the words, then even the intermediate existence would not exist.

original: de lta na yang srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar du gong du 'pho ba 'gro ba gcig tu skye ba'i srid pa brgyad par mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na yang srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar du gong du 'pho ba 'gro ba gcig tu skye ba'i srid pa brgyad par mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then one who proceeds to the peak of existence would not be born in the eighth existence.

original: 'dod pa'i khams las dgongs te gsungs pa'i phyir nyes pa med do //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams las dgongs te gsungs pa'i phyir nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no error because it is stated with reference to the desire realm.

original: 'di la shes par byed pa mdo'am rigs pa ci zhig yod /🔽lha dang mi dag gi nang nas sor lan bdun skye'i gnyi ga'i nang du lan bdun ma yin pa nyid do zhes bya ba 'di la yang shes par byed pa ci zhig yod de /🔽'di skad du lha rnams dang mi rnams kyi nang du lan bdun zhes 'byung ngo zhe na /
analyzed: 'di la shes par byed pa mdo'am rigs pa ci zhig yod / lha dang mi dag gi nang nas sor lan bdun skye'i gnyi ga'i nang du lan bdun ma yin pa nyid do zhes bya ba 'di la yang shes par byed pa ci zhig yod de / 'di skad du lha rnams dang mi rnams kyi nang du lan bdun zhes 'byung ngo zhe na /
translated: What is the sutra or reasoning that proves this?🔽What is the proof that one is born among gods and humans for seven existences, but not among both?🔽It is stated that one is born among gods and humans for seven existences.

original: 'od srungs pa rnams lha rnams su lan bdun /
analyzed: 'od srungs pa rnams lha rnams su lan bdun /
translated: The Kaśmīrans say: One is born among gods for seven existences,

original: mi rnams su lan bdun zhes so sor yang 'don pas 'di la mngon par zhen par mi bya'o //
analyzed: mi rnams su lan bdun zhes so sor yang 'don pas 'di la mngon par zhen par mi bya'o //
translated: The Sūtra says that one is reborn among humans seven times at the most, but it does not say that one is reborn seven times in the same family.

original: gang zhig mi dag gi nang du rgyun du zhugs par gyur pa de ni de kho nar 'ongs nas yongs su mya ngan las 'das la /
analyzed: gang zhig mi dag gi nang du rgyun du zhugs par gyur pa de ni de kho nar 'ongs nas yongs su mya ngan las 'das la /
translated: The stream-enterer who has been a human is reborn among humans in order to obtain nirvāṇa.

original: gang zhig lha dag gi nang du rgyun du zhugs par gyur pa de ni de kho nar 'ongs nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da'o //
analyzed: gang zhig lha dag gi nang du rgyun du zhugs par gyur pa de ni de kho nar 'ongs nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da'o //
translated: The stream-enterer who has been a god is reborn among the gods in order to obtain nirvāṇa.

original: ci'i phyir srid pa brgyad pa mngon par mi 'grub ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir srid pa brgyad pa mngon par mi 'grub ce na /
translated: Why is an eighth existence lacking?

original: dus de srid kyis gdon mi za bar rgyud yongs su smin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dus de srid kyis gdon mi za bar rgyud yongs su smin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because, in this period of time, the stream-enterer necessarily perfects his faculties and becomes a once-returner.

original: lam de ni de 'dra ste /
analyzed: lam de ni de 'dra ste /
translated: This path is of such a nature that it cannot be surpassed without having been actualized.

original: sprul gom pa bdun pas zin pa lta bu dang / rims nyin bzhi ba bzhin no //
analyzed: sprul gom pa bdun pas zin pa lta bu dang / rims nyin bzhi ba bzhin no //
translated: It is like the seven steps of a snake, or the four days of a fever.

original: kun tu sbyor ba bdun po tha ma'i cha dang mthun pa gnyis dang / gong ma'i cha dang mthun pa lnga lus pa'i yang phyir ro //
analyzed: kun tu sbyor ba bdun po tha ma'i cha dang mthun pa gnyis dang / gong ma'i cha dang mthun pa lnga lus pa'i yang phyir ro //
translated: Moreover, the stream-enterer has not yet abandoned the seven bonds that he should abandon through the path of cultivation.

original: bar skabs su yang 'phags pa'i lam mngon du byed cing yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' ste /
analyzed: bar skabs su yang 'phags pa'i lam mngon du byed cing yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' ste /
translated: They do not enter into nirvāṇa in the interim,

original: de srid du srid ba myong bar 'gyur ba'i las kyi stobs bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de srid du srid ba myong bar 'gyur ba'i las kyi stobs bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they have generated the power of karma to experience existence.

original: sangs rgyas 'byung pa med na khyim pa kho nar dgra bcom pa nyid 'thob @21a * //
analyzed: sangs rgyas 'byung pa med na khyim pa kho nar dgra bcom pa nyid 'thob @21a * //
translated: If a Buddha has not appeared, they obtain the state of an arhat while still lay people,

original: na khyim na ni mi gnas so //
analyzed: na khyim na ni mi gnas so //
translated: but they do not remain in the home.

original: chos nyid kyis 'thob pa'i dge slong gi mtshan ma yang 'thob bo //
analyzed: chos nyid kyis 'thob pa'i dge slong gi mtshan ma yang 'thob bo //
translated: They obtain the marks of a monk by the power of the Dharma.

original: gzhan dag na re //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re //
translated: Others say:

original: dge spyong gzhan gyis mtshan mas so zhes zer ro //
analyzed: dge spyong gzhan gyis mtshan mas so zhes zer ro //
translated: They obtain the marks of a monk through the marks of another monk.

original: ci'i phyir log bar ltung pa'i chos can ma yin zhe na //
analyzed: ci'i phyir log bar ltung pa'i chos can ma yin zhe na //
translated: Why are they not destined to the downfall?

original: der 'gro ba'i las mi sogs pa'i phyir dang / bsags pa yang sbyor ba dang bsam pa dag ba'i sgo nas dge ba'i rtsa ba stobs dang ldan pas bsgos pa'i phyir rgyud rnam par smin ba dang / mi mthun pa byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: der 'gro ba'i las mi sogs pa'i phyir dang / bsags pa yang sbyor ba dang bsam pa dag ba'i sgo nas dge ba'i rtsa ba stobs dang ldan pas bsgos pa'i phyir rgyud rnam par smin ba dang / mi mthun pa byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they do not accumulate karma to go there, and because they have generated a powerful root of virtue through their application and intention, they have created a mindstream that is incompatible with the ripening of that karma.

original: ngan song du nges ba'i las yod na ni des bzod pa yang bskyed bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ngan song du nges ba'i las yod na ni des bzod pa yang bskyed bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If one has karma that is certain to lead to the lower realms, one will not even be able to generate patience.

original: 'dir smra sa pa /
analyzed: 'dir smra sa pa /
translated: Here, some say:

original: mi mkhas pas ni sdig pa chung du byas kyang 'og tu 'gro //
analyzed: mi mkhas pas ni sdig pa chung du byas kyang 'og tu 'gro //
translated: The unwise go down even by committing a small nonvirtue.

original: mkhas pas chen po byas kyang gnod ba rab tu spong bar 'gyur //
analyzed: mkhas pas chen po byas kyang gnod ba rab tu spong bar 'gyur //
translated: The wise go up even by committing a great nonvirtue.

original: lcags kyi gong bu chung yang chu yi gting du 'bying 'gyur la //
analyzed: lcags kyi gong bu chung yang chu yi gting du 'bying 'gyur la //
translated: A small lump of iron sinks in water,

original: de nyid snod du byas na che yang steng du 'phyo bar 'gyur //
analyzed: de nyid snod du byas na che yang steng du 'phyo bar 'gyur //
translated: but the same iron made into a vessel floats.

original: sdug bsngal gyi mthar byed do zhes bya ba sdug bsngal gyi mtha' gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi mthar byed do zhes bya ba sdug bsngal gyi mtha' gang yin zhe na /
translated: It is said that one will reach the end of suffering. What is the end of suffering?

original: gang phan chad sdug bsngal med ba ste /
analyzed: gang phan chad sdug bsngal med ba ste /
translated: It is the absence of suffering beyond that.

original: sdug bsngal gyi nying mtshams mi sbyor bar byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi nying mtshams mi sbyor bar byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is the meaning of “one does not link with suffering.”

original: yang na mtha' ni mya ngan las 'das pa yin no //
analyzed: yang na mtha' ni mya ngan las 'das pa yin no //
translated: Or the end is nirvana.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa ji ltar byed ce na /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa ji ltar byed ce na /
translated: How does one reach nirvana?

original: de 'thob pa'i bgegs bsal ba'i phyir te dper na smra ba po 'dun khang rdib la nam mkha' gyis  zhes 'dzer ba lta bu yin no //
analyzed: de 'thob pa'i bgegs bsal ba'i phyir te dper na smra ba po 'dun khang rdib la nam mkha' gyis  zhes 'dzer ba lta bu yin no //
translated: In order to eliminate the obstacles to obtaining this fruit, just as one says: “Make the sky clear for the speaker in the assembly hall.”

original: mchog tu thogs na lan bdun pa gzhan yang yod mod kyi ma nges pas mi brjod do //
analyzed: mchog tu thogs na lan bdun pa gzhan yang yod mod kyi ma nges pas mi brjod do //
translated: There is another who is a maximum of seven times, but since this is not certain, it is not mentioned.

original: re zhig 'bras bu la gnas ba bsgos pas spang par bya ba ma zad pa mchog tu thogs na lan bdun pa ni de lta bu yin no //
analyzed: re zhig 'bras bu la gnas ba bsgos pas spang par bya ba ma zad pa mchog tu thogs na lan bdun pa ni de lta bu yin no //
translated: The maximum of seven times is for one who is a once-returner who has not eliminated the objects to be abandoned by cultivation.

original: rnam gsum rnam bzhi las grol ba //
analyzed: rnam gsum rnam bzhi las grol ba //
translated: One who is freed from three or four types

original: tshe gnyis gsum du rigs nas rigs //
analyzed: tshe gnyis gsum du rigs nas rigs //
translated: is born into two or three families.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa de nyid rgyu gsum gyis na rigs nas rigs su skye ba yin te /
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa de nyid rgyu gsum gyis na rigs nas rigs su skye ba yin te /
translated: That very stream-enterer, due to three causes, is born into two or three families.

original: nyon mongs pa spang ba las ni nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa gsum mam bzhi spang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa spang ba las ni nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa gsum mam bzhi spang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: From the point of view of abandoning afflictions, it is because three or four types of afflictions are abandoned.

original: dbang po lngas ni de'i gnyen po zag pa med pa'i dbang po thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang po lngas ni de'i gnyen po zag pa med pa'i dbang po thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: From the point of view of faculties, it is because one obtains the uncontaminated faculties that are their antidotes.

original: skye ba las ni tshe gnyis sam gsum lus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye ba las ni tshe gnyis sam gsum lus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: From the point of view of birth, it is because one has two or three births remaining.

original: tshigs su bcad pa'i nang du gnyis shig smos pa ni /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa'i nang du gnyis shig smos pa ni /
translated: The root text mentions two types of once-returners,

original: rgyun du zhugs pa phyis nyon mongs pa spong bar byed na de'i gnyen po zag ba med pa'i dbang bo thob pa ni ma smos @21b kyang grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa phyis nyon mongs pa spong bar byed na de'i gnyen po zag ba med pa'i dbang bo thob pa ni ma smos @21b kyang grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the obtainment of the uncontaminated faculties that are the antidotes to the afflictions is established even though it is not mentioned if the once-returner later abandons the afflictions.

original: skye ba ni gal te gong ma'i skal ba dang ldan pa'i phyir ches nyung dur yang 'gyur bas de'i phyir 'di smos so //
analyzed: skye ba ni gal te gong ma'i skal ba dang ldan pa'i phyir ches nyung dur yang 'gyur bas de'i phyir 'di smos so //
translated: The once-returner who is born is mentioned because he or she is born with a very small number of afflictions, since he or she possesses the fortune of the higher realms.

original: ci'i phyir rnam pa lnga spangs pa'i phyir ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir rnam pa lnga spangs pa'i phyir ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why is it not said that the once-returner is so called because he or she has abandoned five types of objects to be abandoned by the path of cultivation?

original: de spangs na drug pa yang gdon mi za bar spong ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: de spangs na drug pa yang gdon mi za bar spong ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because when those five are abandoned, the sixth is necessarily also abandoned.

original: de'i rnam ba gcig gis ni bar chad gcig pa'i bzhin du 'bras bu la bgegs bya bar mi nus te /
analyzed: de'i rnam ba gcig gis ni bar chad gcig pa'i bzhin du 'bras bu la bgegs bya bar mi nus te /
translated: One type of object to be abandoned by the path of cultivation cannot obstruct the result like the single obstruction to the fruit of stream entry.

original: khams las mi 'da' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khams las mi 'da' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it does not transcend the realm.

original: rigs nas rigs su skye bde ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: rigs nas rigs su skye bde ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There are two types of once-returners who are born in the same family:

original: lha'i rigs nas rigs su skye ba ni lha dag gi nang du rigs gnyis sam gsum du 'khor nas lha'i rigs de'am gzhan du yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: lha'i rigs nas rigs su skye ba ni lha dag gi nang du rigs gnyis sam gsum du 'khor nas lha'i rigs de'am gzhan du yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: The noble ones who are born in the same class among the gods are those who, having transmigrated twice or thrice among the gods, attain Nirvana in this class or in another.

original: mi'i rigs nas rigs su skye ba ni mi dag gi nang du rigs gnyis sam gsum du 'khor nas gling de'am gzhan du yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba gang yin pa'o //🔽'bras bu la gnas ba de nyid //🔽rnam pa lnga yi bar bcom pa //🔽gnyis pa la ni zhugs pa yin //
analyzed: mi'i rigs nas rigs su skye ba ni mi dag gi nang du rigs gnyis sam gsum du 'khor nas gling de'am gzhan du yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba gang yin pa'o // 'bras bu la gnas ba de nyid // rnam pa lnga yi bar bcom pa // gnyis pa la ni zhugs pa yin //
translated: The noble ones who are born in the same class among humans are those who, having transmigrated twice or thrice among humans, attain Nirvana in this continent or in another.🔽The abiders in the fruit who have abandoned from one to five categories are approachers of the second fruit.

original: 'bras bu la gnas pa gang gis rnam pa gcig nas lnga'i bar du spangs ba yin na de'i 'bras bu gnyis pa la zhugs pa yin bar rig par bya'o //🔽rnam pa drug pa zad gyur pa //
analyzed: 'bras bu la gnas pa gang gis rnam pa gcig nas lnga'i bar du spangs ba yin na de'i 'bras bu gnyis pa la zhugs pa yin bar rig par bya'o // rnam pa drug pa zad gyur pa //
translated: The abiders in the fruit who have abandoned from one to five categories are approachers of the second fruit.

original: de ni lan cig phyir 'ong ba //
analyzed: de ni lan cig phyir 'ong ba //
translated: The abiders in the fruit who have abandoned the sixth category are approachers of the third fruit.🔽The abiders in the fruit who have abandoned the sixth category are approachers of the third fruit.🔽The abiders in the fruit who have abandoned the seventh and eighth categories are approachers of the fourth fruit.

original: de ni 'bras bu gnyis pa thob pa yin te /
analyzed: de ni 'bras bu gnyis pa thob pa yin te /
translated: The abiders in the fruit who have abandoned the seventh and eighth categories are approachers of the fourth fruit.

original: lha dag gi nang du song nas mi'i 'jig rten du lan cig phyir 'od ba'i phyir 'ong ba ste /
analyzed: lha dag gi nang du song nas mi'i 'jig rten du lan cig phyir 'od ba'i phyir 'ong ba ste /
translated: Having gone to the realm of the gods, he returns once to the human world.

original: phan chad skye ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phan chad skye ba med pa'i phyir ro //

original: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug rnams bsrabs pa'i phyir zhes 'byung pa ni chung du'i rnam pa lus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug rnams bsrabs pa'i phyir zhes 'byung pa ni chung du'i rnam pa lus pa'i phyir ro //

original: 'bras bu la gnas pa de nyid //
analyzed: 'bras bu la gnas pa de nyid //

original: nyis cha bdun dang brgyad zad pa //🔽tshe gcig bar chad gcig pa dang // gsum pa la ni zhugs pa'ang yin //
analyzed: nyis cha bdun dang brgyad zad pa // tshe gcig bar chad gcig pa dang // gsum pa la ni zhugs pa'ang yin //

original: yang lan cig phyir 'ong ba de nyid rgyu gsum gyis bar chad gcig pa yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: yang lan cig phyir 'ong ba de nyid rgyu gsum gyis bar chad gcig pa yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: The same person who is a candidate for the fruit of nonreturner is a single-interventer for three reasons:

original: nyon mongs pa'i rnam ba bdun nam brgyad spangs pa'i phyir dang / de'i gnyen po zag pa med pa'i dbang bo thob pa'i phyir dang / tshe gcig lus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i rnam ba bdun nam brgyad spangs pa'i phyir dang / de'i gnyen po zag pa med pa'i dbang bo thob pa'i phyir dang / tshe gcig lus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: he has abandoned seven or eight categories of defilements of the realm of desire; he has acquired the faculties whose nature is opposed to these defilements; he has only one birth remaining.

original: ji ltar na 'di'i rnam pa gcig gis 'bras bu la bgegs byed bar nus she na /
analyzed: ji ltar na 'di'i rnam pa gcig gis 'bras bu la bgegs byed bar nus she na /
translated: How can a single category of defilement hinder him from obtaining the fruit?

original: khams las 'da' ba'i phyir te /🔽gong du las rnams ni gnas skabs gsum du bgegs byed pa'i @22a * //
analyzed: khams las 'da' ba'i phyir te / gong du las rnams ni gnas skabs gsum du bgegs byed pa'i @22a * //
translated: because they transcend the realm of sense desire.

original: phyir nye bar gnas so zhes bshad zin to //
analyzed: phyir nye bar gnas so zhes bshad zin to //
translated: For it has already been stated that karma is present in order to obstruct in three circumstances.

original: las rnams ji lta bar nyon mongs pa rnams kyang de dang 'dra bar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: las rnams ji lta bar nyon mongs pa rnams kyang de dang 'dra bar rig par bya ste /
translated: It should be understood that the afflictions are like karma,

original: rnam par smin pa dang rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu'i sa las 'da' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa dang rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu'i sa las 'da' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they transcend the realm of karma, the realm of karma-result, and the realm of natural outflow.

original: bar chad ces bya ba ni bar chad byed pa'o //🔽de'i mya ngan las 'da' ba la tshe gcig gis chod pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: bar chad ces bya ba ni bar chad byed pa'o // de'i mya ngan las 'da' ba la tshe gcig gis chod pa'i phyir ram /

original: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa gcig gis chod pa'i phyir 'di la bar chad gcig yod pas na bar chad gcig pa yin no //
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa gcig gis chod pa'i phyir 'di la bar chad gcig yod pas na bar chad gcig pa yin no //
translated: Because his nirvana is obstructed by a single birth, or because the fruit of non-returning is obstructed by a single part of the affliction, he has one obstruction, thus he is a once-returner.

original: rnam pa bdun dang brgyad spangs pa de ni 'bras bu gsum pa la zhugs pa yin par rig par bya'o//
analyzed: rnam pa bdun dang brgyad spangs pa de ni 'bras bu gsum pa la zhugs pa yin par rig par bya'o//

original: sngon rnam pa gsum dang bzhi spangs pa'am /
analyzed: sngon rnam pa gsum dang bzhi spangs pa'am /
translated: Previously, he has abandoned three or four parts.

original: bdun pa dang brgyad pa spangs pa 'bras bu thob pa ni ji srid du 'bras bu khyad par can gyi lam mngon du ma byas pa de srid du rigs nas rigs su skye ba'am bar chad gcig pa ma yin no //

translated: They are called nonreturners because they

translated: Those who transfer to a higher level are parinirmit in the intermediate state, so they are intermediate state parinirmitas.

analyzed: de bzhin du skyes nas dang / 'du byed pa dang 'du byed pa med pa la yang sbyar bar bya'o //

analyzed: bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ni srid pa bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: Intermediate state parinirmitas are those who attain nirvana in the intermediate state.

original: skyes nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ni skyes pa tsam las mi 'chi bar phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'da' bas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ste /

translated: Born parinirmitas are those who attain nirvana through the nirvana that is the remainder of the aggregates without dying immediately after birth.

original: mngon par brtson pa dang / lam ngang gis 'byung ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon par brtson pa dang / lam ngang gis 'byung ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because they are diligent and the path arises naturally.

original: gzhan dag na re de yang phung po'i lhag ma med pas so zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re de yang phung po'i lhag ma med pas so zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say: They also attain nirvana through the nirvana that is the remainderless aggregates.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: tshe 'dor ba la dbang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshe 'dor ba la dbang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one has no power to relinquish one's life.

original: mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas pas yongs su @22b mya ngan las 'da' ba ni skyes nas sbyor ba ma btang zhing mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas pas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas pas yongs su @22b mya ngan las 'da' ba ni skyes nas sbyor ba ma btang zhing mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas pas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba gang yin pa ste /
translated: Those who attain nirvana through effort are those who attain nirvana through effort after birth, without abandoning attachment.

original: mngon par brtson pa dang lam ngang gis 'byung ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon par brtson pa dang lam ngang gis 'byung ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //

translated: Those who attain nirvana without effort are those who attain nirvana without effort.

original: mngon par mi brtson pa dang lam ngang gis 'byung ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes grag go //
analyzed: mngon par mi brtson pa dang lam ngang gis 'byung ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes grag go //

original: gzhan dag na re 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas pa la dmigs pa'i lam gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas pa la dmigs pa'i lam gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say: Because they attain nirvana through the path that focuses on the conditioned and unconditioned.

original: de ni mi rung ste /
analyzed: de ni mi rung ste /
translated: That is illogical,

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is an extreme consequence.

original: mdo las ni mngon bar 'du byed pa med par yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba sngar 'byung bas de kho na bzhin du rung ste /
analyzed: mdo las ni mngon bar 'du byed pa med par yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba sngar 'byung bas de kho na bzhin du rung ste /
translated: Since the sutras state that those who attain nirvana without application are the first to appear, it is correct that they are just as stated.

original: lam ngang gis 'byung ba dang ngang gis 'byung ba ma yin pa dag ni 'bad pa med pa dang 'bad pas 'thob ba'i sgo nas mngon par 'du byed pa med pa dang mngon par 'du byed pas bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //

translated: Because the path that naturally arises and the path that does not naturally arise are respectively accomplished by nonapplication and by application, they are established by nonapplication and by application.

original: skyes nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ni lam ches ngang gis 'byung ba dang / ches che ba dang / phra rgyas ches chung ba yin no //
analyzed: skyes nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ni lam ches ngang gis 'byung ba dang / ches che ba dang / phra rgyas ches chung ba yin no //
translated: Those who attain nirvana after birth have a path that naturally arises, is greater and has fewer negative tendencies.

original: gong du 'pho ba ni gang du skyes pa de nyid du yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' bar gong du 'gro ba gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: gong du 'pho ba ni gang du skyes pa de nyid du yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' bar gong du 'gro ba gang yin pa ste /
translated: Those who proceed to a higher level are those who do not attain nirvana in the level where they were born but proceed to a higher level.

original: 'pho ba dang 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni don gcig go //
analyzed: 'pho ba dang 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni don gcig go //

original: de ni bsam gtan spel nas 'og min 'gro //
analyzed: de ni bsam gtan spel nas 'og min 'gro //
translated: They proceed to Akaniṣṭha after augmenting the absorptions.

original: gong du 'pho ba de ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i sgo nas rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: gong du 'pho ba de ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i sgo nas rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The higher rebirth is twofold, from the point of view of cause and from the point of view of result.

original: rgyu'i sgo nas ni bsam gtan spel ba dang / spel ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu'i sgo nas ni bsam gtan spel ba dang / spel ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //

original: de nas shi 'phos nas 'og min pa dag gi nang du skye ba gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: de nas shi 'phos nas 'og min pa dag gi nang du skye ba gang yin pa ste /
translated: Then, after death, they are born among the Akaniṣṭhas.

original: de ni bar du mi 'gro bas na 'phar ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni bar du mi 'gro bas na 'phar ba zhes bya'o //
translated: They are called “leapers” because they do not go through the intermediate state.

original: phyed du 'phar ba zhes bya ba ni de nas gnas gtsang ma rnams su skyes la bar nas gnas gzhan 'ga' tsam yang rgal te 'og min du 'phos nas 'og min du 'jug pa gang yin pa'o //

translated: Those called “half-leapers” are born in the Pure Abodes, but after skipping over one or two other abodes, they enter Akaniṣṭha.

original: 'phags pa ni tshangs chen pa dag gi nang du mi skye ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa ni tshangs chen pa dag gi nang du mi skye ste /
translated: Aryas are not born among the Mahābrahmās.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: lta ba'i gnas yin pa'i phyir dang / gtso bo gcig tu zad pa'i phyir dang / gnas thams cad du 'chi 'pho ba zhes bya ba ni gnas gzhan thams cad du 'phos nas 'og min du 'jug pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: lta ba'i gnas yin pa'i phyir dang / gtso bo gcig tu zad pa'i phyir dang / gnas thams cad du 'chi 'pho ba zhes bya ba ni gnas gzhan thams cad du 'phos nas 'og min du 'jug pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Those called “those who die in all abodes” are those who enter Akaniṣṭha after skipping over all other abodes.

original: phyir mi 'ong ba ni nam yang skye ba'i skye mched de nyid du tshe gnyis pa mngon par 'grub par mi byed de /
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba ni nam yang skye ba'i skye mched de nyid du tshe gnyis pa mngon par 'grub par mi byed de /
translated: Nonreturners never establish a second life in the very same place of birth.

original: khyad par du 'gro ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par du 'gro ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he is going to a higher stage.

original: 'di ltar na 'di'i phyir mi 'ong ba nyid yongs su rdzogs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar na 'di'i phyir mi 'ong ba nyid yongs su rdzogs pa yin te /
translated: In this way, his nonreturner state is complete,

original: gang du skyes pa de 'og dang der gtan du mi 'ong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang du skyes pa de 'og dang der gtan du mi 'ong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because he will not return to the stage where he was born, or to any stage below it.

original: re zhig bsam gtan spel nas 'og min du 'gro ba ni de lta bu yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: re zhig bsam gtan spel nas 'og min du 'gro ba ni de lta bu yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: This is how one who increases his absorption and goes to Akaniṣṭha should be understood.

original: de las gzhan srid rtse mor 'gro //🔽gong du 'pho ba bsam gtan ma spel ba ni srid pa'i rtse mo'i mthar thug pa yin te /
analyzed: de las gzhan srid rtse mor 'gro // gong du 'pho ba bsam gtan ma spel ba ni srid pa'i rtse mo'i mthar thug pa yin te /
translated: One who goes to the summit of existence goes there by a different path.🔽One who increases his absorption and goes to the summit of existence goes there by a different path.

original: de ni snyoms par 'jug pa gzhan rnams ro myong bar byed cing gnas gzhan thams cad du skye la /🔽gnas gtsang ma rnams su mi 'jug pa kho na ra gzugs med par skye ba'i rim gyis srid pa'i rtsa mor song ste /
analyzed: de ni snyoms par 'jug pa gzhan rnams ro myong bar byed cing gnas gzhan thams cad du skye la / gnas gtsang ma rnams su mi 'jug pa kho na ra gzugs med par skye ba'i rim gyis srid pa'i rtsa mor song ste /
translated: He is one who relishes other meditative attainments and is born in all other abodes.🔽He is one who does not enter the pure abodes and is born in the formless realm.

original: yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'o //
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'o //
translated: He goes to the summit of existence and attains nirvana.

original: 'di ni zhi gnas spyad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni zhi gnas spyad pa yin no //
translated: He is one who practices serenity.

original: snga ma ni lhag mthong spyad pa yin no //
analyzed: snga ma ni lhag mthong spyad pa yin no //
translated: The former is one who practices insight.

original: gong du 'pho ba bar skabs su yang yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar rung bar blta'o //
analyzed: gong du 'pho ba bar skabs su yang yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar rung bar blta'o //
translated: It should be understood that the intermediate nirvana is also possible for those who go higher.

original: 'og min dang srid pa'i rtse mo'i mthar thug pa nyid ni phan chad du 'gro ba med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'og min dang srid pa'i rtse mo'i mthar thug pa nyid ni phan chad du 'gro ba med pa'i phyir te /
translated: The highest stage is the summit of existence and the highest realm is the summit of existence, because there is no going beyond that.

original: dper na rgyun du zhugs pa mchog tu thogs na lan bdun pa nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na rgyun du zhugs pa mchog tu thogs na lan bdun pa nyid bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the stream enterer who is at most seven times.

analyzed: re zhig de dag ni gzugs su nye bar 'gro ba'i phyir mi 'ong ba lnga yin no // gzhan ni gzugs med 'gro rnam bzhi //

original: phyir mi 'ong ba gzhan ni gzugs med par nye bar 'gro ba ste /
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba gzhan ni gzugs med par nye bar 'gro ba ste /

analyzed: gzugs kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba 'di nas shi 'phos nas gzugs med @23b pa dag gi nang du skye ba gang yin pa'o //

original: de yang skyes nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba la sogs pa'i bye brag gis rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: de yang skyes nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba la sogs pa'i bye brag gis rnam pa bzhi ste /

original: de dag ni phyir mi 'ong ba rnam pa drug yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni phyir mi 'ong ba rnam pa drug yin no //

original: gzhan ni 'di la mya ngan 'da' //
analyzed: gzhan ni 'di la mya ngan 'da' //

original: gzhan ni tshe 'di kho na la yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ste /🔽mthong ba'i chos la yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba de ni bdun pa yin no //🔽gsum la rnam gsum phyi nas su //
analyzed: gzhan ni tshe 'di kho na la yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ste / mthong ba'i chos la yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba de ni bdun pa yin no // gsum la rnam gsum phyi nas su //

analyzed: gsum po gang dag / ce na ; bar ma do dang skyes nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dag dang / gong du 'pho ba'o // rnam pa gsum du phye bas ji lta bu zhe na /

original: re zhig bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ni dpe gsum gyis myur ba dang / myur ba ma yin pa dang / yun ring mo zhig nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i phyir ro //
