original: skyes nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ni skyes nas dang / mngon par 'du byed pa dang / mngon par 'du byed pa med par yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyes nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ni skyes nas dang / mngon par 'du byed pa dang / mngon par 'du byed pa med par yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Those who attain nirvana after birth are of three types: those who attain nirvana quickly, those who attain nirvana after some time, and those who attain nirvana after being reborn.

original: de dag thams cad kyang skyes nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i phyir skyes nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dag yin no //
analyzed: de dag thams cad kyang skyes nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i phyir skyes nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba dag yin no //
translated: All of them attain nirvana after birth, thus they are those who attain nirvana after birth.

original: gong du 'pho ba ni 'phar ba la sogs pa'i bye brag gis so //
analyzed: gong du 'pho ba ni 'phar ba la sogs pa'i bye brag gis so //
translated: Those who go upstream are of three types: those who leap over, those who half-leap, and those who do not leap.

original: yang na gsum po thams cad myur ba dang myur ba ma yin pa dang / yun ring mo zhig nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang na gsum po thams cad myur ba dang myur ba ma yin pa dang / yun ring mo zhig nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Or else, all three attain nirvana quickly, not quickly, and after a long time.

original: de dag gi ni khyad par rnams //🔽las dbang nyon mongs bye brag las //
analyzed: de dag gi ni khyad par rnams // las dbang nyon mongs bye brag las //
translated: Their distinctions🔽are due to karma, affliction, and faculties.

original: phyir mi 'ong ba gsum dang dgu po de dag gi khyad par ni las dang / nyon mongs pa dang dbang po'i bye brag las te /
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba gsum dang dgu po de dag gi khyad par ni las dang / nyon mongs pa dang dbang po'i bye brag las te /
translated: The distinctions of the three or nine nonreturners are due to the distinctions of karma, affliction, and faculties.

original: re zhig gsum po ni go rims bzhin du mngon par 'grub ba dang / skyes pa dang / lan grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur ba'i las bsags pa'i phyir dang / nyon mongs pa kun du spyod pa chung ba dang / 'bring dang / chen po'i phyir dang /
analyzed: re zhig gsum po ni go rims bzhin du mngon par 'grub ba dang / skyes pa dang / lan grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur ba'i las bsags pa'i phyir dang / nyon mongs pa kun du spyod pa chung ba dang / 'bring dang / chen po'i phyir dang /
translated: Because they respectively accumulate karma to be experienced after rebirth, karma to be experienced in a third life, and karma to be experienced in a fourth life and beyond, and because they respectively have small, medium, and great degrees of afflicted action.

original: dbang po chen po dang 'bring dang chung ngu'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang po chen po dang 'bring dang chung ngu'i phyir ro //
translated: They are also distinguished by having great, medium, and small faculties.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de dag so so'i khyad par yang ci rigs par gsum tshan dang po gnyis ni gong ma bzhin du nyon mongs pa dang / dbang po'i @24a * //🔽bye brag las so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de dag so so'i khyad par yang ci rigs par gsum tshan dang po gnyis ni gong ma bzhin du nyon mongs pa dang / dbang po'i @24a * // bye brag las so //
translated: Therefore, their individual distinctions are also made by the first two sets of three, which are respectively made by the distinctions of affliction and faculties, as before.

original: gsum tshan tha ma ni lan grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur ba'i las kyi bye brag las kyang khyad par du blta ste /
analyzed: gsum tshan tha ma ni lan grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur ba'i las kyi bye brag las kyang khyad par du blta ste /
translated: The last set of three is distinguished by the distinction of karma to be experienced in a third life.

original: de dag ni nyon mongs pa dang dbang po'i rnam pa dgu'i phyir phyir mi 'ong ba dgu yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni nyon mongs pa dang dbang po'i rnam pa dgu'i phyir phyir mi 'ong ba dgu yin no //
translated: Because they have nine aspects of affliction and faculties, there are nine nonreturners.

original: 'o na mdo las skyes bu dam pa'i 'gro ba bdun bstan pa ji lta bu zhe na /🔽gong du 'pho ba ma phye bar //
analyzed: 'o na mdo las skyes bu dam pa'i 'gro ba bdun bstan pa ji lta bu zhe na / gong du 'pho ba ma phye bar //
translated: Well, how do the sūtras teach seven abodes of beings?

original: dam pa'i 'gro ba bdun du 'dod //
analyzed: dam pa'i 'gro ba bdun du 'dod //
translated: They assert seven abodes of beings,🔽not distinguishing those who proceed higher.

original: gong du 'gro ba'i chos ni gong du 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: gong du 'gro ba'i chos ni gong du 'gro ba'o //
translated: Those who proceed to higher levels are those who proceed higher.

original: mdo las ni de ma phye bar bstan pa'i phyir mdo las skyes bu dam pa'i 'gro ba bdun zhes gsungs so //🔽ci'i phyir 'di dag kho na skyes bu dam pa'i 'gro ba yin la /
analyzed: mdo las ni de ma phye bar bstan pa'i phyir mdo las skyes bu dam pa'i 'gro ba bdun zhes gsungs so // ci'i phyir 'di dag kho na skyes bu dam pa'i 'gro ba yin la /
translated: Since they are not distinguished in the sūtras, the sūtras state seven abodes of beings.

original: slob pa'i 'gro ba gzhan dag ni ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: slob pa'i 'gro ba gzhan dag ni ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why are only these abodes of beings and not others abodes of beings?🔽Those who possess these abodes of beings engage in only virtuous, excellent karma and do not engage in nonvirtuous, nonexcellent karma.

original: gang dag la 'gro ba 'di dag yod pa de dag ni las dam pa dge ba kho na la 'jug cing dam pa ma yin pa mi dge ba la mi 'jug pa dang / 'gro ba 'di dag tu son pa rnams la yang phyir 'ong ba med pa yin la ji skad du bshad pa 'di dag gzhan la ni med pas de'i phyir /
analyzed: gang dag la 'gro ba 'di dag yod pa de dag ni las dam pa dge ba kho na la 'jug cing dam pa ma yin pa mi dge ba la mi 'jug pa dang / 'gro ba 'di dag tu son pa rnams la yang phyir 'ong ba med pa yin la ji skad du bshad pa 'di dag gzhan la ni med pas de'i phyir /
translated: Those who attain these abodes of beings do not return.

original: dam pa dam min 'jug mi 'jug / son pa phyir mi 'ong phyir te //
analyzed: dam pa dam min 'jug mi 'jug / son pa phyir mi 'ong phyir te //
translated: The noble ones are classified as those who have entered and those who have not entered, and as those who have attained and those who have not attained.

original: skyes bu dam pa'i 'gro ba dag yin gyi gzhan dag ni ma yin no //
analyzed: skyes bu dam pa'i 'gro ba dag yin gyi gzhan dag ni ma yin no //
translated: They are the destinies of the noble ones, but not of others.

original: 'o na mdo kho na las skyes bu dam pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na mdo kho na las skyes bu dam pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the noble one who is a human being?

original: slob pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba rang ldan pa'o zhes rgyas par gsungs pa ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: slob pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba rang ldan pa'o zhes rgyas par gsungs pa ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: It is one who possesses the right view of a learner.

original: gzhan dag la yang sdig pa rnam pa lnga gtan mi byed pa'i sdom pa thob pa'i phyir dang / nyon mongs pa mi dge ba phal cher spangs pa'i phyir rnam grangs pa'i skyes bu dam pa nyid yid mod kyi /
analyzed: gzhan dag la yang sdig pa rnam pa lnga gtan mi byed pa'i sdom pa thob pa'i phyir dang / nyon mongs pa mi dge ba phal cher spangs pa'i phyir rnam grangs pa'i skyes bu dam pa nyid yid mod kyi /
translated: Others are also called noble ones figuratively because they obtain the vow that completely abandons the five types of negative action and because they abandon most of the afflictions that are nonvirtuous.

original: 'dir ni gang dag la rnam grangs med par yod pa de dag gi skabs yin no //
analyzed: 'dir ni gang dag la rnam grangs med par yod pa de dag gi skabs yin no //
translated: But here, the context is those who are noble ones in the nonfigurative sense.

original: ci phyir mi 'ong ba tshe yongs su gyur pa la yang dbye ba 'di yod dam zhe na /
analyzed: ci phyir mi 'ong ba tshe yongs su gyur pa la yang dbye ba 'di yod dam zhe na /
translated: Do these classifications exist for nonreturners who change sex?

original: med de / 'di ltar /
analyzed: med de / 'di ltar /
translated: They do not, because it is said:

original: 'dod par tshe yongs su gyur pa'i 'phags //
analyzed: 'dod par tshe yongs su gyur pa'i 'phags //
translated: Noble ones who change sex in the desire realm

original: khams gzhan du ni 'gro ba med //
analyzed: khams gzhan du ni 'gro ba med //
translated: do not go to other realms.

original: 'dod pa'i khams su tshe yongs su gyur pa'i 'phags pa ni khams gzhan du mi 'gro ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams su tshe yongs su gyur pa'i 'phags pa ni khams gzhan du mi 'gro ste /
translated: Āryas who change their life basis in the desire realm do not go to other realms.

original: tshe 'di nyid la phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu thob nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshe 'di nyid la phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu thob nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they attain the result of nonreturn in this very life and then attain nirvana.

original: gzugs kyi khams su tshe yongs su gyur ba ni gal te na gzugs med pa'i khams dag tu yang 'jug ste /🔽gong du 'pho ba srid pa'i rtse mo'i mthar thug par 'gro @24b ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams su tshe yongs su gyur ba ni gal te na gzugs med pa'i khams dag tu yang 'jug ste / gong du 'pho ba srid pa'i rtse mo'i mthar thug par 'gro @24b ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: Āryas who change their life basis in the form realm may enter the formless realm.

original: 'o na brgya byin gyis /🔽bdag ni tham nyams na lha gang 'og min zhes //
analyzed: 'o na brgya byin gyis / bdag ni tham nyams na lha gang 'og min zhes //
translated: This is because those who upgrade their intellectual faculty and go to the summit of existence are born in the formless realm.🔽What then of the following statement by Śakra?🔽When I fall from here, may I be born

original: rnam par grags ba de ni skye bar 'gyur bar shog / ces gang smras pa ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par grags ba de ni skye bar 'gyur bar shog / ces gang smras pa ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: in Akaniṣṭha, renowned as the highest.

original: bye brag tu smra ba rnams na re chos mngon ba mngon par mi shes pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba rnams na re chos mngon ba mngon par mi shes pa'i phyir te /
translated: Vaibhasikas say: Because he does not understand Abhidharma,

original: yang dag par dga' bar bya ba yin ba'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang ma bkag go zhes zer ro //
analyzed: yang dag par dga' bar bya ba yin ba'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang ma bkag go zhes zer ro //
translated: but the Bhagavan did not refute him because he was truly delighted.

original: de dang gong mar skyes pa ni //
analyzed: de dang gong mar skyes pa ni //
translated: Those born in higher realms

original: yongs nyams dbang po 'pho mi bsten //
analyzed: yongs nyams dbang po 'pho mi bsten //
translated: do not change faculties or retrogress.

original: 'dod pa'i khams su tshe yongs su gyur pa'i 'phags pa de dang / khams gong mar skyes ba'i 'phags pa ni dbang po rnams kyang 'di mi 'pho la ji ltar yang yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams su tshe yongs su gyur pa'i 'phags pa de dang / khams gong mar skyes ba'i 'phags pa ni dbang po rnams kyang 'di mi 'pho la ji ltar yang yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The noble ones who have changed their lives in the desire realm and the noble ones born in higher realms do not change their faculties and they never retrogress.

original: ci'i phyir 'phags pa tshe gzhan du yongs su gyur pa gzugs dang gzugs med par 'jug pa dang / dbang po 'pho ba dang / yongs su nyams pa dag tu mi 'dod ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'phags pa tshe gzhan du yongs su gyur pa gzugs dang gzugs med par 'jug pa dang / dbang po 'pho ba dang / yongs su nyams pa dag tu mi 'dod ce na /
translated: Why do the noble ones who have changed their lives in the desire realm not enter the form and formless realms, change their faculties or retrogress?

original: 'di ltar med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they do not exist.

original: ci'i phyir med ce na ;
analyzed: ci'i phyir med ce na ;
translated: Why do they not exist?

original: tshe rabs gzhan nas yongs su 'dris pas dbang por nams ches yongs su smin pa'i phyir dang / rten khyad par can thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshe rabs gzhan nas yongs su 'dris pas dbang por nams ches yongs su smin pa'i phyir dang / rten khyad par can thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because their faculties are fully matured through familiarity in other lives and because they obtain a special support.

original: yang ci'i phyir slob pa 'dod chags dang ma bral ba bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir slob pa 'dod chags dang ma bral ba bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Why do learners who are not free from attachment not attain nirvana in the intermediate state?

original: lam ma 'dris pas mngon sum du mi 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / phra rgyas rnams shin tu chung ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lam ma 'dris pas mngon sum du mi 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / phra rgyas rnams shin tu chung ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the path is not familiar, it does not manifest and because the negative tendencies are not extremely small.

original: bye brag tu smra ba rnams na re 'dod pa'i khams las 'da' bar dka' ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba rnams na re 'dod pa'i khams las 'da' bar dka' ba'i phyir te /
translated: Vaibhasikas say: It is difficult to transcend the desire realm.

original: 'dis nyon mongs pa mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa spangs pa dang / dge sbyong gi tshul gyi 'bras bu gnyis sam gsum thob pa dang / khams gsum las yang dag par 'da' ba dang mang po zhig bya dgos la /
analyzed: 'dis nyon mongs pa mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa spangs pa dang / dge sbyong gi tshul gyi 'bras bu gnyis sam gsum thob pa dang / khams gsum las yang dag par 'da' ba dang mang po zhig bya dgos la /
translated: Because many things must be done: abandoning afflictions that are nonvirtuous and neutral, obtaining two or three sramanera fruits, and completely transcending the three realms.

original: de yang srid pa bar ma la gnas pas bya bar mi nus zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de yang srid pa bar ma la gnas pas bya bar mi nus zhes zer ro //
translated: But that cannot be done while abiding in the intermediate existence.

original: de ni bsam gtan spel nas 'og min 'gro //🔽zhes bshad pa /
analyzed: de ni bsam gtan spel nas 'og min 'gro // zhes bshad pa /
translated: One who increases absorption goes to Akaniṣṭha.

original: yang dang po nyid du bsam gtan gang spel bar byed ce na /
analyzed: yang dang po nyid du bsam gtan gang spel bar byed ce na /
translated: Which absorption is increased first?

original: dang por bzhi ba spel bar byed //
analyzed: dang por bzhi ba spel bar byed //
translated: The fourth is increased first.

original: ting nge 'dzin ni thams cad pas las su rung ba dang / lam sla ba rnams kyi nang na mchog yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin ni thams cad pas las su rung ba dang / lam sla ba rnams kyi nang na mchog yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Concentration is the best of all because it is the most serviceable and the easiest path.

original: 'di ltar spel bar byed de /
analyzed: 'di ltar spel bar byed de /
translated: One cultivates this by alternating.

original: dgra bcom pa 'am phyir mi 'ong ba yang rung ste zag pa med pa'i bsam gtan @25a * //🔽bzhi pa rgyun dang ldan pa la snyoms par 'jug cing /🔽de las langs nas de nyid zag pa dang bcas pa rgyun dang ldan pa la snyoms par 'jug la /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa 'am phyir mi 'ong ba yang rung ste zag pa med pa'i bsam gtan @25a * // bzhi pa rgyun dang ldan pa la snyoms par 'jug cing / de las langs nas de nyid zag pa dang bcas pa rgyun dang ldan pa la snyoms par 'jug la /
translated: An arhat or nonreturner enters meditative attainment in the fourth uncontaminated absorption and exits.🔽Then he enters meditative attainment in the contaminated fourth absorption and exits.

original: yang zag pa med pa la snyoms par 'jug ste /
analyzed: yang zag pa med pa la snyoms par 'jug ste /
translated: Then he enters meditative attainment in the uncontaminated fourth absorption.

original: de bzhin du rgyun phri nas /
analyzed: de bzhin du rgyun phri nas /
translated: In this way, he reduces the duration of the contaminated and uncontaminated absorptions.

original: gang gi tshe skad cig ma gnyis zag pa med pa la snyoms par 'jug cing skad cig ma gnyis zag pa dang bcas pa la snyoms bar 'jug la yang zag pa med pa la snyoms par 'jug go zhes grag ste /
analyzed: gang gi tshe skad cig ma gnyis zag pa med pa la snyoms par 'jug cing skad cig ma gnyis zag pa dang bcas pa la snyoms bar 'jug la yang zag pa med pa la snyoms par 'jug go zhes grag ste /
translated: When he enters meditative attainment in the uncontaminated absorption for two moments and enters meditative attainment in the contaminated absorption for two moments and again enters meditative attainment in the uncontaminated absorption,

original: 'di ni spel ba'i sbyor ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni spel ba'i sbyor ba yin no //
translated: this is the preparation for alternating.

original: skad cig ma ni bsres pas 'grub //
analyzed: skad cig ma ni bsres pas 'grub //
translated: It is accomplished by mixing moments.

original: bye brag tu smra ba rnams na re gang gi tshe zag pa med pa'i skad cig ma'i mjug thogs su zag pa dang bcas pa mngon sum du byed cing /🔽zag pa dang bcas pa'i mjug thogs su yang zag pa med pa mngon sum du byed la /
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba rnams na re gang gi tshe zag pa med pa'i skad cig ma'i mjug thogs su zag pa dang bcas pa mngon sum du byed cing / zag pa dang bcas pa'i mjug thogs su yang zag pa med pa mngon sum du byed la /
translated: Vaibhasikas say: When one manifests that which possesses defilements immediately after an uncontaminated moment and🔽manifests that which is uncontaminated immediately after that which possesses defilements,

original: de ltar zag pa dang bcas pa'i skad cig ma dang zag pa med pa dag tu bsres pas spel ba 'grub pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar zag pa dang bcas pa'i skad cig ma dang zag pa med pa dag tu bsres pas spel ba 'grub pa yin te /
translated: the enhancement of mixing contaminated and uncontaminated moments is accomplished.

original: skad cig ma gnyis ni bar chad med pa'i lam lta bu yin la /
analyzed: skad cig ma gnyis ni bar chad med pa'i lam lta bu yin la /
translated: Two moments are like the uninterrupted path and

original: gsum pa ni rnam par grol ba'i lam lta bu yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gsum pa ni rnam par grol ba'i lam lta bu yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: the third is like the liberated path.

original: de ltar bsam gtan bzhi pa spel nas /
analyzed: de ltar bsam gtan bzhi pa spel nas /
translated: Having enhanced the fourth absorption in this way,

original: de'i stobs kyis gzhan dang gzhan dag kyang spel bar byed de /
analyzed: de'i stobs kyis gzhan dang gzhan dag kyang spel bar byed de /
translated: through its power one enhances other absorptions.

original: dang por 'dod pa'i khams su gling gsum dag tu spel bar byed la /
analyzed: dang por 'dod pa'i khams su gling gsum dag tu spel bar byed la /
translated: First one enhances the absorptions in the three continents of the desire realm.

original: phyis ni yongs su nyams pas gzugs kyi khams su spel bar byed do //
analyzed: phyis ni yongs su nyams pas gzugs kyi khams su spel bar byed do //
translated: Later, due to complete degeneration, one enhances the absorptions in the form realm.

original: sangs rgyas ma gtogs pas skad cig ma spel bar mi nus te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas ma gtogs pas skad cig ma spel bar mi nus te /
translated: No one except a Buddha can increase the moments of the meditative attainment of cessation.

original: de'i phyir rgyun chags gsum la ji srid du 'dod par snyoms par 'jug pa'i sgo nas rdzogs pa yin no zhes bya bar blta'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyun chags gsum la ji srid du 'dod par snyoms par 'jug pa'i sgo nas rdzogs pa yin no zhes bya bar blta'o //
translated: Therefore, one should understand that the three uninterrupted paths are completed by means of meditative attainment of cessation for as long as one wishes.

original: ci'i phyir bsam gtan spel bar byed ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir bsam gtan spel bar byed ce na /
translated: Why do they increase the meditative development of the meditative absorptions?🔽In order to be reborn and to abide,

original: skye dang gnas par bya phyir dang // nyon mongs pas ni 'jig phyir yang //
analyzed: skye dang gnas par bya phyir dang // nyon mongs pas ni 'jig phyir yang //
translated: and also in order to avoid destruction by the defilements.

original: rgyu gsum gyis na bsam gtan spel bar byed de /
analyzed: rgyu gsum gyis na bsam gtan spel bar byed de /
translated: The meditative development of the meditative absorptions is increased for three reasons:

original: phyir mi 'ong ba dbang po rnon po rnams ni gnas gtsang ma rnams su skye bar bya ba'i phyir dang / mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba dbang po rnon po rnams ni gnas gtsang ma rnams su skye bar bya ba'i phyir dang / mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: those non-returners of sharp faculty who are intent on rebirth in the immaculate abodes and those who are intent on abiding in comfort in this life.

original: dbang po rtul po rnams ni nyon mongs pas 'jigs pa'i yang phyir te /
analyzed: dbang po rtul po rnams ni nyon mongs pas 'jigs pa'i yang phyir te /
translated: Those of dull faculty are also intent on avoiding destruction by the defilements,

original: ro myang ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i ting nge 'dzin thag bsrings pa'i sgo nas yongs su mi nyams par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ro myang ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i ting nge 'dzin thag bsrings pa'i sgo nas yongs su mi nyams par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they do not fall away from the meditative absorption associated with enjoyment by means of the meditative development of the meditative absorption that is distant from enjoyment.

original: dgra bcom pa dbang po rnon po rnams ni mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas @25b par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa dbang po rnon po rnams ni mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas @25b par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The sharp faculties of the arhats are for the sake of abiding happily in this life.

original: dbang po rtul po rnams ni nyon mongs pas 'jigs pa'i yang phyir te /
analyzed: dbang po rtul po rnams ni nyon mongs pas 'jigs pa'i yang phyir te /
translated: The dull faculties are also for the sake of fear of affliction.

original: yongs su mi nyams par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yongs su mi nyams par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: They are for the sake of not retrogressing.

original: yang ci'i phyir gnas gtsang mar skye ba lnga kho na yin zhe na /🔽bsam gtan bzhi pa spel mar bsgoms par bshad pa gang yin pa de ni rnam pa lnga'i phyir ;
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir gnas gtsang mar skye ba lnga kho na yin zhe na / bsam gtan bzhi pa spel mar bsgoms par bshad pa gang yin pa de ni rnam pa lnga'i phyir ;
translated: Why are there only five types of birth in the pure abodes?

original: gnas gtsang skye ba lnga kho na //
analyzed: gnas gtsang skye ba lnga kho na //
translated: Those who cultivate the fourth absorption in a mixed way have five types of birth in the pure abodes because they have five types.

original: spel mar bsgom pa de ni chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po dang / shin tu che ba dang / shin tu ches che ba'i bye brag gis rnam pa lnga yin te /
analyzed: spel mar bsgom pa de ni chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po dang / shin tu che ba dang / shin tu ches che ba'i bye brag gis rnam pa lnga yin te /
translated: That mixed cultivation is fivefold due to the distinctions of small, medium, great, extremely great, and extremely greatly great.

original: dang po la ni zag pa med pa dang zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa dang bcas pa dang po dang sems gsum mngon sum du byed do //
analyzed: dang po la ni zag pa med pa dang zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa dang bcas pa dang po dang sems gsum mngon sum du byed do //
translated: In the first, one manifests three minds: uncontaminated, contaminated, and the first contaminated mind.

original: gnyis pa la ni drug go / gsum pa la ni dgu'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa la ni drug go / gsum pa la ni dgu'o //
translated: In the third, nine.

original: bzhi pa la bcu gnyis so //
analyzed: bzhi pa la bcu gnyis so //
translated: In the fourth, twelve.🔽In the fifth, fifteen.

original: lnga pa la ni bco lnga ste /🔽de dag gi 'bras bu ni grangs bzhin du gnas gtsang ma lnga yin la de la zag pa dang bas pa gang yin pa de'i dbang gas de dag tu skye'o //
analyzed: lnga pa la ni bco lnga ste / de dag gi 'bras bu ni grangs bzhin du gnas gtsang ma lnga yin la de la zag pa dang bas pa gang yin pa de'i dbang gas de dag tu skye'o //
translated: The five pure abodes are the fruits of these five paths.🔽According to others, the five pure abodes are so called because of the predominance of the faculties of faith, etc.

original: gzhan dag na re dad pa'i dbang po la sogs pa lhag pa'i phyir lnga yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re dad pa'i dbang po la sogs pa lhag pa'i phyir lnga yin no zhes zer ro //

original: 'gog pa thob pa'i phyir mi 'ong //🔽lus kyis mngon du byed par 'dod //🔽'di la 'gog pa'i thob pa yod pas na 'gog pa thob pa ste /🔽phyir mi 'ong ba gang la la 'gog pa thob pa de ni mya ngan las 'das pa dang 'dra ba'i chos lus kyis mngon sum du byed pa'i phyir lus kyis mngon sum du thob pa zhes bya'o //🔽ji ltar na lugs kyis mngon sum du byed ce na /
analyzed: 'gog pa thob pa'i phyir mi 'ong //🔽lus kyis mngon du byed par 'dod //🔽'di la 'gog pa'i thob pa yod pas na 'gog pa thob pa ste /🔽phyir mi 'ong ba gang la la 'gog pa thob pa de ni mya ngan las 'das pa dang 'dra ba'i chos lus kyis mngon sum du byed pa'i phyir lus kyis mngon sum du thob pa zhes bya'o //🔽ji ltar na lugs kyis mngon sum du byed ce na /
translated: The nonreturners who obtain cessation are destined for nirvana in the intermediate state,

original: sems med pas lus la brten te skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems med pas lus la brten te skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it arises in dependence on a body that is devoid of mind.

original: 'di lta bu yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di lta bu yin par 'gyur te /
translated: This is how it is.

original: de 'gog pa de las langs nas gang las de ni 'di snyam du kye ma 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa dang 'dra bar zhi ba yin no snyam du sems par 'gyur ba rnam par shes pa dang bcas pa'i lus zhi ba
analyzed: de 'gog pa de las langs nas gang las de ni 'di snyam du kye ma 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa dang 'dra bar zhi ba yin no snyam du sems par 'gyur ba rnam par shes pa dang bcas pa'i lus zhi ba
translated: When one has arisen from the attainment of cessation, one thinks, “Oh, the attainment of cessation is peaceful, like nirvana,” because one has obtained a body with consciousness that is peaceful,

original: sngon ma thob pa thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: sngon ma thob pa thob par 'gyur te /
translated: a body that was not previously obtained.

original: de ltar na 'dis de'i zhi ba nyid du lus kyis mngon du byas pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na 'dis de'i zhi ba nyid du lus kyis mngon du byas pa yin te /
translated: Thus, one has actualized the peacefulness of that body.

original: thob pa dang shes pas mngon sum du byed pa dag gis mngon sum du gyur pa ni mngon du byed pa yin no //
analyzed: thob pa dang shes pas mngon sum du byed pa dag gis mngon sum du gyur pa ni mngon du byed pa yin no //
translated: One actualizes it by means of obtaining it and by means of knowledge.

original: mdo las slob pa bco brgyad ces gsungs pa der lus kyis mngon du byed pa ci'i phyir ma gsungs she na /
analyzed: mdo las slob pa bco brgyad ces gsungs pa der lus kyis mngon du byed pa ci'i phyir ma gsungs she na /
translated: Why is actualization by means of the body not mentioned in the sutra that states, “There are eighteen learners”?

original: rgyu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no cause for it.

original: rgyu gang zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu gang zhig yin zhe na /
translated: What is the cause?

original: zag pa med pa'i slob pa gsum dang de'i 'bras bu ste /🔽de'i @26a * //
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i slob pa gsum dang de'i 'bras bu ste / de'i @26a * //
translated: The three learners who are uncontaminated and their results.

original: khyad par gyis slob pa rnams rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: khyad par gyis slob pa rnams rnam par gzhag go //
translated: The learners are established as distinct on the basis of their specific results.

original: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ni slob pa yang ma yin la slob pa'i 'bras bu yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ni slob pa yang ma yin la slob pa'i 'bras bu yang ma yin te /
translated: The meditative attainment of cessation is neither a learner nor the result of a learner.

original: de'i phyir de dang ldan pas slob pa'i khyad par du ma gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir de dang ldan pas slob pa'i khyad par du ma gsungs so //
translated: Therefore it is not said that one who possesses it is distinct as a learner.

original: 'di ni re zhig phyir mi 'ong ba rnams kyi dbye ba che long yin no ;
analyzed: 'di ni re zhig phyir mi 'ong ba rnams kyi dbye ba che long yin no ;
translated: This is the gross classification of nonreturners.

original: / zhib tu dbye na ni stong phrag tu dbye ba yod de /
analyzed: / zhib tu dbye na ni stong phrag tu dbye ba yod de /
translated: If they are classified in detail, there are thousands of types.

original: bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba la dbang po rtul po dang 'bring po dang rnon po'i bye brag gis gsum mo //
analyzed: bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba la dbang po rtul po dang 'bring po dang rnon po'i bye brag gis gsum mo //
translated: Those who attain nirvana in the intermediate state are classified as three: dull, medium and supreme faculties.

original: de dag nyid sa'i bye brag gis bzhi'o //🔽yongs su nyams pa'i chos can la sogs pa'i rigs kyi bye brag gis drug go //
analyzed: de dag nyid sa'i bye brag gis bzhi'o // yongs su nyams pa'i chos can la sogs pa'i rigs kyi bye brag gis drug go //
translated: Those are classified as four by the specific level.🔽Those who fully degenerate and so on are classified as six by the specific type.

original: gnas gzhan gyi bye brag gis bcu drug go //
analyzed: gnas gzhan gyi bye brag gis bcu drug go //
translated: Those who relocate are classified as sixteen by the specific realm.

original: sa dang 'dod chags dang bral ba'i bye brag gis sum cu rtsa drug ste /
analyzed: sa dang 'dod chags dang bral ba'i bye brag gis sum cu rtsa drug ste /
translated: There are thirty-six types of beings who are detached from the desire realm.

original: gzugs kyi khams kyi 'ching ba mtha' dag dang ldan pa nas bsam gtan bzhi pa'i rnam pa brgyad las 'dod chags dang bral ba'i bar ro //
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams kyi 'ching ba mtha' dag dang ldan pa nas bsam gtan bzhi pa'i rnam pa brgyad las 'dod chags dang bral ba'i bar ro //
translated: They are from those who possess all the fetters of the form realm to those who are detached from the eight stages of the fourth absorption.

original: gnas gzhan dang rigs dang 'dod chags dang bral ba dang dbang po'i bye brag gis nyis stong lnga brgyad gu bcu rtsa gnyis te /
analyzed: gnas gzhan dang rigs dang 'dod chags dang bral ba dang dbang po'i bye brag gis nyis stong lnga brgyad gu bcu rtsa gnyis te /
translated: There are 2,542 types of beings who are detached from the form realm.

original: ji ltar byas pas she na /
analyzed: ji ltar byas pas she na /
translated: How is this calculated?

original: gnas gcig na rigs drug go //
analyzed: gnas gcig na rigs drug go //
translated: There are six types of beings in each level.

original: rigs re re la 'ching ba mtha' dag dang ldan pa nas rang gi gnas kyi rnam pa brgyad las 'dod chags dang bral ba'i bar gang zag dgu dgu ste /
analyzed: rigs re re la 'ching ba mtha' dag dang ldan pa nas rang gi gnas kyi rnam pa brgyad las 'dod chags dang bral ba'i bar gang zag dgu dgu ste /
translated: There are nine individuals in each type, from those who possess all the fetters to those who are detached from the eight stages of their own level.

original: dgu drug ni lnga bcu bzhi'o //
analyzed: dgu drug ni lnga bcu bzhi'o //
translated: Six times nine is fifty-four.

original: lnga bcu rtsa bzhi phrag bcu drug ni brgyad brgya drug cu rtsa bzhi'o //
analyzed: lnga bcu rtsa bzhi phrag bcu drug ni brgyad brgya drug cu rtsa bzhi'o //
translated: Fifty-four times sixteen is eight hundred and sixty-four.

original: yang dbang pa'i bye brag gis sum 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang dbang pa'i bye brag gis sum 'gyur te /
translated: Again, there are three times that number due to the different faculties.

original: de ltar byas pas so //
analyzed: de ltar byas pas so //
translated: That is how it is calculated.

original: 'dra bar rtse ba'i phyir bsam gtan 'og ma'i rnam pa dgu las 'dod chags dang bral ba gang yin pa de ni gong ma'i 'ching ba mtha' dag dang ldan par bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dra bar rtse ba'i phyir bsam gtan 'og ma'i rnam pa dgu las 'dod chags dang bral ba gang yin pa de ni gong ma'i 'ching ba mtha' dag dang ldan par bshad pa yin no //
translated: One who is free from attachment to the nine stages of the lower meditative stabilization is said to possess all the bonds of the higher.

original: bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ji lta bar gong du 'pho ba'i bar du yang de dang 'dra bas thams cad bsdus na phyir mi 'ong ba khri nyis stong dgu brgya drug cu yin no //🔽srid rtse'i bar cha brgyad zad pa //
analyzed: bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ji lta bar gong du 'pho ba'i bar du yang de dang 'dra bas thams cad bsdus na phyir mi 'ong ba khri nyis stong dgu brgya drug cu yin no // srid rtse'i bar cha brgyad zad pa //
translated: Since those who transfer to higher levels are similar to those who attain nirvana in the intermediate state, all nonreturners are subsumed by twelve thousand nine hundred and sixty.🔽Those who enter the state of an arhat

original: dgra bcom nyid la zhugs ba yin //
analyzed: dgra bcom nyid la zhugs ba yin //
translated: exhaust the eight levels up to the summit of existence.

original: phyir mi 'ong ba zhes bya ba'i dbang du byas pa ste /
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba zhes bya ba'i dbang du byas pa ste /
translated: This is from the perspective of nonreturners.

original: yang phyir mi 'ong ba de bsam gtan dang po'i rnam pa gcig las 'dod chags dang bral ba nas bzung ste /
analyzed: yang phyir mi 'ong ba de bsam gtan dang po'i rnam pa gcig las 'dod chags dang bral ba nas bzung ste /
translated: Nonreturners who are free from attachment to one stage of the first absorption and so on up to

original: srid pa'i rtse mo'i rnam par brgyad kyi bar spangs pas dgra bcom pa nyid la zhugs pa yin no //
analyzed: srid pa'i rtse mo'i rnam par brgyad kyi bar spangs pas dgra bcom pa nyid la zhugs pa yin no //
translated: those who abandon the eight stages of the summit of existence enter the state of an arhat.

original: dgu yi bar chad med lam yang //
analyzed: dgu yi bar chad med lam yang //
translated: The uninterrupted path to the ninth

original: @26b de srid pa'i rtse mo'i rnam pa dgu pa spong bar byed pa'i bar chad med pa'i lam la gnas pa na /
analyzed: @26b de srid pa'i rtse mo'i rnam pa dgu pa spong bar byed pa'i bar chad med pa'i lam la gnas pa na /
translated: He is abiding on the uninterrupted path that abandons the ninth stage of the summit of existence.

original: yang dgra bcom pa nyid la zhugs pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: yang dgra bcom pa nyid la zhugs pa kho na yin no //
translated: He is still an enterer to the state of an arhat as long as he is on the uninterrupted path that abandons the ninth stage of the summit of existence.

original: de ni rdo rje lta bu yin //
analyzed: de ni rdo rje lta bu yin //
translated: That is the vajra-like concentration.

original: bar chad med pa'i lam de ni phra rgyas thams cad 'joms par byed pa yin pa'i phyir rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bar chad med pa'i lam de ni phra rgyas thams cad 'joms par byed pa yin pa'i phyir rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya'o //
translated: That uninterrupted path is called the vajra-like concentration because it destroys all the negative tendencies.

original: bcom zin pa'i phyir 'dis thams cad 'joms pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: bcom zin pa'i phyir 'dis thams cad 'joms pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: It is not that it destroys all of them because they have already been destroyed.

original: bar chad med pa'i lam thams cad kyi nang nas shin tu che ba yin pa'i phyir thams cad 'joms bar nus pa yin no //
analyzed: bar chad med pa'i lam thams cad kyi nang nas shin tu che ba yin pa'i phyir thams cad 'joms bar nus pa yin no //
translated: But it is able to destroy all of them because it is the greatest of all uninterrupted paths.

original: rdo rje lta bu rnams kyi bye brag ni rnam ba mang po zhig tu brjod de /
analyzed: rdo rje lta bu rnams kyi bye brag ni rnam ba mang po zhig tu brjod de /
translated: Many different types of vajra-like concentrations are mentioned.

original: mi lcogs pa med pas bsdus pa srid pa'i rtse mo'i sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung la dmigs pas sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung la rjes su shes pa'i rnam pa dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa brgyad dang / 'gog pa dang lam la chos shes ba'i rnam pa dag dang mtshungs pa ldan pa brgyad dang /🔽'gog pa la rjes su shes pa'i rnam pa dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa bsam gtan dang po'i 'gog pa la dmigs pa bzhi nas de bzhin du srid pa'i rtse mo'i 'gog pa la dmigs pa'i bar du bzhi dang / lam la rjes su shes pa'i rnam pa dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: mi lcogs pa med pas bsdus pa srid pa'i rtse mo'i sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung la dmigs pas sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung la rjes su shes pa'i rnam pa dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa brgyad dang / 'gog pa dang lam la chos shes ba'i rnam pa dag dang mtshungs pa ldan pa brgyad dang / 'gog pa la rjes su shes pa'i rnam pa dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa bsam gtan dang po'i 'gog pa la dmigs pa bzhi nas de bzhin du srid pa'i rtse mo'i 'gog pa la dmigs pa'i bar du bzhi dang / lam la rjes su shes pa'i rnam pa dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa bzhi ste /
translated: Eight are concomitant with the aspects of subsequent knowledge of the truths of suffering and origin that focus on the suffering and origin of the summit of existence subsumed by unrestricted access concentration.🔽Eight are concomitant with the aspects of Dharma knowledge of the truths of cessation and path and four are concomitant with the aspects of subsequent knowledge of the truth of cessation that focus on the cessa

original: rjes su shes pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa zad par la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rjes su shes pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa zad par la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: tion of the first absorption and so on up to the four that focus on the cessation of the summit of existence and four are concomitant with the aspects of subsequent knowledge of the truth of path.🔽They focus on the summit of existence and the path of the three realms.

original: de dag ni shes pa'i dmigs pa dang rnam pa'i bye brag gis tha dad pa'i phyir rdo rje lta bu lnga bcu rtsa gnyis yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni shes pa'i dmigs pa dang rnam pa'i bye brag gis tha dad pa'i phyir rdo rje lta bu lnga bcu rtsa gnyis yin no //
translated: They are fifty-two vajra-like concentrations, because they are differentiated by the differences of their objects and aspects.

original: mi lcogs pa med pas bsdus pa ji lta bar bsam gtan bzhi pas bsdus pa'i bar dag kyang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: mi lcogs pa med pas bsdus pa ji lta bar bsam gtan bzhi pas bsdus pa'i bar dag kyang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: Just as the vajra-like concentrations are included in the stage of the first concentration, so also are those included in the four concentrations up to the fourth concentration.

original: nam mkha' dang rnam shes mtha' yas dang ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyis bsdus pa rnams ni grangs bzhin du nyi shu rtsa brgyad dang nyi shu rtsa bzhi dang nyi shu yin te /
analyzed: nam mkha' dang rnam shes mtha' yas dang ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyis bsdus pa rnams ni grangs bzhin du nyi shu rtsa brgyad dang nyi shu rtsa bzhi dang nyi shu yin te /
translated: Those included in the spheres of infinite space, infinite consciousness, and nothingness are, respectively, twenty-eight, twenty-four, and twenty,

original: de dag ni chos shes pa dang rjes su shes pas sa 'og ma'i 'gog pa la dmigs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni chos shes pa dang rjes su shes pas sa 'og ma'i 'gog pa la dmigs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the cognition of the truth and subsequent cognition do not focus on the cessation of lower stages.

original: sa 'og mi'i gnyen po la dmigs pa ni yod de /
analyzed: sa 'og mi'i gnyen po la dmigs pa ni yod de /
translated: But they do focus on the antidote of lower stages,

original: de ni phan tshun du rgyu pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: de ni phan tshun du rgyu pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: because they mutually cause each other.

original: / gang dag lam la rjes su shes pa yang sa re re'i gnyen po la dmigs pa yin par 'dod pa de dag gi ltar na nyi shu rtsa brgyad lhag par bsnan nams mi lcogs pa med pas bsdus pa rdo rje lta bu ni brgyad cu yin te
analyzed: / gang dag lam la rjes su shes pa yang sa re re'i gnyen po la dmigs pa yin par 'dod pa de dag gi ltar na nyi shu rtsa brgyad lhag par bsnan nams mi lcogs pa med pas bsdus pa rdo rje lta bu ni brgyad cu yin te
translated: Thus the vajra like concentrations subsumed by unrestricted access concentration are eighty.

original: / bsam gtan bzhi pas bsdus pa'i bar du yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: / bsam gtan bzhi pas bsdus pa'i bar du yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: The same is true for the vajra like concentrations subsumed by the four absorptions.

original: @27a * // nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched la sogs pa dag ni go rims bzhin du bzhi bcu dang / sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / nyi shu rtsa bzhi yin no //
analyzed: @27a * // nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched la sogs pa dag ni go rims bzhin du bzhi bcu dang / sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / nyi shu rtsa bzhi yin no //
translated: The vajra like concentrations subsumed by the base of infinite space and so on are forty, thirty-two, and twenty-four respectively.

original: yang rigs dang dbang po'i bye brag gis ni ches mang ba yin no //🔽gang srid pa'i rtse mo'i rnam pa dgu par bshad pa rdo rje lta bus spangs pa gang yin pa /🔽de zad thob dang zad pa shes //
analyzed: yang rigs dang dbang po'i bye brag gis ni ches mang ba yin no // gang srid pa'i rtse mo'i rnam pa dgu par bshad pa rdo rje lta bus spangs pa gang yin pa / de zad thob dang zad pa shes //
translated: Moreover, they are even more numerous due to the distinctions of lineage and faculty.🔽The vajra like concentration that abandons the ninth stage of the summit of existence is called the “attainment of exhaustion” and the “knowledge of exhaustion.”

original: rnam pa dgu pa de zad pa'i thob pa dang lhan cig tu zad pa shes pa skye ste /
analyzed: rnam pa dgu pa de zad pa'i thob pa dang lhan cig tu zad pa shes pa skye ste /
translated: The vajra like concentration that abandons the ninth stage of the summit of existence is called the “attainment of exhaustion” kṣaya and the “knowledge of exhaustion” kṣayajñāna.

original: rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyi mjug thogs su rnam par grol ba'i lam tham skye ba yin no //
analyzed: rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyi mjug thogs su rnam par grol ba'i lam tham skye ba yin no //
translated: The path of liberation arises immediately after the vajra-like samadhi.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de ni dang po nyid du zag pa thams cad zad pa'i thob pa dang lhan cig skye ba'i phyir zad pa shes pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de ni dang po nyid du zag pa thams cad zad pa'i thob pa dang lhan cig skye ba'i phyir zad pa shes pa yin no //
translated: For this very reason, it is the cognition of exhaustion, because it arises simultaneously with the attainment of the exhaustion of all contaminants.

original: de tshe de mi slob dgra bcom //
analyzed: de tshe de mi slob dgra bcom //
translated: At that time, he is a non-learner and an arhat.

original: yang dgra bcom pa nyid la zhugs pa de zad pa shes pa skye nas mi slob pa dang dgra bcom pa nyid kyi 'bras bu thob pa yin te /
analyzed: yang dgra bcom pa nyid la zhugs pa de zad pa shes pa skye nas mi slob pa dang dgra bcom pa nyid kyi 'bras bu thob pa yin te /
translated: When the cognition of exhaustion arises for the one who has entered the state of an arhat, he attains the fruit of non-learner and arhatship.

original: 'bras bu gzhan gyi phyir slob par bya ba ma med pa'i phyir mi slob pa yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu gzhan gyi phyir slob par bya ba ma med pa'i phyir mi slob pa yin no //
translated: He is a non-learner because he has no more to learn for the sake of another fruit.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de ni gzhan gyi don byed par 'os pa'i phyir dang / 'dod chags dang bcas pa thams cad kyis mchod par 'os pa'i phyir dgra bcom pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de ni gzhan gyi don byed par 'os pa'i phyir dang / 'dod chags dang bcas pa thams cad kyis mchod par 'os pa'i phyir dgra bcom pa yin no //
translated: For this very reason, he is an arhat because he is worthy of worship by all who have desire, since he is worthy of being honored for the sake of others.

original: gang zag sngar bshad pa gzhan bdun ni slob pa dag yin no zhes bya bar grub bo //
analyzed: gang zag sngar bshad pa gzhan bdun ni slob pa dag yin no zhes bya bar grub bo //
translated: The other seven persons previously explained are established as learners.

original: ci'i phyir de dag slob pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de dag slob pa yin zhe na /
translated: Why are they learners?

original: zag pa zad par bya ba'i phyir bslab pa gsum po lhag pa'i tshul khrims dang lhag pa'i sems dang lhag pa'i shes rab la rtag tu slob pa'i dang tshul can yin pa'i phyir to /
analyzed: zag pa zad par bya ba'i phyir bslab pa gsum po lhag pa'i tshul khrims dang lhag pa'i sems dang lhag pa'i shes rab la rtag tu slob pa'i dang tshul can yin pa'i phyir to /
translated: They are learners because they always train in the three trainings: superior morality, superior mind and superior wisdom, in order to eliminate the contaminants.

original: de dag ni tshul khrims dang ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab kyi rang bzhin dag yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni tshul khrims dang ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab kyi rang bzhin dag yin no //
translated: They have the nature of morality, concentration and wisdom.

original: so so'i skye bo yang slob pa yin par 'gyur ro zhe na /🔽ma yin te /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo yang slob pa yin par 'gyur ro zhe na / ma yin te /
translated: But if they are learners, then ordinary beings would also be learners.

original: bden pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mi shes pa'i phyir dang / yang slob ba gtong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bden pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mi shes pa'i phyir dang / yang slob ba gtong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: They are not learners because they do not perfectly know the four truths as they are and they abandon learning.

original: de nyid kyi phyir ci nas kyang gang zhig slob pa de kho na slob pa yin gyi slob pa 'dor ba ni ma yin no zhes dmigs kyis bsal ba shes par bya ba'i phyir mdo las /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir ci nas kyang gang zhig slob pa de kho na slob pa yin gyi slob pa 'dor ba ni ma yin no zhes dmigs kyis bsal ba shes par bya ba'i phyir mdo las /
translated: Therefore, in order to understand that only those who learn are learners and those who abandon learning are not learners, the sutra states:

original: zhi byed bslab pa la slob cing //
analyzed: zhi byed bslab pa la slob cing //
translated: They train in the training that pacifies

original: bslab pa la slob pas ni de'i phyir slob pa zhes bya'o zhes lan gnyis su gsungs so //
analyzed: bslab pa la slob pas ni de'i phyir slob pa zhes bya'o zhes lan gnyis su gsungs so //
translated: Because they train in the training, they are called those in training.

original: 'phags pa rang bzhin du gnas pa ji ltar slob pa'i dang tshul can yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'phags pa rang bzhin du gnas pa ji ltar slob pa'i dang tshul can yin zhe na /
translated: How can noble ones who are established in the nature of things be called those in training?

original: bsam pa'i sgo nas te /
analyzed: bsam pa'i sgo nas te /
translated: They are so called from the point of view of their intention.

original: lam du 'gro ba gnas pa bzhin no //
analyzed: lam du 'gro ba gnas pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like saying of a traveler that he is staying.

original: thob pa dang rjes su 'brel @27b ba'i yang phyir ro //
analyzed: thob pa dang rjes su 'brel @27b ba'i yang phyir ro //
translated: They are also called those in training because they are connected with the acquisition of the state of being a noble one.

original: yang slob pa'i chos rnams gang zhe na /
analyzed: yang slob pa'i chos rnams gang zhe na /
translated: What are the qualities of those in training?

original: slob pa'i zag pa med pa rnams so //
analyzed: slob pa'i zag pa med pa rnams so //
translated: They are the uncontaminated qualities of those in training.

original: mi slob pa rnams gang zhe na /
analyzed: mi slob pa rnams gang zhe na /
translated: What are the qualities of those beyond training?

original: mi slob pa'i zag pa med pa rnams so //
analyzed: mi slob pa'i zag pa med pa rnams so //
translated: They are the uncontaminated qualities of those beyond training.

original: ci'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa slob pa ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa slob pa ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why is nirvana not a quality of those in training?

original: mi slob pa dang so so'i skye bo gnyi ga yang de dang ldan pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: mi slob pa dang so so'i skye bo gnyi ga yang de dang ldan pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: Because both those beyond training and ordinary beings possess it.

original: / ci'i phyir mi slob pa ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: / ci'i phyir mi slob pa ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why is it not a quality of those beyond training?

original: slob pa dang so so'i skye bo gnyi ga yang de dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: slob pa dang so so'i skye bo gnyi ga yang de dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because both those in training and ordinary beings possess it.

original: de dag thams cad ni zhugs pa bzhi dang 'bras bu la gnas pa bzhi dang / 'phags pa'i gang zag brgyad kho na yin te /
analyzed: de dag thams cad ni zhugs pa bzhi dang 'bras bu la gnas pa bzhi dang / 'phags pa'i gang zag brgyad kho na yin te /
translated: All of these are the eight noble beings: the four who are approachers and the four who are abiders in the result.🔽There are four approachers: one who is an approacher to the result of stream entry for the sake of manifesting the result of stream entry, one who is an approacher to the result of once return, one who is an approacher to the result of nonreturn and one who is an approacher to the result of an arhat.

original: 'di lta ste rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa dang / rgyun du zhugs pa nas de bzhin du dgra bcom pa nyid kyi 'bras bu mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa dang / dgra bcom pa'i bar yin no //
analyzed: 'di lta ste rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa dang / rgyun du zhugs pa nas de bzhin du dgra bcom pa nyid kyi 'bras bu mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa dang / dgra bcom pa'i bar yin no //
translated: There are four abiders in the result: the stream enterer, the once returner, the nonreturner and the arhat.

original: ming gi sgo nas ni brgyad yin no //🔽rdzas su ni lnga yin te /
analyzed: ming gi sgo nas ni brgyad yin no // rdzas su ni lnga yin te /
translated: They are eight by name but five by substance.

original: zhugs pa dang po dang 'bras bu la gnas pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: zhugs pa dang po dang 'bras bu la gnas pa bzhi'o //
translated: The first approacher and the four abiders in the result are the five by substance.

original: zhugs pa lhag ma rnams ni 'bras bu la gnas pa gsum las tha mi dad ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhugs pa lhag ma rnams ni 'bras bu la gnas pa gsum las tha mi dad ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The remaining approachers are not different from the three abiders in the result.

original: mthar gyis 'thob ba'i phyir de skad ces bshad kyi /
analyzed: mthar gyis 'thob ba'i phyir de skad ces bshad kyi /
translated: They are explained in that way because they are obtained serially.

original: phal cher dang 'dod pa las 'dod chags dang bral ba dag cig yin na ni mthong ba'i lam la lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la zhugs pa dag yin gyi /
analyzed: phal cher dang 'dod pa las 'dod chags dang bral ba dag cig yin na ni mthong ba'i lam la lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la zhugs pa dag yin gyi /
translated: If they are detached from the realm of desire, they are candidates for the fruit of once-returner or for the fruit of non-returner.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba dag ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba dag ni ma yin no //
translated: They are not candidates for the fruit of stream-enterer or for the fruit of once-returner.

original: bsgom pa'i lam 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa rnam pa gnyis su bshad pa la /
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa rnam pa gnyis su bshad pa la /
translated: The path of cultivation is twofold: mundane and supramundane.

original: slob pa 'di gang gis gang las 'dod chags dang bral ba 'thob ce na /
analyzed: slob pa 'di gang gis gang las 'dod chags dang bral ba 'thob ce na /
translated: By what path and from what realm is the detached person detached?

original: 'jig rten 'das kyis srid rtse las //
analyzed: 'jig rten 'das kyis srid rtse las //
translated: The detached person is detached from the summit of cyclic existence by the supramundane path.

original: chags bral 'jig rten pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: chags bral 'jig rten pas ni ma yin no //
translated: He is not detached by the mundane path.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: de'i gong na 'jig rten pa med pa'i phyir dang / rang gis pa'i gnyen po ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i gong na 'jig rten pa med pa'i phyir dang / rang gis pa'i gnyen po ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no mundane path higher than it, and because it is not the counter-agent of the summit of cyclic existence.

original: ci'i phyir gnyen po ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir gnyen po ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why is it not the counter-agent?

original: de'i nyon mongs pa rgyas par 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: de'i nyon mongs pa rgyas par 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because the defilements of the summit of cyclic existence are activated by it.

original: nyon mongs pa gang zhig dngos po gang la rgyas par 'gyur ba de ni dngos po des spong bar byed pa ma yin la /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa gang zhig dngos po gang la rgyas par 'gyur ba de ni dngos po des spong bar byed pa ma yin la /
translated: The affliction that increases through a thing does not abandon that thing.

original: gang gi gnyen po gang yin pa de la ni nyon mongs pa de rgyas par yang mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi gnyen po gang yin pa de la ni nyon mongs pa de rgyas par yang mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: And the antidote to a thing does not increase that affliction.

original: gzhan las rnam pa gnyis //
analyzed: gzhan las rnam pa gnyis //
translated: Two types from other realms.

original: srid pa'i rtse mo las gzhan pa'i sa thams cad las @28a * //🔽ni 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis kyang 'dod chags dang bral la /
analyzed: srid pa'i rtse mo las gzhan pa'i sa thams cad las @28a * // ni 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis kyang 'dod chags dang bral la /
translated: From all the stages other than the summit of existence,🔽one is detached through the mundane path.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pas kyang 'dod chags dang bral lo //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pas kyang 'dod chags dang bral lo //
translated: One is also detached through the transcendent lokottara path.

original: 'jig rten pa yis chags bral ba'i //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa yis chags bral ba'i //
translated: The noble ones who are detached through the mundane path

original: 'phags la bral ba'i thob rnams gnyis //
analyzed: 'phags la bral ba'i thob rnams gnyis //
translated: have two types of obtainment of detachment.

original: 'phags pa 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis 'dod chags dang bral bar gyur pa la bral ba'i thob pa 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa dang rnam pa gnyis skye'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis 'dod chags dang bral bar gyur pa la bral ba'i thob pa 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa dang rnam pa gnyis skye'o //
translated: The noble ones who are detached through the mundane path have two types of obtainment of detachment: mundane and transcendent.

original: kha cig 'jig rten 'das kyis kyang //
analyzed: kha cig 'jig rten 'das kyis kyang //
translated: Some say: They are also detached through the transcendent path.

original: gzhan dag na re 'jig rten las 'das pas kyang de dang 'dra'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re 'jig rten las 'das pas kyang de dang 'dra'o zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say: It is similar for transcendent paths.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: btang la nyon mongs mi ldan phyir //
analyzed: btang la nyon mongs mi ldan phyir //
translated: Because one relinquishes and does not possess affliction.

original: gal te 'phags pa'i lam gyis 'dod chags dang bral ba 'thob pa la 'jig rten pa'i bral ba'i thob pa mi skye na /
analyzed: gal te 'phags pa'i lam gyis 'dod chags dang bral ba 'thob pa la 'jig rten pa'i bral ba'i thob pa mi skye na /
translated: If the obtainment of freedom from attachment by the ārya path does not generate the obtainment of freedom from attachment through the mundane path,

original: de lta na 'phags pa'i lam gyis ci yang med pa'i skye mched las 'dod chags dang bral ba bsam gtan la brten te dbang po rnams 'pho bar byed pa gang yin pa de lam snga ma zad par btang pa'i phyir dang / 'bras bu'i lam 'ba' zhig thob pa'i phyir sa gong ma pa'i nyon mongs pa'i bral ba dang mi ldan par yang 'gyur la /
analyzed: de lta na 'phags pa'i lam gyis ci yang med pa'i skye mched las 'dod chags dang bral ba bsam gtan la brten te dbang po rnams 'pho bar byed pa gang yin pa de lam snga ma zad par btang pa'i phyir dang / 'bras bu'i lam 'ba' zhig thob pa'i phyir sa gong ma pa'i nyon mongs pa'i bral ba dang mi ldan par yang 'gyur la /
translated: then when āryas who are free from attachment to the base of nothingness upgrade their intellectual faculty in dependence on the absorptions, they would not possess freedom from affliction of higher realms because they would relinquish the former path and obtain only the path of result.

original: de btang na yang nyon mongs pa de dag dang ldan par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de btang na yang nyon mongs pa de dag dang ldan par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: And if they relinquish that, they would again possess those afflictions.🔽Those free from half of the summit of existence

original: srid rtse'i phyed las rnam grol dang // gong du skyes pa bzhin mi ldan //
analyzed: srid rtse'i phyed las rnam grol dang // gong du skyes pa bzhin mi ldan //
translated: do not possess it like those born in higher realms.

original: de la 'jig rten pa'i bral ba'i thob pa med du zin kyang de dag dang ldan par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la 'jig rten pa'i bral ba'i thob pa med du zin kyang de dag dang ldan par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Even though they do not obtain mundane freedom from attachment, they are not possessed of those afflictions.

original: dper na srid pa'i rtse mo'i rnam pa phyed la rnam par grol ba la de'i bral ba'i 'thob pa 'jig rten pa yang med la /
analyzed: dper na srid pa'i rtse mo'i rnam pa phyed la rnam par grol ba la de'i bral ba'i 'thob pa 'jig rten pa yang med la /
translated: For example, one liberated by the half-stage of the summit of existence does not obtain mundane freedom from attachment.🔽Even though they relinquish transcendent freedom from attachment through upgrading their intellectual faculty, they are not possessed of those afflictions.

original: dbang po 'pho bas 'jig rten las 'das pa yang btang bzhin du nyon mongs pa de dag dang ldan par mi 'gyur ba dang / yang dper na so so'i skye bo bsam gtan dang po yan chad du skyes pa 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa'i bral ba'i thob pa btang bas yang de dag dang ldan par mi 'gyur ba bzhin bas 'di ni shes par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dbang po 'pho bas 'jig rten las 'das pa yang btang bzhin du nyon mongs pa de dag dang ldan par mi 'gyur ba dang / yang dper na so so'i skye bo bsam gtan dang po yan chad du skyes pa 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa'i bral ba'i thob pa btang bas yang de dag dang ldan par mi 'gyur ba bzhin bas 'di ni shes par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: Also, for example, ordinary beings born in the first absorption and so on relinquish the obtainment of freedom from attachment of the desire realm, but they are not possessed of those afflictions.

original: sa gang zhig gis gang las 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur zhe na /🔽zag med mi lcogs med pa yis //
analyzed: sa gang zhig gis gang las 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur zhe na / zag med mi lcogs med pa yis //
translated: By which level is one freed from which level?

original: thams cad las ni 'dod chags bral //
analyzed: thams cad las ni 'dod chags bral //
translated: One is freed from all by uncontaminated nonreturn.

original: srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar las so //
analyzed: srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar las so //
translated: up to the summit of existence.

original: yang gang zhig nyer bsdogs la brten te sa 'og ma las 'dod chags dang bral ba 'thob na /
analyzed: yang gang zhig nyer bsdogs la brten te sa 'og ma las 'dod chags dang bral ba 'thob na /
translated: If one obtains freedom from attachment to lower levels by relying on access concentration,

original: ci'i phyir rnam par grol ba'i lam @28b thams cad bar chad med pa'i lam bzhin du nyer bsdogs las skye'am zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir rnam par grol ba'i lam @28b thams cad bar chad med pa'i lam bzhin du nyer bsdogs las skye'am zhe na /
translated: why are all liberated paths generated from access concentration, like the uninterrupted path?

original: smras pa / ma yin no //
analyzed: smras pa / ma yin no //
translated: We respond: No.

original: 'o na ji lta bu zhe na /🔽sa gsum rgyal la bsam gtan nam //
analyzed: 'o na ji lta bu zhe na / sa gsum rgyal la bsam gtan nam //
translated: What is it like?🔽The final liberated path of one who conquers three levels

original: nyer bsdogs las mtha'i rnam grol lam //🔽skye ba'i sa ni thams cad du dgu ste /
analyzed: nyer bsdogs las mtha'i rnam grol lam // skye ba'i sa ni thams cad du dgu ste /
translated: arises from absorption or access concentration.

original: 'dod pa'i khams dang bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa brgyad do //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams dang bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa brgyad do //
translated: The level of birth is any of the nine levels: the desire realm and the eight absorption and formless realm levels.

original: de la bsam gtan gnyis kyi bar las 'dod chags dang bral ba sa gsum las rgyal ba de la ni rnam par grol ba'i lam tha ma nyer bsdogs sam bsam gtan dngos gzhi las skye'o //
analyzed: de la bsam gtan gnyis kyi bar las 'dod chags dang bral ba sa gsum las rgyal ba de la ni rnam par grol ba'i lam tha ma nyer bsdogs sam bsam gtan dngos gzhi las skye'o //
translated: The final liberated path of one who conquers three levels, freedom from attachment to the level of the second absorption and below, arises from access concentration or the actual basis of the second absorption.

original: gong ma'i nye bar bsdogs las min //
analyzed: gong ma'i nye bar bsdogs las min //
translated: It does not arise from higher access concentration.

original: sa gsum las rgyal ba yan chad ni btang snyoms kyi dbang po thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir dngos gzhi kho na las skye'i nyer bsdogs las ni ma yin no //🔽bsam gtan gsum na ni nyer bsdogs dang dngos gzhi gnyis kyi dbang po tha dad pa'i phyir la la bsam gtan dang dngos gzhi la 'jug mi nus te /
analyzed: sa gsum las rgyal ba yan chad ni btang snyoms kyi dbang po thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir dngos gzhi kho na las skye'i nyer bsdogs las ni ma yin no // bsam gtan gsum na ni nyer bsdogs dang dngos gzhi gnyis kyi dbang po tha dad pa'i phyir la la bsam gtan dang dngos gzhi la 'jug mi nus te /
translated: The stage of victory over the three realms and above is generated from the actual basis alone, because the faculty of equanimity is not common to access concentration.🔽In the third absorption and above, the faculty of pleasure is common to both access concentration and the actual basis.

original: dbang po'i 'pho ba ni dka' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang po'i 'pho ba ni dka' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: But some are unable to enter the actual basis of the third absorption and above because it is difficult to upgrade faculties.

original: de lta bas nas gsum las 'dod chags dang bral ba la ni rnam par grol ba'i lam tha ma nyer bsdogs las kyang skye'o //🔽zag med mi lcogs med pa yis //
analyzed: de lta bas nas gsum las 'dod chags dang bral ba la ni rnam par grol ba'i lam tha ma nyer bsdogs las kyang skye'o // zag med mi lcogs med pa yis //
translated: Therefore those who are free from attachment to the third absorption and below generate the final liberated path from access concentration.🔽Those free from attachment to all

original: thams cad las ni 'dod chags bral //
analyzed: thams cad las ni 'dod chags bral //
translated: through the uncontaminated unrestricted access concentration.🔽This is explained, but it is not explained by others.

original: zhes bshad kyi gzhan dag gis ni ma bshad pas de'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes bshad kyi gzhan dag gis ni ma bshad pas de'i phyir /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: 'phags / brgyad kyis rang gong sa las rgyal //🔽zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: 'phags / brgyad kyis rang gong sa las rgyal //🔽zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The noble ones conquer their own and higher levels through eight.

original: zag pa med pa'i bsam gtan dang bsam gtan khyad par can dang gzugs med pa brgyad kyis ni rang gi sa dang sa gong ma las 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur ro //🔽'og ma las ni ma yin te /
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i bsam gtan dang bsam gtan khyad par can dang gzugs med pa brgyad kyis ni rang gi sa dang sa gong ma las 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur ro // 'og ma las ni ma yin te /
translated: The eight formless meditative attainments and the uncontaminated meditative attainments and special meditative attainment cause one to become free from attachment to one's own stage and to higher stages.

original: 'dod chags dang bral zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They do not cause one to become free from attachment to lower stages,🔽because one is already free from attachment to lower stages.

original: de la 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bar chad med pa dang rnam par grol ba'i lam rnams ni bden pa la dmigs pa'i phyir bden pa'i rnam par zhugs pa dag yin no zhes bya bar grub po //
analyzed: de la 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bar chad med pa dang rnam par grol ba'i lam rnams ni bden pa la dmigs pa'i phyir bden pa'i rnam par zhugs pa dag yin no zhes bya bar grub po //
translated: The mundane uninterrupted and liberated paths focus on the four truths, because they focus on the four truths.

original: 'jig rten pa yi rnam grol dang // bar chad med lam go rims bzhin //🔽zhi sogs rags sogs rnam pa can //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa yi rnam grol dang // bar chad med lam go rims bzhin // zhi sogs rags sogs rnam pa can //
translated: The mundane liberated and uninterrupted🔽paths have the aspects of peace and coarseness, etc.

original: rnam par grol ba'i lam rnams ni zhi ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa can dag yin la /
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i lam rnams ni zhi ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa can dag yin la /
translated: The liberated paths have the aspects of peace,

original: bar chad med pa'i lam rnams ni rags pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa can dag yin no //
analyzed: bar chad med pa'i lam rnams ni rags pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa can dag yin no //
translated: and the uninterrupted paths have the aspects of coarseness.

original: de dag kyang go rims bzhin du /
analyzed: de dag kyang go rims bzhin du /
translated: They are, respectively,

original: @29a * // gong dang 'go ma'i spyod yul can //
analyzed: @29a * // gong dang 'go ma'i spyod yul can //
translated: The higher and lower stages are the domain of the former and latter.

original: rnam par grol ba'i lam rnams ni ci rigs par sa gong ma la zhi ba dang / gya nom pa dang / nges par 'byung ba'i rnam par blta'o //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i lam rnams ni ci rigs par sa gong ma la zhi ba dang / gya nom pa dang / nges par 'byung ba'i rnam par blta'o //
translated: The paths of liberation are to be seen as peace, excellence, and definite emergence, in the higher stages, as is appropriate.

original: bar chad med pa'i lam rnams ni sa 'go ma la rags pa dang / tha ma ngan pa dang / rtsig pa stug po lta bur blta ste /
analyzed: bar chad med pa'i lam rnams ni sa 'go ma la rags pa dang / tha ma ngan pa dang / rtsig pa stug po lta bur blta ste /
translated: The uninterrupted paths are to be seen as coarse, bad, and like a thick wall, in the lower stages.

original: mngon par 'du byed pa shin tu che ba nyid kyis ma zhi ba'i phyir rags pa blta'o //
analyzed: mngon par 'du byed pa shin tu che ba nyid kyis ma zhi ba'i phyir rags pa blta'o //
translated: They are to be seen as coarse because they are not peaceful due to the great effort of application.

original: gya nom pa ma yin pa'i phyir tha ba ngan par blta ste /
analyzed: gya nom pa ma yin pa'i phyir tha ba ngan par blta ste /
translated: They are to be seen as bad because they are not excellent.

original: gnas ngan len rab tu mang ba nyid kyis mi mthun par gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas ngan len rab tu mang ba nyid kyis mi mthun par gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are not harmonious due to the abundance of negative tendencies.

original: rtsig pa las nges par mi 'byung ba bzhin du de nyid kyis sa de las nges par mi 'byung ba'i phyir rtsig pa steg po lta bur blta'o //
analyzed: rtsig pa las nges par mi 'byung ba bzhin du de nyid kyis sa de las nges par mi 'byung ba'i phyir rtsig pa steg po lta bur blta'o //
translated: They are to be seen as like a thick wall because, like not emerging from a wall, one does not emerge from that stage due to that.

original: de dag las bzlog pa ni zhi ba dang / gya nom pa dang / nges par 'byung ba'i rnam pa can dag yin no //
analyzed: de dag las bzlog pa ni zhi ba dang / gya nom pa dang / nges par 'byung ba'i rnam pa can dag yin no //
translated: The aspects of calm, excellence, and definitive release are the opposite of these.

original: zhar la 'ongs pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: zhar la 'ongs pa rdzogs so /
translated: The digression is concluded.

original: // / dkyus ma kho na brjod par bya ste ;
analyzed: // / dkyus ma kho na brjod par bya ste ;
translated: We must now continue our discussion.

original: yang zad pa shes pa'i mjug thogs su ci zhig skye zhe na /🔽gal te mi g-yo zad shes las //
analyzed: yang zad pa shes pa'i mjug thogs su ci zhig skye zhe na / gal te mi g-yo zad shes las //
translated: What arises immediately after the cognition of exhaustion?

original: mi skye'i blo gros /
analyzed: mi skye'i blo gros /
translated: If one is unshakable, the cognition of nonarising.

original: gal te dgra bcom pa mi g-yo ba'i chos can zhig yin na de la zad pa shes pa'i de ma thag tu mi skye ba'i shes ba skye'o //
analyzed: gal te dgra bcom pa mi g-yo ba'i chos can zhig yin na de la zad pa shes pa'i de ma thag tu mi skye ba'i shes ba skye'o //
translated: If the perfected being is of unshakable nature, the cognition of nonarising immediately follows the cognition of exhaustion.

original: gal te min //
analyzed: gal te min //
translated: If one is not of unshakable nature,

original: zad pa shes sam mi slob lta /🔽gal te mi g-yo ba'i chos can ma yin na ni zad pa shes pa las zad pa shes pa kho na'am /
analyzed: zad pa shes sam mi slob lta / gal te mi g-yo ba'i chos can ma yin na ni zad pa shes pa las zad pa shes pa kho na'am /
translated: the cognition of exhaustion or the right view of the adept.

original: mi slob pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba skye'o //
analyzed: mi slob pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba skye'o //
translated: If the perfected being is not of unshakable nature, the cognition of exhaustion is immediately followed either by the cognition of exhaustion or by the right view of the adept.

original: yongs su nyams pa srid pa'i phyir mi skye bshes pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yongs su nyams pa srid pa'i phyir mi skye bshes pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The cognition of nonarising does not arise, because regression is possible.

original: ci mi g-yo ba'i chos can la de mi skye ba kho na yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: ci mi g-yo ba'i chos can la de mi skye ba kho na yin nam zhe na /
translated: Does the unshakable one never produce this cognition?

original: de ni dgra bcom thams cad la //
analyzed: de ni dgra bcom thams cad la //
translated: The unshakable one is not always in a state of concentration.

original: mi g-yo ba'i chos can la yang res 'ga' mi skye ba shes pa las mi skye ba shes pa kho na skye la /
analyzed: mi g-yo ba'i chos can la yang res 'ga' mi skye ba shes pa las mi skye ba shes pa kho na skye la /
translated: Sometimes, the unshakable one produces the cognition of exhaustion from the cognition of exhaustion alone, and not from the cognition of non-arising.

original: res 'ga' ni mi slob pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba skye'o //
analyzed: res 'ga' ni mi slob pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba skye'o //
translated: Sometimes, he produces right view of the adept from right view of the adept alone, and not from the cognition of exhaustion.🔽The four fruits that have just been mentioned are the fruits of what?

original: gang dag 'bras bu bzhir bshad pa de dag gang gi 'bras bu dag yin zhe na dge sbyong gi tshul gyi 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: gang dag 'bras bu bzhir bshad pa de dag gang gi 'bras bu dag yin zhe na dge sbyong gi tshul gyi 'bras bu yin no //
translated: They are the fruits of the way of virtuous endeavor.

original: dge sbyong gi tshul zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig ce na /🔽dge sbyong tshul ni dri med lam //
analyzed: dge sbyong gi tshul zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig ce na / dge sbyong tshul ni dri med lam //
translated: What is the way of virtuous endeavor?🔽The way of virtuous endeavor is the stainless path.

original: dge sbyong gi tshul ni zag pa med pa'i lam yin no //
analyzed: dge sbyong gi tshul ni zag pa med pa'i lam yin no //
translated: The way of virtuous endeavor is the pure path.

original: des nyon mongs pa yang dag par zhi bar byed pa'i sgo nas dge sbyong du 'gyur te /
analyzed: des nyon mongs pa yang dag par zhi bar byed pa'i sgo nas dge sbyong du 'gyur te /
translated: One becomes a śramaṇa by means of it, because it causes the defilements to be abandoned.

original: mdo las / 'dis sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos zhes bya ba nas rgyas par rga shir 'gyur ba'i bar rnam pa du ma zhi bar @29b byas pa yin pas /
analyzed: mdo las / 'dis sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos zhes bya ba nas rgyas par rga shir 'gyur ba'i bar rnam pa du ma zhi bar @29b byas pa yin pas /
translated: Because he has pacified many types of evil, nonvirtuous phenomena, up to and including aging and death,

original: de'i phyir dge sbyong zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir dge sbyong zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: he is called an ascetic.

original: so so'i skye bo ni gtan du zhi bar mi byed pa'i phyir don dam pa'i dge sbyong ma yin no //🔽dge sbyong gi tshul de'i 'bras bu 'dus byas 'dus ma byas /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo ni gtan du zhi bar mi byed pa'i phyir don dam pa'i dge sbyong ma yin no // dge sbyong gi tshul de'i 'bras bu 'dus byas 'dus ma byas /
translated: An ordinary person is not a true ascetic because he does not pacify them permanently.🔽The conditioned and unconditioned are🔽the results of the ascetic life.

original: dge sbyong gi tshul gyi 'bras bu ni 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas rnams yin no /
analyzed: dge sbyong gi tshul gyi 'bras bu ni 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas rnams yin no /
translated: The results of the ascetic life are conditioned and unconditioned.

original: de dag kyang mdo las rnam pa bzhir gsungs so //
analyzed: de dag kyang mdo las rnam pa bzhir gsungs so //
translated: The sutras declare that they are of four types.

original: gzhan yang de dag brgyad cu rtsa dgu'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang de dag brgyad cu rtsa dgu'o //
translated: They are also eighty-nine.

original: de dag kyang gang zhe na //
analyzed: de dag kyang gang zhe na //
translated: What are they?

original: grol lam zad pa rnams dang bcas //
analyzed: grol lam zad pa rnams dang bcas //
translated: The conditioned results of the ascetic life are the eight perfect knowledges, the ten qualities of one beyond training, and the unfixed result.

original: mthong bas spang bar bya ba spong bar byed pa'i bar chad med pa'i lam brgyad dang / rnam par grol ba'i lam brgyad dang / bsgom pas spang bar bya ba spong bar byed pa sa dgu po re re zhing yang nyon mongs pa rnam pa dgu dgu spong bar byed pa de snyed kho na'i bar chad med pa'i lam dang rnam par grol ba'i lam dag go //
analyzed: mthong bas spang bar bya ba spong bar byed pa'i bar chad med pa'i lam brgyad dang / rnam par grol ba'i lam brgyad dang / bsgom pas spang bar bya ba spong bar byed pa sa dgu po re re zhing yang nyon mongs pa rnam pa dgu dgu spong bar byed pa de snyed kho na'i bar chad med pa'i lam dang rnam par grol ba'i lam dag go //
translated: The eight uninterrupted paths that abandon objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing and the eight liberated paths, and the uninterrupted paths and liberated paths that abandon the ninefold classes of afflictions to be abandoned by the path of meditation on the nine remaining levels are the same number.

original: de la bar chad med pa'i lam rnams ni dge sbyong gi tshul yin no //
analyzed: de la bar chad med pa'i lam rnams ni dge sbyong gi tshul yin no //
translated: The uninterrupted paths are the system of training in virtue.

original: rnam par grol ba'i lam rnams ni dge sbyong gi tshul gyi 'bras bu 'dus byas dag yin te /
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i lam rnams ni dge sbyong gi tshul gyi 'bras bu 'dus byas dag yin te /
translated: The conditioned results of the system of training in virtue are the liberated paths.
