original: de'i rgyu mthun pa dang / skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ro /
analyzed: de'i rgyu mthun pa dang / skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ro /
translated: They are the result of natural outflow and the result of conscious effort.

original: nyon mongs pa de dag gi spangs pa ni dge sbyong gi tshul gyi 'bras bu 'dus ma byas dag yin te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa de dag gi spangs pa ni dge sbyong gi tshul gyi 'bras bu 'dus ma byas dag yin te /
translated: The unconditioned results of the system of training in virtue are the abandonment of those afflictions.

original: de ltar brgyad cu rtsa dgu yin no //
analyzed: de ltar brgyad cu rtsa dgu yin no //
translated: Thus there are eighty-nine.

original: de ltar na 'o na ni sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa kha bskang bar bya dgos par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar na 'o na ni sangs rgyas kyis gsungs pa kha bskang bar bya dgos par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then the Buddha’s statements must be supplemented.

original: bya mi dgos te /
analyzed: bya mi dgos te /
translated: They do not need to be supplemented.

original: gal te yang 'bras bu rnams mang mod kyi /
analyzed: gal te yang 'bras bu rnams mang mod kyi /
translated: Although there are many results,

original: 'bras bu bzhi rnam gzhag pa ni //
analyzed: 'bras bu bzhi rnam gzhag pa ni //
translated: the four results are posited

original: rgyu lnga dag ni srid phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu lnga dag ni srid phyir ro //
translated: because five causes are possible.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis spong ba'i lam gyi gnas skabs gang la rgyu lnga srid pa de la 'bras bu rnam par gzhag go zhes grag go //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis spong ba'i lam gyi gnas skabs gang la rgyu lnga srid pa de la 'bras bu rnam par gzhag go zhes grag go //
translated: The Bhagavān posits the results in the context of the path of abandonment when five causes are possible.

original: lnga gang zhe na //
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na //
translated: What are the five?🔽Giving up the former result,🔽obtaining another, combining the eliminations,🔽obtaining the eight knowledges,

original: 'bras la sngon lam btang ba dang // gzhan thob pa dang zad bsdoms dang / shes pa brgyad tshan thob pa dang // rnam pa bcu drug thob pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras la sngon lam btang ba dang // gzhan thob pa dang zad bsdoms dang / shes pa brgyad tshan thob pa dang // rnam pa bcu drug thob pa'o //
translated: and obtaining the sixteen aspects.

original: lam snga ma btang ba dang sngon med pa'i lam thob pa ni zhugs pa dang 'bras bu'i lam btang ba dang thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lam snga ma btang ba dang sngon med pa'i lam thob pa ni zhugs pa dang 'bras bu'i lam btang ba dang thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Giving up the former path and obtaining a former non-path is giving up and obtaining the path of entry and the result.

original: spangs pa bsdoms pa ni thams cad kyis thob pa cig rnyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spangs pa bsdoms pa ni thams cad kyis thob pa cig rnyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Combining eliminations is obtaining all at once.

original: shes pa brgyad cig car du 'thob pa ni chos dang rjes su shes pa rnam pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: shes pa brgyad cig car du 'thob pa ni chos dang rjes su shes pa rnam pa bzhi'o //
translated: The possession of eight cognitions at one time is the four aspects of cognition of the doctrine and subsequent cognition.

original: rnam pa bcu drug thob pa ni mi rtag pa'i rnam pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: rnam pa bcu drug thob pa ni mi rtag pa'i rnam pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The possession of sixteen aspects is the aspects of impermanence, etc.

original: rgyu lnga po de dag ni 'bras bu re re la yod do //🔽gal te zag pa med @30a * //
analyzed: rgyu lnga po de dag ni 'bras bu re re la yod do // gal te zag pa med @30a * //
translated: These five causes exist for each result.

original: pa'i lam kho na dge sbyong gi tshul yin na 'jig rten ba'i lam gyis thob pa'i 'bras bu gnyis ji ltar dge sbyong gi tshul gyi 'bras bur rung zhe na /
analyzed: pa'i lam kho na dge sbyong gi tshul yin na 'jig rten ba'i lam gyis thob pa'i 'bras bu gnyis ji ltar dge sbyong gi tshul gyi 'bras bur rung zhe na /
translated: If the state of a sramanera is only the uncontaminated path, how can the two results obtained by the mundane path be suitable as results of the sramana?

original: 'jig rten pa yis thob 'bras ni //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa yis thob 'bras ni //
translated: The result obtained by the mundane path

original: bsres dang zag med thob 'dzin phyir //
analyzed: bsres dang zag med thob 'dzin phyir //
translated: is mixed with the uncontaminated result because it holds obtainment.

original: de la ni lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu 'am phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis 'bras bu spangs pa kho na yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de la ni lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu 'am phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis 'bras bu spangs pa kho na yang ma yin no //
translated: The result of once-returner or nonreturner is not just the abandonment obtained by the mundane path.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: mthong ba'i lam gyis 'bras bu spangs pa yang der bsre bar bya ste /
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam gyis 'bras bu spangs pa yang der bsre bar bya ste /
translated: The abandonment obtained by the path of seeing is also mixed with it.

original: thams cad kyi thob pa de'i 'bras bur bsdus pa cig rnyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad kyi thob pa de'i 'bras bur bsdus pa cig rnyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the obtainment of all is subsumed as the result of that.

original: de nyid kyi phyir mdo las /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir mdo las /
translated: Therefore a sutra states:

original: lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu gang zhe na /
analyzed: lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu gang zhe na /
translated: What is the fruit of once-returner?

original: kun du sbyor ba gsum spangs pa dang / 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug rnams bsrabs pa gang yin pa de yin na //
analyzed: kun du sbyor ba gsum spangs pa dang / 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug rnams bsrabs pa gang yin pa de yin na //
translated: It is the abandonment of three fetters and the reduction of attachment, aversion and delusion.

original: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu gang zhe na /
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu gang zhe na /
translated: What is the fruit of non-returner?

original: kun du sbyor ba tha ma'i cha dang mthun pa lnga spangs pa gang yin pa de yin no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: kun du sbyor ba tha ma'i cha dang mthun pa lnga spangs pa gang yin pa de yin no zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is the abandonment of five fetters that are part of the higher realms.

original: de'i stobs kyis yongs su nyams pa mi 'chi ba'i phyir bral ba'i thob pa zag pa med pas spangs pa de 'dzin par yang byed de /
analyzed: de'i stobs kyis yongs su nyams pa mi 'chi ba'i phyir bral ba'i thob pa zag pa med pas spangs pa de 'dzin par yang byed de /
translated: Because one does not die through the power of that, one also seizes that abandonment by the obtainment of separation that is uncontaminated.

original: 'di'i phyir yang 'di dge sbyong gi 'bras bu nyid du rigs so //
analyzed: 'di'i phyir yang 'di dge sbyong gi 'bras bu nyid du rigs so //
translated: For this reason also, it is logical that this is the fruit of the spiritual trainee.

original: dge sbyong gi tshul du bshad pa gang yin pa /
analyzed: dge sbyong gi tshul du bshad pa gang yin pa /
translated: The path of the spiritual trainee

original: de nyid tshangs tshul tshangs pa yi //
analyzed: de nyid tshangs tshul tshangs pa yi //
translated: is also called the brahma conduct and the brahma way.

original: 'khor lo // nyon mongs pa rnams spong ba'i phyir tshangs pa'i tshul lo //
analyzed: 'khor lo // nyon mongs pa rnams spong ba'i phyir tshangs pa'i tshul lo //
translated: It is the Brahma wheel because it eliminates the afflictions.🔽The wheel of Brahma

original: tshangs pa'i 'khor lo ni /
analyzed: tshangs pa'i 'khor lo ni /
translated: is the wheel of the Dharma,

original: tshangs pas bskor phyir ro //
analyzed: tshangs pas bskor phyir ro //
translated: because it is turned by Brahma.

original: bcom ldan 'das ni tshangs pa'i tshul bla na med pa dang ldan pa'i phyir tshangs pa yin te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ni tshangs pa'i tshul bla na med pa dang ldan pa'i phyir tshangs pa yin te /
translated: The Bhagavat is Brahma because he possesses the unsurpassed Brahma way of life.🔽A sutra declares,

original: mdo las / bcom ldan 'das de ni tshangs pa zhes kyang bya /
analyzed: mdo las / bcom ldan 'das de ni tshangs pa zhes kyang bya /
translated: The Bhagavat is called Brahma,

original: zhi ba dang bsil bar gyur pa zhes kyang bya zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //🔽'khor lo 'di ni de'i yin pas na tshangs pa'i 'khor lo ste /
analyzed: zhi ba dang bsil bar gyur pa zhes kyang bya zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro // 'khor lo 'di ni de'i yin pas na tshangs pa'i 'khor lo ste /
translated: and he is called peaceful and cool.

original: des bskor pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des bskor pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The wheel of Brahma is the wheel of the Dharma because it is turned by him.

original: chos kyi 'khor lo mthong ba'i lam /
analyzed: chos kyi 'khor lo mthong ba'i lam /
translated: The wheel of Dharma is the path of seeing

original: rgyu bas na 'khor lo'o //
analyzed: rgyu bas na 'khor lo'o //
translated: Because it moves, it is a wheel.

original: de dang chos mthun pa'i phyir mthong ba'i lam ni chos kyi 'khor lo yin no //
analyzed: de dang chos mthun pa'i phyir mthong ba'i lam ni chos kyi 'khor lo yin no //
translated: The path of seeing is the wheel of Dharma because it is similar to a wheel.

original: 'di'i chos mthun pa ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: 'di'i chos mthun pa ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: How is it similar?

original: myur bar 'gro sogs rtsibs sogs kyis /
analyzed: myur bar 'gro sogs rtsibs sogs kyis /
translated: It moves quickly and so on, like a wheel.

original: myur du 'gro ba'i phyir dang / 'dor ba dang 'jug pa'i phyir dang / ma rgyal ba rgyal bar byed pa dang rgyal ba rnal du dgod pa'i phyir dang / 'phar ba dang 'bab pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: myur du 'gro ba'i phyir dang / 'dor ba dang 'jug pa'i phyir dang / ma rgyal ba rgyal bar byed pa dang rgyal ba rnal du dgod pa'i phyir dang / 'phar ba dang 'bab pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it moves quickly, because it casts off and takes up, because it conquers the unconquered and stabilizes the conquered, and because it rises and falls.

original: myur bar 'gro ba la sogs pa ni de lta bu yin no //
analyzed: myur bar 'gro ba la sogs pa ni de lta bu yin no //
translated: It moves quickly, etc., in this way.

original: btsun pa @30b dbyangs sgrogs na re 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa ni rtsibs la sogs pa dang chos mthun pa'i phyir 'khor lo zhes bya ste /
analyzed: btsun pa @30b dbyangs sgrogs na re 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa ni rtsibs la sogs pa dang chos mthun pa'i phyir 'khor lo zhes bya ste /
translated: Bhadanta Ghoṣaka says: The eightfold noble path is called a wheel because its members are similar to spokes, etc.

original: yang dag pa'i lta ba dang rtog pa dang rtsol ba dang dran pa rnams ni rtsibs lta bu yin no //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i lta ba dang rtog pa dang rtsol ba dang dran pa rnams ni rtsibs lta bu yin no //
translated: Right view, thought, effort, and mindfulness are like spokes.

original: yang dag pa'i ngag dang las kyi mtha' dang 'tsho ba rnams ni lte ba lta bu yin no //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ngag dang las kyi mtha' dang 'tsho ba rnams ni lte ba lta bu yin no //
translated: Right speech, action, and livelihood are like the hub.

original: ting nge 'dzin ni mu khyud lta bu yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin ni mu khyud lta bu yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Concentration is like the rim.

original: mthong ba'i lam chos kyi 'khor lo yin no zhes bya ba 'di ga las she na 'phags pa koondi n+ya la de skyes pa na chos kyi 'khor lo bskor to zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam chos kyi 'khor lo yin no zhes bya ba 'di ga las she na 'phags pa koondi n+ya la de skyes pa na chos kyi 'khor lo bskor to zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Why? Because it is said that when it arose in the ārya Kauṇḍinya, he turned the wheel of Dharma.

original: ji ltar na de lan gsum du bzlas pa dang rnam pa bcu gnyis yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na de lan gsum du bzlas pa dang rnam pa bcu gnyis yin zhe na /
translated: How is it repeated three times and has twelve aspects?

original: bye brag tu smra ba rnams na re /
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba rnams na re /
translated: Vaibhasikas say:

original: 'di ni sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden pa'o //
translated: This is the ārya truth of suffering.

original: de yongs su shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de yongs su shes par bya'o //
translated: It should be fully known.🔽It has been fully known.

original: de yongs su shes so zhes bya ba 'di dag ni lan gsum du bzlas pa yin no //
analyzed: de yongs su shes so zhes bya ba 'di dag ni lan gsum du bzlas pa yin no //
translated: These are the three repetitions.

original: bzlas pa re re la mig skyes so //
analyzed: bzlas pa re re la mig skyes so //
translated: In each repetition, eye,🔽knowledge,🔽and understanding arose.

original: shes pa dang rigs pa dang blo skyes so zhes bya ba 'di dag ni rnam pa bcu gnyis yin te /
analyzed: shes pa dang rigs pa dang blo skyes so zhes bya ba 'di dag ni rnam pa bcu gnyis yin te /
translated: These are the twelve aspects.

original: bden pa re re la yang de dang 'dra'o //🔽gsum tshan dang bcu gnyis su chos mthun pa'i phyir lan gsum du bzlas te /
analyzed: bden pa re re la yang de dang 'dra'o // gsum tshan dang bcu gnyis su chos mthun pa'i phyir lan gsum du bzlas te /
translated: Each truth is similar.

original: rnam pa bcu gnyis zhes bshad de /
analyzed: rnam pa bcu gnyis zhes bshad de /
translated: Because it is similar in three sets of four and in twelve, it is said to be repeated three times and to have twelve aspects.

original: gnyis dang / gnas bdun la mkhas pa bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: gnyis dang / gnas bdun la mkhas pa bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: and the seven abodes.

original: bzlas pa 'di dag gis ni grangs bzhin du mthong ba dang bsgom pa dang mi slob pa'i lam rnams bstan to zhes zer ro //
analyzed: bzlas pa 'di dag gis ni grangs bzhin du mthong ba dang bsgom pa dang mi slob pa'i lam rnams bstan to zhes zer ro //
translated: These repetitions indicate the paths of insight, cultivation, and the path of no training, respectively.

original: gal te de lta na 'o na ni mthong ba'i lam kho na la lan gsum du bzlas pa yang ma yin la rnam pa bcu gnyis kyang ma yin na ji ltar na mthong ba'i lam 'di chos kyi 'khor lor rnam par gzhag / de lta bas na chos
analyzed: gal te de lta na 'o na ni mthong ba'i lam kho na la lan gsum du bzlas pa yang ma yin la rnam pa bcu gnyis kyang ma yin na ji ltar na mthong ba'i lam 'di chos kyi 'khor lor rnam par gzhag / de lta bas na chos
translated: If this is so, then the path of insight is neither a threefold repetition nor a twelve aspect, so how can it be posited as the wheel of the Dharma?

original: kyi rnam grangs de nyid chos kyi 'khor lo yang yin lan gsum du bzlas pa dang rnam pa bcu gnyis kyang yin par rung ngo //
analyzed: kyi rnam grangs de nyid chos kyi 'khor lo yang yin lan gsum du bzlas pa dang rnam pa bcu gnyis kyang yin par rung ngo //
translated: Therefore, it is proper to say that the wheel of the Dharma is the same as the sermon of the Dharma, and that it is threefold repetition and twelve aspects.

original: ji ltar na lan gsum du bzlas pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na lan gsum du bzlas pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is it threefold repetition?

original: bden pa rnams lan gsum du bzlas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bden pa rnams lan gsum du bzlas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the truths are repeated three times.

original: ji ltar na rnam pa bcu gnyis yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na rnam pa bcu gnyis yin zhe na /
translated: How is it twelve aspects?

original: bden pa rnams la sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung /
analyzed: bden pa rnams la sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung /
translated: Because the truths have the aspects of suffering, origin,

original: 'gog pa / lam zhes bya ba dang / yongs su shes par bya /
analyzed: 'gog pa / lam zhes bya ba dang / yongs su shes par bya /
translated: the truths of cessation and of the path, and the expressions “should be understood,

original: spang bar bya /
analyzed: spang bar bya /
translated: should be abandoned,

original: mngon sum du bya /
analyzed: mngon sum du bya /
translated: should be realized,🔽should be cultivated,”

original: bsgom par bya zhes bya ba dang // yongs su shes spangs /🔽mngon sum du byas /
analyzed: bsgom par bya zhes bya ba dang // yongs su shes spangs / mngon sum du byas /
translated: “have been understood, have been abandoned,🔽have been realized, have been cultivated,”

original: bsgoms zhes bya ba rnam pa gsum du byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsgoms zhes bya ba rnam pa gsum du byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are made in three parts.

original: de bskor ba ni gzhan gyis rgyud la @31a * //🔽go bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: de bskor ba ni gzhan gyis rgyud la @31a * // go bar byed pa ste /
translated: It is set in motion by the Buddha for the sake of others,

original: don shes par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don shes par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it causes the understanding of the meaning.

original: yang na 'phags pa'i lam thams cad kyang gdul bya'i rgyud la 'jug pa'i phyir chos kyi 'khor lo yin te /
analyzed: yang na 'phags pa'i lam thams cad kyang gdul bya'i rgyud la 'jug pa'i phyir chos kyi 'khor lo yin te /
translated: Or else, the wheel of the Dharma is all the noble path, because it enters the mental continuum of those to be trained.

original: de ni gzhan gyi rgyud la mthong ba'i lam bskyed pa'i phyir bskor bar brtsams pa yin pas de'i phyir bskor ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni gzhan gyi rgyud la mthong ba'i lam bskyed pa'i phyir bskor bar brtsams pa yin pas de'i phyir bskor ba zhes bya'o //
translated: It is set in motion by the Buddha for the sake of others, because it generates the path of seeing in the mental continuum of others.

original: yang khams gang du dge sbyong gi tshul gyi 'bras bu du dag cig 'thob ce na /
analyzed: yang khams gang du dge sbyong gi tshul gyi 'bras bu du dag cig 'thob ce na /
translated: In which realm are the fruits of the sramana’s way obtained?

original: 'dod par gsum thob /
analyzed: 'dod par gsum thob /
translated: Three are obtained in the desire realm.

original: gsum ni 'dod pa'i khams kho nar 'thob kyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gsum ni 'dod pa'i khams kho nar 'thob kyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: Three are obtained only in the realm of desire, not elsewhere.

original: tha ma ni /
analyzed: tha ma ni /
translated: The last is in three.

original: gsum du / dge sbyong gi tshul gyi 'bras bu tha ma ni dgra bcom pa nyid de /
analyzed: gsum du / dge sbyong gi tshul gyi 'bras bu tha ma ni dgra bcom pa nyid de /
translated: The last fruit of the way of virtuous endeavor is the state of an arhat.

original: de ni khams gsum du 'thob po //
analyzed: de ni khams gsum du 'thob po //
translated: It is obtained in the three realms.

original: re zhig 'bras bu gnyis ni 'dod chags dang ma bral bas thob bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir gong mar mi 'thob par yang rigs na gsum pa go //
analyzed: re zhig 'bras bu gnyis ni 'dod chags dang ma bral bas thob bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir gong mar mi 'thob par yang rigs na gsum pa go //
translated: It is reasonable that the first two fruits are not obtained in the higher realms, since they are obtained by those not yet free from attachment.

original: ci'i phyir mi 'thob ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir mi 'thob ce na /
translated: But why is the third not obtained there?

original: gong na mthong lam med /
analyzed: gong na mthong lam med /
translated: The path of seeing does not exist there.

original: 'dod pa'i khams las gang na ni mthong ba'i lam med la //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams las gang na ni mthong ba'i lam med la //
translated: The path of seeing does not exist in any realm higher than the desire realm.

original: de med par yang 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu thob pa med pas zhes bya ba 'di ni gtan tshigs yin no //
analyzed: de med par yang 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu thob pa med pas zhes bya ba 'di ni gtan tshigs yin no //
translated: The reason is that without it, one cannot obtain the fruit of nonreturn, since one is not yet free from attachment.

original: ci'i phyir de na mthong ba'i lam med ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de na mthong ba'i lam med ce na /
translated: Why does the path of seeing not exist there?

original: re zhig gzugs med pa'i khams na ni nyan pa med pa dang / khams 'og ma la mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: re zhig gzugs med pa'i khams na ni nyan pa med pa dang / khams 'og ma la mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: The path of seeing does not exist in the formless realm because there is no listening and it does not focus on lower realms.

original: / gzugs kyi khams na ni /
analyzed: / gzugs kyi khams na ni /
translated: In the form realm,

original: mi skye lung las 'dir rtsom zhing //
analyzed: mi skye lung las 'dir rtsom zhing //
translated: the ordinary beings do not generate the ārya path,

original: der mthar phyin zhes 'byung phyir ro //
analyzed: der mthar phyin zhes 'byung phyir ro //
translated: because it is said that they begin here and complete there.

original: gzugs na spyod pa'i so so'i skye bo rnams ni snyoms par 'jug pa'i bde ba la chags pa'i phyir dang / sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba med pa'i phyir kun du skyo bar mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: gzugs na spyod pa'i so so'i skye bo rnams ni snyoms par 'jug pa'i bde ba la chags pa'i phyir dang / sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba med pa'i phyir kun du skyo bar mi 'gyur la /
translated: Because the ordinary beings who experience the form realm are attached to the pleasure of meditative attainment and do not have the feeling of pain, they do not become disgusted.

original: skyo ba med bar yang 'phags pa'i lam thob par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: skyo ba med bar yang 'phags pa'i lam thob par mi 'gyur te /
translated: And without disgust, they do not obtain the ārya path.

original: 'di ni re zhig rigs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni re zhig rigs pa yin no //
translated: This is the reasoning for the time being.🔽The scriptural passage is this:

original: lung yang / bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bas na gong du 'pho ba'i bar gang zag lnga ni 'dir rtsom zhing der mthar phyin bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa 'di yin no //
analyzed: lung yang / bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bas na gong du 'pho ba'i bar gang zag lnga ni 'dir rtsom zhing der mthar phyin bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa 'di yin no //
translated: The five types of person who pass into nirvāṇa in the intermediate state and those who transfer to a higher level begin here and complete there.

original: rtsom pa zhes bya ba ni lam rtsom pa yin te /
analyzed: rtsom pa zhes bya ba ni lam rtsom pa yin te /
translated: “Begin” means to begin the path,

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i thabs yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i thabs yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the means to nirvāṇa.

original: 'di skad du /
analyzed: 'di skad du /
translated: It is said:

original: gal te mi g-yo'i zad shes la //
analyzed: gal te mi g-yo'i zad shes la //
translated: If the immutable one has the knowledge of elimination,

original: mi skye blo gros zhes bshad de //
analyzed: mi skye blo gros zhes bshad de //
translated: The sixth is called “one who is unshakable.🔽”

original: ci dgra bcom pa la yang dbye ba yod dam zhe na smras pa yod de /
analyzed: ci dgra bcom pa la yang dbye ba yod dam zhe na smras pa yod de /
translated: Are there also distinctions among arhats?

original: dgra bcom drug 'dod /
analyzed: dgra bcom drug 'dod /
translated: There are six types of arhats.🔽A sutra declares:

original: mdo las dgra bcom pa @31b drug gsungs te /🔽yongs su nyams pa'i chos can dang / 'chi bar sems pa'i chos can dang / rjes su srung ba'i chos can dang / gnas pa las mi bskyod pa dang / rtogs pa'i skal ba can dang / mi g-yo ba'i chos can no //
analyzed: mdo las dgra bcom pa @31b drug gsungs te / yongs su nyams pa'i chos can dang / 'chi bar sems pa'i chos can dang / rjes su srung ba'i chos can dang / gnas pa las mi bskyod pa dang / rtogs pa'i skal ba can dang / mi g-yo ba'i chos can no //
translated: There are six types of arhats:

original: de dag las /
analyzed: de dag las /
translated: those who fully degenerate, those who guard the path, those who are steadfast, those who are capable of penetrating, those who attain nirvana in the intermediate state, and those who are destined to the parinirvana of an arhat.

original: lnga ni dad pas mos las skyes //
analyzed: lnga ni dad pas mos las skyes //
translated: Five are resolute due to faith.

original: mi g-yo ba'i chos can ma gtogs pa gzhan lnga ni dad pas mos pa sngon du 'gro ba dag yin no //
analyzed: mi g-yo ba'i chos can ma gtogs pa gzhan lnga ni dad pas mos pa sngon du 'gro ba dag yin no //
translated: The five arhats who are not unshakable are resolute due to faith.

original: de dag rnam grol dus dang sbyor //
analyzed: de dag rnam grol dus dang sbyor //
translated: Their liberation is timely.

original: lnga po 'di dag gi sems kyi rnam par grol ba ni dus dang sbyor bas 'phangs pa yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: lnga po 'di dag gi sems kyi rnam par grol ba ni dus dang sbyor bas 'phangs pa yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: The five arhats who are not unshakable are known as those whose liberation is timely because their liberation is projected by the path that is timely.

original: rtag tu rjes su srung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag tu rjes su srung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: They always guard the path.

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'di dag ni dus kyi rnam par grol ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'di dag ni dus kyi rnam par grol ba zhes bya'o //
translated: For this reason, they are called “liberated according to circumstances.

original: 'di dag ni dus la ltos pa yang yin la rnam par grol ba yang yin pas dus kyi rnam par grol ba dag ste /
analyzed: 'di dag ni dus la ltos pa yang yin la rnam par grol ba yang yin pas dus kyi rnam par grol ba dag ste /
translated: ” They are “liberated according to circumstances” because they are liberated by relying on circumstances.

original: bar gyi tshig mi mngon par byas pa'i phyir mar gyi bum pa bzhin no //
analyzed: bar gyi tshig mi mngon par byas pa'i phyir mar gyi bum pa bzhin no //
translated: The middle term is elided, as in the expression “curd container” for a pot in which curd is kept.

original: 'di dag gi ting nge 'dzin mngon sum du gyur pa ni yo byad dang nad med pa dang yul gyi bye brag la ltos pa'i phyir dus la ltos pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di dag gi ting nge 'dzin mngon sum du gyur pa ni yo byad dang nad med pa dang yul gyi bye brag la ltos pa'i phyir dus la ltos pa yin no //
translated: Their concentration is dependent on circumstances because it depends on the circumstances of material goods, health, and the particular place.

original: mi g-yo'i chos can mi g-yo ba //
analyzed: mi g-yo'i chos can mi g-yo ba //
translated: The steadfast one is unshakable.

original: mi g-yo ba'i chos can gyi rnam par grol ba ni yongs su mi nyams pa'i sgo nas g-yo bar mi nus pa'i phyir mi g-yo ba yin no //
analyzed: mi g-yo ba'i chos can gyi rnam par grol ba ni yongs su mi nyams pa'i sgo nas g-yo bar mi nus pa'i phyir mi g-yo ba yin no //
translated: The unshakable liberated being is unshakable because he cannot be shaken from his state of nonregression.

original: de'i phyir de dus mi sbyor grol //
analyzed: de'i phyir de dus mi sbyor grol //
translated: For this reason, he is liberated independent of circumstances.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de ni dus dang mi sbyor bar rnam par grol ba zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de ni dus dang mi sbyor bar rnam par grol ba zhes bya ba ste /
translated: For this reason, he is called “liberated independent of circumstances.🔽”

original: de ni 'dod dgur ting nge 'dzin mngon sum du gyur ba'i phyir dus la mi ltos par rnam par grol ba yin no //
analyzed: de ni 'dod dgur ting nge 'dzin mngon sum du gyur ba'i phyir dus la mi ltos par rnam par grol ba yin no //
translated: He is liberated independent of a time, because he has mastery in concentration.

original: yang na yongs su nyams pa srid pa dang / mi srid pa'i sgo nas dus gzhan gyi bar dang / gtan du rnam par grol ba'i phyir dus kyi rnam par grol ba dang / dus dang mi sbyor bar rnam par grol ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: yang na yongs su nyams pa srid pa dang / mi srid pa'i sgo nas dus gzhan gyi bar dang / gtan du rnam par grol ba'i phyir dus kyi rnam par grol ba dang / dus dang mi sbyor bar rnam par grol ba nyid yin no //
translated: Or else, he is liberated for a time and definitively liberated, by reason of the possibility or impossibility of retrogressing, respectively.

original: de ni mthong thob rgyu las byung //
analyzed: de ni mthong thob rgyu las byung //
translated: The steadfast one is of the family of the one liberated through understanding.

original: mi g-yo ba'i chos can de ni mthong bas thob pa sngon du 'gro ba yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: mi g-yo ba'i chos can de ni mthong bas thob pa sngon du 'gro ba yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The steadfast one is of the family of the one liberated through understanding.

original: ci dgra bcom pa drug po 'di dag dang po kho na nas de'i rigs can kho na dag cig yin nam /
analyzed: ci dgra bcom pa drug po 'di dag dang po kho na nas de'i rigs can kho na dag cig yin nam /
translated: Are these six types of perfected beings of this family from the very beginning?

original: 'on te phyis yin zhe na //🔽kha cig dang po nas de'i rigs //
analyzed: 'on te phyis yin zhe na // kha cig dang po nas de'i rigs //
translated: Or do they later become such?🔽Some are of this family from the very beginning;

original: kha cig sbyangs pa las gyur to //
analyzed: kha cig sbyangs pa las gyur to //
translated: some become such through purification.

original: kha cig ni dang po nyid nas 'chi bar sems pa'i chos can gyi rigs can yin la kha cig ni yongs su nyams pa'i chos can du gyur pa las dbang @32a * //
analyzed: kha cig ni dang po nyid nas 'chi bar sems pa'i chos can gyi rigs can yin la kha cig ni yongs su nyams pa'i chos can du gyur pa las dbang @32a * //
translated: Some are by nature those who contemplate death from the outset, while others become those who degenerate completely.🔽

original: po rnams sbyangs pas 'chi bar sems pa'i chos can du gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: po rnams sbyangs pas 'chi bar sems pa'i chos can du gyur pa yin te /
translated: Some are by nature those who consider death from the very beginning, while others become those who consider death through purifying their faculties after becoming those who completely degenerate.

original: mi g-yo ba'i chos can du gyur ba'i bar du yang de dang 'dra bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: mi g-yo ba'i chos can du gyur ba'i bar du yang de dang 'dra bar rig par bya'o //
translated: The same should be understood for those who are immutable.

original: de la yongs su nyams pa'i chos can ni yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba'i skal ba dang ldan gyi 'chi bar sems pa la sogs pa'i chos can ni ma yin pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la yongs su nyams pa'i chos can ni yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba'i skal ba dang ldan gyi 'chi bar sems pa la sogs pa'i chos can ni ma yin pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Those who completely degenerate are those who possess the fortune of completely degenerating but not the fortune of becoming those who consider death and so on.

original: 'chi bar sems pa'i chos can ni 'chi bar sems par 'gyur ba'i skal ba can gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'chi bar sems pa'i chos can ni 'chi bar sems par 'gyur ba'i skal ba can gang yin pa'o //
translated: Those who consider death are those who possess the fortune of becoming those who consider death.

original: rjes su srung ba'i chos can ni rjes su srung bar 'gyur ba'i skal ba can gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su srung ba'i chos can ni rjes su srung bar 'gyur ba'i skal ba can gang yin pa'o //
translated: Those who guard the path are those who possess the fortune of guarding the path.

original: gnas pa las mi bskyod pa ni yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba'i rkyen stobs dang ldan pa med na rjes su ma bsrungs kyang gnas par 'gyur ba'i skal ba can yin zhing nyams par mi 'gyur ba dang mngon par brtson pa med na 'phel bar yang mi 'gyur🔽ba'i skal ba can gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: gnas pa las mi bskyod pa ni yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba'i rkyen stobs dang ldan pa med na rjes su ma bsrungs kyang gnas par 'gyur ba'i skal ba can yin zhing nyams par mi 'gyur ba dang mngon par brtson pa med na 'phel bar yang mi 'gyur ba'i skal ba can gang yin pa'o //
translated: One who is capable of stability is capable of remaining for a while without losing the state of an arhat when the conditions for complete degeneration are not strong, but one who is capable of degeneration is capable of degenerating.

original: rtogs pa'i skal pa can ni mi g-yo ba rtogs par 'gyur ba'i skal pa can gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: rtogs pa'i skal pa can ni mi g-yo ba rtogs par 'gyur ba'i skal pa can gang yin pa'o //
translated: One who is capable of penetrating is capable of penetrating the stage of an immutable arhat.

original: mi g-yo ba'i chos can ni yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur ba'i skal ba can gang yin pa de kho na'o //
analyzed: mi g-yo ba'i chos can ni yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur ba'i skal ba can gang yin pa de kho na'o //
translated: One who is immutable is capable of not degenerating.

original: dang po gnyis ni sngon slob pa'i gnas skabs kho na na rgyun du sbyor ba dang gus par sbyor ba med pa yin no //
analyzed: dang po gnyis ni sngon slob pa'i gnas skabs kho na na rgyun du sbyor ba dang gus par sbyor ba med pa yin no //
translated: The first two are those who did not practice continuously and respectfully in the past when they were learners.

original: gsum pa ni rgyun du sbyor ba yin no //
analyzed: gsum pa ni rgyun du sbyor ba yin no //
translated: The third practiced continuously.

original: bzhi pa ni gus par sbyor ba yin no //
analyzed: bzhi pa ni gus par sbyor ba yin no //
translated: The fourth practiced respectfully.

original: lnga pa ni gnyi gar sbyor ba pa ni yin la dbang po rtul po yin no //
analyzed: lnga pa ni gnyi gar sbyor ba pa ni yin la dbang po rtul po yin no //
translated: The fifth is one who combines both and is of dull faculties.

original: drug pa ni gnyi gar sbyor ba dang dbang po rnon po yin no //
analyzed: drug pa ni gnyi gar sbyor ba dang dbang po rnon po yin no //
translated: The sixth is one who combines both and is of sharp faculties.

original: yongs su nyams pa'i chos can yang gdon mi za bar yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba ma yin la /
analyzed: yongs su nyams pa'i chos can yang gdon mi za bar yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba ma yin la /
translated: One who is subject to retrogressing is not necessarily subject to retrogressing.🔽One who is capable of penetrating is not necessarily capable of penetrating.

original: rtogs pa'i skal ba can gyi bar du yang rtogs bar 'gyur ba ma yin gyi srid ba'i phyir de skad ces bshad do //
analyzed: rtogs pa'i skal ba can gyi bar du yang rtogs bar 'gyur ba ma yin gyi srid ba'i phyir de skad ces bshad do //
translated: But since it is possible that they will retrogress, etc., they are described in this way.

original: de ltar byas na khams gsum char na yang dgra bcom pa drug yod par rung ngo //
analyzed: de ltar byas na khams gsum char na yang dgra bcom pa drug yod par rung ngo //
translated: Thus, in the three realms, the six types of arhats are possible.

original: gang dag gi gdon mi za bar yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba nas mngon par rtogs pa'i bar du 'gyur ba de dag gi ltar na 'dod pa'i khams na ni drug go //
analyzed: gang dag gi gdon mi za bar yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba nas mngon par rtogs pa'i bar du 'gyur ba de dag gi ltar na 'dod pa'i khams na ni drug go //
translated: According to those who maintain that one necessarily retrogresses from the fruit of arhatship, etc., there are six types of arhats in the realm of desire.

original: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams dag na ni gnas pa las mi bskyod ba dang / mi g-yo ba'i chos can dang gnyis te /
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams dag na ni gnas pa las mi bskyod ba dang / mi g-yo ba'i chos can dang gnyis te /
translated: In the realms of form and the formless, there are two types: one who is unshakable and one who is capable of penetrating.

original: de gnyis na yongs su nyams pa dang / 'chi bar @32b sems pa dang / dbang po 'pho ba med pa'i phyir ro //🔽'di dag las gang zhig 'bras bu 'am rigs gang las yongs su nyams par 'gyur ro zhe na /🔽bzhi ni rigs las lnga 'bras las //🔽nyams 'gyur / 'chi bar sems pa'i chos can la sogs pa bzhi ni rigs las yongs su nyams par 'gyur ro //🔽yongs su nyams pa'i chos can ni rang gi rigs las yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de gnyis na yongs su nyams pa dang / 'chi bar @32b sems pa dang / dbang po 'pho ba med pa'i phyir ro // 'di dag las gang zhig 'bras bu 'am rigs gang las yongs su nyams par 'gyur ro zhe na / bzhi ni rigs las lnga 'bras las // nyams 'gyur / 'chi bar sems pa'i chos can la sogs pa bzhi ni rigs las yongs su nyams par 'gyur ro // yongs su nyams pa'i chos can ni rang gi rigs las yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Because there is no complete degeneration, death with a degenerated result, or change of intellectual faculty in these two.🔽From what result and from what lineage do they degenerate?🔽🔽Four degenerate from lineage, five from result.🔽🔽The four, the one who is resolute, etc., degenerate from lineage.🔽The one who degenerates does not degenerate from his lineage.🔽🔽

original: yongs su nyams pa'i chos can la sogs pa lnga ni 'bras bu las kyang yongs su nyams par 'gyur ro //🔽de dag kyang /🔽dang po las ma yin /🔽gang gi rigs dang po gang yin pa de las ni de yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur te /🔽slob pa dang mi slob pa'i lam dag gis brtan por byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yongs su nyams pa'i chos can la sogs pa lnga ni 'bras bu las kyang yongs su nyams par 'gyur ro //🔽de dag kyang /🔽dang po las ma yin /🔽gang gi rigs dang po gang yin pa de las ni de yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur te /🔽slob pa dang mi slob pa'i lam dag gis brtan por byas pa'i phyir ro //
