original: slob pa ni 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam dag gis brtan por byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: slob pa ni 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam dag gis brtan por byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the learner has stabilized his or her result through both mundane and supramundane paths.

original: phyis sbyangs pas thob pa gang yin pa de las ni yongs su nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyis sbyangs pas thob pa gang yin pa de las ni yongs su nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: One who obtains it through later training can retrogress from it.

original: gang gi 'bras bu dang po gang yin pa de las kyang yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi 'bras bu dang po gang yin pa de las kyang yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: One who obtains it through the first result can never retrogress from it.

original: lhag ma las ni yongs su nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lhag ma las ni yongs su nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: One can retrogress from the other results.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu las yongs su nyams pa med do //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu las yongs su nyams pa med do //
translated: That is why there is no retrogressing from the fruit of stream-entry.

original: de ltar byas na yongs su nyams pa'i chos can ni rnam pa gsum yin te /
analyzed: de ltar byas na yongs su nyams pa'i chos can ni rnam pa gsum yin te /
translated: Thus, the one who is subject to retrogressing is of three types:

original: de'i so na gnas pa bzhin du yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa dang / dbang po 'pho ba'am /
analyzed: de'i so na gnas pa bzhin du yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa dang / dbang po 'pho ba'am /
translated: he obtains nirvāṇa while remaining as he is; he obtains it by changing his faculties;

original: yongs su nyams nas slob pa nyid du 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: yongs su nyams nas slob pa nyid du 'gyur ba'o //
translated: he obtains it by retrogressing and becoming a learner again.

original: 'chi bar sems pa'i chos can ni bzhi ste /
analyzed: 'chi bar sems pa'i chos can ni bzhi ste /
translated: The one who is resolved on death is of four types:

original: gsum po de dag nyid dang / yongs su nyams pa'i chos can gyi rigs su slar 'ong ba'o //
analyzed: gsum po de dag nyid dang / yongs su nyams pa'i chos can gyi rigs su slar 'ong ba'o //
translated: and the three previously mentioned types, plus the type that regresses to the type subject to ultimate fall.🔽

original: de bzhin du gsum la yang re re bskyed de /
analyzed: de bzhin du gsum la yang re re bskyed de /
translated: and the three types of those who are freed through predominance of faith, and those who attain through views, and those who attain through confidence, and those who are freed through both parts, and those who are freed through wisdom, and those who are freed through the end, and those who are freed through the summit, and those who are freed through the intermediate state, and those who are freed through being born, and those who are freed through little defilement, and those who are freed through sharp faculties, and those who are freed through the Dharma, and those who are freed through the formless realm, and those who are freed through the summit of cyclic existence.🔽In the same way, there are five, six, and seven types for the three who degenerate.

original: go rims bzhin du rnam pa lnga dang drug dang bdun yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: go rims bzhin du rnam pa lnga dang drug dang bdun yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: They should be known in order.

original: de slob par gyur na gang gi rigs dang po gang yin pa de kho na la gnas kyi gzhan dag la ni ma yin no ;
analyzed: de slob par gyur na gang gi rigs dang po gang yin pa de kho na la gnas kyi gzhan dag la ni ma yin no ;
translated: When they become learners, they abide in the type that they first obtained, but not in others.

original: / de lta ma yin na rigs khyad par can rnyed pa'i phyir de 'phel ba kho nar 'gyur gyi yongs su nyams par ni mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: / de lta ma yin na rigs khyad par can rnyed pa'i phyir de 'phel ba kho nar 'gyur gyi yongs su nyams par ni mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were not so, then because they would obtain a special type, they would only increase and not degenerate.

original: ci'i phyir 'bras bu dang po las yongs su nyams pa med ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'bras bu dang po las yongs su nyams pa med ce na /
translated: Why is there no degeneration from the first result?

original: mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams gzhi med pa'i phyir te /🔽de dag ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i @33a * //
analyzed: mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams gzhi med pa'i phyir te / de dag ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i @33a * //
translated: Because those to be abandoned by the path of seeing are groundless.

original: rtsa ba can yin pa'i phyir bdag gi gzhi la 'jug pa can yin na bdag de yang med do //
analyzed: rtsa ba can yin pa'i phyir bdag gi gzhi la 'jug pa can yin na bdag de yang med do //
translated: Because they are rooted in the view of the transitory collection, they engage the basis of the self, but that self does not exist.

original: 'o na med pa la dmigs par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na med pa la dmigs par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: But if they do not exist, then they would be objects of nonexistence.

original: bden pa la dmigs pa'i phyir med pa la dmigs pa ni ma yin gya phyin ci log te dmigs pa dag ni yin no //
analyzed: bden pa la dmigs pa'i phyir med pa la dmigs pa ni ma yin gya phyin ci log te dmigs pa dag ni yin no //
translated: They are not objects of nonexistence because they are objects of the four truths. They are objects of error.

original: de lta ma yin pa'i nyon mongs pa gang zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: de lta ma yin pa'i nyon mongs pa gang zhig yin zhe na /
translated: What are the afflictions that are not like that?

original: khyad par yod de /
analyzed: khyad par yod de /
translated: There is a difference.

original: bdag tu lta ba ni bdag med bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos po la byed pa po dang tshor ba po dang dbang bsgyur ba nyid du bdag yang dag ba ma yin pa sgro 'dogs par byed la /
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba ni bdag med bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos po la byed pa po dang tshor ba po dang dbang bsgyur ba nyid du bdag yang dag ba ma yin pa sgro 'dogs par byed la /
translated: The afflicted view of the self superimposes the self, which does not exist, as the agent, the experiencer, and the one who controls other things, such as form.

original: mthar 'dzin pa la sogs pa yang de'i gzhi la zhugs pa yin pas gzhi med pa dag ces bya'o //
analyzed: mthar 'dzin pa la sogs pa yang de'i gzhi la zhugs pa yin pas gzhi med pa dag ces bya'o //
translated: Since the afflicted view of the extremes and so on are based on that, they are said to be without a basis.

original: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba 'dod chags dang / khong khro ba dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa rnam pa ni gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos po la chags pa dang / kun nas mnar sems dang / khengs pa dang / mi gsal ba'i ngo bor zhugs pa 'ba' zhig tu zad pas gzhi dang bcas pa dag ces bya ste /🔽gang la de dag 'jug par 'gyur ba sdug pa la sogs pa tsam de ni yod kyi /
analyzed: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba 'dod chags dang / khong khro ba dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa rnam pa ni gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos po la chags pa dang / kun nas mnar sems dang / khengs pa dang / mi gsal ba'i ngo bor zhugs pa 'ba' zhig tu zad pas gzhi dang bcas pa dag ces bya ste / gang la de dag 'jug par 'gyur ba sdug pa la sogs pa tsam de ni yod kyi /
translated: Therefore, they are said to have a basis.

original: bdag la sogs pa ni bdag kyang med do //
analyzed: bdag la sogs pa ni bdag kyang med do //
translated: The mere pleasant, etc., in which they are engaged exists, but the self, etc., do not exist.

original: gzhan dag ni 'di skad ces zer te /
analyzed: gzhan dag ni 'di skad ces zer te /
translated: Others say:

original: 'di ltar bsgom pas spang bar bya ba rnams la ni gzhi yid du 'ong ba dang yid du mi 'ong ba'i mtshan nyid so sor nges pa yod kyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar bsgom pas spang bar bya ba rnams la ni gzhi yid du 'ong ba dang yid du mi 'ong ba'i mtshan nyid so sor nges pa yod kyi /
translated: Thus, those to be abandoned by cultivation have a basis that is ascertained as having the characteristics of being pleasant or unpleasant.

original: mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams la ni bdag la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid med de /
analyzed: mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams la ni bdag la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid med de /
translated: But those to be abandoned by the path of seeing do not have the characteristics of a self, etc.

original: de lta bas na gzhi so sor nges pa med pa dag ces bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na gzhi so sor nges pa med pa dag ces bya'o //
translated: Therefore, they are said to be without a basis that is ascertained.

original: gzhan yang 'phags pa des par mi rtog pa la dran pa nyams pas nyon mongs pa rnams skye bar 'gyur gyi nges par rtog pa la ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'phags pa des par mi rtog pa la dran pa nyams pas nyon mongs pa rnams skye bar 'gyur gyi nges par rtog pa la ni ma yin te /
translated: Moreover, the arya who is not definitely conceiving generates the defilements through the loss of mindfulness, but not through definite conceiving.

original: thag pa la sprul gyi 'du shes bzhin no //
analyzed: thag pa la sprul gyi 'du shes bzhin no //
translated: This is like the perception of a snake in a rope.

original: nges par mi rtog pa la ni bdag tu lta ba la sogs pa 'byung bar mi rung ste /
analyzed: nges par mi rtog pa la ni bdag tu lta ba la sogs pa 'byung bar mi rung ste /
translated: But it is not possible for the view of self, etc. to arise in one who is not definitely conceiving,

original: kun du rtog par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun du rtog par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is a form of imagination.

original: de lta bas na mthong bas spang bar bya ba spangs pas sa dang po las yongs su nyams pa med do //
analyzed: de lta bas na mthong bas spang bar bya ba spangs pas sa dang po las yongs su nyams pa med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no falling away from the first stage through the abandonment of that which is to be abandoned by seeing.

original: mdo sde ba rnams na re dgra bcom pa nyid las kyang yongs su nyams pa med do zhes zer te /
analyzed: mdo sde ba rnams na re dgra bcom pa nyid las kyang yongs su nyams pa med do zhes zer te /
translated: The Sautrantikas say: There is no falling away even from the state of arhatship.

original: de nyid rigs pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid rigs pa yin no //
translated: That is reasonable.

original: 'di ji ltar khong du chud ce na /
analyzed: 'di ji ltar khong du chud ce na /
translated: How is this understood?

original: lung dang rigs pa las so //
analyzed: lung dang rigs pa las so //
translated: From scripture and reasoning.

original: lung las ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: lung las ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: How from scripture?

original: dge slong dag 'phags pa'i shes rab kyis @33b spangs pa gang yin pa de ni spangs pa yin no zhes gsungs pa dang / slob pa la bag yod pa la bag yod par bya'o zhes dang smra'o gsungs kyi dgra bcom pa la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dge slong dag 'phags pa'i shes rab kyis @33b spangs pa gang yin pa de ni spangs pa yin no zhes gsungs pa dang / slob pa la bag yod pa la bag yod par bya'o zhes dang smra'o gsungs kyi dgra bcom pa la ni ma yin no //
translated: I say that one should be heedful with regard to the heedful, but not with regard to the arhat.🔽Ananda, I say that even for the arhat, gain and honor are an obstacle.

original: kun dga' bo dgra bcom pa la yang rnyed pa dang bkur stis bar chad byed pa yin par nga smra'o zhes gsungs pa'i mdo de las ni mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa tsam kho na las yongs su nyams par 'gyur bar gsungs par zad de /
analyzed: kun dga' bo dgra bcom pa la yang rnyed pa dang bkur stis bar chad byed pa yin par nga smra'o zhes gsungs pa'i mdo de las ni mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa tsam kho na las yongs su nyams par 'gyur bar gsungs par zad de /
translated: This sutra states that one degenerates from mere abiding in comfort in this life.

original: 'dis sems rnam par grol ba mi g-yo ba lus kyis mngon sum du byas pa gang yin pa de las ni rnam grangs gang gis kyang yongs su nyams par 'gyur bar nga mi smra'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'dis sems rnam par grol ba mi g-yo ba lus kyis mngon sum du byas pa gang yin pa de las ni rnam grangs gang gis kyang yongs su nyams par 'gyur bar nga mi smra'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: I do not say that one can degenerate from the physical manifestation of the unshakable liberation of mind in any circumstance.

original: gal te dus dang sbyor ba la yod do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te dus dang sbyor ba la yod do zhe na /
translated: If you say that it exists for those who attain nirvana in time,

original: kho bo cag kyang de skad ces ni zer ro //🔽ci de dgra bcom pa nyid yin nam /
analyzed: kho bo cag kyang de skad ces ni zer ro // ci de dgra bcom pa nyid yin nam /
translated: We also say this.🔽Are they arhats or are they meditators?

original: 'on te bsam gtan pa rnams yin zhes bya ba dpyad par byas te /🔽bsam gtan dngos gzhi'i ting nge 'dzin ni dus su mngon sum du 'gyur ba'i phyir rnam par grol ba dus dang sbyor ba zhes kyang bya la mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas par bya ba'i phyir yang dang yang du btsal bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir yid
analyzed: 'on te bsam gtan pa rnams yin zhes bya ba dpyad par byas te / bsam gtan dngos gzhi'i ting nge 'dzin ni dus su mngon sum du 'gyur ba'i phyir rnam par grol ba dus dang sbyor ba zhes kyang bya la mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas par bya ba'i phyir yang dang yang du btsal bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir yid
translated: This should be investigated.🔽The concentration of the actual basis of meditative absorption is called “liberation that is timely” because it manifests at the appropriate time.

original: du 'ong ba zhes kyang bya'o //
analyzed: du 'ong ba zhes kyang bya'o //
translated: It is also called “pleasurable” because it is sought again and again in order to abide in pleasure in this life.

original: gzhan dag na re ro myang bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re ro myang bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say: It is called “pleasurable” because it is to be savored.

original: dgra bcom pa nyid kyi rnam par grol ba ni rtag tu rjes su 'brel ba'i phyir dus dang sbyor ba yin par yang mi rung la /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa nyid kyi rnam par grol ba ni rtag tu rjes su 'brel ba'i phyir dus dang sbyor ba yin par yang mi rung la /
translated: The liberation of arhats is not suitable to be called “timely” because it is always associated with arhats.

original: yang don du gnyer bar bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir yid du 'ong ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: yang don du gnyer bar bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir yid du 'ong ba yang ma yin no //
translated: It is also not pleasurable because it is not something to be sought again.

original: gal te yang dgra bcom pa nyid las yongs su nyams pa srid pa zhig tu gyur na /
analyzed: gal te yang dgra bcom pa nyid las yongs su nyams pa srid pa zhig tu gyur na /
translated: If it were possible to retrogress from the status of arhat,

original: ci'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas par lhag pa'i sems las byung ba dag kho na las yongs su nyams par 'gyur bar gsungs par gyur te /
analyzed: ci'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas par lhag pa'i sems las byung ba dag kho na las yongs su nyams par 'gyur bar gsungs par gyur te /
translated: why would the Fortunate One have said that one retrogresses from the enjoyments of the present life, i.e., from the satisfactions of the present life, which are the satisfactions proper to the practitioners?

original: de'i phyir dgra bcom pa thams cad kyi rnam par grol ba ni mi g-yo ba yin par khong du chud do //
analyzed: de'i phyir dgra bcom pa thams cad kyi rnam par grol ba ni mi g-yo ba yin par khong du chud do //
translated: Thus one should understand that the liberation of all the perfected beings is unshakable.

original: mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa dag las ni la la ni rnyed pa dang bkur stis g-yen sbyo ba'i nyes pas dbang nyams pa'i phyir yongs su nyams par 'gyur te /
analyzed: mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa dag las ni la la ni rnyed pa dang bkur stis g-yen sbyo ba'i nyes pas dbang nyams pa'i phyir yongs su nyams par 'gyur te /
translated: From among the enjoyments of the present life, some retrogress through the fault of being occupied with gain and honor;

original: dbang po rtul po gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: dbang po rtul po gang yin pa'o //
translated: this is the case for those of weak faculties.

original: la la yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: la la yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Some do not retrogress;

original: dbang po rnon po gang yin pa'o //🔽de la gang zhig @34a * //
analyzed: dbang po rnon po gang yin pa'o // de la gang zhig @34a * //
translated: this is the case for those of sharp faculties.🔽Among the perfected beings who retrogress,

original: yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba de ni yongs su nyams pa'i chos can yin la /
analyzed: yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba de ni yongs su nyams pa'i chos can yin la /
translated: some are susceptible of retrogressing,

original: gang zhig yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur pa de ni yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur ba'i chos can yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur pa de ni yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur ba'i chos can yin te /
translated: One who does not retrogress is a non-retrogressor.

original: de bzhin du 'chi bar sems pa'i chos can la sogs pa la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'chi bar sems pa'i chos can la sogs pa la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The same for one who has the thought of death, etc.

original: yongs su mi nyams pa'i chos can dang / gnas pa las mi bskyod pa dang / mi g-yo ba'i chos can rnams la khyad par ci yod ce na /
analyzed: yongs su mi nyams pa'i chos can dang / gnas pa las mi bskyod pa dang / mi g-yo ba'i chos can rnams la khyad par ci yod ce na /
translated: What is the difference between the steadfast one, the unshakable one, and the one who is liberated through wisdom?

original: yongs su mi nyams pa'i chos can ni sbyangs pa las gyur pa ni ma yin la /
analyzed: yongs su mi nyams pa'i chos can ni sbyangs pa las gyur pa ni ma yin la /
translated: The steadfast one is not a perfected being by nature.

original: mi g-yo ba'i chos can ni sbyangs pa las gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: mi g-yo ba'i chos can ni sbyangs pa las gyur pa yin te /
translated: The unshakable one is a perfected being by nature.

original: de gnyis ni ting nge 'dzin gyi khyad par gang kho na skyed par byed pa de las yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de gnyis ni ting nge 'dzin gyi khyad par gang kho na skyed par byed pa de las yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: These two, the steadfast one and the unshakable one, do not retrogress from the meditative attainment which they have produced.🔽The unshakable one does not retrogress from the stage in which he is found.

original: gnas pa las mi bskyod pa ni yon tan gang kho nal gnas pa de las yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur ba 'ba' zhig tu zad kyi /
analyzed: gnas pa las mi bskyod pa ni yon tan gang kho nal gnas pa de las yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur ba 'ba' zhig tu zad kyi /
translated: He does not retrogress from the qualities which he has acquired.

original: gzhan yang skyed par mi byed pa'am /
analyzed: gzhan yang skyed par mi byed pa'am /
translated: He does not produce other qualities.

original: skyed par byed na yang de las g-yo bar 'gyur ba yin pas 'di ni khyad par yin par mngon no //
analyzed: skyed par byed na yang de las g-yo bar 'gyur ba yin pas 'di ni khyad par yin par mngon no //
translated: If it were to generate it, it would be unstable.🔽The venerable Saṅgharakṣita, who was a learner, was very attached to the taste of meditative concentration and his faculties were dull. He often regressed from the liberation of mind that is timely and suitable.

original: tshe dang ldan pa gnag tshogs can slob par gyur pa ha cang ro myang ba'i phyir dang / dbang bo rtul po yin pa'i phyir sems rnam par grol ba dus dang sbyor ba pa las yang dang yang du yongs su nyams pa dang / yi chad nas lus dang srog la mi lta bar mtshon gyis 'debs par byed la /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa gnag tshogs can slob par gyur pa ha cang ro myang ba'i phyir dang / dbang bo rtul po yin pa'i phyir sems rnam par grol ba dus dang sbyor ba pa las yang dang yang du yongs su nyams pa dang / yi chad nas lus dang srog la mi lta bar mtshon gyis 'debs par byed la /
translated: He became discouraged and, without regard for his body and life, he took a knife and was about to kill himself.

original: 'chi ba'i dus kho nar dgra bcom pa nyid thob cing yongs su mya ngan las 'das par yang gyur te /
analyzed: 'chi ba'i dus kho nar dgra bcom pa nyid thob cing yongs su mya ngan las 'das par yang gyur te /
translated: But at the very moment of his death, he attained the state of an arhat and passed into parinirvāṇa.

original: de lta bas na de yang dgra bcom pa nyid las yongs su nyams pa ma yin no //🔽bcu las 'phros pa las kyang bskyed par bya ba'i chos ni gcig ste /
analyzed: de lta bas na de yang dgra bcom pa nyid las yongs su nyams pa ma yin no // bcu las 'phros pa las kyang bskyed par bya ba'i chos ni gcig ste /
translated: Therefore, he did not regress from the state of an arhat.🔽The Pañcaviṃśati-sāhasrikā Prajñāpāramitā-upadeśa says,

original: sems rnam par grol ba dus dang sbyor ba yid du 'ong ba yin no //
analyzed: sems rnam par grol ba dus dang sbyor ba yid du 'ong ba yin no //
translated: “The Dharma that is to be generated is one: the liberation of mind that is timely and suitable.”

original: mngon sum du bya ba'i chos ni gcig ste /
analyzed: mngon sum du bya ba'i chos ni gcig ste /
translated: The Dharma that is directly realized is one:

original: sems rnam par grol ba mi g-yo ba yin no zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: sems rnam par grol ba mi g-yo ba yin no zhes gsungs te /
translated: the unshakable liberation of mind.

original: gal te sems rnam par grol ba dus dang sbyor ba pa yid du 'ong ba dgra bcom pa nyid kho na yin par gyur na ;
analyzed: gal te sems rnam par grol ba dus dang sbyor ba pa yid du 'ong ba dgra bcom pa nyid kho na yin par gyur na ;
translated: If the unshakable liberation of mind were the state of an arhat,

original: ci'i phyir bcu tshan de kho na las dgra bcom pa nyid lan gnyis su smos par 'gyur /
analyzed: ci'i phyir bcu tshan de kho na las dgra bcom pa nyid lan gnyis su smos par 'gyur /
translated: why would the state of an arhat be mentioned twice in that list of ten?

original: dgra bcom pa nyid bskyed par bya ba yin par ni gang du yang ma gsungs so //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa nyid bskyed par bya ba yin par ni gang du yang ma gsungs so //
translated: Nowhere does it say that the state of an arhat is to be generated.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: mngon sum du bya ba yin no //
analyzed: mngon sum du bya ba yin no //
translated: It is to be directly realized.

original: dbang po rtul pos bsdus pa'i dgra bcom pa nyid bskyed par @34b bya ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: dbang po rtul pos bsdus pa'i dgra bcom pa nyid bskyed par @34b bya ba yin no zhe na /
translated: If the state of an arhat that is included in the dull faculty is to be generated,

original: yang 'dis ci zhig shes par bya ba yin /
analyzed: yang 'dis ci zhig shes par bya ba yin /
translated: what is it that this person knows?

original: re zhig gal te bskyed par bya bar nus pa yin no zhe na ni /
analyzed: re zhig gal te bskyed par bya bar nus pa yin no zhe na ni /
translated: If it is said that it is possible to generate it,

original: gzhan yang nus so //
analyzed: gzhan yang nus so //
translated: then it is possible for others as well.

original: 'on te bskyed par 'os pa yin no zhe na ni gzhan ches shin tu 'os pa yin te /
analyzed: 'on te bskyed par 'os pa yin no zhe na ni gzhan ches shin tu 'os pa yin te /
translated: If it is said that it is suitable to generate it, then it is even more suitable for others.

original: de lta bas na rnam par grol ba dus dang sbyor ba pa ni dgra bcom pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na rnam par grol ba dus dang sbyor ba pa ni dgra bcom pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, one liberated according to circumstances is not an arhat.

original: 'o na dus kyis rnam par grol ba'i dgra bcom pa zhes ji skad ces bya zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na dus kyis rnam par grol ba'i dgra bcom pa zhes ji skad ces bya zhe na /
translated: But what is an arhat liberated according to circumstances?

original: gang zhig dbang po rtul po'i phyir ting nge 'dzin mngon sum du 'gyur ba dus la ltos pa yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig dbang po rtul po'i phyir ting nge 'dzin mngon sum du 'gyur ba dus la ltos pa yin no //
translated: One who is liberated according to circumstances is an arhat who, because of his dull faculties, depends on time, that is, on favorable circumstances, in order to actualize concentration.

original: bzlog pa ni dus dang mi sbyor bar rnam par grol ba yin no //
analyzed: bzlog pa ni dus dang mi sbyor bar rnam par grol ba yin no //
translated: One who is liberated not according to circumstances is the opposite.🔽The Abhidharma

original: chos mngon pa las kyang /
analyzed: chos mngon pa las kyang /
translated: says:

original: gnas gsum gyis 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyi phra rgyas skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gnas gsum gyis 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyi phra rgyas skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: The proclivity of attachment to pleasure arises through three causes:

original: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyi phra rgyas ma spangs shing yongs su ma shes pa yin /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyi phra rgyas ma spangs shing yongs su ma shes pa yin /
translated: the proclivity of attachment to pleasure is not abandoned and is not thoroughly known;

original: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyi kun nas dkris par gyur pa'i chos rnams kyang snang bar gyur pa yin /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyi kun nas dkris par gyur pa'i chos rnams kyang snang bar gyur pa yin /
translated: the factors associated with attachment to pleasure appear;

original: de la yang tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa yin zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de la yang tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa yin zhes gsungs so //
translated: and there is incorrect mental attention with regard to them.

original: gal te de lta bu ni rgyu yongs su tshang ba las skyes pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de lta bu ni rgyu yongs su tshang ba las skyes pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that such a person is born from the complete assemblage of causes,

original: rgyu yongs su ma tshang bar go gang zhig skye zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu yongs su ma tshang bar go gang zhig skye zhe na /
translated: then what is born from an incomplete assemblage of causes?

original: re zhig lung las ni de lta bu yin no //
analyzed: re zhig lung las ni de lta bu yin no //
translated: This is so according to the scriptures.

original: rigs pa las ji lta bu zhe na /🔽re zhig gal te dgra bcom pa la gang gis na nyon mongs pa rnams gtan tu mi skye ba'i chos nyid du gyur pa de lta bu'i gnyen po zhig skyes na ni ji ltar na yang yongs su nyams par 'gyur /
analyzed: rigs pa las ji lta bu zhe na / re zhig gal te dgra bcom pa la gang gis na nyon mongs pa rnams gtan tu mi skye ba'i chos nyid du gyur pa de lta bu'i gnyen po zhig skyes na ni ji ltar na yang yongs su nyams par 'gyur /
translated: How is it so according to reasoning?🔽If an arhat has generated the antidote that causes the defilements to become dharmas that will never eventuate, then how could he ever retrogress?

original: 'on te ma skyes te de'i sa bon gyi chos nyid gtan du rtsa nas ma bton na ni ji ltar zag pa zad pa yin /
analyzed: 'on te ma skyes te de'i sa bon gyi chos nyid gtan du rtsa nas ma bton na ni ji ltar zag pa zad pa yin /
translated: But if he has not generated it, then how could his contaminants be extinguished if the seeds of the defilements have not been completely eradicated?

original: zag pa ma zad na yang ji ltar dgra bcom pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: zag pa ma zad na yang ji ltar dgra bcom pa nyid yin te /
translated: And if his contaminants have not been extinguished, how could he be an arhat?

original: rigs pa las ni de lta bu yin no //
analyzed: rigs pa las ni de lta bu yin no //
translated: This is so according to reasoning.

original: 'o na ni gang las 'di skad du 'phags pa nyan thos pa dang ldan pa de ltar spyod pa de ltar gnas pa de brgya la res 'ga' zhig dran pa nyams pa las sdig pa mi dge ba'i rnam par rtog pa dag skye bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs🔽pa sol ba'i phung po lta bu'i mdo'i lan gdab dgos so //
analyzed: 'o na ni gang las 'di skad du 'phags pa nyan thos pa dang ldan pa de ltar spyod pa de ltar gnas pa de brgya la res 'ga' zhig dran pa nyams pa las sdig pa mi dge ba'i rnam par rtog pa dag skye bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa sol ba'i phung po lta bu'i mdo'i lan gdab dgos so //
translated: “If a noble śrāvaka acts and abides in this way, then sometimes, due to a lapse in mindfulness, nonvirtuous thoughts arise.”

original: de ni de las dgra bcom pa kho na yin par bstan te /
analyzed: de ni de las dgra bcom pa kho na yin par bstan te /
translated: That sutra states that the arhat alone is like a heap of charcoal.

original: yun ring po nas sems dben ba la gzhol ba yin zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: yun ring po nas sems dben ba la gzhol ba yin zhes bya ba nas /
translated: It says, “For a long time, his mind has been directed to solitude,

original: mya ngan las 'das pa la bab pa yin zhes bya ba'i @35a * //🔽bar du gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa la bab pa yin zhes bya ba'i @35a * // bar du gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: up to he has attained nirvana.”

original: gzhan las de ni dgra bcom pa'i stobs yin par yang gsungs la /
analyzed: gzhan las de ni dgra bcom pa'i stobs yin par yang gsungs la /
translated: And it says that this is the power of the arhat.

original: zag pa'i gnas lta bu'i chos thams cad las ni bsil bar gyur cing bsil bar gyur pa zhes kyang gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zag pa'i gnas lta bu'i chos thams cad las ni bsil bar gyur cing bsil bar gyur pa zhes kyang gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It also says that he is cool and has become cool with regard to all phenomena that are like the abode of defilement.

original: de skad du 'byung ba yang yod mod kyi ji srid du spyod pa legs par ma rtogs pa de srid du slob pa de ltar spyod pa la yang nyon mongs pa 'byung ba srid pa yod pas slob pa'i gnas skabs kyi dbang du mdzad nas de skad du
analyzed: de skad du 'byung ba yang yod mod kyi ji srid du spyod pa legs par ma rtogs pa de srid du slob pa de ltar spyod pa la yang nyon mongs pa 'byung ba srid pa yod pas slob pa'i gnas skabs kyi dbang du mdzad nas de skad du
translated: Indeed, such statements are found, but as long as one does not fully understand the practice, it is possible that affliction will arise in one who practices in that way, even though one is a learner.

original: gsungs pa'i phyir nyes pa med do //
analyzed: gsungs pa'i phyir nyes pa med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no fault in stating that the above is said from the perspective of the stage of being a learner.

original: bye brag tu smra ba rnams ni dgra bcom pa nyid las kyang yongs su nyams par 'gyur bar brjod do //🔽ci dgra bcom pa de dag kho na rigs drug dang ldan nam /
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba rnams ni dgra bcom pa nyid las kyang yongs su nyams par 'gyur bar brjod do // ci dgra bcom pa de dag kho na rigs drug dang ldan nam /
translated: Vaibhasikas say: One can also retrogress from the state of an arhat.

original: 'on te gzhan dag kyang rigs drug dang ldan zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te gzhan dag kyang rigs drug dang ldan zhe na /
translated: Do only arhats possess the six types of faculties or do others possess the six types of faculties?

original: slob dang 'phags min rigs drug ldan //
analyzed: slob dang 'phags min rigs drug ldan //
translated: Learners and non āryas possess six types.

original: slob pa dang so so'i skye bo rnams kyang de bzhin du rigs drug dang ldan te /
analyzed: slob pa dang so so'i skye bo rnams kyang de bzhin du rigs drug dang ldan te /
translated: Learners and ordinary beings also possess the six types of faculties in the same way.

original: dgra bcom pa'i rigs rnams ni de dag sngon du 'gro ba yin no //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa'i rigs rnams ni de dag sngon du 'gro ba yin no //
translated: The six types of faculties of an arhat are the prior state of those.

original: gzhan yang / mthong ba la ni 'pho ba med //
analyzed: gzhan yang / mthong ba la ni 'pho ba med //
translated: Moreover, there is no change in the view.

original: mthong ba'i lam las gzhan pa la dbang po 'pho ba yod kyi sbyor ba mi srid pa'i phyir mthong ba'i lam la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam las gzhan pa la dbang po 'pho ba yod kyi sbyor ba mi srid pa'i phyir mthong ba'i lam la ni ma yin no //
translated: One does not upgrade faculties on the path of seeing, because it is impossible to upgrade faculties while one is in meditative equipoise.

original: la la ni so so'i skye bo'i gnas skabs na dbang po rnams 'pho'o //
analyzed: la la ni so so'i skye bo'i gnas skabs na dbang po rnams 'pho'o //
translated: Some upgrade their faculties while ordinary beings.

original: la la ni dad pas mos pa'i gnas skabs na'o //
analyzed: la la ni dad pas mos pa'i gnas skabs na'o //
translated: Some upgrade their faculties while resolute in faith.

original: mdo las 'di skad du /
analyzed: mdo las 'di skad du /
translated: A sutra states:

original: 'dis mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa lhag pa'i sems las byung ba bzhi thob pa gang dag yin pa de las gang yang rung ba zhig las 'di yongs su nyams par 'gyur bar ni nga smra'i 'di gcig pus sems kyi rnam par grol ba mi g-yo
analyzed: 'dis mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa lhag pa'i sems las byung ba bzhi thob pa gang dag yin pa de las gang yang rung ba zhig las 'di yongs su nyams par 'gyur bar ni nga smra'i 'di gcig pus sems kyi rnam par grol ba mi g-yo
translated: I declare that one may completely degenerate from any of the four meditative attainments of pleasure in this very life, but I do not say that one degenerates from the unshakable liberation of mind alone.

original: ba'i bar du lus kyis mngon sum du byas pa gang yin pa de las ni 'di'i rnam grangs gang gis kyang yongs su nyams par 'gyur bar na mi smra'o zhes gang gsungs pa yang ji ltar na ma g-yo ba'i chos can mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas🔽pa dag las yongs su nyams par 'gyur zhe na /🔽thob dang ma thob nyer spyad las //
analyzed: ba'i bar du lus kyis mngon sum du byas pa gang yin pa de las ni 'di'i rnam grangs gang gis kyang yongs su nyams par 'gyur bar na mi smra'o zhes gang gsungs pa yang ji ltar na ma g-yo ba'i chos can mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa dag las yongs su nyams par 'gyur zhe na / thob dang ma thob nyer spyad las //
translated: How can one who is unshakable fall from abiding happily in this life?🔽One should know that there are three types of falling away:

original: yongs nyams rnam pa gsum shes bya //
analyzed: yongs nyams rnam pa gsum shes bya //
translated: from obtainment, from enjoyment, and from nonobtainment.

original: gal te yon tan thob pa las yongs su nyams na thob pa las yongs su nyams pa yin no //🔽gal te yon tan thob par bya ba ma thob na ma thob pa las yongs su @35b nyams pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te yon tan thob pa las yongs su nyams na thob pa las yongs su nyams pa yin no // gal te yon tan thob par bya ba ma thob na ma thob pa las yongs su @35b nyams pa yin no //
translated: If one falls from the qualities that one has obtained, one falls from obtainment.🔽If one does not obtain the qualities that one should obtain, one falls from nonobtainment.

original: gal te yon tan thob pa mngon sum du mi byed na nye bar spyod pa las yongs su nyams pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te yon tan thob pa mngon sum du mi byed na nye bar spyod pa las yongs su nyams pa yin no //
translated: If one does not manifest the qualities that one has obtained, one falls from enjoyment.

original: yongs su nyams pa 'di rnams las //
analyzed: yongs su nyams pa 'di rnams las //
translated: From among these three types of falling away,

original: ston pa tha ma mi g-yo la //
analyzed: ston pa tha ma mi g-yo la //
translated: the teacher does not fall from the last.

original: bar ma 'ang gzhan la rnam gsum mo //
analyzed: bar ma 'ang gzhan la rnam gsum mo //
translated: The middle one also has three in relation to others.

original: sangs rgyas lan nye bar spyad pa las yongs su nyams pa kho na mnga'i gzhan ni mi mnga'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas lan nye bar spyad pa las yongs su nyams pa kho na mnga'i gzhan ni mi mnga'o //
translated: The Buddha does not have any degeneration of enjoyment, but he does have degeneration of appearance.

original: mi g-yo ba'i chos can la ni de dang ma thob pa las yongs su nyams pa yang yod de /
analyzed: mi g-yo ba'i chos can la ni de dang ma thob pa las yongs su nyams pa yang yod de /
translated: The immutable arhat has degeneration of both that and nonobtainment.

original: gang zag khyad par can gyi chos ma thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang zag khyad par can gyi chos ma thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he has not obtained the qualities of a special being.

original: dgra bcom pa gzhan la ni thob pa las yongs su nyams pa yang yod do //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa gzhan la ni thob pa las yongs su nyams pa yang yod do //
translated: Other arhats have degeneration of obtainment.

original: de'i phyir mi g-yo ba'i chos can nye bar spyad pa las yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba'i phyir mdo dang mi 'gal lo //
analyzed: de'i phyir mi g-yo ba'i chos can nye bar spyad pa las yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba'i phyir mdo dang mi 'gal lo //
translated: Therefore, because the immutable arhat degenerates from enjoyment, there is no contradiction with the sūtra.

original: yongs su mi nyams par smra ba na re thams cad kyi rnam par grol ba zag pa med pa ni mi g-yo ba yin la /
analyzed: yongs su mi nyams par smra ba na re thams cad kyi rnam par grol ba zag pa med pa ni mi g-yo ba yin la /
translated: Those who assert nondegeneration say: The uncontaminated liberation of all arhats is immutable.

original: mi g-yo ba'i chos can du ji ltar rnam par gzhag pa ni de bzhin du bshad zin pa de'i phyir 'di ni klan kar mi rung ngo zhes zer ro //
analyzed: mi g-yo ba'i chos can du ji ltar rnam par gzhag pa ni de bzhin du bshad zin pa de'i phyir 'di ni klan kar mi rung ngo zhes zer ro //
translated: The immutable arhat is posited in that way. Therefore this is not a fault.

original: yang gang zhig dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu las yongs su nyams na ci de yang skye 'am zhe na /
analyzed: yang gang zhig dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu las yongs su nyams na ci de yang skye 'am zhe na /
translated: Also, if one regresses from the result of an arhat, does he or she take birth again?

original: de lta bu ni med de /🔽'di ltar / 'bras las nyams pa 'chi ba med //
analyzed: de lta bu ni med de / 'di ltar / 'bras las nyams pa 'chi ba med //
translated: That is not so,🔽because it is said:🔽One who regresses from the result does not die.

original: 'bras bu las yongs su nyams pa ni 'ga' yang 'chi ba med de /
analyzed: 'bras bu las yongs su nyams pa ni 'ga' yang 'chi ba med de /
translated: One who regresses from the result does not die.🔽A sutra states:

original: mdo las / dge slong dag 'phags pa nyan thos thos pa dang ldan pa la dran pa nyams pa chung du 'byung mod kyi 'on kyang yang myur ba kho nar nub pa dang yongs su zad pa dang yongs su gtugs par 'gyur ro zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mdo las / dge slong dag 'phags pa nyan thos thos pa dang ldan pa la dran pa nyams pa chung du 'byung mod kyi 'on kyang yang myur ba kho nar nub pa dang yongs su zad pa dang yongs su gtugs par 'gyur ro zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Monks, for a noble hearer who possesses learning, even if a small amount of forgetfulness of mindfulness occurs, it quickly disappears, is completely exhausted, and is completely eliminated.

original: de lta ma yin na tshangs par spyod pa yid brtan du mi rung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na tshangs par spyod pa yid brtan du mi rung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were not so, then pure conduct would not be reliable.

original: 'bras bu gang zhig las yongs su nyams pa ni 'bras bu de la gnas pas bya ba ma yin pa gang yin pa'i /
analyzed: 'bras bu gang zhig las yongs su nyams pa ni 'bras bu de la gnas pas bya ba ma yin pa gang yin pa'i /
translated: One who regresses from any result does not perform the actions that are not to be done by one abiding in that result.

original: bya ba ma yin de mi byed //
analyzed: bya ba ma yin de mi byed //
translated: He does not perform that action that is not to be done.

original: yongs su nyams kyang 'bras bu de dang 'gal ba'i bya ba mi byed de /
analyzed: yongs su nyams kyang 'bras bu de dang 'gal ba'i bya ba mi byed de /
translated: Even if one regresses from the fruit, one does not perform the action that is incompatible with that fruit.

original: rtsal po che bred pa rdeg mi 'cha' ba bzhin no //
analyzed: rtsal po che bred pa rdeg mi 'cha' ba bzhin no //
translated: It is like a great athlete who is frightened and does not strike back.

original: yang dbang po rnams 'pho ba la bar chad med pa dang rnam par grol ba'i lam du dag cig skye zhe na /🔽mi g-yo rnam grol bar chad med //
analyzed: yang dbang po rnams 'pho ba la bar chad med pa dang rnam par grol ba'i lam du dag cig skye zhe na / mi g-yo rnam grol bar chad med //
translated: How many uninterrupted and liberated paths arise in the transmutation of faculties?🔽The unshakable have nine.

original: lam dgu'o // rtogs pa'i skal ba can zhig mi g-yo ba'i rigs can rtogs par byed na bar chad med pa'i lam dgu dang / rnam par grol ba'i lam dgu skye ste /
analyzed: lam dgu'o // rtogs pa'i skal ba can zhig mi g-yo ba'i rigs can rtogs par byed na bar chad med pa'i lam dgu dang / rnam par grol ba'i lam dgu skye ste /
translated: If one who possesses the lineage of realization of the unshakable asriddhyaksanatvayi transforms faculties, then nine uninterrupted paths and nine liberated paths arise.

original: dper na dgra bcom pa nyid thob pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na dgra bcom pa nyid thob pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like one who obtains the state of an arhat.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: @36a * // dbang po rtul po'i rigs de shin tu brten phyir ro //
analyzed: @36a * // dbang po rtul po'i rigs de shin tu brten phyir ro //
translated: Because that lineage of dull faculty is very stable.

original: des dbang po rtul po'i rigs de shin tu goms par byas pa yin pas 'bad pa chung dus bzlog par mi nus te /
analyzed: des dbang po rtul po'i rigs de shin tu goms par byas pa yin pas 'bad pa chung dus bzlog par mi nus te /
translated: That person has made that lineage of dull faculty very familiar, and it cannot be reversed with little effort,

original: slob pa dang mi slob pa'i lam dag gis brtan por byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: slob pa dang mi slob pa'i lam dag gis brtan por byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is stabilized by the paths of training and no longer training.

original: mthong bas thob la re re'o //
analyzed: mthong bas thob la re re'o //
translated: For the one who obtains through insight, there is one for each.

original: mthong bas thob pa rtogs par byed na bar chad med pa'i lam gcig kho na dang rnam par grol ba'i lam gcig kho na skye'o //
analyzed: mthong bas thob pa rtogs par byed na bar chad med pa'i lam gcig kho na dang rnam par grol ba'i lam gcig kho na skye'o //
translated: If the one who obtains through insight realizes, there is only one path of no-more-learning and one path of liberation.

original: sbyor ba'i lam ni thams cad du gcig kho na yin no //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i lam ni thams cad du gcig kho na yin no //
translated: The path of preparation is always one.

original: bar chad med pa dang rnam par grol ba'i lam de dag thams cad ni /
analyzed: bar chad med pa dang rnam par grol ba'i lam de dag thams cad ni /
translated: All of these paths of no-more-learning and liberation🔽are uncontaminated.

original: zag med / 'phags pa rnams kyi dbang po ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i lam gyis 'pho ba med do //
analyzed: zag med / 'phags pa rnams kyi dbang po ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i lam gyis 'pho ba med do //
translated: The faculties of the āryas do not change through a contaminated path.

original: dbang po rnams gang du 'pho zhe na /🔽mi yi nang du 'pho //
analyzed: dbang po rnams gang du 'pho zhe na / mi yi nang du 'pho //
translated: Where do the faculties change?🔽They change in the human realm.

original: mi rnams kyi nang kho nar dbang po 'pho'i gzhan du ni ma yin te /
analyzed: mi rnams kyi nang kho nar dbang po 'pho'i gzhan du ni ma yin te /
translated: The faculties change only among humans, not elsewhere,

original: yongs su nyams pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yongs su nyams pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because regression is impossible.

original: gang zhig sa gang la brten nas dbang po rnams 'pho bar byed ce na /
analyzed: gang zhig sa gang la brten nas dbang po rnams 'pho bar byed ce na /
translated: In dependence on which level does one change the faculties?

original: mi slob pa dgu la brten te /
analyzed: mi slob pa dgu la brten te /
translated: One changes the faculties in dependence on nine levels.

original: mi lcogs pa med pa dang / bsam gtan khyad par can dang / bsam gtan bzhi dang / gzugs med pa gsum pa la'o //
analyzed: mi lcogs pa med pa dang / bsam gtan khyad par can dang / bsam gtan bzhi dang / gzugs med pa gsum pa la'o //
translated: the stage of the preliminary stage of the first meditation, the stage of the intermediate meditation, the stage of the special meditation, the stage of the first meditation, the stage of the second meditation, the stage of the third meditation, the stage of the fourth meditation, the stage of the first formless realm, the stage of the second formless realm, the stage of the third formless realm.

original: slob pa drug la /
analyzed: slob pa drug la /
translated: Six learners,

original: gzugs med pa rnams ma gtogs so //🔽ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: gzugs med pa rnams ma gtogs so // ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: excluding the formless realm.🔽Why?

original: gang gi phyir ;🔽'phel ba 'bras bu khyad par can //
analyzed: gang gi phyir ; 'phel ba 'bras bu khyad par can //
translated: Because

original: btang ste 'bras bu thob par 'gyur //
analyzed: btang ste 'bras bu thob par 'gyur //
translated: the result is abandoned and the special result is obtained.

original: dbang po rnams 'pho ba na dbang bo rtul po'i lam gyi 'bras bu dang 'bras bu khyad par can btang ste dbang po rnon po'i rigs kyi lam gyi 'bras bu kho na 'thob par 'gyur na /
analyzed: dbang po rnams 'pho ba na dbang bo rtul po'i lam gyi 'bras bu dang 'bras bu khyad par can btang ste dbang po rnon po'i rigs kyi lam gyi 'bras bu kho na 'thob par 'gyur na /
translated: When the faculties are transformed, the result of the path of dull faculties and the special result are abandoned and only the result of the path of sharp faculties is obtained.

original: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu gzugs med pas bsdus pa ni med do zhes bya ba 'di ni gtan tshigs yin no //
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu gzugs med pas bsdus pa ni med do zhes bya ba 'di ni gtan tshigs yin no //
translated: The formless realm does not subsume the result of nonreturn. This is the reason.

original: dgra bcom pa 'di dag thams cad ni dbang po'i bye brag las dgu kho na yin te /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa 'di dag thams cad ni dbang po'i bye brag las dgu kho na yin te /
translated: All these arhats are only nine due to the distinction of faculties.

original: ji ltar byas pas shi na /
analyzed: ji ltar byas pas shi na /
translated: How is this?

original: sangs rgyas gnyis dang nyan thos bdun //
analyzed: sangs rgyas gnyis dang nyan thos bdun //
translated: Two buddhas and seven śrāvakas.

original: de dgu dbang po rnam dgu can //
analyzed: de dgu dbang po rnam dgu can //
translated: These nine are the nine persons who possess the faculties.

original: nyan thos bdun gang zhe na //
analyzed: nyan thos bdun gang zhe na //
translated: What are the seven śrāvakas?

original: yongs su nyams pa'i chos can la sogs pa lnga dang / mi g-yo ba'i chos can rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: yongs su nyams pa'i chos can la sogs pa lnga dang / mi g-yo ba'i chos can rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Five beginning with the one liable to retrogress, and two of the unshakable ones:

original: sbyangs pa las gyur pa dang / dang po nas de'i rigs can no //
analyzed: sbyangs pa las gyur pa dang / dang po nas de'i rigs can no //
translated: the unshakable one who has attained through views, and the unshakable one who has attained through faculties.

original: sangs rgyas gnyis ni mi g-yo ba'i bye brag kho na yin te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas gnyis ni mi g-yo ba'i bye brag kho na yin te /
translated: The two buddhas are only of the unshakable type.

original: rang sangs rgyas dang / sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas dang / sangs rgyas so //
translated: They are the pratyekabuddha and the buddha.

original: de @36b ltar na de dag ni chung ngu'i chung ngu la sogs pa dbang po rnam ba dgu'i bye brag gis gang zag dgu yin no //
analyzed: de @36b ltar na de dag ni chung ngu'i chung ngu la sogs pa dbang po rnam ba dgu'i bye brag gis gang zag dgu yin no //
translated: Thus, they are nine persons, distinguished by the nine categories of faculties, from weak-weak to strong-strong.

original: 'phags pa'i gang zag rnams ni thams cad du bdun yin te /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i gang zag rnams ni thams cad du bdun yin te /
translated: All of them are seven noble persons.

original: dad pas rjes su 'brang ba dang / chos kyis rjes su 'brang ba dang / dad pas mos pa dang / mthong bas thob pa dang / lus kyis mngon sum du byed pa dang / shes rab kyis rnam par grol ba dang / gnyi ga'i cha las rnam par grol ba'o //
analyzed: dad pas rjes su 'brang ba dang / chos kyis rjes su 'brang ba dang / dad pas mos pa dang / mthong bas thob pa dang / lus kyis mngon sum du byed pa dang / shes rab kyis rnam par grol ba dang / gnyi ga'i cha las rnam par grol ba'o //
translated: 1. the one who follows trust, 2. the one who follows the teaching, 3. the one devoted to truat, 4. the one devoted to insight, 5. the one liberated through predominance of trust, 6. the one liberated through predominance of understanding, 7. the one liberated in both ways.

original: gang zag bdun po de dag kyang sbyor ba dang / dbang po snyoms 'jug rnam grol dang // gnyi gas byas pa'o //
analyzed: gang zag bdun po de dag kyang sbyor ba dang / dbang po snyoms 'jug rnam grol dang // gnyi gas byas pa'o //
translated: These seven persons are made by two things: application, faculties, meditative concentration, and liberation.

original: sbyor ba las ni dad pas rjes su 'brang ba dang / chos kyis rjes su 'brang ba dag ste /
analyzed: sbyor ba las ni dad pas rjes su 'brang ba dang / chos kyis rjes su 'brang ba dag ste /
translated: By application, there are two: the one who follows trust and the one who follows the teaching.

original: dang po nyid nas gzhan gyi dring 'jog pa dang / chos kyis rjes su 'brang ba dag gis don rnams la sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dang po nyid nas gzhan gyi dring 'jog pa dang / chos kyis rjes su 'brang ba dag gis don rnams la sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are applied to the meaning by being placed in dependence on another and by the teaching, respectively.

original: dbang po las ni dad pas mos pa dang / mthong bas thob pa dag ste /
analyzed: dbang po las ni dad pas mos pa dang / mthong bas thob pa dag ste /
translated: By faculties, there are two: the one devoted to trust and the one devoted to insight.

original: dad pas mos pa dang shes rab lhag pa'i sgo nas dbang po rtul po dang rnon po yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dad pas mos pa dang shes rab lhag pa'i sgo nas dbang po rtul po dang rnon po yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are those who attain through predominance of calm, those who attain through predominance of insight, and those who attain through predominance of both.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa las ni lus kyis mngon sum du byed pa ste /🔽'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa mngon sum du byed pa'i phyir ro //🔽rnam par grol ba las ni shes rab kyis rnam par grol ba'o //
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa las ni lus kyis mngon sum du byed pa ste / 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa mngon sum du byed pa'i phyir ro // rnam par grol ba las ni shes rab kyis rnam par grol ba'o //
translated: They are those who attain through the body, those who attain through faith, those who attain through seeing, those who attain through their own nature, those who transfer to higher levels, and those who attain nirvana in the intermediate state.🔽They are those who attain nirvana as soon as they are born, those who attain nirvana with effort, those who attain nirvana without effort, those who go upstream, those who go to the highest, and those who are arhats.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa dang rnam par grol ba las ni gnyi ga'i cha las rnam par grol ba'o //🔽ming gi sgo nas ni gang zag de bdun yin no //
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa dang rnam par grol ba las ni gnyi ga'i cha las rnam par grol ba'o // ming gi sgo nas ni gang zag de bdun yin no //
translated: They are those who attain through degeneration, those who attain through remaining, those who attain through advancement, those who attain through being born in another realm, those who attain through being born in the same realm, those who attain through the formless realm, and those who attain through the form realm.

original: de dag drug / rdzas su ni de dag drug yin te /🔽'di ltar lam gsum la gnyis gnyis /
analyzed: de dag drug / rdzas su ni de dag drug yin te / 'di ltar lam gsum la gnyis gnyis /
translated: They are those who attain through the eyes, those who attain through the ears, those who attain through the body, those who attain through the eyes and the body, those who attain through the eyes, the ears and the body, and those who attain through the mental faculty.🔽They are those who attain through the eyes, those who attain through the ears, those who attain through the nose, those who attain through the tongue, those who attain through the body, and those who attain through the mental faculty.

original: mthong ba'i lam la gang zag gnyis te /🔽dad pas rjes su 'brang ba dang / chos kyis rjes su 'brang ba dag go //🔽de dag nyid bsgom pa'i lam la gnyis te /
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam la gang zag gnyis te / dad pas rjes su 'brang ba dang / chos kyis rjes su 'brang ba dag go // de dag nyid bsgom pa'i lam la gnyis te /
translated: They are those who attain through the eyes, those who attain through the ears, those who attain through the nose, those who attain through the tongue, those who attain through the body, and those who attain through the mental faculty.🔽They are those who attain through the eyes, those who attain through the ears, those who attain through the nose, those who attain through the tongue, those who attain through the body, and those who attain through the mental faculty.🔽They are those who attain through the eyes, those who attain through the ears, those who attain through the nose, those who attain through the tongue, those who attain through the body, and those who attain through the mental faculty.🔽They are those who attain through the eyes, those who attain through the ears, those who attain through the nose, those who attain through the tongue, those who attain through the body, and those who attain through the mental faculty.

original: dad pas mos pa dang / mthong bas thob pa dag go //
analyzed: dad pas mos pa dang / mthong bas thob pa dag go //
translated: They are those who attain through the eyes, those who attain through the ears, those who attain through the nose, those

original: de gnyis kyang mi slob pa'i lam la gnyis yin te /
analyzed: de gnyis kyang mi slob pa'i lam la gnyis yin te /
translated: These two, on the path of no-more-learning, are of two types:

original: dus kyis rnam par grol ba dang // dus dang mi sbyor bar rnam par grol ba dag go //
analyzed: dus kyis rnam par grol ba dang // dus dang mi sbyor bar rnam par grol ba dag go //
translated: those liberated through predominance of faith and those liberated through wisdom.

original: de la dad pas rjes 'brang ba dbang po'i sgo nas ni gsum mo //
analyzed: de la dad pas rjes 'brang ba dbang po'i sgo nas ni gsum mo //
translated: Those liberated through predominance of faith are of three types by way of faculty.

original: rigs kyi sgo nas ni lnga'o //
analyzed: rigs kyi sgo nas ni lnga'o //
translated: They are of five types by way of lineage.

original: lam gyi sgo nas bco lnga ste /
analyzed: lam gyi sgo nas bco lnga ste /
translated: They are of fifteen types by way of path,

original: bzod pa brgyad dang shes pa bdun la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: bzod pa brgyad dang shes pa bdun la gnas pa'o //
translated: abiding in eight acceptances and seven knowledges.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sgo nas ni bdun cu rtsa gsum ste /🔽'ching ba @37a * //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sgo nas ni bdun cu rtsa gsum ste / 'ching ba @37a * //
translated: They are of seventy-three types by way of freedom from attachment.🔽They are of nine types by way of complete bondage

original: mtha' dag dang ldan pa dang 'dod pa las 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir dgu nas de bzhin du ci yang med pa'i skye mched las 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir gyi bar du'o //
analyzed: mtha' dag dang ldan pa dang 'dod pa las 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir dgu nas de bzhin du ci yang med pa'i skye mched las 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir gyi bar du'o //
translated: and freedom from attachment to the desire realm, and so on, up to freedom from attachment to the base of nothingness.

original: rten gyi sgo nas ni dgu ste /
analyzed: rten gyi sgo nas ni dgu ste /
translated: They are of nine types by way of basis,

original: gling gsum dang lha'i ris drug tu skyes pa'o //
analyzed: gling gsum dang lha'i ris drug tu skyes pa'o //
translated: being born in the three continents and six divine classes.

original: dbang po dang rigs dang lam dang 'dod chags dang bral ba dang rten gyi sgo nas bsdoms na ni /
analyzed: dbang po dang rigs dang lam dang 'dod chags dang bral ba dang rten gyi sgo nas bsdoms na ni /
translated: If they are combined by faculty, lineage, path, freedom from attachment and basis,🔽

original: 'bum bzhi khri bdun stong brgyad brgya nyi shu rtsa lngar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'bum bzhi khri bdun stong brgyad brgya nyi shu rtsa lngar 'gyur te /
translated: If one adds up the persons according to their faculties, their spiritual lineages, their paths, their freedom from attachment, and their physical supports, there are 4,788,225.

original: gang zag gzhan dag kyang ci rigs par de bzhin du brtsi bar bya'o //
analyzed: gang zag gzhan dag kyang ci rigs par de bzhin du brtsi bar bya'o //
translated: Other persons should be calculated in the same way, as is appropriate.

original: gnyi ga'i cha las rnam par grol ba zhes bya ba 'di ni gang /
analyzed: gnyi ga'i cha las rnam par grol ba zhes bya ba 'di ni gang /
translated: What is a person who is liberated according to circumstances?

original: shes rab kyis rnam par grol ba ni gang zhe na /
analyzed: shes rab kyis rnam par grol ba ni gang zhe na /
translated: What is a person who is liberated by wisdom?

original: 'gog thob gnyi ga las rnam grol //
analyzed: 'gog thob gnyi ga las rnam grol //
translated: One who has attained cessation is liberated by both.

original: shes rab kyis ni cig shos so //
analyzed: shes rab kyis ni cig shos so //
translated: The other is liberated by wisdom.

original: gang 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa thob pa de ni gnyi ga'i cha las rnam par grol ba yin te /
analyzed: gang 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa thob pa de ni gnyi ga'i cha las rnam par grol ba yin te /
translated: One who has attained the meditative attainment of cessation is liberated by both,

original: shes rab dang ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs dag gis nyon mongs pa dang / snyoms par 'jug pa'i sgrib pa las rnam par grol ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes rab dang ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs dag gis nyon mongs pa dang / snyoms par 'jug pa'i sgrib pa las rnam par grol ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because he is liberated from the obscurations of the passions and the meditative attainment by the power of wisdom and concentration.

original: cig shos ni shes rab kyis rnam par grol ba yin te /
analyzed: cig shos ni shes rab kyis rnam par grol ba yin te /
translated: The other is liberated by wisdom alone,🔽because he is liberated from the obscurations of the passions by the power of wisdom alone.

original: shes rab kyi stobs kyis nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa 'ba' zhig las rnam par grol ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes rab kyi stobs kyis nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa 'ba' zhig las rnam par grol ba'i phyir ro //
translated: For, by the power of their understanding, they are liberated from the obscurations of the defilements alone.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis /
translated: The Lord has said:

original: 'di la gang zhig nyon mongs lnga spangs te //
analyzed: 'di la gang zhig nyon mongs lnga spangs te //
translated: Here, one who has abandoned the five defilements

original: mi 'phrogs chos ldan slob pa yongs su rdzogs //🔽zhes gang gsungs pa /
analyzed: mi 'phrogs chos ldan slob pa yongs su rdzogs // zhes gang gsungs pa /
translated: and possesses the unshakable nature of mind is a perfected being.🔽What is meant by a perfected being?

original: ji tsam gyis na slob pa yongs su rdzogs pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji tsam gyis na slob pa yongs su rdzogs pa yin zhe na /
translated: A perfected being is said to be so on account of meditative concentration,

original: snyoms 'jug dbang po 'bras rnams kyis //🔽slob pa yongs rdzogs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: snyoms 'jug dbang po 'bras rnams kyis // slob pa yongs rdzogs zhes bya'o //
translated: the controlling faculties and the fruits.

original: slob pa yongs su rdzogs pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: slob pa yongs su rdzogs pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: A perfected being is of three kinds:

original: 'bras bu dang / dbang po dang / snyoms par 'jug pa las so //
analyzed: 'bras bu dang / dbang po dang / snyoms par 'jug pa las so //
translated: one who is a perfected being on account of the fruits, one who is a perfected being on account of the controlling faculties and one who is a perfected being on account of meditative concentration.

original: phyir mi 'ong ba dad pas mos pa lus kyis mngon sum du byed pa ma yin pa ni 'bras bu kho na las so //
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba dad pas mos pa lus kyis mngon sum du byed pa ma yin pa ni 'bras bu kho na las so //
translated: A non-returner who is not liberated by the wisdom faculty and who is not liberated by the controlling faculty of meditative concentration is a perfected being on account of the fruits alone.

original: mthong bas thob pa 'dod chags dang ma bral ba ni dbang po kho na las so //
analyzed: mthong bas thob pa 'dod chags dang ma bral ba ni dbang po kho na las so //
translated: One who is liberated by the wisdom faculty but not by the controlling faculty of meditative concentration is a perfected being on account of the controlling faculties alone.

original: phyir mi 'ong ba mthong bas thob pa lus kyis mngon sum du byed pa ma yin pa ni 'bras bu dang dbang po las so //
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba mthong bas thob pa lus kyis mngon sum du byed pa ma yin pa ni 'bras bu dang dbang po las so //
translated: Nonreturners who obtain results by insight are not complete in terms of their results and faculties.

original: dad pas mos pa lus kyis mngon sum du byed pa ni 'bras bu dang snyoms par 'jug pa kho na las so //
analyzed: dad pas mos pa lus kyis mngon sum du byed pa ni 'bras bu dang snyoms par 'jug pa kho na las so //
translated: Those resolute in faith who make progress through physical refinement are complete in terms of their results and meditative attainment.🔽Those who obtain results by insight are complete in terms of their results, faculties, and meditative attainment.🔽Those who obtain results by insight are complete in terms of their results, faculties, and meditative attainment.

original: mthong bas thob pa lus kyis mngon sum du byed pa ni 'bras bu dang / dbang po dang / snyoms par 'jug pa @37b las so //
analyzed: mthong bas thob pa lus kyis mngon sum du byed pa ni 'bras bu dang / dbang po dang / snyoms par 'jug pa @37b las so //
translated: Those who obtain results by insight are complete in terms of their results, faculties, and meditative attainment.🔽Those who are learners are complete in terms of two.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa kho na dang / snyoms par 'jug pa dang / dbang po las yongs su rdzogs pa nyid ni mad do //
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa kho na dang / snyoms par 'jug pa dang / dbang po las yongs su rdzogs pa nyid ni mad do //
translated: They are complete in terms of their faculties and meditative attainment.🔽Those who are not learners are complete in terms of three.🔽They are complete in terms of their results, faculties, and meditative attainment.

original: gnyis kyis mi slob yongs su rdzogs //
analyzed: gnyis kyis mi slob yongs su rdzogs //
translated: Those who are not learners are complete in terms of two.

original: dbang po dang snyoms par 'jug pa las so //
analyzed: dbang po dang snyoms par 'jug pa las so //
translated: They are complete in terms of their faculties and meditative attainment.

original: 'bras bu yongs su ma rdzogs pa la ni mi slob pa nyid kyang med pa kho na yin pas 'di'i 'bras bu rdzogs pa ni yongs su rdzogs pa nyid du rnam par ma bzhag go //
analyzed: 'bras bu yongs su ma rdzogs pa la ni mi slob pa nyid kyang med pa kho na yin pas 'di'i 'bras bu rdzogs pa ni yongs su rdzogs pa nyid du rnam par ma bzhag go //
translated: Those who are not learners who have not completed their results are not complete in terms of their results. Therefore their completion of results is not posited as their completion.

original: shes rab kyis rnam par grol ba dus dang mi sbyor bar rnam par grol ba ni dbang po kho na las so //🔽gnyi ga'i cha las rnam par grol ba dus kyis rnam par grol ba ni snyoms par 'jug pa kho na las so //
analyzed: shes rab kyis rnam par grol ba dus dang mi sbyor bar rnam par grol ba ni dbang po kho na las so // gnyi ga'i cha las rnam par grol ba dus kyis rnam par grol ba ni snyoms par 'jug pa kho na las so //
translated: Those liberated by wisdom who are liberated regardless of occasion are liberated by faculty alone.🔽Those liberated by both parts who are liberated regardless of occasion are liberated by meditative attainment alone.

original: gnyi ga'i cha las rnam par grol ba dus dang mi sbyor bar rnam par grol ba ni dbang po dang snyoms par 'jug pa dag las so //
analyzed: gnyi ga'i cha las rnam par grol ba dus dang mi sbyor bar rnam par grol ba ni dbang po dang snyoms par 'jug pa dag las so //
translated: Those liberated by both parts who are liberated regardless of occasion are liberated by both faculty and meditative attainment.🔽The many different types of paths are explained, such as mundane and transcendent, paths of seeing, meditation and no more learning, the path of preparation, the uninterrupted path, the liberated path and the special path.

original: 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa dang / mthong ba dang bsgom pa dang mi slob pa'i lam rnams dang / sbyor ba dang / bar chad med pa dang rnam par grol ba'i lam dang khyad par can gyi lam rnams zhes bya ba lam gyi bye brag mang po zhig bshad pa de dag mdor bsdu na lam rnam pa du zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa dang / mthong ba dang bsgom pa dang mi slob pa'i lam rnams dang / sbyor ba dang / bar chad med pa dang rnam par grol ba'i lam dang khyad par can gyi lam rnams zhes bya ba lam gyi bye brag mang po zhig bshad pa de dag mdor bsdu na lam rnam pa du zhig yin zhe na /
translated: If one condenses those, how many types of paths are there?

original: mdor na lam ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: mdor na lam ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: In brief, there are four types of paths:

original: khyad par can dang rnam grol dang // bar chad med dang sbyor zhes bya //
analyzed: khyad par can dang rnam grol dang // bar chad med dang sbyor zhes bya //
translated: The path of application, the uninterrupted path, the path of liberation, and the special path.

original: sbyor ba'i lam ni gang gi mjug thogs su bar chad med pa'i lam skye ba'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i lam ni gang gi mjug thogs su bar chad med pa'i lam skye ba'o //
translated: The path of application is the path that immediately precedes the uninterrupted path.

original: bar chad med pa'i lam ni gang gis sgrib pa rab tu spong ba'o //
analyzed: bar chad med pa'i lam ni gang gis sgrib pa rab tu spong ba'o //
translated: The uninterrupted path is the path by which the obstacles are abandoned.

original: rnam par grol ba'i lam ni des spang bar bya ba'i sgrib pa las nges par grol pa dang po nyid du skye ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i lam ni des spang bar bya ba'i sgrib pa las nges par grol pa dang po nyid du skye ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: The path of liberation is the first path that arises from being liberated from the obstacles that are to be abandoned by that .

original: khyad par can gyi lam ni de dag las gzhan pa'i lam gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: khyad par can gyi lam ni de dag las gzhan pa'i lam gang yin pa'o //
translated: The special path is the path that is different from those .

original: ci'i phyir lam zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir lam zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why is it called the path?

original: de nas der 'gro ba'i phyir ram /
analyzed: de nas der 'gro ba'i phyir ram /
translated: Because it goes there,

original: 'dis mya ngan las 'das pa tshol ba'i phyir 'di ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam yin no //
analyzed: 'dis mya ngan las 'das pa tshol ba'i phyir 'di ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i lam yin no //
translated: or because it seeks nirvana.

original: rnam par grol ba dang khyad par can gyi lam dag ji ltar na lam nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par grol ba dang khyad par can gyi lam dag ji ltar na lam nyid yin zhe na /
translated: How are the path of liberation and the special path paths?

original: de dang 'dra ba dang / ches che ba yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de dang 'dra ba dang / ches che ba yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because they are similar to it and because they are greater than it.

original: gong nas gong du phyin par byed pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: gong nas gong du phyin par byed pa'i phyir ram /
translated: because it causes one to go higher and higher,

original: phung po'i lhag ma ma lus par 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phung po'i lhag ma ma lus par 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: or because it causes one to enter into the state of no remainder of the aggregates.

original: yang lam nyid mya ngan las 'das pa sgrub par byed pa'i phyir sgrub pa zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: yang lam nyid mya ngan las 'das pa sgrub par byed pa'i phyir sgrub pa zhes gsungs so //
translated: Moreover, the path is called “practice” because it causes one to attain nirvana.

original: lam ni bzhi ste /🔽mngon par shes pa bul la dka' ba'i @38a * //
analyzed: lam ni bzhi ste / mngon par shes pa bul la dka' ba'i @38a * //
translated: There are four paths:

original: lam yang yod /
analyzed: lam yang yod /
translated: there is a path that is slow and difficult to experience;

original: mngon par shes pa myur la dka' ba'i lam yang yod de /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa myur la dka' ba'i lam yang yod de /
translated: there is a path that is quick and difficult to experience;

original: de bzhin du sla ba yang rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: de bzhin du sla ba yang rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: and there are two that are easy.🔽Among them,

original: de la / bsam gtan dag gi lam rnams sla //
analyzed: de la / bsam gtan dag gi lam rnams sla //
translated: the paths of the meditative concentrations are easy.

original: bsam gtan bzhi'i lam ni sla ba yin te /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi'i lam ni sla ba yin te /
translated: The paths of the four meditative concentrations are easy,

original: yan lag gis yongs su zin pa dang / zhi gnas dang lhag mthong mnyam pa dag gis 'bad mi dgos par rang gi dang gis 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yan lag gis yongs su zin pa dang / zhi gnas dang lhag mthong mnyam pa dag gis 'bad mi dgos par rang gi dang gis 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are embraced by the factors of enlightenment and because serenity and insight are balanced, so that they occur naturally without effort.

original: sa gzhan dag gi dka' ba yin //
analyzed: sa gzhan dag gi dka' ba yin //
translated: The paths of the other stages are difficult.

original: mi lcogs pa med pa dang / bsam gtan khyad par can dang / gzugs med pa rnams kyi lam ni /
analyzed: mi lcogs pa med pa dang / bsam gtan khyad par can dang / gzugs med pa rnams kyi lam ni /
translated: The paths of the preparatory meditative concentration, the special meditative concentration, and the formless meditative attainments are difficult,🔽because they are not embraced by the factors of enlightenment and because serenity and insight are not balanced.

original: yan lag gis yongs su ma zin pa'i phyir dang / zhi gnas dang lhag mthong chung ba'i phyir lam dka' ba yin te /
analyzed: yan lag gis yongs su ma zin pa'i phyir dang / zhi gnas dang lhag mthong chung ba'i phyir lam dka' ba yin te /
translated: It is difficult because it is not supported by the members and because serenity and insight are weak.

original: mi lcogs pa med pa dang bsam gtan khyad par can na ni zhi gnas chung ngo //
analyzed: mi lcogs pa med pa dang bsam gtan khyad par can na ni zhi gnas chung ngo //
translated: In the preliminary stage of concentration and in the special stage of concentration, serenity is weak.

original: gzugs med pa dag na ni lhag mthong chung ngo //
analyzed: gzugs med pa dag na ni lhag mthong chung ngo //
translated: In the formless realms, insight is weak.

original: lam de yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: lam de yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: This path is also of two types:

original: blo rtul mngon shes bul ba ste //
analyzed: blo rtul mngon shes bul ba ste //
translated: The dull-facultied one has slow direct knowledge.

original: cig shos kyi ni mngon shes myur //🔽dbang po rtul po ni lam sla ba 'am dka' ba yang rung ste /
analyzed: cig shos kyi ni mngon shes myur // dbang po rtul po ni lam sla ba 'am dka' ba yang rung ste /
translated: The other one has quick direct knowledge.

original: mngon par shes pa bul ba yin no //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa bul ba yin no //
translated: The path of the dull-facultied person is slow in direct knowledge, whether it is easy or difficult.

original: dbang po rnon po ni mngon par shes pa myur ba yin no //
analyzed: dbang po rnon po ni mngon par shes pa myur ba yin no //
translated: The path of the sharp-facultied person is quick in direct knowledge.

original: lam nyid la mngon par shes pa bul ba yod pas na 'di ni mngon par shes pa bul ba ste /
analyzed: lam nyid la mngon par shes pa bul ba yod pas na 'di ni mngon par shes pa bul ba ste /
translated: The path itself has slow direct knowledge, so it is the one with slow direct knowledge.

original: mngon par shes pa myur ba yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa myur ba yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: The one with quick direct knowledge is similar.

original: yang na 'di gang zag dbang po rtul po'i yin pas mngon par shes pa bul ba yin la /
analyzed: yang na 'di gang zag dbang po rtul po'i yin pas mngon par shes pa bul ba yin la /
translated: Or, since this path is for the person of dull faculties, it has slow direct knowledge.

original: yid rnon po'i yin pas mngon par shes pa myur ba'o //
analyzed: yid rnon po'i yin pas mngon par shes pa myur ba'o //
translated: Since it is of sharp mind, it is of quick superknowledge.

original: lam 'di ni byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa zhes bya ba'i ming 'thob ste /
analyzed: lam 'di ni byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa zhes bya ba'i ming 'thob ste /
translated: This path obtains the name of “conducive to enlightenment.”

original: byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa sum cu rtsa bdun ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi dang / yang dag par sbong ba zhi dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi dang / dbang po lnga dang / stobs lnga dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang /
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa sum cu rtsa bdun ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi dang / yang dag par sbong ba zhi dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi dang / dbang po lnga dang / stobs lnga dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang /
translated: The thirty-seven conducive to enlightenment are the four foundations of mindfulness, the four right efforts, the four legs of supernatural power, the five faculties, the five powers, the seven limbs of enlightenment,

original: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad do //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad do //
translated: and the eightfold noble path.

original: de la zad dang mi skye shes pa ni /
analyzed: de la zad dang mi skye shes pa ni /
translated: The knowledge of elimination and non-production🔽is enlightenment.🔽The knowledge of elimination and non-production is enlightenment.🔽The knowledge of elimination and non-production is enlightenment.🔽The knowledge of elimination and non-production is enlightenment.
