original: de gnyis kyis ma rig pa ma lus par spangs pa'i phyir dang / rang gi don byas pa dang / yang @38b byar med pa nyid yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs pa'i phyir ro //🔽de dang mthun nyid phyir /
analyzed: de gnyis kyis ma rig pa ma lus par spangs pa'i phyir dang / rang gi don byas pa dang / yang @38b byar med pa nyid yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs pa'i phyir ro // de dang mthun nyid phyir /
translated: because they completely abandon ignorance, because they have accomplished their own goal, and because they have realized that there is nothing more to do.

original: sum cu rtsa bdun de'i phyogs mthun //
analyzed: sum cu rtsa bdun de'i phyogs mthun //
translated: The thirty-seven are concordant with that.

original: byang chub dang mthun pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub dang mthun pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are concordant with enlightenment.

original: ming gi sgo nas /
analyzed: ming gi sgo nas /
translated: In terms of name,

original: byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa sum cu rtsa bdun zhes bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa sum cu rtsa bdun zhes bya'o //
translated: they are called the thirty-seven factors of enlightenment.

original: rdzas su bcu /
analyzed: rdzas su bcu /
translated: In terms of substance, they are ten.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa thams cad ni rdzas su bcu ste /
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa thams cad ni rdzas su bcu ste /
translated: All the factors of enlightenment are ten in substance.

original: bcu gang zhe na /
analyzed: bcu gang zhe na /
translated: What are the ten?🔽Faith, effort, mindfulness,

original: dad dang brtson 'grus dran pa dang // shes rab ting 'dzin btang snyoms dga' //
analyzed: dad dang brtson 'grus dran pa dang // shes rab ting 'dzin btang snyoms dga' //
translated: wisdom, concentration, equanimity, joy,

original: rtog dang tshul khrims shin tu sbyangs //
analyzed: rtog dang tshul khrims shin tu sbyangs //
translated: Discernment, ethics, and pliancy.

original: de ltar byas na de dag ni rdzas su bcu'o //
analyzed: de ltar byas na de dag ni rdzas su bcu'o //
translated: Thus, they are ten in substance.

original: ji ltar byas pas shan /
analyzed: ji ltar byas pas shan /
translated: How are they so?

original: dran pa nyer gzhag shes rab ste ;
analyzed: dran pa nyer gzhag shes rab ste ;
translated: The foundations of mindfulness are wisdom.

original: / brtson 'grus yang dag 'jog ces bya //
analyzed: / brtson 'grus yang dag 'jog ces bya //
translated: Effort is right exertion.

original: rdzu 'phrul rkang pa ting 'dzin to //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul rkang pa ting 'dzin to //
translated: The bases of psychic power are concentration.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang yang dag par rab tu 'jog pa dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams ni shes rab dang / brtson 'grus dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi rang bzhin dag yin no //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang yang dag par rab tu 'jog pa dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams ni shes rab dang / brtson 'grus dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi rang bzhin dag yin no //
translated: The applications of mindfulness, right exertions, and bases of psychic power are, respectively, wisdom, effort, and concentration by nature.

original: de'i phyir re zhig dbang po dang stobs rnams ni ming gis smos pa dad pa dang brtson 'grus dang dran pa dang ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab kyi rdzas lnga yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir re zhig dbang po dang stobs rnams ni ming gis smos pa dad pa dang brtson 'grus dang dran pa dang ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab kyi rdzas lnga yin te /
translated: Therefore, the faculties and powers are, respectively, the five substances of faith, effort, mindfulness, concentration, and wisdom.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams dang / chos rnam par 'byed pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / yang dag pa'i lta ba ni shes rab kho na yin no //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams dang / chos rnam par 'byed pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / yang dag pa'i lta ba ni shes rab kho na yin no //
translated: The applications of mindfulness, the limb of enlightenment of the investigation of phenomena, and right view are wisdom alone.

original: yang dag par rab tu 'jog pa rnams dang / brtson 'grus yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / yang dag pa'i rtsol ba ni brtson 'grus kho na yin no //
analyzed: yang dag par rab tu 'jog pa rnams dang / brtson 'grus yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / yang dag pa'i rtsol ba ni brtson 'grus kho na yin no //
translated: The members of enlightenment are seven in number: mindfulness, investigation of the teachings, vigor, joy, serenity, concentration, and equanimity.🔽The members of the path are eight in number: right view, right thought, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness, and right concentration.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams dang / ting nge 'dzin yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni ting nge 'dzin kha na yin no //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams dang / ting nge 'dzin yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni ting nge 'dzin kha na yin no //
translated: The members of enlightenment and the members of the path are pure, i.e., uncontaminated.🔽The others are of two types.🔽The others are of two types: either pure or impure.

original: dran pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / yang dag pa'i dran pa ni dran pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: dran pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / yang dag pa'i dran pa ni dran pa kho na yin no //
translated: The members of enlightenment and the members of the path are only pure, for they are obtained through the power of the noble path.

original: ci zhig lus she na /
analyzed: ci zhig lus she na /
translated: The others are of two types.🔽The others are of two types: either pure or impure.🔽The others are of two types: either pure or impure.🔽The others are of two types: either pure or impure.🔽The others are of two types: either pure or impure.

analyzed: de ltar na byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa de dag ni rdzas bcu yin no //
translated: The others are of two types

original: bye brag tu smra ba rnams kyi ltar na lus dang ngag gi las dag tha dad cing rigs mi mthun pa'i phyir tshul khrims kyi yan lag rnams rdzas gnyis yin pas rdzas bcu gcig yin no //🔽'di skad du dran pa nye bar gzhag pa @39a * //
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba rnams kyi ltar na lus dang ngag gi las dag tha dad cing rigs mi mthun pa'i phyir tshul khrims kyi yan lag rnams rdzas gnyis yin pas rdzas bcu gcig yin no // 'di skad du dran pa nye bar gzhag pa @39a * //
translated: According to the Vaibhāṣikas, the members of morality are two real entities, since bodily and vocal actions are distinct and do not belong to the same class.

original: la sogs pa ni shes rab dang brtson 'grus dang / ting 'dzin gyi rang bzhin dag yin no zhes bshad pa gang yin pa der ni /
analyzed: la sogs pa ni shes rab dang brtson 'grus dang / ting 'dzin gyi rang bzhin dag yin no zhes bshad pa gang yin pa der ni /
translated: We have said that the members of enlightenment are understanding, vigor, and concentration.

original: gtso bo smos pa yin par rig par bya'o //🔽de dag ni /
analyzed: gtso bo smos pa yin par rig par bya'o // de dag ni /
translated: We should understand that the word “etc.” refers to the members of the path.🔽The members of enlightenment and the members of the path

original: sbyor byung yon tan kun kyang yin //
analyzed: sbyor byung yon tan kun kyang yin //
translated: are also all the qualities that arise from cultivation.

original: gtso bo smos pas de skad bshad kyi /
analyzed: gtso bo smos pas de skad bshad kyi /
translated: The word “etc.” refers to the members of the path.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / yang dag par rab tu 'jog pa dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams ni sbyor ba las byung ba'i yon tan thams cad kyang yin no //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / yang dag par rab tu 'jog pa dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams ni sbyor ba las byung ba'i yon tan thams cad kyang yin no //
translated: The members of enlightenment and the members of the path are also all the qualities that arise from cultivation.

original: ci'i phyir brtson 'grus la yang dag par rab tu 'jog pa zhes bshad ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir brtson 'grus la yang dag par rab tu 'jog pa zhes bshad ce na /
translated: Why is vigor called right exertion?

original: des lus dang ngag dang yid yang dag par 'jog pas so //
analyzed: des lus dang ngag dang yid yang dag par 'jog pas so //
translated: Because it correctly establishes body, speech, and mind.

original: ci'i phyir ting nge 'dzin la rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa zhes bshad ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir ting nge 'dzin la rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa zhes bshad ce na /
translated: Why is concentration called the basis of supernatural powers?

original: de ni yon tan thams cad sbyor ba'i rten yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni yon tan thams cad sbyor ba'i rten yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the basis for the union of all good qualities.

original: gang dag rdzu 'phrul ni ting nge 'dzin kho na yin la /
analyzed: gang dag rdzu 'phrul ni ting nge 'dzin kho na yin la /
translated: Those who say that supernatural power is only concentration

original: 'dun pa la sogs pa ni rkang pa yin no zhes zer ba de dag gi ltar na ni 'dun pa dang sems dag lhag pa'i phyir byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa rdzas bcu gsum du 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'dun pa la sogs pa ni rkang pa yin no zhes zer ba de dag gi ltar na ni 'dun pa dang sems dag lhag pa'i phyir byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa rdzas bcu gsum du 'gyur la /
translated: and that aspiration and the others are its bases would have thirteen real entities for the factors of enlightenment, because aspiration and mind are added.

original: dge slong dag rdzu 'phrul yang bshad pa rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams kyang bshad do zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: dge slong dag rdzu 'phrul yang bshad pa rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams kyang bshad do zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Monks, I have explained supernatural power and the bases of supernatural power.

original: rdzu 'phrul gang zhe na /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gang zhe na /
translated: What is supernatural power?

original: 'di na dge slong rdzu 'phrul gyi yul rnam pa du ma nyams su myong bar byed cing /
analyzed: 'di na dge slong rdzu 'phrul gyi yul rnam pa du ma nyams su myong bar byed cing /
translated: Here a monk experiences many kinds of supernatural power:

original: gcig tu gyur nas mang por 'gyur zhes bya ba'i bar rgyas par gsungs pa'i mdo dang yang 'gal lo //
analyzed: gcig tu gyur nas mang por 'gyur zhes bya ba'i bar rgyas par gsungs pa'i mdo dang yang 'gal lo //
translated: and the sutra that says, “Having become one, they become many” and so on.

original: ci'i phyir dbang po rnams kho na yang stobs rnams su bshad ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir dbang po rnams kho na yang stobs rnams su bshad ce na /
translated: Why are the faculties alone called powers?

original: chung ngu dang chen po'i bye brag gis rdzi ba dang rdzi ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chung ngu dang chen po'i bye brag gis rdzi ba dang rdzi ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are not overcome by their opposites, due to the distinction of weak and strong.

original: dbang po rnams kyi go rims cis byas she na /
analyzed: dbang po rnams kyi go rims cis byas she na /
translated: Why are the faculties presented in that order?

original: dad par gyur pa ni 'bras bu'i don du brtson 'grus rtsom par byed do //
analyzed: dad par gyur pa ni 'bras bu'i don du brtson 'grus rtsom par byed do //
translated: One who has faith undertakes with perseverance for the sake of the result.

original: brtson 'grus brtsams na dran pa nye bar gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: brtson 'grus brtsams na dran pa nye bar gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: When one has undertaken with perseverance, mindfulness is present.

original: dran pa nye bar gnas na rnam par mi g-yeng ba'i phyir sems mnyam par 'jog go //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gnas na rnam par mi g-yeng ba'i phyir sems mnyam par 'jog go //
translated: When mindfulness is present, the mind becomes concentrated due to nondistraction.

original: sems mnyam par gzhag na yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems mnyam par gzhag na yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes par 'gyur ro //
translated: When the mind is concentrated, one knows reality just as it is.🔽In what states do the bodhisattvas cultivate the thirty-seven factors of enlightenment?

original: gnas skabs gang du byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa gang zhig rab tu 'byed can bye brag tu smra ba rnams na re /
analyzed: gnas skabs gang du byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa gang zhig rab tu 'byed can bye brag tu smra ba rnams na re /
translated: The Vaibhasikas say:

original: sde tshan bdun ni go rigs bzhin //
analyzed: sde tshan bdun ni go rigs bzhin //
translated: The seven groups are as follows:🔽The foundations of mindfulness are for beginners,

original: las ni dang po pa dag dang // nges 'byed cha mthun rnams dang ni //
analyzed: las ni dang po pa dag dang // nges 'byed cha mthun rnams dang ni //
translated: those conducive to penetrations,

original: bsgom dang mthong la rab tu phye //
analyzed: bsgom dang mthong la rab tu phye //
translated: those of meditation and seeing.

original: las @39b dang po pa'i gnas skabs su ni lus la sogs pa la nye bar brtag pa'i phyir dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams so //
analyzed: las @39b dang po pa'i gnas skabs su ni lus la sogs pa la nye bar brtag pa'i phyir dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams so //
translated: In the stage of a beginner, there are the foundations of mindfulness, because one investigates the body and so on.

original: khyad par thob pas brtson 'grus yang dag par spel ba'i phyir dro bar gyur pa dag la ni yang dag par rab tu 'jog pa rnams so //
analyzed: khyad par thob pas brtson 'grus yang dag par spel ba'i phyir dro bar gyur pa dag la ni yang dag par rab tu 'jog pa rnams so //
translated: In the heat stage, there are the right efforts, because one increases effort through obtaining special qualities.

original: yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba la 'jug pa'i phyir rtse mo dag ni rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams so //
analyzed: yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba la 'jug pa'i phyir rtse mo dag ni rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams so //
translated: In the peak stage, there are the legs of manifestation, because one engages the roots of virtue that do not decline.

original: yang yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur ba'i sgo nas dbang po thob pa'i phyir bzod pa dag la ni dbang po rnams so //
analyzed: yang yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur ba'i sgo nas dbang po thob pa'i phyir bzod pa dag la ni dbang po rnams so //
translated: In the patience stage, there are the faculties, because one obtains the faculties through not declining.

original: nyon mongs pa rnams kyis mi brdzi ba'i phyir ram /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnams kyis mi brdzi ba'i phyir ram /
translated: Or because one is not crushed by afflictions.

original: 'jig rten pa'i chos can gzhan dag gis mi brdzi ba'i phyir chos kyi mchog dag la ni stobs rnams so //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i chos can gzhan dag gis mi brdzi ba'i phyir chos kyi mchog dag la ni stobs rnams so //
translated: The powers are the supreme dharmas, because they cannot be overwhelmed by any mundane states.
